title: Does not live up to Marriott brand. Stylish but not functional
text: Disappointed. There are no drawers for your belongings, just small cubbies on each nightstand and one in the closet. The towels are like sandpaper.  Extremely noisy - we were on the 20th floor and we could hear traffic and music from some nightclub. Large desk is wasted because there ate no drawers for storage. Very stylish but not very functional hotel.

title: Location, Location, Location
text: The location is perfect if you want to be close to Penn Station.  Was in town for a Peloton class which is only a 10 min walk away. Tons of restaurants in the area and use of Planet Fitness come in handy. The staff was very attentive and as a platinum member they upgraded us to a balcony room with a huge walk out.  No food service In the club lounge on the weekend but with all the food options near by it really not a big deal. Will stay here every time I come to the city.

title: Superb Hotel and Service
text:
My family and I have been staying at this hotel each time we go to NYC for the past six years.  It’s in a great location.. near the subway, the train station, etc. 
Our hotel rooms have always been superb and so has the staff. From helping me fix up the room with stuff we need, to little treats  before we arrive for my daughter’s birthday’s. To helping me with reservations that are hard to get. Keeping our luggage so we can enjoy the last of the city before we have to leave. They have also booked a very nice return car service to the airport for us and we’re there waiting for us when we returned to the hotel.
Our visit to NYC and staying at this hotel has always been excellent which is the reason why we always choose The Renaissance New York Midtown.

title: Great location - Hotel lacking for price
text:
We stayed here for 6 days during our holiday in New York.

Starting with the good points. The rooms are nice, modern and have enough space. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. Staff were nice we had no issues.

The real negative here is every day the hotel has water heating issues. During the shower you water goes luke warm at best. 

The music in the common areas is far too loud, you feel like you're in a club and can't hear staff or your partner easily. It seems unnecessary to have music blaring at 6.30am.

Due to the above, I can't really give this hotel more than 2 stars for the price. We paid 500 USD per night, for that I expect a hot shower, especially during the colder months. Reading others reviews it seems like this has been a common issue for years. Disappointing to see management won't fix it.

title: Favorite hotel in NYC
text:
The Renaissance New York Midtown Hotel is my absolute favorite hotel in NYC. Yes, the location is perfect.  The design is trendy and fun, while still feeling adult and functional. But the staff is what really makes this hotel shine!
We planned to take the LIRR into Penn Station from JFK (the hotel is located RIGHT across the street from Penn Station).  Our flight was a bit delayed, but the train was super-fast and easy.  Even though it was late when we arrived (1am), Nelli and James greeted us full of energy (their enthusiasm was more like a 1pm vibe than 1am!).  The room was great- very clean, very functional.  And the view was incredible- the most perfect cityscape! It was almost like I could hear Alicia Keys singing in the background “Concrete jungle where dreams are made of, there’s nothing you can’t do.”
The location is so great- we walked to an art gallery in Chelsea, walking back along the Highline and through Hudson Yards. It’s central enough that we walked down Broadway to Flatiron. And in addition to being right across the street from Penn Station and Madison Square Garden, the 1 train is located just outside the 34th Street exit of the hotel, which we jumped on to head up to Central Park and the Upper West Side. 
Over the course of the weekend, the hotel team made us feel so welcome, as though we were a part of their family! Every member of the team was kind, genuine, and completely authentic.  
Just a few of the incredible team members that we encountered making our stay extra special were Nelli, James, Catherine, Javonne, Rosy, Mike, Duke, Cesar, and the entire front desk team and bell team. Kudos to the management team at this hotel for retaining such great people- ones that truly care about the guest experience. 10/10

title: Okay, but housekeeping is more of a house skipping
text:
The location is good, the room is OK, the reception staff is friendly. It is clean...

However, if you have your "Do Not Disturb" sign on the door knob after 10am, they will skip it the entire day. Yesterday I had a late morning and left the room in the morning, but a bit later than usual.
When I came back from work, the room was not done. When I inquired about it they said that the DND sign was on the entire day. Not true.
Today, same thing. They never stopped at the room.

Advice to guests: Do NOT use the sign on the door or they will mark the room as "occupied" for the rest of the day and will not clean it.

To the hotel management: This practice has to stop. This is very unusual for this class of hotels and will be a factor in choosing a hotel for my future business trips to NYC.

title: Wasn’t properly cleaned before next reservation
text: I’ve been to this hotel before and thoroughly enjoyed the food but this last time was not my favorite. I definitely feel like my room wasn’t properly cleaned bc I found dirty socks by the bed and the fridge still had food in it. At first I thought I was in someone else’s room! Hope for next time, the cleaning staff will be more attentive.

title: Duke Perkins........absolutely fabulous!!!!
text:
My wife and I have stayed at the hotel on several occasions. Each visit exceeded the previous! Duke Perkins: exceptional, engaging, knowledgeable, incredible attention to details, and the consummate professional. Duke makes us feel as though we are the only guest in the hotel. Duke is the reason that the Renaissance New York Midtown Hotel is and will continue to be the only hotel my wife and I will stay when visiting New York.  
In Sincere Gratitude,
Drs. G.

title: Best Concierge on the Planet
text: I recently had a mother/daugther 48 hour trip to NYC (1/11/24). The start of our stay was immediately kicked off in a supremely positive way when we interfaced with  Duke Perkins, Lead Navigator for the hotel. His knowledge, enthusiasm and on-point recommendations were only second to his genuine interest in helping us and his personal follow up. I travel extensively and have yet to have such a positive experience with a concierge and one that is such an admirable representative of the hotel and city. Kudos to you, Duke. Thank you for making our visit so special and positively memorable.

title: Fabulous!
text:
Absolutely the BEST hotel I have stayed in, in New York!! 
When checking in, the front desk upgraded our rooms to two kings instead of the one dble queen room which was a lovely surprise. We got to check-in earlier, the rooms were extremely nice, clean, comfortable! 
It was definitely worth paying for the valet as parking and driving was a nightmare lol. The valet staff were excellent.
We are definitely going to stay here again when visiting. 
Thank you so much!!
I highly recommend :)

(Only things to note are; there isn’t a lock on the bathroom door-sliding door-would be nice to have a latch inside or something for privacy. The shower is kind of exposed into the bedroom, so you can be seen showering from bed lol - if you like to be watched great 👍, if not there is a blind/shade that can be pulled down. 
When we walked in the room, guests from the room next door were sitting in their window area staring at us… a little creepy as they can see into our room so we shut our blinds. A little weird, but it’s New York so it didn’t bother us that much as we were out most of the time, but just saying).

title: Was a good stay - however ….
text:
Very nice hotel - I visit NY several times a year and have stayed in many different hotels. The renaissance was nice - however two negative things stood out. 

1) I exited my room and saw the electronic piece (where the keycard recognized the door) of the room across from me on the floor. Like it had been ripped off? Kinda weird. I leave my room and wait for the elevator. A security guard comes out of the elevator and attempts to open MY door - I say “that’s my room” he says “I know - I was just seeing if it was locked “ very strange. What if I had been showering ? (The bathroom is right in front of the door. It made me feel uneasy as a woman travelling alone. I wouldn’t expect to feel that way in the class level of this hotel. It soured the experience.

2) The versa restaurant / club woke me up at 130am on Friday night. I was staying on the 15th floor above it. Why not make those rooms soundproof,

title: Hotel in New York City, NY
text:
Had a great stay here this past weekend!!!  The overall decor of the hotel and rooms are pretty modern looking. Got a King Bedroom—was surprisingly spacious for a NYC hotel room, perfect size for 2 people!

Our room was clean—had amenities like a fridge, safe and huge desk.  The bed was comfy too!  I wasn’t a huge fan of their “contemporary with industrial-look design”—some parts of the walls just looked like concrete that had no wallpaper.

Hotel location was good!  They have a drive-in area in front which made it easy to get a taxi/Uber without blocking the main street.  Check-in was easy—the concierge is located on the 6th floor.  As a Marriott gold member, they gave us a complimentary box of chocolate and bottled water, which was nice!  

Note: the elevator system is a bit frustrating because you have to select which floor you want to go to and wait for an assigned elevator—often this took a while—once you get into the designated elevator, there’s no press buttons inside.

title: High recommended
text:
Excellent place to stay with family , especially if you are going to an event at MSG. 
Duke Perkins, the conceiere was extremely accommodating. He helped us to have a Christmas tree set up in the room for our kids to walk in on and be surprised with gift under it. A moment we will never forget. 
Thank you Duke!

title: Professional welcome after a long day of travel
text: I arrived late Tuesday evening after Christmas at the hotel, very crowded on the street entrance. However, I made it up to the lobby to check in. Everything went very smooth and professional. I had many questions in the Marriott associate at the front desk was excellent. Paola answered all of my very detailed questions perfectly she is the pinnacle of subject matter excellence and professionalism. Truly a great representative of the Marriott brand. Checked into my room. Very happy with my room. Quiet on an upper floor. Love the amenities. Very happy with the decor very ultra modern.

title: Excellent hotel and location in NYC
text: Excellent Marriott property in a great location in NYC! This is the Renaissance that is NOT in Times Square - and that is a good thing! Easy walk to Empire State, Hudson Yards, many restaurants, Times Square, great hole-in-wall pizza right outside hotel, and much more. The hotel has a REALLY good restaurant / bar called Versa - the menus is extensive and awesome for snacks or dinner. It also subs for room service. This is also a great place for larger groups (e.g. work happy our) as they have a patio bar. Rooms are a little small and should not expect upgrades to suites or large rooms at this property - they have very few of them and are limited. Do not bother with Suite Night Rewards here. Front desk staff were extremely helpful during recent stay.

title: Duke Perkins - Best concierge!
text: Just a quick call to Duke, concierge, and all was done. Wanted to have a surprise gift for my mother in law to be delivered to her room before arriving. He just not made that happen but managed to even get rooms one on the side of the other. And a great chocolates detail in my room too! Duke is an example of professionalism, great customer service and empathy. Looking forward to stay here again!

title: Duke Perkins was an exceptional concierge
text: I would love to give more than five stars for the exceptional service provided. Duke Perkins exceeded all expectations in arranging the special accommodations for my husband's birthday. Unfortunately, I only have videos to capture the moment, but the details were simply breathtaking: 56 strategically placed black balloons, wine, chocolates, intricate origami swans, rose petals, and a room with a stunning view. My heartfelt thanks to the entire team for creating such a memorable and outstanding experience.

title: Duke Perkins, a concierge you’ll remember!
text: I’ve been staying at this hotel probably close to, or over a 100 nights the past few years. Love the location, the comfort of the rooms… But one of the big reasons, is Duke Perkins, the concierge. Always smiling and available, and with true personalized attentions. There are many places where I go where I feel I receive a note just because of my status, and regardless of the frequency of my visits, it’s always the same. At the Renaissance, Duke provides a truly personalized experience, with thought through attentions, gifts and handwritten cards. When a hotel becomes a bit your home when you’re travelling, it actually matters a lot. When you arrive on 6th floor and are greeted by his communicative smile, you’re in for a great stay. Thanks a lot Duke, and thanks to the overall management of this hotel!

title: Girls trip
text: The BEST concierge ever!! He was super helpful, attentive, thorough and went above & beyond to help us with many things!!  Such an asset to this hotel, would not have been the same experience without him!!!

title: Renaissance, great experience.
text: My wife and I adore this property.  The location is an easy walk to Broadway, great restaurants, shopping, parks, transportation.  What makes the Renaissance Midtown sparkle above so many other properties is their concierge, Duke Perkins.  His personality makes the hotel, his smile and gracious welcoming service are unsurpassed.  We've stayed in hotels from Ritz Carlton, Four Seasons, take it from a well seasoned traveler, this hotel is wonderful but best of all take advantage of all Duke has to offer about New York.

title: Concierge Duke Perkins is the best!
text: My colleagues typically choose to stay at the Renaissance Midtown when traveling to NYC for work and are repeat guests. The concierge, Duke Perkins, could not be more helpful.  His professionalism, attentiveness, and positive attitude are the epitome of excellent customer service. If I owned my own business I would hire him. He has truly left a lasting positive impression and we will be returning to the Renaissance when back in town. Thank you, Duke!

title: Another amazing overnight stay at the Renaissance NY Midtown Hotel!
text:
My husband book an overnight stay for us at the Renaissance NY Midtown Hotel for the Black Coffee concert and (as usual) we had an amazing stay. The hotel's location to the train station and Madison Square Garden is unmatched. The staff is always friendly and accommodating and the hotel room views are unparalleled. 

The hotel restaurant also never disappoints and is often our first stop upon arriving from our train. We love staying here and will definitely be back in the future.

title: Nice stay- great location
text: We had a great stay here in October for 3 nights. We were happy with the location- only one block from Penn station so we didn’t have to pull our luggage very far. It’s close enough to the action without being right in the craziness of Time Square.  Recommend getting breakfast at Als Delicatessen which is close to  the corner of 7th and 35th about 1 min from hotel entrance.

title: Murky muddy water in all taps for pricey room
text:
My daughter and I stayed three nights. Hotel left a notice on Friday about water shutoff 3 hours to do pipe work. Whole day Saturday the water from all faucets was muddy brown. For a 500$ a night room!!!  

I spoke to someone at the lobby who said they would discount the room. Nope, got the full bill at checkout!! Talked to the manager Mr Mathew Washington who was surprised that someone on his staff had offered to give a discount for the room. There was no apology, no sorry you paid for a room that was not functional. JUST HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE.

title: Nearly perfect stay
text:
We stayed at three hotels during our week-long stay and this one was by far the best. I would typically be a little more picky with my rating, but compared to their peers this was by far the best experience. 

Pros:
Great location, any subway you need is within a block
Entrance from 34th OR 35th, this works great with subway travel.
Will bring luggage to your room if you're not there when room is ready
Great sized rooms (we had an upgrade I think?)
Good shower pressure
Bed was comfortable
Room is cold and stays cold (apparently hard to find in NYC)
Housekeeping great, made the bed with the pillows we brought some days!
Window opens in room!

Cons:
Was told there was no way to warm up leftovers in hotel, but has a fridge so kinda weird no way to heat
Shower temperature takes some time to warm up
Elevator has long waits, plan a cushion of 15 minutes

title: Average with bad elevator
text: Stayed a couple of nights for Billy Joel. Elevator was the worst. It was programmed to pick up who knows when. We waited 15 minutes to come down from 12th floor. Staff nice. M Club doesnt operate on weekends and no breakfast for Titanium Bonvoy members. Have stayed here before and it seems to have slipped some. Will go elsewhere

title: Comfort with smile
text: I truly enjoyed my stay at the hotel. It is located conveniently next to major attractions, shopping centers and metro stations. The room was modern and clean and housekeeping was always helpful. The restaurant also has a nice restaurant with an excellent cuisine which was helpful when after a long day, I did not feel like heading back outside. A special shout-out to the concierge, the bell desk and the reception, especially Paola and Jason, for their help, advice and genuine concern for making my stay the best possible experience. Elevators can take some time, especially during rush hour, but than, what to expect in a hotel with over 35 floors.

title: Business trip
text: Good base for business trip, central location   but would caution against going out alone, be careful area is full of vagrants, and i was accosted and had to attend hospital after an attempted mugging, nothing taken but still unpleasant.  Hotel itself is very comfortable, rooms well appointed, comfortable beds, and very efficient rain showers . Restaurant food nothing special and menu quite limited but there a good restaurants within 5 mins walk. Staff all very friendly  room sevice is slow.

title: Overall great NYC option
text: This property is very well run. The staff are kind, the location is great, and the rooms are quiet. They have a nice Elite lounge with light breakfast Mon-Fri and water/soda available 24/7. The bar and restaurant are also quite good.  This has become my go-to hotel for short visits to NYC and gets a lot of use. Some light refurbishment in certain areas is soon in order, especially the carpet in the rooms and hallways, paint here and there, and some of the furniture could stand a good clean or change out. But overall, an excellent choice.

title: Pleasant stay near MSG
text:
I was in town for a concert and choose this hotel due to the proximity to MSG. This was among the largest NYC hotel rooms I've stayed in. The beds were comfortable and the room clean. 

I booked a standard double Queen with a high floor (for those new to staying in NYC, I advise always going for a high floor to get away from some street level noise).  I didn't pay the premium for a room with a view so I expected to look out directly into another building (the norm in NYC), but actually ended up with a corner (two windows) and a nice view!  I was really surprised!

The bathroom door is a sliding glass door which was a great idea to save space in the room, but was poorly thought out for privacy. Just be aware that if you use the bathroom, shower, etc. Anyone else in the room will be able to see you. Hopefully the hotel will replace these doors with something more practical.  They definitely look like something an interior designer would pick (they look nice) but must be a nightmare for the cleaners and maintenance.

After the concert, traffic was a nightmare so I was very happy to be walking back to a hotel. This also meant that there were a lot of sirens and horn honks. The room TV is also set up with several white noise elements - rainfall, beach, etc. - to help drown it out. 

My room was 2503 near the elevator but I never heard it or another person. The room was very quiet, except for the traffic noise which is expected.

The bell station/baggage check on the first floor is very friendly and check in was easy. We checked our bags before check in to do some touristy stuff.

We had some extra time before the concert and took the F Train from Herald Square to Delancey to eat at Russ and Daughters and visit the Tenement Museum - a great way to learn about the City's immigrant history. Liberty Bagel is practically nextdoor for breakfast - don't be intimidated by the long line - it moves quickly because they have an efficient system.

I don't recommend eating at Versa. The food was mediocre.

title: Much potential, pretty disappointing
text:
First, the good.  The front desk, bellhop and  cleaning folks were very friendly and welcoming.  The rooms, albeit tiny for the price point, were clean. 

Now, the not so good.  The bartender was the single rudest person I have encountered as a paying customer at a hotel. I stopped for a cup of coffee to go.  When I ordered, I was asked if I wanted to pay with cash or card.  I said I’d like to charge it to the room.  She then audibly grunted and said “you really can’t pay with cash?”  I am sure she was looking to not put the coffee through the system and pocket the cash.  I was so put off by this interaction that I actively avoided returning to the restaurant during my stay.  

The room was very small and pretty loud (although some of this just goes with the territory for NYC hotels). It was also a bit stuffy and starting to develop that “damp” smell.  My shower was tiny and didn’t have any sort of floor basin, so water got all over the rest of the bathroom.  The mint/menthol toiletries were irritating to my skin (had a bit of an icy hot tingle), so I had to run to CVS to buy my own.  I wish Renaissance would return to what they used to use.  

The lounge is a joke.  No coffee machine or snacks, only a small set of soft drinks.  No breakfast benefit on the weekends for elite members.  The elevators take forever and are annoying to use.  

I am not eager to return to this hotel.  I will look elsewhere on my next trip.

title: Decent choice for NY
text: Lovely hotel , well positioned, clean and great staff . Easy to walk to underground or any of the shopping or Central Park. The hotel is offset from the Main Street so it’s quite. the rooms were clean , small but which New York hotel has very big rooms.

title: Wonderful Property, Terrific Marriot Team!
text:
The Renaissance New York Midtown Hotel became our “hotel of choice” after our initial stay Spring Break April 2023 with our family.  Proximity to subway, MSG, Penn Sta./Moynihan, Grand Central, walking the City and endless “good eats” — the best.  We have since chosen this Marriot property numerous times since during our frequent travels back in our hometown of NYC.  Between business trips, girlfriend trips and family trips, we have returned seven times and have recommended to our friends and family (who have become hooked on choosing this excellent property too).  Whether our visits are for business, personal or both, we are always appreciative of the beautiful, comfortable and clean accommodations — it has become our “home away from home.”  Everyone is welcoming and accommodating, from Bellhop Front Staff, to Front Desk Reception, Concierge and Managerial Staff — Customer Service & Relations are great!  Special shout out to Concierge Manager Duke, Kathleen at Reception and David (Night Manager)
for always taking terrific care of us during our stays!!!  When glitches occur, resolution is always prompt and favorable for the guests.  Thank you for your warmth and hospitality!  Thank you for treating your guests with sincere hospitality.  We are looking forward to our upcoming visit October 2023 — see you soon RNYMH!

title: Where Service matters and will bring me back!
text: Renaissance New York Midtown Hotel’s location is fantastic. It was so easy to get  around to many desired locations. We could walk to Times Square, Broadway, the Empire State Bldg, many restaurants as well as concerts at Madison Square Garden.  The hotel itself is pretty nice and well kept.  The restaurant provided what we needed, pretty good food and several TVs so that we could catch our favorite games.  BUT…..I would be remiss if I did not highlight what differentiated this property from other Marriott stays.  I am an avid traveler for business and pleasure (Bonvoy Ambassador Elite) therefore my perspective is far reaching.  I can say without a doubt that my time at the Renaissance NY Midtown was MADE due to the outstanding service and attitudes of the staff.  Javonne Washington and Duke Perkins on the Events and Navigator teams made me feel like my family mattered!  Javonne was quick to answer questions over the weekend prior to my arrival (during his personal time) and Duke’s personality, knowledge of the property and neighborhood truly made my family feel like we were at Home.  I am sold and will absolutely be back to this hotel for my next trip to NYC.

title: Zimmer gut, alles andere mittelmässig
text: Zimmer und Einrichtung sind modern, Bett bequem. Leider ist es lärmig, wir hatten die Lüftungsanlagen unterhalb des Zimmers und 24 Stunden lärm. Die Reception war sehr unfreundlich und erlaubte nicht, ein anderes Zimmer zu sehen um ev. zu tauschen. Der junge Mann blieb stur, dass Besichtigungen nicht erlaubt seien. Bis jetzt haben wir auch keine Rechnung online erhalten. Das Restaurant ist lärmig (laute Musik) und zu kühl und Service mittelmässig. Frühstück haben wir ausserhalb eingenommen. Auch die Rezeption war lärmig (Musik viel zu laut) und sehr kalt. Die Lage ist zentral, jedoch nicht wirklich gut und nicht zu vergleichen mit der Lage nahe Centralpark. Generell würden wir das Hotel nicht mehr wählen.

title: Hotel's fine, location's fabulous
text: The hotel itself is fine, though we paid extra for a view room and I'm not sure the upcharge really added anything.  BUT, the location is fantastic.  I wasn't sure about staying near Penn, but it was so easy to get places.  We could walk to Times Square?Broadway, the Empire State Bldg, etc. and anything we didn't want to walk to, we were so close to the subway.  We took the train in from Newark Airport too and just walked the one block to the hotel from Penn (use the LIRR entrance).  I'd definitely stay here again!  There's also a Starbucks just a few doors down, along with a good diner, and in the next block there's delicious pizza at Village Square Pizza.

title: Great location. AAA Discount made it a good price.
text:
The staff was very kind. They watched our luggage while we went to see the Statue of Liberty. They had convenient outlets to charge my phone (since I wasn’t smart enough to charge it on the train in). 
The room layout was nice. I liked the modern showers.  Some of the equipment needed maintenance.  The cover on my electronic key broke off, but I didn’t know it until my daughter came up. The TV had Netflix and U-Tube, but I couldn’t get them to work.  The room was cold. I should have raised the thermostate. 
The location was very convenient.  The subway was a block away.  The initial restaurant for dinner was a block away.  Dinner was moved to a further walk, but I got my steps in.

title: Awesome view , select high floor for city view
text:
Good location in midtown , I paid for a High floor for the New York City view . 
Note drinking water is provided only on first night , I was not even given during check in n had to call to request for it.

Hotel room was clean , bedding and pillow was nice .

No amenities such as bedroom slippers , toiletries kit , toothbrush etc would expect such from international hotel  chain . Maybe it’s unique to hotels in NYC.

Best bagel show across the street , so it’s really good place for breakfast .

title: 部屋からの眺望がきれいでした
text: Penn Stationからすぐ近くにあるホテルです。レセプションは上階にあるので、まずエレベーターで上がる必要があります。エレベーターはタッチパネル式で、初めてでは戸惑うかもしれません。入口にいる係員の人が使い方を教えてくれます。レセプションフロアにつくと、開放感のあるラウンジがありました。全体的にモダンでしゃれたデザインのホテルです。今回泊まった部屋は28階でした。夕方でもミッドタウンの高層ビルの景色がきれいでしたが、夜景の美しさは格別で、窓際のカウチからずっと眺めていました。レセプションの係の方もとても親切で、とても快適な滞在でした。

title: It's the Year of The Renaissance!
text: Whew! I had a time in Manhattan!  I had such a blast staying at the Renaissance NY Midtown.  The staff was amazing!  I loved my room! I had an amazing view of New York, Lady Liberty greeted me every morning! I was in town for work training and upon my arrival, the company spared no expense.  I had difficulty checking in but Thomas Williams was my knight and shining armour.  He was able to assist me and made checking in a breeze.  I can't thank him enough!  Pulse is an entire vibe! The bartenders made amazing frozen drinks and I loved sitting outside looking out on Fashion Ave.  What an amazing location, a minute walk to Time Square. Now let me tell you, Duke Perkins is the mayor of the city!  An amazing NY native well informed with all the hot spots of the city!  This is the guy you want to know honey!  He was so accommodating and sweet.  This was an amazing trip and I loved my stay!  My room stayed clean, the food and drinks were amazing, the ambiance is top tier, and the location, location, LOCATION is top tier.  I mean minutes from Madison Square Garden!  I was there the weekend Dave Chappell performed. Though I did not attend the show, I enjoyed the bustling streets of NYC and people watching as they headed to the show.  I'm definitely going to request my company to place me here EVERY TIME I come to NY.  I work in service and the staff at Renaissance NY Midtown are model citizens when it comes to customer service.  This is how you do a hotel stay! They were phenomenal! I miss you guys already *tear*. Well done guys! Well done!

title: Worst Room Service EVER
text: Woke up surprisingly early my first morning at the hotel after a long trip back from SC the day before. Ordered room service for the first time in a long time with great anticipation. I assumed a four star, $300/night hotel would wheel up a nice spread with a bit of a presentation as I fondly recalled from past experiences. Called down my order of two poached eggs, some toast, potatoes, a fruit plate, side of bacon, couple of sausage and orange juice. I was literally fantasizing about the meal that would soon be rolled in and presented with covered plates, pot of hot water and tea bags, a carafe of OJ and all the condiments I might need. I put on the terry cloth robe that was hanging in the closet and got ready to watch TV while I ate. Shortly there was a knock at the door and when I answered it I was greeted by an employee who handed me a paper bag. I might as well have ordered Uber Eats or Door Dash. I ate room service out of a paper bag with food in boxes and a plastic fork at the computer desk. No plates, no silverware, no salt and pepper, no napkins. When I visited the Ritz in Berlin recently every room received breakfast for free. There was literally 14 different cold cuts, prosciutto sliced up. A chef cooking waffles, pancakes, eggs. Ever scoop out honey from a live honeycomb in a frame? I did that day! Yogurts, any type of topping you wanted to sprinkle on top. Any kind of fruit drink; apple, orange, blueberry juice, there was a multi-vitamin drink. Free bloody marys. But there I was eating poached eggs out of a box! Then I would have to open another box and get my toast and another box for bacon. There's all these greasy boxes in front of me. How is that service? It was the worst room service I'd ever gotten. I'd rather not have room service. I could have gone downstairs and grabbed this at any place on 35th street and brought it up to my room for ten times less than that cost me.

title: Excellent Stay
text: This was a great hotel. We went to NYC for a long weekend for a concert at MSG. We picked this hotel partly because of its location to MSG & partly due to cost & partly due to being a Marriott Bonvoy Member. I booked a Lowe floor king bed room & I did use Marriott upgrade nights to get a high floor city view room. We ended up on the 34th floor looking out over MSG & Lower Manhattan & could see the Statue of Liberty from our room - amazing view, well worth using upgrade points (not sure I’d pay the difference for the room if I was just going to sleep there & be out of the room all day, but maybe). The entry area was nice & the lobby good. Also had a nice Club Level Room with drinks & appetizers (didn’t use it as much as we maybe should have). The room with a king bed was a good size for 2 people. I can’t say it was a large room, but we never felt like we were confined by the space. Very large window wall with a small lounging sofa in front of it to take advantage of the view. Nice sized bathroom with a pretty big walk-in shower. This was by far the nicest Marriott brand hotel in Manhattan that we’ve stayed in. 2 blocks from MSG, but also easy walking distance (for 2 relatively healthy 50 year olds) to Times Square & Rockefeller Plaza. Getting a little farther, but still walkable to Central Park. This will be my 1st choice hotel for us to stay in when we go back to NYC.

title: Great location, good sized rooms, confounding elevators
text: Stayed for 3 nights recently.  Super convenient walking distance to Penn Station and Hudson Yards.  Not too far from Broadway and Times Square too.  Rooms are a little bigger than your typical NYC hotel shoe box.  Beds were comfy and the bathroom set up had plenty of space.  Room had a bit of a mildewy odor to it so we kept the AC on the whole time to keep the air circulating.  The fitness center is actually using the Planet Fitness next door which obviously has more stuff than one could every possible use - but the tradeoff is the clientele in there (ha!).  Club Lounge which we were entitled to use was excellent - nice simple light free breakfast and a fridge stocked w/ water and sodas t/o the day.  Bellmen were helpful w/ luggage and umbrellas (it rained a bit).  Only major gripe was the elevators.  Not sure what algorithm they are using but often times, you're waiting for an elevator that's going up and down while they are others sitting idle.  So you need to allot plenty of time to get out of the building.  Also the lobby on 6 vs on the street adds complexity b/c of the elevator issue.

title: I was more than impressed with this hotel!
text: The bar and restaurant are beautiful. They have an outdoor bar and restaurant as well. The bedding was clean and comfortable. They did such a great job with a small space. The bathroom is beautifully done with great lighting and nice night lighting under the mirror. Art is the closet was a nice touch. The AC was great. My only complaints were that it took a long time for the shower to get hot and the door was so heavy it came back so hard that I have a nice bruise on my butt!

title: Quite simply an excellent hotel
text:
This was the perfect hotel for a first-timer in New York City. 

The rooms are surprisingly spacious and very clean and modern. At first, I didn't like the bare walls in the rooms, but it grew on me. 

The bathrooms were quite spacious, and the shower pressure was good.

The location is simply excellent. You're 10 mins away from Times Square, 10 mins walk to Hudson Yards, 10 mins walk to Grand Central and Penn subway is opposite the hotel. On the subway, Brooklyn is about 18 minutes away, Downtown is about 10. Greenwich Village is about 8 minutes away. You can't be closer to the centre.

Customer service is excellent. A big shoutout to Neli at Front Desk who helped me out on my last day at the hotel.  

Yes, it's slightly more expensive than other hotels in Midtown area but you'll love it. We'll be back soon!

title: Comfort Hotel near the heart of Midtown Manhattan
text:
Stayed here prior to COVID and after, the hotel still wins on their superior locations (one block away from PENN station, almost direct access to/from JFK Airport with Air Tran connection at Jamaica station.

Macy's is around the corner too, two of the most famous bagel cafe are right across from the hotel (Liberty & Best Bagels).  

The room itself is very modern looking after few years and comfort level is one of the better ones in the surrounding areas. The room you can still hear the typical NYC noises but it is not as bad as some of the time square hotels, yet still provides easy access to Time Square shops.

Service is generally great, everyone is very helpful and pleasant.  

Would not hesitate to stay here when the prices is right.

title: This is the 2nd time I stayed here and got disappointed both time. Not gonna stay here.
text: The hotel refuse to credit the night I stayed. They saying it was their system error and they can’t fix it. Got an unapologetic email from guest service manager , Matthew , and telling  me  how I should spend thousands of dollar to get one night equivalent point. And Sent me 5k as a charity. Bonboy customer service is useless also.

title: Great Location for a weekend in NYC
text:
We stayed here over a weekend and it was one of the best hotels in NYC that we have stayed in.  Location was perfect as we came in on the train and Penn Station was right there.  Also near subways and walkable to many attractions.

The rooftop bar/restaurant was a great place to dine or have a drink.  Service was good even if the venue was crowded.

Room was clean and bathroom was updated and large. We had a high corner room with a great view of the city.

Front desk was very helpful with a snafu we had with checking in.  Very professional!

We would stay here again when visitng the city.

title: Great long weekend away!
text: We had an amazing stay, the staff was friendly, the room was great, beds were comfortable, we were pleasantly surprised by the size of the room. We greatly appreciated the security and needing to have a room key to enter the elevator. We will definitely be back.

title: Excellent Stay
text: We had originally booked the Moxy hotel for our stay in NY, but one night was sufficient for us, it caters for a much younger clientele. The Renaissance was recommended to us and we were able to get two rooms for four nights with the help of David Nunez, Assistant Guest Services Manager. He was incredibly helpful and sorted out rooms on the 31st floor. Good size bedroom and modern bathroom and nicely decorated. Great view too. The hotel is in a good location being near Penn St Station and not far from Times Square. Great cocktails from the bar, the food in the restaurant was very good - consider sharing as portions are big- as was breakfast. Across from the hotel is a great Bagel cafe. The concierge sorted out taxis for us and also arranged a car to take us to the airport. The four of us had a really great stay at the Renaissance and I would well recommend it.

title: Awesome staying, excellent location, stunning view
text:
ROOMS: big and stylish rooms with an iconic NY views. Spacious bathroom with a shower, very comfortable bed, big windows. You can even see NY from the shower:) Every room is equipped with safe, fridge and coffee machine (filter coffee bags and tea bags are provided).
LOCATION: definitely awesome! The hotel is located next to Penn station, Macy’s is on the corner as well. Empire State Building is in 5min walking distance. They’re a lot of cafes and coffee shops nearby.
FOOD: breakfast isn’t included, you should pay for it. There is bar on site and also restaurant with a terrace.
FACILITIES: fast wi-fi, fitness center, bottled water is provided on the reception desk.
STAFF: polite and smiley.

title: My Memorable Stay at a Wonderful Hotel
text:
I stayed at the Renaissance New York Midtown Hotel, renncycmidtown, in February and May 2023. Both trips were for leisure. I stayed in a guest room with two queen beds and a breathtaking Statue of Liberty and New York City view.  
This hotel has a fantastic location. It is minutes from  Times Square, Empire State Building, and Macy's. Did I mention that the hotel is across the street from "The world-famous Madison Square Garden" and Penn Station? But the highlight of this hotel is Mr. Duke Perkins. From the moment I arrived, he went above and beyond to ensure I had everything I needed for a comfortable stay. He is incredibly knowledgeable about the area and provided excellent recommendations for places to eat and things to do. Thanks to him, my mother and I could enjoy "Global Day" at the hotel. There were so many fun activities, such as making our perfume and getting a tutorial on the best colors for our skin tone. Duke is the reason that this is my go-to hotel for NYC. He is a gem.

title: Very Nice Hotel
text: Very. nice hotel, I enjoyed the Restaurant upstairs and the view from my Room was awesome. beds were comfortable and the clean. Close to Time Square and main attractions, the only thing I would like is to have coffee in the room

title: Great Service
text: Great stay at the Renaissance. Rooms were quiet and comfortable and the staff professional and courteous. A special thanks to Lead Navigator (concierge) Duke for his expertise and knowledge of local restaurants.

title: Missing the mark on many areas
text: Sadly this hotel fell way below what I’ve come to expect from Marriott. A curious layout with reception on 6th floor with a bar really didn’t work to me.  Reception desk staff seemed disengaged generally.  Our double Queen set up and bathroom were okay but furniture was tired with knocks to woodwork etc unrepaired.  The bathroom looked to be more recently modernized on face of it but clearly poorly maintained.  First night’s sleep broken by persistently leaking and dripping shower.  Following morning we asked for it to be fixed whilst out for day.  However after a second night kept awake with same shower problem it seemed apparent the requested maintenance hadn’t been performed.  On return to room that evening our room had not be cleaned or made up and shower remained unfixed so we had to revert to reception to ask to be moved to a different room - always a pest when u r all unpacked.  The second room made us realize that the shower problem in the first room created a very weak shower experience in comparison!  No further problems with second room.  Breakfast experience was one not to be repeated either and we only had breakfast in hotel restaurant once as a result.  The venue for breakfast was incredibly dark and more like a bar atmosphere.  Whilst the food was ok a side order was missed and we needed to request again which then appeared late after other food finished.  However - the worst was a staff member who in full view of the room placed his hand down his trousers to rearrange his nether regions before immediately putting on his apron and then proceeding to handle clean cutlery into receptacles.  Revolting behaviour.  Hence we ate out for rest of stay for breakfast.

title: Great Location
text: We stayed for four nights at the Renaissance in a city view room. We loved this location. It was easy to walk to the sights we were interested in. If we didn't want to walk, we took the subway that had a main stop just steps away from the hotel. We also took the train in from the JFK to Penn Station. We easily walked with our luggage to the hotel. The room was clean and modern. The bed was comfortable. I loved the shower. There isn't much in the way of privacy between the bathroom and bedroom. I would stay here again.

title: Terrible hotel to stay in the weekend, with unhelpful staff
text:
If I can give 0 star, I will!!!!! Do not stay in this hotel in the weekend unless you want to participate in the club party from your room. 

We are staying in this hotel for two nights. We just moved from very busy Times Square area, so wanted to have a little peace here (I know that Penn 34th is not so much different), which seemed like a case at first. But we paid more for the two nights here than the three nights in the TS, so you can imagine I was expecting better. It seemed like it in the first glance. Lobby was peaceful, staff were polite and efficient. It seemed like a right choice only until 5pm when our nap was disturbed by crazy vibration and club music. I thought at first there was an earthquake as the room was literally vibrating. But shortly after with loud club music, I realised that something terrible was going on nearby. I called the reception where the staff very casually said “Oh there is a party on the 5th floor. I will ask them to turn down the music.” Don’t they think they needed to warn us when we checked in today??? Fortunately (?) we went out for a dinner shortly, but to our dismay, the loud music was continued when we came back at 9:30pm. When we called AGAIN, they said the party was over at 10pm. Obviously it wasn’t and I received a call from a manager at 10:30 who said that he had no control over the party at the restaurant that he could only ask them to turn down the volume. 

So, the staff didn’t know what was going on in their hotel, and the manager did not have the authority to end the party that is clearly disturbing the guest. 

This is not a four star hotel that I was expecting and paid for. I would obviously haven’t come here if I knew the hotel had a terrible sound proof system with parties in the weekend. Do Not stay in this hotel unless you want to feel a party vibe in your room!

title: Credit card stolen by housekeeping
text: This is my second time staying here, and probably my last. First time was great, but this time, a member of housekeeping took a credit card out of my wallet while in my room. Although I spoke with security, nothing was done and the card was not retrieved. The hotel staff I spoke to kept insisting I had misplaced the card even though I repeatedly told I'm 100% sure it was removed from my wallet while I was out of my room. Very disappointing since I really enjoyed staying at this hotel and have never had something taken from my room before in the city.

title: Small but quite nice
text: Stayed here for a short period. The rooms were small but quite nice.  Feels like this hotel was either built fairly recently or renovated. Felt like going into an apartment building at first.  The rooms were modern, clean, and comfortable. The location of this hotel is kind of hidden from the mainstream areas. But still accessible to some major tourist points.  I would stay here again if I wanted somewhere nice, but away from the hustle and bustle.

title: NICE LOCATION
text: Hotel is close to Bryant Park. Room and bathrooms were small but nice, compared to similar priced hotels in Manhattan. Housekeeping staff were nice and courteous, service is provided daily. Hotel has a lounge for elite guests, with water bottles, but lacks in food offerings, it serves light breakfast on weekdays only (no compensation for days it is closed). Versa restaurant has a nice ambiance with live music and menu with lot of choices, service was ok.

title: The Concierge Made our stay a pleasure
text: The staff at the hotel were outstanding. My husband and I have stayed at many hotels around the world and have experienced various degrees of service by the hotel staff, but our expectations were exceeded at the Renaissance New York Midtown Hotel. The registration staff were great, but the experience and service we received from Duke Perkins, the Concierge, was extraordinary. He was friendly and very helpful about arranging events for us. When my husband accidentally left his eye glass case at his desk, he rushed to the elevator to go 6 floors down to the street level to return them. Duke, by far, is the most caring Concierge we have ever had the pleasure to meet.

title: Modern and clean but expect to hear your neighbors
text: The hotel’s location is very good, within easy walking distance to many attractions. I would have rated my experience 5 stars but was disappointed with two aspects of my stay. We could hear every word from our neighbor’s room despite the fact that the walls are concrete. Lastly, the water was only luke warm even on the hottest setting. Otherwise the hotel is clean and modern and the staff are very welcoming.

title: Good location for me (Near MSG).  Otherwise nothing special.
text:
The common area is good but a bit noisy.  The club lounge was sparse at best.  

My room was ok.  Quiet and functional.  The room is just a bit worn and the bed was lumpy.  The bathroom was ok but the shower was marginal.  The hardware (handles and hand held shower head were/are falling off the wall/door.  The temperature knob was stuck and took herculean force to move it.  The window between the shower and room (not my style but ok) was either dirty or poorly frosted.  Looked bad.

Might not stay here again.

title: Exceptional Hotel & Staff!
text: I cannot say enough about this hotel. I haven't traveled to NYC in awhile but as a Marriott Elite Member, I decided to stay here. This place did not disappoint. GREAT LOCATION! The staff was incredibly friendly, the room was a nice size for New York, the hotel smelled good and was very clean. The Hotel Bar on the 6th floor was fun. We didn't eat here so I can't speak on the food.  When I return to NYC, this is where I'll stay. Do yourself a favor, (especially if you're a Marriott member) and stay here. The price is fair. FYI-IF YOU HAVE A CAR, PARKING IS $100 USD

title: Business at Renaissance Midtown
text: Stayed at the Renaissance Midtown on West 35th Street for the first time on business the past three days.  Sleeping rooms are decent size for Manhattan, there is good working / desk space, plenty of electrical outlets to plug in all devices, and bathrooms are well lit.  Front Desk staff is exceptional.  I would like to point out and thank Catherine for her exceptional customer service.  I had specific sleeping room requests and she accommodated.  Thank you Catherine.  I look forward to coming back!

title: Excellent Stay
text: Booked with Hotels.com, March 4/5, 2023. Excellent property and very customer friendly staff especially Duke Perry and Jordan Carlisle - thank you!!  And thanks to Thomas Williams and all front desk staff.

title: Why create a brand if there is no consistency?
text: Don't get me wrong, it's a nice enough hotel.  As you would expect from an expensive, high end hotel in Manhattan.  Rooms were clean and modern and decent size for NYC.  Nice view from our upgraded floor room.  Great location near Penn Station.  But the Marriott/Renaissance experience is so inconsistent.  The whole purpose of creating a brand is to have a consistent experience across properties (or restaurants, or retail locations, or gas stations) so that customers know what to expect.  I understand that the properties are independently owned.  But if you provide a breakfast benefit to elite members, you need to provide it consistently.  I never know what I’m going to get at a Marriott.  Hyatt doesn’t do that.  As a Globalist, I get breakfast at a Hyatt property.  Full stop.  No question.  Marriott, I don’t know.  Renaissance Platinum benefit is breakfast.  Or maybe not.  Depending on if that property wants to give it to you or not.  Like that is literally the policy.  You get breakfast unless the property doesn’t want to give you breakfast.  This one told me at check in, no breakfast on the weekends.  Instead, they chose to give me 1,000 points.  Worth $6 or $7 in my opinion.  When I got to the room, there was a card offering paid breakfast in the morning.  So it’s available, they just chose not to give it to me.  Question to the manager.  No breakfast.  Question to the Platinum call center.  Ask the manager of the property.  At least with the low-end Marriott properties I know I’ll get a mediocre breakfast.  I’m pretty close to lifetime Platinum.  Not sure why I want it.  Hyatt treats their loyal customers right.  I know where I’m staying next time.

title: Worst Marriott member hotel we stayed in
text:
I’m a Marriott Bonvoy member and stay at Marriott hotels most of the time but first time experienced:
-the lack of water bottles in the room
-clogged sink
-non-working sockets near the bed (all of them)
-no space for fitting luggage because the room is so tiny 

Also, you can see on pictures there is only rough finish in the room. Somebody can say “it’s a loft style” but I can say this hotel doesn’t keep the Marriott brand.

title: Awesome Stay
text: Excellent experience at this hotel. They were very accommodating when we arrived extremely early due to a mishap at the airport and we were unable to travel on our scheduled date. Hotel view was lovely, bed was very comfortable. Room service food was delicious.

title: Good option for midtown!
text: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel.   The bed was very comfortable and my room had a great view. It could use a bit of an update and the prices seem to fluctuate wildly, but it’s a solid, conveniently located property for a quick business trip.

title: Should have gone elsewhere
text: It is really 2.5. It is a good place to stay if you are in for business and only need to sleep and shower. I met my husband after he was staying there for work and we should have moved to another hotel. I hated it. The elevators are ridiculous. They confuse people and you have to add time to depart because you never know when you will get on. The room was never really cleaned- we did not have our drinking glasses replaced all week. The pillows are like cement and the bedding was itchy. The shower took at least 10 minutes for the water to get hot. The air was either cold or hot and stuffy.  And last, but not least, it sounded like we were in a submarine. There was this noise that was constant coming from the closet. Bad on me, I should have gone somewhere else, but my husband had been there for several days and had a great rate.

title: Perfect for us
text:
This hotel is only a couple blocks from Penn Station which made it easy for us since we traveled by train. The staff was extremely welcoming and directed us to the elevators that took us up to the lobby on the 6th floor. 
The desk help was enthusiastic and full of advice. The lounge had "grown up punch" free for guests. 
Our room was upgraded to a city view. It was quiet (so hard to find in NYC) so we slept well. The pillows were perfect with a variety on the bed to choose from. 
The room was exceptionally clean and our bed was made every day. 
The location was convenient. Across the street was Best Bagels and Coffee-an incredible establishment. At the end of the street is .99 pizza which is pretty wonderful if you are hungry and want something quick and cheap.
Macy's is nearby. I easily walked to the NY Public Library. Don't miss the French patissery Aux Marveiullux Fred on Sixth Ave.

title: Duke Came Through!
text:
Great room. 
Great accommodations. 
Great service.
Great staff.
Great stay and...
SPECIAL THANKS to Duke Perkins who went above and beyond to knock out the special request I made for my anniversary weekend!

title: Not what it used to be...
text:
This has been our go-to hotel in New York for years - the location is great (centrally located, but far enough away from the madness of Times Square). We visited last June for a quick overnight coming back into the country from overseas, and noticed the condition of the rooms has deteriorated a bit - furniture was a little beat up and our shower didn't drain. Not a huge deal.

We returned in January with family and I took care of booking our rooms - it was "hotel week" so I was able to score a rate that offered 10K bonus points per night, which, if you're a Marriott Rewards member is a pretty sweet promo. There was a Renaissance in Chelsea that was about $160 cheaper, but the point bonus made up for the price difference in my opinion.

Things quickly went downhill at check-in - they couldn't find our reservations (though they were showing in the app and I'd been able to check-in online) and the individuals checking us in couldn't have been more unfriendly/uncaring. It took over 30 minutes just to get keys to our rooms only to find they'd rebooked our reservations incorrectly and we had to get new keys. They also claimed they upgraded us like they'd done us this huge favor, until I pointed out they'd given us City View rooms which is exactly what we had booked to begin with. And then I had to go back for new keys again after we couldn't get into the lounge (which, after pointing out the keys weren't working, I got a snooty "um, you're gold" - I'm Platinum btw, so don't expect any status recognition here either). Lounge is also not open on weekends except for a beverage fridge that was almost totally empty every time we went in, and their compensation for no breakfast was 1K points - which I never received.

Naturally I had concerns regarding any of this getting credited to my account, despite multiple assurances from the manager that he would get everything resolved. I requested email copies of my folios multiple times (which should have come automatically) and sure enough those never showed up and I only got standard credit for one of the rooms. I've been going back and forth with Marriott since trying to get this corrected, to no avail.

Points/credit situation aside, my main issue was the complete apathy that the hotel's team showed. The ladies checking us in acted annoyed with us even though it was an issue with their system and were just generally incompetent, and the manager, while very nice, did not follow-through on his promises to ensure things got resolved on the back end. We also didn't have any hot water our first day (which to their credit they did get fixed, but that's two stays in a row now we've had issues with the showers).

As long as you don't have high expectations of the staff and/or any sort of status recognition or perks like breakfast or a functional lounge, the location is solid and the beds are comfortable. But after my last two stays at what was once our go-to hotel, I have to say this location is trending towards simply mediocre with bad customer service. We'll be trying a new location on our next visit.

title: Average hotel with service that doesn’t really care even the manager Jordan
text: Stayed here a few times and it’s getting worse on the service. The checkin staff don’t really care. The restaurant food is ok but better eating outside the restaurant. The manager doesn’t really seem to care when a colleague had a problem with them checking them out of my room even though is was booked and paid for. The lobby bar is not open so only the sports bar available which is loud and hard to just chill and chat in. Think I will find another Marriott linked hotel.

title: Great Location, Wonderful Staff
text: I really liked this hotel. Thankfully we got a high floor room so views of the city where breathtaking. I loved watching the sun rise and set on NYC, very cool. The room was average NYC size. Loved the bathroom; the shower was everything! This place had some of the nicest doormen in the city. I would stay here again. The only meh experience was the bar. Didn't receive the best service and the drinks were just ok for the price.

title: Good location, great service, gorgeous rooms!
text:
We had a really amazing experience at this hotel. We stayed 4 nights in gorgeous rooms with large windows which offered a beautiful opening on the outside, especially at night! 

The service was impeccable and the staff was efficient and understanding. We initially had a room with a King size bed for two people but decided that 2 separated beds would bring us more comfort, so the staff very kindly made us move to an even more beautiful room with 2 Queen size beds. 

The restaurants are also very qualitative, there’s a lot of options to choose from and everything was tasty and fresh. I loved the breakfast!

title: Great Location & Service
text: Traveled to New York to celebrate Christmas/My Birthday and my stay at Renaissance New York Midtown was awesome! The hotel was modern & clean. The room had a great view of MSG and even the Statue of Liberty in the distance - It was clean, comfortable and relatively spacious. We had no problems during the stay which was great. The person who made this stay extraordinary for us was Duke Perkins, The Lead Navigator Concierge! He was absolutely amazing and a huge help during the entirety of our stay. He helped recommend great restaurants, make reservations, and gave us insight into the city. Aside from that he is just great company! We throughly enjoyed daily interactions with Duke and looked forward to running into him in the hotel. Once you arrive, you need to connect with Duke to ensure a great experience in NYC. I posted daily stories of everything we did and ate in NYC along with a room tour if you want a real look into my experience at this hotel on instagram @alexxusfinnell under my "NYC *christmas tree emoji*" Highlight. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay again next time I visit!

title: Great Service, Good Location
text: We chose this hotel for the proximity to Madison Square Garden. We were traveling with our toddler and needed to be within walking distance to the game we were attending. The staff at "The Ren" was phenomenal! Duke the Concierge was spot on with lunch recommendations and the Guest Service Ambassadors Tinisha, Catherine, and Julie were so friendly and sweet! Will definitely be staying here again!

title: Great location. Minimal Bonvoy Benefits.
text:
Great location. Perfect for a concert at Madison Square Garden MSG or for easy access to Penn Station. The place was clean. 

Elevators were slow. 

For Bonvoy Elites : No Suite upgrades with Suite Night Awards. No lounge breakfast on weekends.

title: Thanksgiving and Black Friday week stay
text: I visited NYC last week of November incl. Thanksgiving and Black Friday. This hotel is very special in many aspects, eg. its location in Midtown (close to Empire State Building, Macy’s Herald Square and more). I had my room on the 35th floor with amazing view. Restaurant Versa has a cosy atmosphere. But what makes the real difference is the fantastic staff. Duke as a lead navigator and a native New Yorker is the best to help you with great recommendations of must sees’, restaurants etc. Neli in the reception is always there to help you with any of your requests. Without nice people like them, my visit would have not been that perfect as finally it was.

title: Ottima posizione
text:
Hotel in posizione comodissima, vicino alla metro ma da cui è possibile raggiungere a piedi l 'Empire, ma anche il Moma e Hudson Yards
Lobby molto bella, con bar e terrazza. Camere spaziose per gli standard di NY, con vista mozzafiato sullo skyline di Mid Town.

title: Duke Perkins, The Lead Navigator Concierge For The Win
text:
The highlight of our stay was our daily interactions with Duke Perkins. He was an excellent resource for restaurant recommendations along with things to do! He went out of his way to make sure my daughter’s birthday was memorable. The icing on the cake was the impromptu photo shoot with Duke.  Thank you Duke for making sure we had a great Christmas/Birthday vacation. We are already planning to return next year! 

Also, Catherine at the Front Desk was very pleasant, professional, and helpful at check in. Tinisha was a life saver in helping me locate my driver’s license that I left at the front desk. 

The hotel is modern & clean. The pillows and beds were so comfortable that I contacted Serta for a local retailer. 

The view was amazing! The location is across the street from Penn Station which was very convenient.  Absolutely, no complaints and that is unusual for me because I am hard to please.

title: BOOK IT! You Won't Regret it!
text:
Do not think twice about booking here! Everything from the concierge at the entrance to the front desk people to the pillows were amazing. I had several hotels booked for our anniversary trip to NYC, but after reading the reviews of the Renaissance, I decided to try it and I'm so glad I did. I have neck issues so I normally travel with my pillow, but since we already had a lot of luggage, I decided to leave mine at home. I'm so happy to say that the pillows on the bed were wonderful! I didn't have any neck pain and slept great. The location is perfect as it's near the subway, Macy's, Starbucks, a lot of restaurants, and Time Square, but still fairly quiet. The black out curtains were great and we turned the thermostat fan on while sleeping so we didn't hear any sirens. There is a refrigerator which came in handy and the bathroom had a lot more counter space than most I had looked at. 
We had a couple housekeeping issues (clogged toilet and didn't have enough towels). Those took a while to get resolved, but other than that there were no room issues. 

The hotel restaurant (Versa) left a lot to be desired. My husband and I both got a cocktail on our last night. Mine was undrinkable and my husbands was not a true old fashioned. Our waiter never came back to ask how they were (after recommending the one I got) and we had to flag him down to get our bill. We got a couple appetizers and salad which were fine, but nothing great. We both wished we had walked a few extra steps and gone to another rooftop bar or restaurant because we spent a lot of money on a bad experience. 

All in all, book the hotel, but skip the restaurant!

title: Our beautiful Wives Bday Weekend!!!
text:
The Renaissance was AMAZING and it was everything we ever imagined it would be! Especially with the NUMBER CONCIERGE in NYC Mr. Duke himself!!! 
He alone was able to make sure our room was showered with gifts and that every reservation for Brunch, Dinner or Drinks & Live Music was the epitome of ROYALTY! We cannot thank him enough and will return ONLY to stay at the RENAISSANCE as long as Duke is there!!! 

The Counte & Doni Pettaway!!!

title: Nice hotel, friendly staff
text:
I enjoyed my stay here for 3 nights. The location is great if you need to be near Penn Station / Midtown. The room is clean and modern. Expect some city noise of course, I could hear cars from the 24th floor. I couldn't hear a thing from my neighbors or the hallway, which was awesome! 
Staff were incredibly nice - super friendly at check in, gave me bagel recommendations, let me borrow umbrellas, etc. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

title: Great location, good skyline.
text: Location and comfort was great. The service at desk and reception was super quick and helpful in particularly Alena was super helpful when required. The top rooms are having good skyline but you have to often wait for elevators as many guests reside in hotel.

title: Not at all what I expect from a Renaissance
text:
I stayed here for a business trip and was extremely underwhelmed.  I could not believe that you have to pay extra for WiFI that is fast enough for streaming. I did not have good cell service in my room so could not hot spot off my phone for Zoom calls.  That was frustrating.

Also, it is crazy that they send you to the Planet Fitness next door instead of having their own gym. That facility was dirty and there were people with mental and hygiene issues in that gym. As someone who travels for work a good amount, being able to workout in a clean facility is important for mental and physical wellness.

The only good aspects of my stay  that the bed was comfortable , the shower pressure was good and the staff was friendly.

When in NYC again, I will stay in another hotel. I really liked the Kixby which has a boutique feel, its own secure gym (small but with 2 Peloton bikes) and free, fast WiFI!

title: Great Mid Town Hotel
text: My wife and I stayed here while I was in town for meetings.  I was a little taken aback by the street the hotel was on, but once you step inside and get on the elevators, it is a wonderful experience.  The hotel is modern, with a very unique layout, the lobby is on the 6th floor.  Joshua at the front desk was very helpful, and upon asking he was able to help us arrange a late check out.  The rooms are nice and inviting, which I really love.  Nothing is more of a disappointment than coming back to the room after a long day of meetings or sightseeing and feeling like we are walking into a hospital.  Modern touches like a number of outlets and USB ports are a big plus.  The bed is very comfortable, and while the room is standard NY size, the full floor to ceiling window and a chaise lounge to watch the city from was essential to making the room and experience wonderful.  The location is close to a number of good restaurants and eateries, namely the Stick to my Pot next door is a great place for late night dumplings, or the NY Desserts a block or two away is great for a sweet treat.  I would recommend this hotel for a mid town stay.

title: Solid in many respects
text:
The sister property, Renaissance Times Square, is just not a good hotel (see my review from 2019, which may been out-of-date if they made any changes since then), and I didn't have a lot of faith in the Renaissance Midtown, but a friend raves about it, so I tried it.  Definitely better.

Rooms at this hotel are spacious, especially for NYC.  Appointments are quite nice, and the bathroom is large with a big shower.  You have plenty of AC and USB power near the bed, and on the desk as well, making computers useful.  The bed is comfortable although I'd love to see some foam pillows as an option.  For some reason my Marriott profile that states "foam pillows requested" is never done when I'm assigned a room.

Location:  excellent.  I love this location for proximity to my office.  It's also not far from a ton of restaurant options, and about 45 minutes from LGA with minor traffic.

Amenities:  the Bonvoy Platinum and above free breakfast is pretty good.  Fresh fruit, scrambled eggs, plenty of pastries.  My only complaint were the beverage options - only bottled water and sugary sodas in the mornings.  This could be much better.  The main restaurant has good variety and the bar service is efficient.  I had some meatballs and soup - both good choices.

Where I'm torn on the amenities offering is on the Planet Fitness access.  Planet Fitness is not a very good gym in general, but I assumed it would be better than a standard hotel gym.  This is really not the case, especially with the layout of the Planet Fitness.   The sheer amount of unnecessary cardio machines takes up almost all the floor space, so if you offer dumbbells and kettlebells, you need to offer real estate for people to use them.  This gym consumes all its floor space with the aforementioned cardio machines, some pulley stations (good feature), and about three adjustable benches.  No bench, no rack (except a Smith machine) ... just not a good gym except if you want 57 treadmills and ellipticals to choose from.  Although this shouldn't be a review of Planet Fitness, I can't help criticizing it since the hotel doesn't have its own gym.  Believe it or not, I think I'd rather use a hotel gym that has one pulley station, dumbbells and kettlebells.

Overall, I would return to Renaissance Midtown for all the positive reasons I listed.  I'd like to see them create their own gym space, but as long as their partnership with PF remains intact, I don't see an incentive for them to do so any time soon.

title: Gracious and kind staff!
text: I arrived to the hotel in a rush (delayed flight) and had to get to my room and pad out the door for work as soon as I could. The Check-in desks were busy (LOTS of folks in for a concert down the street)…I took a risk and the hotel’s lead negotiator (aka Concierge), Duke, if he would be able to check me in. OK, this is totally not his job, but he was so kind — clearly saw the stressy look on my face, gave me a beautiful box of Belgian chocolates *AND* checked me in. Duke did not have to do this. He did this out of the kindness of his heart — he took care of me. He smiled, he made me feel less stressy…it was pure kindness. I’ll never forget him, He totally helped me out. He didn’t have to. Hospitality, polish, professionalism and love — that’s Duke.

title: I want to like it - but needs to focus on the customer
text: I regularly stay in NYC for work and pleasure. After spending the week at the Moxy across the street (rooms too small for me) I decided to stay the weekend at the Renaissance. Arrived at 2pm and no problem checking in early. Upgraded to the 29th floor with an amazing view due to my platinum status. Getting a car in/out of the hotel for luggage is very difficult as the street backs up and cars stay parked in the circle. Lobby is a bit dated. Rooms are small but they are renovated and very functional. I like them, especially if you have a high floor with a view. Part of the value proposition of this hotel is its “digital” experience. Well that’s very disappointing. The QR code wouldn’t work for me and did not send a text to my phone to kick off the process. The alarm clock was also set at the wrong time. Had a really nice night sleeping and the black out blinds are useful. Waking up the next morning I was ready for breakfast. When I arrived I was informed they don’t serve breakfast on weekend in the lounge and I need to go to the restaurant. Even worse they don’t offer a credit for the restaurant and force you to take points as an elite member. Nothing is mentioned about that on their website. I’ve stayed in many Renaissance hotels and that’s not the customer service I expect. Anyway, I went to the restaurant. The espresso was made the size of filter coffee and the service was slow. It was a beautiful unusually warm November morning and they had closed the outside section of the restaurant for “an event”. No one was preparing for an event and they crammed all the guests into the inside section for their convenience I guess? The food quality was ok. Bottom line:  the high floor rooms are good but the service and attitude especially to elite members is very average for a Renaissance hotel. Perhaps given it’s location it’s just focused on the volume tourist $ and not the frequent travelers. Idk if I’ll be back. It’s a shame because the location works well for me.

title: Nice hotel near Penn Station
text: Came into New York for a tradeshow over the weekend for work. Stayed in room 1912 for one night, overall my stay was quick but the room was comfortable. Easy walk to the Javits Convention center and really easy walk to Penn Station if your arriving by train. Staff was friendly. I also grabbed a happy hour drinks at the hotel with friends before heading out to dinner, which was nice. It was also easy to leave my luggage at the hotel before and after I checked in and out.

title: Great hotel. Housekeeping never saw
text:
I brought my daughter and her friends to the city for her 18th birthday.  We wanted to be midtown so we would have easy access to the city. I had originally booked a Hilton a few blocks away but changed the night before after reading all the positive reviews on this hotel.  Everyone is so friendly!  The doormen, front desk people, amazing!

When I had checked in online I chose to have my room cleaned daily.  The first morning she knocked on the door at 9:30 and o said we would be gone in an hour.  We came back at 6 and the room hadn’t been cleaned.  

The next morning we left at 10, returned at 6 again. No cleaning again.  I messaged the front desk on the app and explained and she said that if they come once and we aren’t ready that it is up to the guest to let them know when we want service.  I explained I had told her we’d be gone in an hour and thought that was sufficient enough.  

Great hotel. Great location, just letting people know to request housekeeping if they come once and you’re not ready yet.

title: Great Place to Stay in NYC!
text: We loved everything about our experience at this hotel, but especially our interaction with Duke the concierge who planned some wonderful evening jazz experiences.  His knowledge of the hottest new clubs and best restaurants helped us have the time of of our lives!  Almost everyone was a delight and the view of our upper level corner room was exquisite!  The hotel is very close to Madison Square Garden and convenient to Chelsea and right across from Macy’s.  Will definitely be back .  The breakfast service could use some improvement.  The lounge was very nice and the outside bar had great drinks.

title: Incredible Hospitality
text: I planned this trip for an anniversary and was blown away by the hospitality of the staff every step of the way. Duke Perkins helped organize decorations in the room, as well as a bottle of champagne upon checkin. The front desk accommodated room requests, and the views were incredible. Beautiful hotel and great overall experience.

title: Great Staff
text: I just completed a one night stay at this property.   I would like to recognize Catherine and Ruby who checked me in.  They were super friendly and recognized my Marriott elite status multiple times. Even though I’m only “gold” they gave me an upgraded room, access to the lounge, and a late checkout.  The bellmen were friendly and helpful as well.  It was a quick stay so I did not get to experience restaurants/bars onsite.   I liked the location as we were able to walk to a lot of the places we planned to visit.   I would definitely stay here again.

title: Solid choice for midtown NYC hotel
text:
I had a pleasant stay at this hotel and I would stay here again.  Rooms are small but standard for NYC.  

Pros:
- location is good for convenience to Penn Station and Madison Square Garden.  I felt very safe walking around
- nice Executive Lounge for Elite members.  Good to grab breakfast or (non-alcoholic) beverages 
- I had an upgraded room on a high floor with a good view
- they have daily housekeeping which is a huge plus in these post-COVID times!

Cons:
- the lounge is not open for breakfast on weekends.  Most other Bonvoy hotels will give you breakfast in their restaurant as an alternative, but not this one. They will give you an additional 1000 points.
- elevators are slow.
- Not a fan of the glass wall between shower and bedroom.  There is (thankfully) a shade you can raise and lower, but it is not great if you have one person who gets up earlier than the other.

title: Marriott’s Lead Navigator of all Navigators
text:
Wow. Just W O W 
And I mean this in the absolute best way possible! I travel a lot and have stayed at a lot of hotels in my days; however, this was the best experience I’ve ever had, especially trying to organize, plan and coordinate with a hotel. 
Marriott Hotels everywhere need someone like Duke Perkins, Lead Navigator, on their staff.
