As I planned a trip for my wife and her friend to come to the hotel to celebrate her 30th birthday, he was with me every step of the way, even taking the initiative to reach out to confirm all is well and still in order as we approached the day… not to mention it was an absolute INSANE weekend for the hotel with four huge events going on and soooo many people funneling in and out of the hotel. I could not have asked for better coordination and/ or help. Truly was my eyes, ears, hands and feet while I was hundreds of miles away. Thank you so much to Duke and all the staff at the Marriott Hotel! Y’all are all awesome! Duke, again, a special thank you to you.

title: Exceptional Experience
text:
This was our first trip since 2019 and wow, what a great place to get back to the joys of traveling! The room (and the view!) were fantastic, the service and the food at Versa was amazing, and the staff was wonderful. 

The absolute highlight of the trip for us was Duke, the hotels Lead Navigator! There are not enough words to describe how incredible of a human being he is. He is so engaging, thoughtful, and knowledgeable. He provided us with great recommendations for dining and we loved every single one of them! We so enjoyed talking with him and getting to know him, so much so that we looked forward to seeing him each day. By the end of the trip, he became a friend and we were so very sad to say goodbye. 

We very much look forward to our next trip and to see our friend Duke!

title: Great centrally located New York hotel
text: Loved our stay at the Renaissance! The hotel was very clean and in a great location! We took the Amtrak, and the walk from Penn Station is only 5 min. The hotel offers a bar and restaurant. There is also a lounge for members with free waters and soda 24/7. We stayed in a king room on the 26th floor next to the elevator. The room was very clean and we loved the rainfall shower! We were worried about noise being so close to the elevator, but we didn’t hear it at all the entire stay. The elevators are fast for New York, and we never waited too long. There is a planet fitness on the first floor that serves as the hotel gym. We recommend staying at the Renaissance and would stay again!

title: NY Winner
text:
This hotel is conveniently located between the Penn Station & Herald Sq subway lines.  A very walkable location too.

The staff was incredible from the bell hops to the check-in staff (Neli was great) to the housekeepers to the concierge (Duke was fantastic)
I would absolutely return!

title: Fantastic Anniversary weekend at this great hotel in NYC!
text: We had the best stay at this hotel. From the moment we arrived and met the bellmen, then we met the Navigator Duke who was excellent, super friendly and helpful!  We were tired after long travel and they were so nice to get our room ready earlier. It was Fantastic!  We loved our room and they even had some special treats waiting for us for our 18th wedding anniversary - which was amazing.   We will be staying here again. Location was excellent and the on site Versa restaurant was great also for a quick bite and a drink. Thank you !  We also saw the broadway show Come From Away as we are from NFLD!  It was so great. Can’t wait to come back!

title: Great hotel-chic and convenient
text:
I love its location.  It is convenient to go to Times Square, Hudson Yard, Central Park, Penn Station and many subway stations.  Though it is convenient, it is not as lousy as those in Times Square.

Like most of the hotels in NYC downtown, the room is not spacious, but it works well for me.  At least it has a sofa.  

The rooms are pretty modern with multiple USB plugs.  The bed is super comfortable.  The room is sound proof so it is great for light sleepers.

Maybe the hotel is in the fashion district, the interior design reflects it by adding a seeing machine toy to the night stand.

The staffs are super nice.  The bellman on the first floor is amazing.  They not only store luggages, provide directions but also remind hotel guests the temperature outside might be cool that it is better to put on a jacket before stepping out.

The hotel is popular.  The check-in time is 4 pm even you are an elite members.

title: We LOVE Duke!
text: We loved the hotel and our room! But the best part was the concierge, Duke Perkins. My mom and I were visiting the city from NC. Duke was so warm and gave us so many tips about the city and set up some amazing reservations for us. He even checked in after to make sure we had a wonderful time. the reason we would come back is Duke. My mom wants to stay at the Ritz next time but she said only if Duke is working there. She fell in love with him!

title: Loved our stay!
text: This was my first time in New York, without anything planned! My family and I checked into this hotel and was immediately met with so much kindness from the staff! Angel at the front desk was super nice and made sure we would like our room. Duke, the head of concierge, was absolutely amazing and so accommodating. He gave us a few lists of recommendations for restaurants, bars, etc. He was such a blessing to meet & made our trip even better!  The room was super nice, clean & spacious. Also was quiet throughout the day/night. The rooftop restaurant is also a cute plus. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone, its in a central area to walk to all of the tourists spots as well. Thanks Duke & Midtown Renaissance!

title: Best concierge EVER!!
text: I booked this Hotel for my daughters 18th birthday and needed some help getting a cake. I spoke with Duke and he ordered a cake and picked it up for me. When we arrived he had the room full of balloons and the cake waiting for her when we walked in!! Duke went ABOVE AND BEYOND for us and made it “The BEST trip ever” my daughters words😊 It was comforting knowing we already had a friend in NY before we even got there!!  If you go and need anything, DEFINITELY ask for Duke🙌🏻🙌🏻🙌🏻

title: US open/NYC trip with stay at the Renaissance New York Midtown
text:
We made a trip to NYC this past week for the US open and some sight seeing. Overall our stay at the Renaissance Midtown was excellent. We were looking to book a hotel close to Penn station in order to take LIRR to the US open(Port Washington line, 2 stops, 20 minutes) and close to activities in Manhattan. I was split between Courtyard Marriott Times Square west and the Renaissance but decided to go with the Renaissance based on the excellent reviews. The Renaissance in located in Midtown, just one block from Penn station for easy access to almost any subway or LIRR routes.  The area around the hotel appeared clean and safe. The service at the hotel was superb from check in to check out. We took the valet for our minivan(drove down from Rochester, NY) which although expensive was convenient(95$/24 hours). Absolutely no waiting at check in. Bell man took our luggage up to the room.  The room itself was smaller than we were used to with Marriott  but considering it was Manhattan, was a decent size. We had the 2 queen bed, higher floor, city view which was nice. Overall for a family of 2 adults and 2 kids(13 and 10) we have enough space. The rooms, beds and bathroom was very clean. The rooms were cleaned every day without requesting it. The bathroom was a decent size with a spacious shower. The interesting thing about the bathroom is that the walls are frosted glass! It Provided enough privacy but solid walls would have been nicer for privacy.. When we needed room service for towels etc, the service was pretty quick. Room service for meals is available for breakfast between 6:30 to 10 AM from one of the insight restaurants My Belly's Playlist. We ordered some omelettes and waffles which were pretty good and served in to go boxes. There is another restaurant Versa on site which he didn't go to but had a decent menu and open for breakfast, lunch and dinner. There is no complimentary breakfast however. There is  a bar in the lobby with live music on some nights. The elevators were very quick and we never waited more that a couple minutes to get an elevator to the room or to the lobby. I was a bit concerned as to whether this was kid friendly hotel. Overall we had no issues and the kids enjoyed the stay, but I did feel that the hotel was more geared towards adults and teens/young adults. But we did see a few other families with kids. The rooms were very quiet and despite all the traffic and busy life on the streets, we couldn't hear much more than the occasional siren of ambulances.

For US opens fans: Great place to stay with convenience to Penn Station and Port Washington line every 30 minutes. After a late night match on Arthur Ashe that finished well after midnight it was very convenient to get back to the hotel via LIRR to Penn station with a one block walk back to the hotel. Even at that late hour it felt very safe.

Regarding the area around the hotel, I would say that its overall decent. There is a really nice bagel place right across the streets and several restaurants steps away from the hotel. Times square is 5-6 block away where we saw Aladdin on Broadway and visited Times Square at night. 

We are vegetarian and were happy to see vegetarian options in both on site restaurants. There is also a great South Indian Restaurant, Sharavana Bhavan, on Lexington and 27 which is just a 15-20 minute easy walk. 

Overall excellent place to stay when visiting NYC is you need easy access to Penn Station or Madison Square Garden  and  access to all Manhattan has to offer.

title: Best choice in Manhattan
text:
This is definitely going to be my hotel for all future bookings in the big apple. Excellent hotel and staff and I would like to specifically mention Duke Perkins (Lead Navigator) as he was extremely helpful and kind. An additional staff member I would like to point out is Catherine at the Front Desk as she is a professional, customer service oriented with true emphaty to customer requirements. Both these staff members have certainly put me in a position with a strong will to come back and book again. Excellent service, primary location with immediate walking access to major Manhatton attractions!!!

Strongly reccommended.

title: Finally a nice place with pre-pandemic level of service!
text:
Great hotel experience.  Actually, the best experience I’ve had since normal travel has resumed.  I have been in quite a few hotels over the last few months, and the service has been uneven – sometimes bad – and always well below the pre-pandemic standard. 

We came into NYC by train to Penn Station, so the Renaissance’s location was ideal. Check-in was a great experience.  This was a family trip, but the agent recognized my Marriott Bonvoy status largely earned from business travel.  He also chatted up my teenage son, which was a nice touch as he was clearly quite busy. The room (2805) was great.  Note that they offer 2 Queen beds rather than the 2 Double beds very common in NYC. The bathroom had Aveda toiletries. Decent view of the city and with some effort could see the Statue of Liberty in the distance.  We used the Concierge Lounge, the patio at the Versa restaurant, and room service.  Again, service was always really good despite the staff being visibly stretched.

McDonald’s, Starbucks, and local bagel places nearby. Subway connections were PERFECT. We used the Penn Station lines and the Herald Square/Macy’s stations to get everywhere.

Good experience. Great staff.

title:
Duke Perkins
Lead Navigator
Renaissance New York Midtown Hotel
text:
Duke suggested us where to visit and arranged all bookings for us. He provided us with all information we needed.  We are very happy with all trips he suggested. The Peak Restaurant & Bar is the most memorable place for dinner and see Manhattan.  
We very appreciated for his kind and friendly assistance. 
Uaychai.

title: Birthday Weekend
text: OUTSTANDING.  From check in to check out Duke Perkins, Lead Navigator made my birthday a special one from making dinner reservations for us at TAO (exceptional dinning) to ending my special day with a personal birthday note and treats in our room! I highly recommend this property to anyone visiting New York for business or pleasure.  Say hello to Duke for us!

title: Big shout out to the front of house team
text: Lovely hotel in Mid town New York. We has an excellent stay here but it started with a big problem as my niece’s room had been cancelled by her booking agency. Big shout out to Nellie on reception who sorted the problem out and was super attentive throughout our stay.  Can’t thank her and her colleagues for their attention above and beyond what was expected of them. Rooms, bar and restaurant all lovely and very conveniently located for all places of interest.

title: 24th Wedding anniversary
text:
The room was amazing.  My wife and I were celebrating our 24th Wedding anniversary. Duke the concierge, made it extra special by helping us with dinner suggestions, and reservations. He even left us a little surprise in our room. He went above and beyond.

The location is 2 blocks from Macy's and Harold Square, close to all the Subway Stations you need, 6 blocks South of Times Square and 3 Blocks from 5th Ave.

Neighborhood: Try Madmen Espresso to get you going in the AM and try to finish the night on the Rooftop Bar at Monarch in the shadow of the Empire State Building.  Amazing.

title: The best concierge around !
text: When I tell you Duke is the most amazing person ever those words aren’t good enough. For my friends birthday I wanted the room decorated. He stayed in contact the whole time and when I finally got to see the room it’s was better than I could imagine. He made sure we were good our entire trip. I even had random questions here and there for him that he helped with. If you are staying here stop by and see Duke for any of your needs!

title: Excellent up market room, modern, clean and comfortable
text: While a little pricey, its not too bad for New York.  Great location, fantastic rooms with all the amenities.  Staff were pretty good, had one hiccup where I went all the way to my room to discover my card didn't work but other than that, was a great stay.

title: Beautiful view, nice room, and friendly  professional service
text: I stay at Renaissance Midtown  for 3 days on this visit and I really enjoy my time there.  Check in was smooth and quick.  Shout  out to Joshua at the front desk.  He was helpful, friendly and professional.  We stop by the front desk a couple of times during our stay with questions and each time we find them helpful and friendly.  Our room was clean and comfortable  as expected. There is a basic coffee maker and a nice modern small cold  empty refrigerator.   No complementary water even for Bonvoy  members.  We like our room very much for  the view of the water and  can see the Statue of Liberty.  The lobby is on the 6th floor, small but comfortable and cozy.  I was concerned about  safety and walkability as some other reviewers  mentioned in other posts, I see no problems and no concerns walking by myself during the day. I walk  every where every day during my stay.  To be fair I did not walk around at night time.  I would recommend this hotel on the Bonvoy list. I would stay here again on my next visit.

title: Still great
text: I keep coming back.  I've been staying here since the opening.  I keep trying other properties in the area and keep coming back here.  Lounge is back open, restaurant and bar(s) are great.  Nice room service.  Rooms are clean and quiet.  Great shower.  Great views on high floors, especially facing south.

title: Great staff at front desk
text:
What is great? Well-appointed rooms. Courteous staff. Duke at the front desk is great.  Other staff helped me with Broadway booking apps which helped me save a lot of money

What could be better? elevator speed; safety as guest room floors have access without a keycard

title: Good Hotel and a Central Location
text: Welcome was great, extremely friendly and overall the hotel is clean and well presented. The bar and outdoor area are really good with nice views of Empire State at night especially. Strangely though the outdoor bar area shut quite early by our standards when we went there one night which is a shame with such a nice view. Room was pretty standard, bed very comfortable and bathroom smallish but clean and nice. The opaque sliding glass door to the bathroom might be a test for couples early in their relationship! Great views from our corner room on the 24th floor as well. The location is great for getting around all of NYC but it's very central so very busy and you're gonna encounter homelessness, drugs, weed vans/shops and the like a fair bit, much more so than other parts of town. And it seems to have got worse in recent years. So just be prepared or if you want to avoid it, head to the less raw parts of town down in the Village etc. Overall would stay again though.

title: Top notch hospitality
text: Loved our room, the lounge and restaurant with rooftop patios - but above all, I cannot say enough about the staff - every single employee we encountered went out of his/her way to be friendly and helpful. Shout out to Duke, Justin, James, and - Dexter-and others whose names I didn’t catch. Thank you for making our NYC getaway fantastic!

title: We loved the attention to detail! Great stay!
text:
We were in town from 6/9-6/12/2022. We could not have asked for a better location for our goals while in the city. This spot is walkable to broadway & Times Square and super close to penn station and LIRR which allows you to travel just about anywhere. It’s a 3 min walk to MSG which was perfect for us because we were in town partially for a Billy Joel concert. 

Highlights:
-Duke @ Concierge was AMAZING. Sometimes he would need to research something before giving you advice and he would personally send you a text with the information you need. We consulted him about any and every thing from broadway tickets to trains to Belmont Park. He’s definitely an expert and has a strong attention to detail. 

-The concierge lounge had good, HOT breakfast and drinks stocked at all hours. Such a treat to crack a cold soda after hours of city walking in the summer. 

-Free cocktails available every evening in the lobby! Fun way to start your evening!

We would NOT recommend the on-site restaurant, but I’m not going to count that against the hotel as my understanding is that they are a separate entity. Skip it and dine somewhere fun in the city!

title: Duke was Great!
text: My friend and I were traveling with her husbands Bonvoy points. Duke (the concierge) treated us like Titanium members!  He was so friendly and so helpful, making sure every part of our stay was perfect. He also had some really helpful tips for when to arrive at shows to get the best seats (front and center for Macy Gray!!). I would stay here again for sure!!

title: Great hotel
text: Stayed with my family of four, two queen bed room. Room and bathroom was excellent. (Great shower!) and was a surprisingly quiet room (15th floor) and overall was excellent. Centrally located with food locations and travel (less than 10 mins to Times Sq) all close by.

title: Worst Marriott property in the vicinity
text:
I have lived in many midtown hotels and pretty much all the Marriott properties. This one is by far the worst even though it’s TripAdvisor rating is good.

The room is really tiny, especially compared to other similar Marriott properties like Renaissance Times Square, Westin Times Square, Westin Grand Central etc. The room also doesn’t have adequate lighting.

The floor plate is small and the walls are thin, which means the hallway noise is very loud. The air conditioner noise is as loud as loud can be. I actually like white noise, but even then I think it’s unbelievably loud.

Service was nonchalant. I had a terrible laundry incident where I called in the morning for laundry pick up, which was confirmed but never was. So at night I asked what happened and I was told “you need to drop that with the bell service”. First of all, I wasn’t told. Second of all, I have never experienced a hotel at this price point asking guests to deliver own laundry. Then I was promised they will get this done and return the laundry back to me by 3pm before my Platinum late check out. Then of course the laundry never came. By the time it’s 7:15 the laundry is still not here and I had to leave for the airport.

Luckily the gentleman Ed was being super nice and helpful, trying his best to either send it to me or even get that to the airport. He showed empathy and helpfulness not seen in others at the hotel.

The worst thing about the hotel really is about the service attitude, not to mention everything else. Btw, I was asked “how was your stay” and I replied, “it was just ok”. The reply was “we look forward to seeing you again at the hotel”. So yes the training is there to deploy the standard customer service lines, with smiles no less. But where’s the actual heart?

Avoid.

title: Great location/Great staff
text:
We checked in early and checked out late.  Staff went out of their way to give us a nice upgraded room even though we were early.  Beautiful room with a balcony.  Tenisha at the front desk was very friendly and helpful.  She knew it was going to be hard to get us in right away, but checked with her manager to see if there was anything they could do before giving up.  That way we were able to store our belongings and head right out to do what we came for, after getting some cool beverages from the club lounge.
Duke, at the concierge, was wonderful and we had a blast talking to him.  Great attitude and an very nice person.  
We were very pleased with our stay.
Marriott selected some great employees for this hotel!

title: Great hotel and service
text:
Great hotel, amazing service. In particular Duke at reception has been outstanding in helping with all what a guest may need. Definitely going back soon!
The area is a bit messy being close to Penn Station but the hotel is worthy. Thank you !!

title: Great choice for Midtown
text: If you need to stay in Midtown - this is a great choice.  Rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable for NYC.  Wifi was reliable. Bar area was nice.  Staff was very helpful.  I want to give a special shout out to our concierge - Duke.  He was SUPER helpful with shopping and restaurant recommendations.  I really appreciated his help.  All around a very good experience.  Thanks Duke!

title: 2nd time visit, made a right choice
text: It was my 2nd time visit and I enjoyed this hotel like last visit. The hotel is modern, somewhat industrial , but it doesn't mean it is not luxurious. All the staffs are friendly and trys to help guests with all of their ability. The room feels modern but still feels like a upscale hotel. Also, we enjoyed welcome drink that was provided in lobby during our stay, the drink made us feel that we were welcomed. I would definetly recommend this hotel. Especially, if you want a hotel with a view, this hotel may be one of the options. For rooms in high floors with a view, the view is wonderful.

title: Some key problems and inconsistent overall quality
text:
Excellent location and that was a key reason I chose this hotel and it was also recommend by a work colleague, as well. Overall, it was a mixed bag my visit and I'll describe why.

First, the lobby was interesting in that there isn't one when you first walk in off the street as it's just like a clerk desk and you need take the elevator up to the 6th floor to reach the actual lobby to check in or do anything else.

The elevators are great, they're the smart variety where you punch in on a control panel what floor you want and it tells you which elevator to go to and that car will take you direct to where you need to go with no buttons present inside the actual elevator.

The service was pretty attentive once at the lobby and in subsequent times I visited the lobby. Even if employees are standing around talking to each other, they quickly broke out and asked how they could help me. They were also nice on the phone when calling for any needs.

But, there also was times that the call wouldn't get picked up, especially by room service. I called down one evening for a breakfast order and they never picked up and I left my order and asked them to call me back to confirm. They never did and I called before I sent to sleep to confirm and they said good thing I called before they don't check their v-mail (??). I put in my order and she confirmed. The next morning after the time range they gave me for delivery was already passed, I waited a bit in case they were on their way. After they were about 10 mins late, I called to see if they were on the way and they said they had no breakfast order for me (!!!). 

I have a customer meeting to go to and I don't have extra time for this kind of nonsense. That's the whole point of calling in the order way in advance and confirming twice. SMH. The good part is they said they would get right on it and they did deliver it pretty quickly from that point.

Food, by the way, was decent. Not bad, not great. Not a huge selection  or variety, but decent quality and choices.

This is NYC and as expected the room was pretty small. I didn't take a star away for that, but it was pretty tight. They decorated it pretty well, but nothing special.

The other reason they got 3 stars is because there was no housekeeping done. First, a hotel of this caliber and price set to do housekeeping only on request is silly. Second, I specifically asked for housekeeping the next day when I realized it's request only. Guess what? I come back to the room after a long day and ... no cleaning done (?!?).

I paid, literally, over $2K for 3 nights and what they delivered was far from a good value, even despite the location.

title: Chaos
text: Had multiple problems, I inquired about them via chat the next morning. They responded once to have me re explain and ignored every single one after that. They have no care in the world after they take your money

title: Sorry try again!
text: The hotel is in a great location. The bellmen and valet guys were super accommodating and friendly. The front desk staff seemed overwhelmed. When we tried to check in the desk people were all trying to accommodate guests but ended up frustrating most. I reserved a king deluxe corner room. Had to wait on room and when we get to it was just a king room. I asked for foam pillows and got none of my requested items. Very disappointed in this property, as a Bonvoy member I was not treated as such. Feel very let down. Huge waste of a lot of money-it wasn’t worth it.

title: Chaotic and Understaffed
text:
We just completed a 3 night weekend stay to attend a graduation ceremony.    The hotel was near capacity, and everyone (check in staff, housekeeping, etc) seems overwhelmed.   We completed online checkin and requested early check in, something that’s customarily given to Marriott Platinum level guests.  The front desk could not find my online check in and, of course, no early check in.  When finally checking in, they forgot to offer me the choice of 1,000 points or the food credit.   Under the Bonvoy rules, this entitles me to additional compensation.   I did not press the issue — I just wanted my room.     

We declined housekeeping but asked for fresh towels and additional tea bags for the room.  Both were an adventure and required several calls and texts within the Marriott app.  Finally got the towels.  Never got the tea.  We gave up.   New York has lots of tea.  Renaissance Midtown — apparently not.   

On checkout, I requested a copy of the folio, which was a zero since it was an award stay.  It was correct.   But 5 hours later, when back home in Washington DC, another bill appeared by email.   This time, it was for over $320 and in my wife’s name.   Several calls and texts later they acknowledged it was a “mistake” and would be corrected.   I asked for an email confirmation.    You know what’s next — no email conformation.  So more texts and finally a zero balance invoice, but still in my wife’s name even though I booked the room in my name, and I’m the platinum member.   So more calls/texts, and I’m finally back to where I started the day — a zero balance invoice in my name.  Pretty ridiculous.    

My credit card still shows this mystery $320 charge.  It’s not an authorization — it’s a charge.  I assume this will be reversed.    

So bottom line — a confusing and frustrating experience in an otherwise nice hotel with good rooms and good public spaces.   But it’s clearly understaffed and overworked and created a chaotic and unsatisfying experience.   They need to do better.

title: Surprise upgrade!
text:
The stay at the Renaissance unfortunately didn't start the way we expected. We arrived later than expected due to a cancelled flight but upon arrival found out that the double queen room we requested are no longer available for the first night (of a 2 night stay). To compensate tho, they upgraded us to the King suite for the first night! so I will mention some general feedback and specific feedback for each types of rooms. 

General: The staff was amazing, from front desk to the bell hops. Everyone was very helpful and very attentive to details. The ground floor staff (lobby was on ~6th floor) was always available to help open doors or press elevator for you if you had your hands full. They also have "smart" elevators which some folks did find difficult to use (you enter the floor and then instructed to use one of the 3 elevators). Hotel also offered free water bottles unlike our second hotel (Luma) that we stayed at. Unfortunately they had run out of slippers during our stay and were awaiting shipment. The location was 7-8 blocks from Times Sq and a bit too close to Penn Station but it was very close to Korean Town for all the good food options. 

King Suite 3602: The views are amazing especially with floor to ceiling windows. Nothing beats waking up to the Manhattan skyline or falling asleep to all the night lights from your bed. The swanky and stylish sitting area, leading into the king sized bedroom was very nice. The bed was as comfy as expected with automatic curtains, tv in both bedroom and sitting room, and a huge bathroom and frosted glass shower window to the bedroom. Again, hard to criticize anything about this room – it was amazing. The only issue we found was the sofa bed, which had a sorry excuse for a mattress. 

Double Queens 3003: It was a corner so had south facing views and while not as grand as the king suite, the views were pretty nice itself. It even had a nice sitting table in the corner, affording a nice place to sit and enjoy the views. It did not have automatic curtains but everything else was excellent. As with the other room, the safe was a drawer safe with ample space for multiple full size laptops. It unfortunately did have a broken shower door hinge which was a bit annoying.

title: No limpian tu habitacion
text:
El hotel es bueno! Tiene buena ubicacion!
Solo que estuvimos 4 dias hospedados y nunca nos hicieron limpieza de habitacion! Que porque la hacen cada 3 dias! 
La cual se me hace de pesimo servicio! Pues las habitaciones son pequeñas y estas con maletas y demas y nunca limpiaron nuestra habitación. 
Ni pasaban por la basura
El restaurante donde tienen desayuno tienen un menu muy pequeño! Y el q es servicio al cuarto cierra muy temprano!

title: Everything we hoped & more!!
text:
Check staff were lovely, it was our daughters 21st while there. On knowing this we were upgraded to 36th floor. Extra large room & the most amazing view with the Statue of Liberty in the distance! 
Beds are the most comfortable we have ever slept in while away. 
Housekeeping came every day as requested and left the room spotless.
Had dinner a couple of times in Versa and the food was great as was the whole ambiance of the restaurant.  Funky music playing and a real New York vibe going on!
We would not hesitate in recommending this hotel and hopefully one day will return!

title: A Great Hotel
text:
This was our first visit to this hotel and I must say, it was great. 

It’s location for us was perfect. A quick 10 minute walk to Times Square and quiet enough that you don’t feel like you’re in the middle of chaos. Macy’s was also a two minute walk and there are pubs and restaurants on every corner. 

Check in was a breeze and the front desk agent, Matthew was professional, kind and relatable. 

Our room was very nice and clean. The bedding and pillows were heavenly and the room was complexly modern.  We loved the decor…except for the bathroom door. It has a super sexy sliding door; however it’s frosted glass (you can see someone’s silhouette while they’re using the toilet) and the door doesn’t close completely or lock, which impacts privacy. The hallway on our floor was also incredibly warm - we could have done hot yoga in it. 

My only other comment would be that housekeeping seemed a little… off, I guess?Housekeeping was scheduled for every third day, with a small refresh on the in-between days (change garbages, restock shampoo, etc.). For our first day, we had nothing - the garbages were full, no restocking, nothing. On the second day, they changed our garbages and gave us some additional towels, but that was it. No refreshing of in-room coffee pods and supplies, our in-room glasses and coffee mugs weren’t changed. For the third day, they tidied the bathroom, changed towels, made the beds, and changed the garbages, but still didn’t get new glasses, mugs or refill of coffee pods and cream. We really don’t think we’re snobs about this stuff… but kind of would have expected a bit more attention to detail on this. Maybe this is common for big city destinations, but it just seemed weird. 

Overall a great experience.

title: Lovely stay
text:
My family of three stayed 5 nights at the Renaissance Midtown, in NYC for the usual touristy activities.

Great midtown location for transport links.  The area does have a few homeless, but we never had any issues or felt unsafe.  Security at the hotel is very good.

The rooms were modern, well equipped and a good size for New York.  Housekeeping are thorough and felt very well looked after,

 The staff are welcoming and so very helpful.  Would definitely recommend to fellow tourists.

title: Great hotel
text: Stayed here for a birthday weekend. Really nice hotel with very accommodating staff. Rooms were comfortable. Nice restaurant and bar on site. Newer amenities and really nice view. Andrew the night manager really went above and beyond. Would stay again

title: Excellent Service
text: Came in for my friend’s birthday. Stayed the night. Great hotel, excellent room and awesome service from Andrew the night manager! He was outstanding and my experience with him will be the reason why I stay here again.

title: Big rooms, clean, better than expected
text: Much better than expected.  I spent three nights here in March during business meetings that I had to attend at Hudson Yards.  I have stayed in a number of really bad chain hotels in New York.  Those near Times Square and/or Penn Station tend to be really poor, dirty, over used, etc.  On the other end, I have also experienced several nicer boutique hotels in the same area that whilst better offer room sizes akin to a coffin.  This Renaissance honestly got both of those right.  It’s in a good location tucked down 35th street between 7th and 8th avenue.  It has a really nice bar and restaurant.  The rooms are large with good / modern wall in showers.  It had a big bed, Tv and plenty of workspace.  It was very clean, and as a bonus offered great views of Manhattan.  I was pleasantly surprised and will definitely return.  Decent value for money as well - about $300 per night (you won’t find better at that price in New York). I also can feel the influence of Hudson Yards being quite positive on this side of midtown (which needs a clean up and needs to avoid the increasingly horrible Times Square influence)

title: good location especially for those who come for the first time
text:
good location especially for those who come for the first time

Good things

You can’t complain about the location of the hotel. it is excellent. It is right into the middle of penn station. The view is perfect and nice. 

Should improve

- Some staffs does not helpful. We ask for the early check inn, but they did not give us and never text us when the room is ready.
- Few amenities. I asked for toothbrush but they have never brought it up to the room.
- maid didnt clean the room properly.
- no water complimentary for this such hotel, they should have one.

title: Location, Location,Location
text:
This overlooks Penn station so very handy for transport connections. I had a train to catch and I was allowed to leave my bags till 5 pm when I had to leave. The hotel is modern and rooms very quiet. The view was fantastic and the room very comfortable with a great night’s sleep. The shower was very good once I got used to the controls.

I had booked a room with breakfast but disappointed I then had to pay extra for breakfast  at a restaurant that was independent from the hotel. Not sure if this was my travel agency at fault however.

The lifts are very quick and the bar area very relaxing. Very quick and efficient check in and check out

title: Incredible hotel and service
text: We had a wonderful stay at the Renaissance! Absolutely incredible service, Nelly at the front desk was exceptionally helpful and competent! The view was probably the best of any hotel we will stay at in NYC. Very happy and will be back!

title: Yet Another Great Stay at the Renaissance Midtown!
text: What can I say about this hotel that I haven't already said before? Yet another great stay at this amazing property that is steps from NY Penn Station and MSG and a quick cab ride away to the best NY has to offer. We love staying at this property.

title: COVID protocol not followed at check-in
text:
This is my 3rd stay at the Renaissance.  I stay here whenever I can because it is around the corner from my company’s office, so it’s very convenient.  The lobby was eerily quiet when I checked in because the bar was closed. I stayed at another hotel in NYC last month, so I knew to bring my vaccine card as required by city COVID protocol.  The person who checked me in did not ask for my proof of vaccine.  I was also a little disappointed that I wasn’t offered an upgrade at hotel that was basically empty.  I think I saw only two other guests the whole time I was there.

Otherwise, the hotel is fine.  Huge shower, decent size room, room service even during COVID.

Oh, and the towels were scratchy.

title: Wonderful stay.  Planet Fitness stinks
text: I have stayed several times and always loved this hotel.  The room and sleeping quality are great. The staff is nice.  The only reason I wouldn't probably stay again is that they offer an arrangement with Planet Fitness next door to serve as their fitness center but Planet Fitness is not up to par.  It's a gym for body-builders, The equipment is subpar and dated.  The treadmills are the worst of the worst. There weren't any props a modern gym would offer.  Renaissance, why not ditch Planet Fitness and go solo?

title: Solid home away from home in Midtown
text:
Did a three-night stay here to separate from Covid at home.  Had stayed here a few years ago, and found the same solid quality.  The hotel developer invested in high quality materials which contributes to a high quality experience.

Sure the block can be a bit seedy at times but hey, once you're in the hotel you are just fine.  

Matthew at the front desk provided friendly and helpful assistance throughout the stay.  Would definitely return.  It's sort of a Park Hyatt "lite" experience.

Service in Versa - the restaurant could have been more personable, and cold chicken on penne a la vodka was weird, but indoor dining in NYC options are limited currently.

All in all a solid option in Midtown.

title: Excellent hotel, but….
text:
We come to New York City at least 3-4 times a year for shopping, to see a Broadway show or just check out the sights and vibe of the city and have seldom stayed in the same hotel. But that could change after a stay here. We loved the proximity to everything, particularly NY Penn Station, just a couple blocks away, since we always come by train. Macy’s is literally around the corner and Times Square and the theatre district are an easy 15-20 minutes away. We’re walkers so this location is just perfect for everything we like to do. 

My only complaint and the reason I only gave 4 stars was that I used suite upgrades, which were confirmed, yet when we reached the hotel we were told that the suite wasn’t available and I needed to call Marriott to have them reinstate the awards to my Bonvoy account, which I did. As a result, we were given a standard room that didn’t have the great views others have raved about and we were celebrating our 40th wedding anniversary, which was noted on the reservation. Suffice it to say that as a Lifetime Titanium on the cusp of becoming an Ambassador by year’s end, I wasn’t happy. But, fortunately, my wife loved the location and the decor of the hotel so much that she didn’t make a big deal out of it, even though I thought it was for such a special occasion. Nevertheless, she wants to stay here again, so no doubt we will. But, hopefully, with better hospitality or it will definitely be our last.

title: PERFECT STAY
text: Beautiful city views.  Funky decor and comfortable bedding. Surprisingly quiet. Thomas W., Guest Services Manager, is AMAZING!  Grateful for his exceptional customer service and making our stay memorable.  Can't wait to come back soon!

title: Broken toilet and smoke alarm made for terrible night. Stay at another hotel.
text: Do not stay here! No microwave in the room and none available that work in hotel. Toilet didn’t flush. Plumber called and could not resolve issue. Smoke alarm went off for no reason in the morning. 20 plus minutes to resolve. Plumber is here again now. He can get it to flush but it is not fixed. Toilet is broken. Hotel will not comp. This a very expensive hotel to have no bathroom and smoke alarm issues. Stay at another hotel.

title: Nice hotel but don’t leave anything in room
text:
This hotel is really nice, the front desk staff was nice and accommodating and very friendly. The rooms were nice (typical new york size) and the beds were very comfortable but here is where the issues come in. 

DO NOT LEAVE ANYTHING IN THE ROOM!! I left for my flight earlier before my friend she texted me letting me know I left my makeup bag and she was leaving it on the bed and to call the hotel (we don’t live near each other). When I got home I called the hotel asking if they found my bag and they said no when I know for a fact that my bag was left there. They transferred me to the manager of house keeping and my call hasn’t been returned and it’s been 4 business days. 

So lock your valuables up in the safe and don’t leave anything you care about behind if you choose to stay here. Now I have to replace $100s of dollars worth of makeup.

title: Exceptional!
text: My friend and I had a major problem at another hotel and switched to this Renaissance a block away. We were upgraded to a skyline view room on the 35th floor, which was incredible. The view looking north simply took my breath away at night! The bed was extremely comfortable, and the room had all modern amenities. Loved the setup of the bathroom, and the bathroom's nightlight. The staff, from the front desk to the door team, were so welcoming. This is my new favorite hotel in New York City and it was clear to me why it's earned such excellent reviews. This hotel made an amazing trip to NYC even better.

title: Renaissance Midtown
text: I stayed here Friday night and loved it.  The hotel is in the perfect locations  It's only a few blocks away from Times Square so you're close to all of the action but not in the center of it.  The hotel itself if very nice!!!  I love the fact that it's close to the PATH train too.  It made traveling between the city and NJ very easy!!  The view from my room was top notch and the rooms were immaculately clean.

title: Overcharged on room rate!
text: Stayed here 3 night for the US Open. We are Ambassador level but only received a floor upgrade. Ironically hotel had plenty of rooms available 3 days before checkin but 24 hours before was fully booked. Perfect location to sightsee, shop and head to the tournament. Nice rooms. Review bill carefully at checkout. We were overcharged by $350 and charged incorrect rate for 2 of the 3 nights. Inexcusable. Luckily I asked for a printout of the bill and had a printout of my confirmation. They said they had no idea how this could have happened.

title: Great visit with wonderful, helpful employees
text:
We were in NY for medical reasons and had originally booked for 11 nights. After some complications, we had to unexpectedly extend our stay twice (for a total of 23 nights). Thomas, the front desk manager, was SO incredibly helpful, allowing us to keep our room at our original discounted rate (even though current rates for the added dates was triple our original rate). It made our stay so much easier and comfortable, so we didn’t have to move hotels midway through our stressful situation.

All of the employees at this location (front desk, maid service, bellmen, room service) were friendly and went out of their way to assist us (but particularly Thomas and Caleb).  Marriott is lucky to have such wonderful employees.

We will stay at this property any opportunity we have when we visit NY due to the great service and how centrally it’s located (walkable in 5-6 min to multiple subway stations and Penn Station).

Room service food was excellent, reasonably priced, and quickly delivered.

title: Great Location
text: I needed a hotel near Midtown for meetings in NYC. Everything needed was within walking distance of the hotel. Service was good and people were friendly. Little bit of a taxi issue with cyclist blowing by while you are trying to get out of the car at the entrance of the hotel. Again, this may be a NY thing. Almost took a guy out unintentionally.

title: Weekend getaway
text:
The hotel is beautiful, updated and well maintained. The rooms are modest sized, but the bathroom was 
 spacious. The midtown south area was not my favorite, but it was convenient to many restaurants and sites nearby. Unfortunately the hotel did not provide breakfast or housekeeping at this time, but they did offer complimentary bottled water, which was great. And Versa is a good spot for drinks. We didn’t have any issues with noise, as our room was very quiet. Staff were friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Loud nightclub on weekends
text:
I’m basing this 3 star review on an average of out 3 night stay. The first 2 nights were very good (4-5). The room was nice, exceptional view and the bellhops were always polite and welcoming. While the area did have some rough spots, overall the location is super convenient and there were several great takeout breakfast spots. 
My issue was our last night (Friday). I specifically looked for a hotel, based on other reviews, that did not have a nightclub on  the property. I searched the website and the only thing their website showed was a rooftop restaurant. Zero mention of a nightclub like their sister property in Chelsea. Well after a long day exploring the city and returning to our room around 9pm to finally sleep and get an early start, we realized that was not the case. There was loud thumping music and people screaming. This was not just a little background noise it was so loud that we had to have our TV on a level 30 to even hear it. There was zero chance of sleeping as people were cheering and screaming on top of the music. We requested earplugs and they were all out. After calling the front desk we were told it would continue until midnight and this is the case every Friday and Saturday night. Being that we were exhausted and wanting to get an early start in the morning, this was an awful night. 
Overall, nice hotel and location. Just beware if you want to get any rest before midnight on the weekends. Maybe you could request a lower floor and this would not be an issue.

title: Great hotel
text:
This hotel was near perfect, I really enjoyed it. I like to review with pros and cons. I hope this help.

Pros: 

Location: Just on downtown, near Penn station and more, so much to do near by

Room: Great design and quality

Gym: We can use planet fitness which is located in hotel. This gave full items to do work out.

Cons: 

Room: Many electric supplies had problems. The TV remote was slow, the charging port was damaged for multiple locations.

Final words: It was great hotel, I just give 5/5 to perfect hotel, and as this was not perfect so it ended with 4/5. But it was near perfect and I have thought to give 5/5 when the charging port was fine. If there were option for 4.5/5, I would definitely give that. I would recommend this hotel.

title: Poor service poor location
text: Was very disappointed with this hotel. The area is extremely bad and we felt very unsafe walking around the hotel area. Inside the hotel got worse. There is a two stage elevator that can take forever to come. When it does arrive a queue has formed and the elevator was jam packed with no restrictions. staff were rude and unhelpful and made no effort to help with anything we asked for. also rigid check in times and they will not allow you to check in anytime before 4pm. room was not cleaned either. avoid if possible.

title: Disastrous Housekeeping
text: We are currently staying at this hotel and are in day 2 of no service/housekeeping. Got a call from a supervisor who laughed that she had no staff. Nothing has been done to ameliorate this situation. Gives Marriott, Bonvoy and Renaissance a bad name.

title: Perfect so far
text: I haven’t even stayed at this property and I’m already impressed. I called today to confirm an upcoming stay & ask a few questions about the property. If I’m being honest, I was trying to decide if I should keep this reservation or go with another in the area. Imagine my surprise when an actual human answered on the second ring. Natasha answered all of my questions without hesitation & offered even more details and tips. Needless to say, we are canceling the other reservation & look forward to our stay. I’ll post more details & pics soon.  I’m impressed so far. Look forward to bringing our girls (12, 10) to NYC for the first time while my husband & I celebrate our anniversary.

title: An extended stay
text:
I recently got the chance to stay at the Renaissance Midtown hotel. I was there on a professional assignment for the National Guard. I am currently a sergeant and first responder. I stayed at this hotel a little over a year in a king size corner room with a downtown view. 
When I entered the room, the size was that of a typical city hotel but the bed was very comfortable and the basic room amenities were there. The bathroom was not spectacular but just right for a soldier after a long day. 
The lobby was spacious and brightly lit with four reception tests. Plexiglass, hand sanitizer, and social distancing stickers were also visible. The room and all the public areas of the hotel were very clean. 
Most of the staff was amazing, helpful, professional, especially Tinisha Marie, Caleb, Murat and Tima at the front desk – they made a major difference during my stay. The hotel restaurant and gym were not open due to COVID but the overall hotel experience was pleasant during a very difficult time.

Thank you for all your support.

title: Nice stay
text: The hotel itself is nice. Though the location is convenient to get to many things, we don't love that midtown area. Service was excellent. A few things to note: while the bathroom 'barn' style doors are nice and quiet, they make it difficult to use the bathroom with a light at night while others are sleeping. The shower has an overhead  showerhead and a wall/body showerhead, you cannot use both at the time time. If you have hair that you don't want to wash, you are forced to use the body head which is mounted quite low on the shower wall (and I am very short). The water pressue stunk. The window coverings are roller shades and are aesthetically superior to drapes but they don't go to the edges of the window which is problematic when the sun rises at 5am.  The elevator system and security are great. Beds were comfortable and we had a nice view. We did have an issue one night but that was resolved by the helpful hotel staff.

title: Midtown Manhattan Ease
text: Very good hotel with reasonable space in each guest room. Attached planet fitness for use. Midtown location with easy access to Times Square. Central Park, Bryant park, Madison square garden, and subway. A little on the touristy side, but not as bad as Times Square location. Although I prefer the more subdued areas of Manhattan, this is a very good choice

title: Great find in midtown
text: I have stayed in the city over a dozen times over the years - this was my first stay at this hotel.  What a find! Great location - near Macy’s, the Garden, Empire State Building  and Penn Station.  Lots of food around.  The price was right - got a beautiful view of the Statue of Liberty up on the 33rd floor!  Can’t say enough about the staff - very helpful and fun.  Felt very safe there as well - good security procedures in place.  And the last night there the rain was so bad we decided to eat at the restaurant.  Not something we would normally do but it worked out - the manager and staff made us feel right at home!  We recommend both bagel places near there and then bring the food back to the lobby to eat - plenty of space. Rooms themselves were small but that’s NYC- comfortable and quaint.  My only criticism was there is no privacy in the bathroom - all sounds can be heard by all.

title: Great girls weekend
text: We got there early and our room was not ready so they stored our luggage. The staff that greeted us was very accommodating and friendly. They walked to the street to give us directions and advised us of some places to go. Offered to help with anything we needed. They drew us a map and explained the best route to take. When we got back to the hotel after a full day out and dinner they were interested in how our day went. Unfortunately I had fallen and they were very concerned if I needed medical attention the next morning everyone asked how I was doing. They suggested we get bagels across the street and bring them to the hotel to eat since the bagel place had limited seating. The hotel is very clean and up to date with great staff. Highly recommend and would stay again. Great location walking distance from the train station.

title: Lovely boutique hotel
text: Only two nights, first time in NYC after pandemic so we were excited to come. The hotel room is beautiful and designed so uniquely, very cozy. Security of hotel is great since you can get into your floor with scanning your room key only. Saturday night we ate at Versa witch is a roof top part of the hotel,  the food, DJ, music and views were incredible. Location was perfect, literally next to Penn station, not to far from Time Square.

title: Great to be back
text:
I've stayed at this hotel many times since it opened.  I had not stayed in nearly two years, however, before this week.  It was great to be back.  Location can't be beat, rooms are just fine in size.  Great bed and shower.  HVAC can be left ON for white noise which is great for the city.

Only issue was a lack of water in the room but you could get it at the front desk.  And my carpet could have been cleaner.  I am sure these will be rectified by the time I stay again in a few weeks.

title: Lingering pandemic limitations
text:
First, what's great: the location. The hotel is a short walk to Penn Station and Macy's, and about 20 minutes to Grand Central. The building is modern and fairly new. Elevators take you straight to your floor. Our room was very small and the AC was very noisy, but the bed was comfortable, and the bath, with just a shower stall (no tub), was adequately equipped, although the bathroom could have been cleaner. It was not nice seeing hair on the toilet seat when we arrived. 
Getting the room serviced by housekeeping was by request only, which seems to be the norm during the pandemic. 
Now, a couple of oddities. The room lacked both bottled water and drinking glasses. Sure, NYC tap water is great and we would happily have drunk it, but with what? At the very least disposable cups should have been provided. I asked for water at the front desk, and we were given two bottles when we checked in, but the next day I was told they were out. This is an example of how small details can make a big impression. Also, although the restaurant opened that very day for lunch and dinner, there was no on-site option for breakfast, and the list of nearby restaurants didn't include restaurants serving breakfast. 
These are easy fixes, and perhaps as we ease out of the pandemic, things will improve.

title: Great location and great service
text: We spent one night at this hotel with our kids while visiting our nephew who's an NYU student. We loved the central location and proximity to the sites and areas that we wanted to explore. The employees were friendly and we had a large hotel room with great views of the city. So glad that we returned to the city with our family. Room was clean and hotel a great stay.

title: Night Out
text: I stayed here for one night on May 1st. The stay was wonderful the customer service was amazing. The location was great. The room was perfect it met all my expectations. I had a decent view of the city nothing to complain about. My only complaint would be that the toilet after my first use did not flush. The chain was broken so that was a lil bit of a problem. Since it was only a one night stay and by the time we noticed, it was after a long night and around 1am I didn’t call down to front desk. The room was nice bed was comfy. When I checked out I did inform them of the issue. I would have reviewed 5 stars if I didn’t have issue with toilet. Overall I will definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel.

title: Perfection of Guest Service Excellence!!
text:
In a nutshell, the title offers my sincere thankful impression of this wonderful hotel. I was made to feel welcome, and valued, from the moment I walked in on the ground level, and that was only with Security. Clear directions were provided for my check-in (located on Floor 6) and that's where I met even more excellence. Although I arrived earlier than requested via the app, they advised my room was already available, thanked me for being an Elite member, provided some food/beverage info, suggested I contact them with any questions, and then "let me walk you over to the elevator", all with a smile. It's these little things (that don't cost them a dime) making that first impression a VERY positive one.
   Everything in my assigned room (Floor 35) was in perfect working order. Another reviewer commented this property felt a bit boutique-like (due to minimal number of rooms on each floor) and I totally get that now. The hallways, like my room, was very clean.  I enjoyed the city skyline view from my room, and will admit that even on the high floors it is possible to hear some activity of sirens during the day/night, but I totally expected that considered where I was staying within the city. It was not extremely loud at all and caused zero problems during my short stay. The Aveda toiletries they provide are some of the best at any Marriott property.  The shower is designed without a 'lip' which avoids any trip hazard, and it totally works.  I figured the chaise lounge would go unused, but I was wrong.  A great addition right there at the window for relaxed viewing.  
   The elevators, like many things in this hotel, use a digital smart technology to access your room. Enter desired floor info, tap your key/device, and voila you're on your way . . . and rather quickly I might add.  Like so many hotels, in-house food service is currently shuttered with the ongoing travel challenges, but they offer numerous alternatives, and, hey, you're in NYC where there are many options within a short walk.  I was advised of this pre-arrival, so not surprise or disappointment there. 
   You are very close to the main NY Penn Station hub (as well as several street access points) and also the new Moynihan Train Hall.  Even if you don't need it, go visit the hall, which is superb. You are also so very close to the huge Macy's Herald Square and also the Empire State Building.  With any vacation location, you absolutely must use common sense when out and about. and I can say that I did feel quite safe in most of this area.  The positioning of security on that lower level also seems to assure great safety while in the hotel too.  
   I didn't need to visit the front desk during my brief stay, but in addition to doing mobile check-out I went by to turn in my card and offer a Thank You before departing.  Before I could say much I was referred to by name, and making sure I'd enjoyed my experience.  Again, those little things making a now perfect final impression.  I hope to make this my Go-To hotel in NYC for any future travel.  I normally prefer to try a different location on each arrival, but they truly were that impressive.  "If it ain't broke, don't fix it" right??  VERY easy to recommend Renaissance Midtown to others.  I hope your experience will be as wonderful as mine.  Another big THANK YOU to the entire team. 
[caveat: I work for a huge hospitality company that provides some of the best guest service training in the industry, and can be quite picky.]

title: Amazing experience and customer service!
text: We visited this property over MA spring break for a few nights. I came with my teenage son. My best friend joined us with her son and stayed in another room.  I'm a platinum elite member and was appropriately upgraded upon arrival. Room was lovely and modern with a view of the skyline. Decent size for NY. The staff went out of their way to get us the proximity to my friend's room we requested. Staff remembered us each time we came to the desk - often asking about excursions they knew we had taken. They were always helpful and made us feel welcome. After over a year of relative isolation, these gestures really made our trip. This property is more like a boutique property in that there aren't many rooms per floor. Decor is sleek. We spent many evenings relaxing in the lobby before bed. The restaurants, bar and elite lounge are closed because of covid, but we made due. Liberty bagels is on the same block as the hotel and is amazing!! We went there EVERY day for breakfast and one day for lunch. I dont normally do that because I like to try different places but it was just that good! Location is wonderful. You can walk a few blocks down adjacent 7th Ave to times Square. It's only 2 blocks from empire state building. Of course, it is also close proximity to Penn Station and subways to everywhere. Thank you for the wonderful stay!!

title: Best friend's birthday
text: We absolutely love this hotel!  Caleb and his team took amazing care of us, and helped me surprise my best friend with balloons in our room. Our view was epic, and the room was  extremely clean! Obviously we couldn't take full advantage of the hotel's amenities due to covid-19 but we truly enjoyed our stay! We'll be back soon for sure!

title: Exceptional Customer Service and Beautiful Views
text:
I just want to Thank Thomas, who was so pleasant and friendly upon arrival. Thomas clam demeanor and exceptional customer service was greatly appreciated. I’ve stayed at many Marriott's and this one by far exceeds the customer service standards. I will definitely recommend this establishment and continue to book stays here as long as the customer service is as consistent as Thomas was. Thank you so much for making my weekend stay in NYC such a pleasant and wonderful one. Also the room and view was great 😊
-Marilyn C.
Confirmation # 99611601

title: Ceo
text: Thomas at the front desk was marvelous. Made me feel comfortable and ensured me that my stay would be great. I would most definitely come back and stay again in the newer future and you should also !!!

title: Good hotel, good location
text:
The hotel is suffering from the same restrictions as the rest of the city so no restaurant, no bar, no gym, et. But it is still a kind of trendy, nice hotel. The front desk staff is not particularly friendly but they do their job. The rooms are pretty big for the city. Floor to ceiling window in the room and...the bathroom. Yes, the shower is exposed to the room (there is a shade you can pull down for privacy. There is a comfy chaise in front of the window so you can daydream or read. The desk is long if you need to work. The room has a mini-fridge and coffee maker. My only complaint with the room is the really dim lighting. 

The hotel is a 5 minute walk to Madison Square and Penn Station. Depending on the time of day, there are many eating options within a short walk. Macys is a 2 minute walk. 

I would recommend for anyone who needs to be in a comfy room for a night or two. I hope to stay again when their restaurant is open again because it looks really quite nice!

title: RENAISSANCE MIDTOWN 10/10
text: Tima, James, & Tinisha were all a huge help during my groups stay. Everything was made simple for myself & peers & our next time in NYC we will definitely be staying at the Renaissance in Midtown. Thank you again, Tima. 2106127656.

title: My second home...
text:
Unforeseen delays and the COVID epidemic much delayed the renovation of my NYC apartment, causing me to stay in hotels for several months. I stayed in a few different places, but it wasn't until I checked in to the Renaissance Midtown that i was able to take a deep breath as I felt that I was finally in a place where i felt "at home". From the very first greeting, Tima and team made me feel genuinely welcome and the feeling only grew during my stay. 
As a New Yorker who has experienced many different hotels, i can say with some authority that this has one of the best services available.

title: Best Hotel Experience in New York
text:
One of the most incredible experiences I’ve had in New York, was staying at the Renaissance Hotel. The staff was incredibly kind throughout the entire trip.

Murat & Tima were so helpful with my check in and gave me great advice of things to do through out my stay.

This place is truly vibes!

The bathrooms were pristine, the beds were so comfy, and view was breath taking. 

If you want to have a magical moment in New York, this is where you stay. 

:)

title: Great stay!
text: Had a great time at the Renaissance! Tima, Tinesha, Thomas, Murat, Daniel, Carlos, and Elex were all very great with assisting me with all my needs during my stay here. My room had great views and everyone was accomodating.

title: Wonderful experience
text: Stayed at the Renaissance hotel as a weekend staycation. The design of the hotel is very beautiful and easy to get to from Penn Station. Tima was very friendly and welcoming. The check in process was easy and quick. She provided us with a list of restaurants in the area. The room was clean, very clean! The cable was out during our stay but HBO still worked, which sufficed. Got a chance to talk to Murat when we needed a bottle opener, he was very friendly too. The hospitality of the staff really stood out and was appreciated. Would definitely be back. The view was amazing, especially as the snow storm started!

title: Quaadir Davis
text: I really enjoyed my stay at the Renaissance hotel. All of the staff were very nice and helpful. They were able to set up our room with rose petals balloons for our anniversary, which was amazing. The manager Caleb was very helpful in making this a good experience as well as the Daniel for setting the room up. I could definitely see myself staying here again.

title: It was the best weekend!
text: For my wife's birthday we decided to visit New-York  and chose to stay at this hotel.  I have contacted the hotel in advance with a request to provide a room with the best sky view for a surprise to my wife. Very polite Guest services manager Caleb Gaillard communicated with me via email.  I also requested an earlier check-in (1pm) since I arrived in New York earlier than the usual 4pm.  Caleb did everything in the best possible way.  Arriving at the hotel at 1pm we were greeted by very polite staff and our room was ready.  When we came into the room we saw a gorgeous view from the window, you can look through it all day and night.  The room was stylish, modern and very clean.  For our one-year-old child was immediately brought a crib.  The room had everything you need (iron, hairdryer, internet and much more).  We really loved this hotel and will definitely come back again.

title: Great getaway!
text: Our family spent five nights at this hotel to explore NYC and had a fantastic experience. We were traveling with our two teenagers and booked two rooms -- within minutes of booking, I received an email from the hotel: we've booked you into adjoining rooms! There was also a kind, handwritten note waiting for me when I checked in congratulating me on my birthday. Our rooms were clean, well-sized (especially for NYC); the bathrooms were well laid out (great shower) and the beds were very comfortable. The chaise lounge in the king room was an especially nice touch. Due to covid, we had limited contact with hotel staff -- but any requests we had (ie., replacing a room key, extra toiletries, a room refresh) were handled in a welcoming and prompt manner. The location of this hotel was excellent -- with easy access to multiple subway lines. I would definitely stay here again!

title: Hip Midtown Hotel
text: I love this hotel.  I live just outside NYC and I always stay here after a fun night on the town.  I've had my friends stay here too. Chic updated contemporary feel, the rooms are great and the staff is super nice. Perfect location.  Even with Covid and demonstrations in Times Square during this visit, it was safe and sound. The ultimate pied-a-tere experience.

title: Wonderful staff and excellent service
text: The staff was very professional & friendly. Caleb-Manager Tinisha from front desk, are impressively splendid. The superb service of the bell-mans- Adrian, Daniel and Elex. Spacious room and clean. I would definitely recommend this Hotel.

title: 25th Wedding Anniversary
text: This is Daphne Lane from Huntsville, Al. My husband and I celebrated our 25th Wedding Anniversary at this hotel. We want to send a big Thank you to the staff and Caleb for your great hospitality. The hotel is in a great location within walking distance to Time Square and Broadway for shopping and restaurants. Our experience was great and we will definitely be back this Summer.

title: Clean, modern, centrally located hotel
text: This is a great hotel. Next to Penn station, subways, MACYS, The Empire State building, and good restaurants. Staff is friendly and it is really cheap right now. There is a rooftop bar with a retractable roof on the 6th floor which is perfect in the rain. There is a gym but that is closed due to COVID. Walking distance to Times Square and the Theatre District. Close to Korea town for some ethnic food and a couple of high end steak choices. Temperature checks before you get past the door and probably the safest spot in town (National Guard Unit is also staying there but you never see them)

title: Great hotel, horrible service.
text: I'm not one to write bad reviews but I was pretty shocked by how events transpired during my stay in Feb 2020. I was injured during my stay by a faulty piece in my room's bathroom. It was a substantial injury that required me to go to City MD. The hotel did not know how to handle it - to the point in which I had to just call an Uber to take myself to the ER while they were still figuring it out. I'm not even upset about their inability to handle the situation. i'm more upset that to this day, I still have not received resolution. I gave some leeway because 2020 has been a crazy year, but this is quite some time to take in not resolving it. I made several calls and exchanged many emails with their insurance company only to find out that my contact left the firm, and months later I finally got a new contact. I was a super loyal Marriott person until this incident.  Marriott has truly shown that they did not care about me.

title: Highly recommend for price quality service
text: Highly recommend it, I really enjoyed my stay the staff were very welcoming and accommodating, the room was clean and beautiful. Definitely a 5/5. I had tried other hotels in the same area and this one was for sure the best in terms of cleanliness and room aesthetic.

title: Great stay
text:
I really enjoyed my stay at the hotel there. From the first moment, I felt welcomed. Tima was amazingly hospitable!!
The staff was great, room gorgeous, and very Covid attentive always.
Location was terrific.
I would stay there again in a New York Minute.

title: Excellent stay
text: first i would like to thank the renaissance team  starting from first floor to front desk Tima Tenisha and  this  stay was so special to me it was moms 59th birthday coming from totally different city was a surprise for mom to celebrate her birtday in new york, i highly recommend this hotel near everything shopping area and shelsey area was my favorite for the best restaurants  option.

title: Quick trip
text: My boyfriend and me came here for a weekend from P.R. The two girls Tanisha and Tima were very nice at check in. Marut at night was cool and helpful. I will stay here again. This location is very convenient he gave directions to local CVS. The room was clean.  Gracias!

title: Absolutely Amazing
text:
We Very Much enjoyed our stay at Renaissance MIdtown! The staff was so friendly and helpful, particularly Tinisha, Thomas, and Adrian. The rooms are cozy and clean, and the rooftop bar Versa was fantastic! Great Location too. Wifi is free, and Parking is close by. With these difficult times it was nice to see the staff upbeat and housekeeping is very thorough and sensitive during covid.
Will Recommend.

title: October Wedding Stay
text:
After postponing our destination wedding plans, my fiancé and I decided to host a small micro wedding in NYC, where we live. With several of my family members having to travel in town to attend, we wanted to find a hotel for our guests that was conveniently located in Manhattan and very clean, so our guests felt safe. We’d reached out to a few different hotels to get availability and pricing information, their safety protocols and current practices due to COVID. 

From the moment I reached out to Renaissance NY Midtown hotel, my experience was amazing, nothing like my interaction with other hotels. The front desk reservations manager, immediately connected me to the Group Sales Director, Esther. It was so great to actually speak with someone, instead of receiving info all via email. Esther answered all of my questions and was so helpful in helping us determine the best way for our guests to book rooms. She even connected me with the restaurant in the hotel, Versa, for hosting a pre-wedding dinner. And weeks later, when our honeymoon plans elsewhere were cancelled unexpectedly due to hurricane Delta, once again Esther was more than helpful in quickly helping me to extend my reservation. 

From the moment my family checked in the staff was so helpful and kind, especially Tima and Tinisha. And even upgraded my room so I could have the most perfect bridal suite to get ready in the day of my wedding.

My family and I are so appreciative. It's the little things that are even more special, especially during these unprecedented times. 

Thank you to the entire Renaissance NY Midtown team!

title: Work
text:
Beautiful view & great customer service.
The Rooftop was perfect and the food was amazing.
Thank you for the great hospitality, I’ll definitely come back again. I’ll stay longer next time.
Again thank you so much.

title: Work
text: Excellent service, professional staff, beautiful room with an excellent view. The restaurant has great service and delicious food. The roof top view is amazing as well and allows for plenty of social distancing.

title: Red carpet service with Tima
text: In this hotel I got the best experience. Clean room, nice view and excellent customer service. And also when I got greeted by Tima in the Check-in  she got me the best service. Tima was excellent and made me and my husband want to extended our stay, as we did. We will for sure stay at this hotel again!and again

title: Great service and ambiance.
text: Good day.  My girlfriend and I stayed at the Renaissance Hotel.  Service was good.  Specifically, James gave very good service.  The hotel room and ambiance was very modern and romantic.   I will definitely be staying here again.  Thank you to all the staff.

title: Best hotel to stay in NYC
text: My room is lovely the internet is high speed you can even stream gaming on the internet without even paying planet fitness is  downstairs the location in NYC is not crowed the staff treats you nice they have a lovely smile while greeting you

title: Outstanding!
text: I stayed here for a night at the end of August. The room was very, very nice and immaculately clean, but my favorite part about this place is the people that work here. Tima at the front desk, in particular, was awesome, but everybody I came across here was extremely nice and helpful. I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Stylish, hip, and safe midtown NYC oasis
text:
Although a frequent previous  guest this was my first visit to NYC since the pandemic. This was a combination leisure and business visit. I am pleased to report that all the things I love about this,property are still present in these difficult times. The hotel has a superb location just steps from Penn Station. It is convenient to Times Square, Chelsea, 34th Street shopping and Hudson Yards. Connections to mass transit are outstanding.  The hotel has a stylish , hip decor that pays homage to the Garment District. It has many high tech features. Above all it is well designed and comfortable . The rooms have great soundproofing, super comfortable beds with luxurious linens, and fun glass showers. The ceiling to floor wall to wall windows provide spectacular views. What makes the Renaissance NYC midtown unique is its commitment to professional personalized hospitality. Every staff member goes out of his/her way to make you feel welcomed and appreciated. Tinisha answered many questions I had regarding visiting during the pandemic the day before I arrived. It was a pleasure to meet her in person as I checked in. The hotel has instituted a temperature check for each person entering the building. Elex, the doorman performed this procedure quickly and cheerfully as I walked into the lower lobby. My room was as beautiful, comfortable, and clean as I have a experienced during past stays with some pandemic accommodations. It is now possible to control the large screen tv from your smart phone rather than using remote control. Versa,the property restaurant, is open for lunch and dinner.
