Although the menu has been shortened, Dave my waitperson was excellent. The food was delicious and the service was prompt. Renaissance gives its concierges the title of “Navigator” and I had the pleasure of getting expert advice from Daniel Garcia. Daniel may be the best concierge in NYC.  He is a real treasure and great resource. When I checked out I enjoyed the personalized service provided by Caleb.  Unfortunately the Elite Member Concierge Lounge is temporarily closed because of the pandemic so the hotel is providing double points to elite status guests as compensation until this wonderful lounge can be reopened.
As always I felt welcomed but I also came away with the strong feeling that the RenaIssance NY Midtown has take every step and precaution to keep me safe and comfortable during these difficult times. I look forward to my next return stay.

title: Wedding Weekend
text: We celebrated our son and new daughter-in-law’s wedding. From the moment we arrived until we checked out the entire staff at the Marriott and Versa restaurant went above and beyond to make this day extraordinarily seamless.  The Front Desk Staff, Bell Hop, Housekeeping and everyone behind the scenes were professional and had our utmost trust in dealing with the Covid protocol. Special thanks to the Versa crew whose attention to detail made Bret and Laura’s day one we won’t forget. Especially Esther Wells, Nick Bathurst, Tony, Eric, Camilla and Joseph. The highlight was the talented bartender Shuba Fikru who kept us all well hydrated even while have to prepare the specialty crafted cocktail all evening!  Our sincerest gratitude to the entire staff of both venues for their hospitality during a most difficult time for hotels and restaurants.  We will be back!

title: excellent
text:
Wonderful experience from beginning to end! Beautiful room, great views, good food,  
and Tima Sadfi was a breath of fresh air, after a bad experience at another hotel. The  customer service was superlative so glad I came. Will be frequenting this hotel

title: Best service I've received at ANY Marriott - ever
text: My family and I had an unexpected need to travel to NYC for the first of about 5-6 total trips in the next month.  I did a TON of research to find a hotel we'd be comfortable putting all of our care and trust in.  I picked the right one.  The staff at the Renaissance was the most accommodating, thoughtful, and friendly team I've experienced anywhere - and I travel frequently on business across the US (or at least used to, pre-COVID).  Specifically, Ralphy and Elex are gems and I couldn't recommend this hotel enough to anyone looking for a clean, convenient, and friendly experience.

title: Wonderful stay
text: Showing some love for hotels i've stayed at in the past since its a difficult time for hotels right now. :) This stay was the perfect example of how a wonderful front desk agent can make a trip with a small kind gesture like an upgrade. I had come from another property where i had a view of a wall and when he found that out he upgraded me to a room on the 35th floor. I wish i could remember his name but he was super friendly and that gesture made my stay! The hotel has a great location, is super clean and modern, with great views!

title: Very Helpful During Unavoidable COVID Stay
text: My wife and I stayed at this property March 2020, as the city was shutting down. Staff were super helpful and considerate, checking in every day on our plans.  Housekeeping was great. It's a great looking hotel, sad of course that the bar/restaurant was closed, but they still made coffee/ quick breakfast for the very few guests there. Bathroom very well designed and shower among the best I've seen in an NYC hotel. Many thanks to staff who hung in there for us.

title: アートなホテル
text:
ペンステーションが目の前という便利なホテルでした。
ホテル内色々とアートが飾ってあり多少落ち着きませんでしたが快適でした。

title: 立地がよくコスパも良いおしゃれホテル
text: お部屋が大きいわけではないですが、適度な広さで内装がモダンでとてもおしゃれでした。部屋からの眺めも良かったです。クラブラウンジが利用できましたが、いつでもソフトドリンクが飲め重宝していました。

title: Amazing!!!!
text: Such a beautiful location with great service.  Noor was so welcoming and gave us some delicious recommendations for food!  With such a beautiful view, really appreciate this hotels service and will definitely be back! 😁🥳

title: Quick Trip to NYC
text: Short trip to the city. Easy Uber ride from LGA. Great location, in the center of everything. Great hotel.  The room was was nicely appointed, not big, but just enough space. Modern decor, our room had a great view.

title: Disappointed with front desk staff
text:
As an Ambassador Elite member, I'm typically on the road 150-200 nights per year. I'm often upgraded to suites on business trips without even asking, however, this was actually a leisure stay and was excited to see there was a Skyline King Suite available for the duration of my stay.

Upon check in, the front desk staff helping my girlfriend and I check in told my guest and I that the suite was available but we would not be upgraded to it and instead, the hotel would charge us $500 if we wanted the room upgrade and stated this is how it is laid out in the hotel's terms and conditions. That is completely incorrect as per the terms and conditions on Marriott for platinums and above, "Platinum Elite Members and above receive a complimentary upgrade to the best available room subject to availability for the entire length of stay at the time of check-in.   Complimentary upgrade includes suites, rooms with desirable views, rooms on high floors, corner rooms, rooms with special amenities or rooms on Executive Floors"

In the grand scheme, it's only 1 night, but the customer service provided was poor and this property should retrain its staff to understand what it's company's actual T&Cs state. There are a lot of hotels in NYC I could have chosen from for a night and I'm leaving disappointed this is the one I chose.

The terms and conditions on the Marriott site clearly states that

title: The Wynner
text: The Versa restaurant in the renaissance hotel was very good. Food was good service was good. Very warm ambiance. Very good casual restaurant. Great for after the Knick game. Very close to Penn station.

title: Superb hotel
text: Modern hotel with immaculate spacious room. We were greeted warmly and escorted to our lively king bed room that had a chaise lounge and lots of desk space. Bathroom had lovely walk in shower. Had dinner at versa. Delicious.

title: Disappointed
text:
Stayed here while attending the Eagles concert at MSG. Great location!
Room was satisfactory and clean but had a few issues. The shower sounded like a jack hammer when the water was turned on. At first I didn’t realize what was going on but wow. Crazy. The security block on the door stuck out and nearly decapitated my wife. Maybe something that sits flush on wall and slides would have been a better solution 
Maid service knocks on door at 8:00am on Saturday?  Really?
Saturday night after concert many folks headed to hotel bar only to be told they were closed?  2 bars both close at 11:40?  Looked open but told they couldn’t serve us. 
So it was good and bad, mostly good!

title: Visited During Summer Blackout, Otherwise Decent Property
text: Chose this hotel for its proximity to Grand Central for a weekend stay in NYC this summer. I had the unfortunate luck of staying during the black out - which is of no fault to Renaissance. I stored my bags because I arrived early and got back close to midnight. The check in was welcoming and apologetic for the computer issues stemming from the blackout. The problem was that after the card key was issued, I could not get into my room for another 20+ minutes because the card was defective somehow. Elite status was not recognized either. This is a perfectly fine hotel, above average, but the blackout could have been handled a little better. If I could give 3.5/5 I would have.

title: Luv the decor , sooo pretty and comfortable !!!
text: I either want to move in here forever or redecorate my home!!  So fancy, love it, especially the bathroom - soo cool !!  The lighting throughout is amazing, and the concrete post modern design is fantastic !!

title: Slipping a bit
text: Have visited this Renaissance for several years.  Be advised that this year, they withdrew weekend breakfast benefits for elite members.  This was a terrific benefit - and one wouldn’t know it was gone unless you combed the terms and conditions of the Bonvoy program.  In addition, the hotel is showing some wear and tear - carpets, furnishings, etc.  Still had a lot to offer but manage your expectations.

title: Our anniversary trip experience
text:
Overall hotel ok.  The food at restuant is average.  When you are staying at one that is right in the middle of the tourist attraction one has to take the good with the bad. 

We got the email that they send out to members who have status asking what they could do.  Asked to have quiet room. 

When we checked in they told us that they gave us this specific room b/c they have a note that I am a light sleeper. We get to our room, we hear drilling above us. We go down again. They explain they are doing construction above us until 4.

Granted we were on a high floor the rest of our stay we didn't have any noise. They have wonderful black out curtains, so the next morning we were able to sleep in

title: Terrific Service and Ecletic Designed Property
text:
I stayed at this location for two days this past weekend and had a wonderful time.   It is in a great location, close to everything by Madison Square Garden.

The Concierge, Mr. Garcia, was perfect as I called the night before checking in and he gave me some great tips.   He was able to Answer all my touristy questions with great ease!!

The hotels design is very eclectic with the room designs pretty funky.    The service from the time I arrived and to the point of leaving was outstanding with all team members was aggressively friendly.

We will be back in March!!

Bob Greene
General Manager 
Courtyard by Marriott
Clifton Park, NY

title: Fantastic stay
text:
I stayed at the Renaissance New York Midtown on Saturday night, I had a wonderful stay, the front desk staff was very welcoming and the concierge was helpful by sharing some restaurants recommendations. We decided to book a higher floor room on the 30th floor, the view was stunning and the bathroom was very sleek. 
We book on directly on marriott.com where we had the lowest price.

title: A few days in the city
text:
Amazing time with family. We shopped and explored different places. Our Hotel was amazing great service and hotel was superb. The rooms were very clean and modern.
Everyone was very pleasant. From the front desk to valet.

title: Excellent hotel ! Five stars
text: Excellent hotel. Clean, great staff, lovely breakfast in the restaurant, and so close to the Penn station. Would definitely visit again. The view from our room was the best thing. Free lounge access for Marriott elites.

title: Extremely helpful staff for birthday surprise!
text: Our stay at the Renaissance Midtown was fantastic! I had arranged a trip to New York to celebrate my girlfriend's 30th birthday. Prior to booking the hotel I had enquired to see whether the staff could help me with a birthday surprise. They were incredibly helpful. Not only did they make special arrangements with room service, where we ordered from a separate menu, but they also offered to arrange to deliver flowers and balloons. I obliged. When the day came, they delivered the breakfast and balloons with great enthusiasm, wishing my girlfriend a very happy birthday, much to her surprise. The best bit, they filmed the whole thing and sent it to me afterwards. It was a fantastic surprise and a great example of how their staff went the extra mile for the me. Of course, the facilities, location and view were all absolutely fantastic too. But the staff made the difference. Thank you, we will definitely be booking again the next time we're in the city.

title: Excellent Service
text: I've been staying at the Renaissance since early last summer and I have had nothing but incredible experiences. Ranie the Lead Navigator has been wonderful since my first reservation. I got an email from her confirming my reservation and suggesting places to see and eat around the hotel. She is the perfect combination of classy, sweet, professional and badass! Ranie will always take care of any need you have, she even gave me club lounge access on my last stay due to a longer wait than usual for my room, incredible guest service. Thomas was a pleasure from the second I saw him. HUGE smile and so kind and charming, he always made me feel welcome in the lobby (and I was down there quite a few times). Even when I needed my keys redone, asked for a drink, was running late for breakfast, Thomas made me feel like nothing was my fault and he was happy to see me again! He even called me "family". Besides the rooms being stunning and comfortable and every request I have being fulfilled with no questions asked, I truly keep coming back because of Ranie, Thomas, and the rest of the incredible staff at the Renaissance. They are the pinnacle of perfect service and make every stay worthwhile!

title: Excellent hotel out of the beaten path
text: This hotel very close to Penn Station is on the iuppwr floors of a fairly new building with the lobby on the A6th floor.  The rooms are fairly large and modern.  They have an executive lounge. For New York the elevators are fast and efficient.  Excellent staff.

title: Road trip
text: Wat een fantastisch hotel. Mooie centrale locatie. Kamers keurig verzorgd met alles erop en eraan. Een view van de 34ste verdieping doet je slapen met de gordijnen open. Personeel vriendelijk en behulpzaam.

title: Xmas and NYE in NYC
text: Amazing hotel, pricey but worth every penny compared to other hotels in NY. Friendly staff. Noor was absolutely amazing. Both my wife and I were always helped by her. She also introduced us to the best veg burger ever, at the Versa restuarant. Enjoyable stay, great place, amazing views from our room.... And thank you to an amazing reception staff, Noor.

title: Best hotel I stayed in New York!!
text:
So during my recent trip to New York, I stayed at 4 different hotels (so I could experience different parts of NY). I booked this hotel last minute since the previous hotel I stayed at was SO BAD I had to check out earlier and found another hotel to save myself. 

Long story short, after doing a lot of research in such a short time, I decided to book this hotel, and I did not regret it at all. My biggest regret is not staying at this hotel from the beginning to the end of my trip!!!

I arrived early in the morning and was greeted by Joshua, a super friendly guy at the reception. Not only he was super accommodating, but he also allowed me to checked in early because I was an elite member. To be very honest, I was surprised since I stayed at different marriott-bonvoy hotels and I didn't always get "special" treatment.

The other thing that I LOVE from the hotel is the view!!! I specifically booked for a room with a skyscraper view and I was blown away. It was raining most of the time when I was there, but when it clears up, you can see the city, the lights, everything!! It was MAGICAL! Love it!!!

The bed was super comfortable, the room is a bit tiny, but also this is New York so I didn't expect too much. I love that they have bluetooth speaker in the room. And the service is outstanding! Everyone was super friendly!! 

The location is perfect if you wanna go shopping, the Metro station is just a few steps away, there's a lot of stores and restaurants right around the corner. It's just PERFECT.

I would definitely be back to this hotel when I'm back to New York. Special thanks to Joshua!!!

title: BEST of NYC
text: What a pleasant experience! First off, we got an early check-in provided by the professional, hospitable and friendly reception staff. Secondly, the room was nice, clean, of a decent size, with the beautiful midtown view. The elite member’s lounge was a good option for a snack or a cup of coffee to go. But what’s really worth  praising is the stunning breakfast offered on weekends in the restaurant. (For Marriott Elite Members). During the weekdays, breakfast is being held in the lounge. It was a bit different, but good as well. The hotel location is perfect!!! It is a stone’s throw away from the subway station, 2 blocks away from Times Square, and 1 min away from the biggest Macy’s. Also, I would love to say that the hotel interior is interesting and stylish. Definitely we will choose this hotel again.

title: Family trip to New York
text: Excellent hotel.  Staff was excellent and very courteous.  The rooms were good size, especially for New York, and very clean.  The hotel is stylish and well put together.  Would recommend this hotel as a good place to explore Manhattan from.

title: Comfortable, great views, cleanliness so-so
text:
We stayed on the 30th floor in December 2019, overseeing Madison Square Garden.

Pros:
There are two entrances - one on 34th and one on 35th Street, really convenient.
The location is fantastic - anything I could think of was within walking distance: cafes, bagel shops, restaurants, nail bars, shopping malls, Times Square, Bryant Park, Grand Central, the Flatiron Building, Empire State building, and of course Penn Station and Madison Square Garden. 
I liked the style of the room - especially the smaller bathroom mirror (it read "I like your style" which I thought was super cute), the big semi-transparent light-bulb, the sewing machine. Also, FINALLY, a hotel where the windows actually open, albeit only an inch. 
The view was breathtaking. We could see all the way to the Statue of Liberty. Absolutely stunning, I could sit by the window for hours. 
I appreciated the separator that was available for privacy on the outside of the  bathroom shower glass panel. 
Despite being in the middle of it all, once you close the window, you can barely hear the outside world. 
The bed was big and comfortable.  
All staff we interacted with was lovely. Staff who look after the baggage storage area in particular are wonderful. 

Areas for improvement:
The aircon is really loud. I can't imagine someone being able to sleep with it on without earplugs. Even if you turn it off - which we did - there's still some sort of fan/ventilation system always on. It doesn't make as much noise thankfully, but it's still audible.
There was only one dressing gown (albeit I did like it very much).
I'm fairly sure the dressing gown and towels were not as clean as they should be. There were faint stains on the towels (kinda like makeup ones). That I did not expect, it was a bit disappointing. 
There was carpet on the floor, which I dislike as it's quite unhygienic, especially in a hotel where so many people come and go.

title: Good comfortable and located hotel.
text: 위치가 타임스퀘어에서 가까워서 좋다. 뭐 쓰기에도 깨끗하고 좋지만 방이 작고, 리운지에 음식이 디양하지가 않다. 기번적으로 일반회원에게는 조식이 제공이 되지 않는다. 가격에 비해 뉴욕의 호텔들은 좋지가 않은 것 같다.

title: My thanks to Ms. Zaina and Ms. Noor
text: Beyond my expectation but not complete surprise, the guest managers in the lobby greeted me with two pairs of welcoming smiles. Ms. Zaina and Ms. Noor, two lovely ladies, made me feel appreciated for being a Marriot member. I just want to say thanks, and I hope you go far with Renaissance and Marriott!

title: Elite Bonvoy Members Skip This Place
text:
On several occasions I’ve had the same thing happen in this hotel. Regardless of the fact that I’m a titanium elite lifetime member I basically got pushed to the back of the line as far as having my room ready when it supposed to be. Wanted to check in one hour early that was a no go, unless of course I wanted to pay for an extra night the night previous to my arrival (see below message I received).  Do you want elite level service try a different Marriott hotel in Manhattan.  Today was the third strike for me at this one.  
 
If you anticipate an early arrival before our 4:00pm registration and would like to have access to your room right away, we highly recommend booking for the prior night to guarantee immediate access. If this is a non-issue, we are happy to store your luggage on the ground level with our bell team until your room does become available.

PS- Front desk needs a little bit of training as well. Learn how to assure people that you’re working on the problem versus quoting your rulebook.  

Not to be completely negative I do think it is a clean property, housekeeping does an excellent job. Also, it’s got a very good location.

title: Great Hotel
text: At checkin Tima made us few extremely welcome.  She explained everything about the property and treated us as family.  The hotel is very trendy and the exposed concrete is really well done!  The Aveda products in the bathroom are wonderful.  I highly recommend this property.

title: Staff was great
text: The location of the hotel is very central but overall not my preferred one as it´s crowded everywhere close to times square. However the hotels lobby is on a higher floor and we´ve been greeted very nicely by ths front desk staff. He gave us a nice room on a high floor with view to madison square garden. The room itself seems to be a little dated already. However for one night it was a great stay.

title: Something good about it
text:
Like pop culture many times it looks good but hides some faults and irregularities. I like this hotel and would come to it many times again.  But, though they are minor, there are some flaws.  Little things do not work sometimes can be irritating because when you are at this hotel you think you are in a 5 star hotel. It has the look, the style, the ambience and cleanliness of a 5 star. But the room service takes forever and the restaurant food in the hotel is very mediocre though it is dressed up to be first class,  Breakfast took me an hour and half to get a 15 dollar oatmeal and coffee.  I went next door and got a great New York breakfast for 5 dollars. On the weekends there is a nightclub that roars with loud music until 12P. So if you have to sleep before then your out of luck.  Ask them to put you on the other side of the hotel. The front desk people were extremely nice and welcoming and the lobby is bustling with the trendy New York and out of town set.  Thats always fun.  
The location is great if you want be in the middle of it all in New York City. Everything is convenient.  The views in the tiny rooms are tremendous which makes the size of the room not matter. I thought they did a great job with the room design and the beds are "uber" comfy to sleep in. My curtains broke on another trip when I was there. They fixed it right away. It would not take much for them to make this a great hotel. But alas, Im to sure they are reaching for this kind of excellence.  As I said, I would stay there again.

title: 1st hotel that made me seriously consider leaving Marriott
Outstanding Luxury, Service and Design!
text:
The Renaissance New York Midtown is an outstanding property in Manhattan! The new hotel (4 years) provides luxurious, fashionable rooms and public spaces.  My wife and I were treated like old friends by Guest Service Supervisor Sophia Gomez and her team. Sophie is obviously personally invested and genuinely cares about going “above and beyond” to delight guests!  She and her staff are crushing customer relations…everyone is helpful and courteous.  We enjoyed the sweeping midtown view from our 36th floor suite...featuring crisp, modern design with floor to ceiling windows.  We enjoyed the cityscape from the our super comfy king size bed.  

I travel extensively for business and pleasure (over 120 nights a year), including to destinations like China, Germany and Vienna…and the Renaissance New York Midtown Hotel is one of the most stylish and comfortable hotels I’ve ever seen.  It is a midtown oasis of comfort and tranquility close to the best restaurants, shopping and other local points of interest.  Those of us who travel like gypsies know how important it is to have a clean, comfortable base from which to operate...this Renaissance provides that luxurious refuge.  The lush appointments of our suite epitomized stylish luxury with modern, well-appointed bathrooms, pinpoint temperature control, big screen televisions... and best of all the heavenly, comfortable bed!  

We will definitely return to this outstanding property.  At 7th Avenue and 35th Street, it's close to everything...next door to Madison Square garden and a short walk from Times Square, the Village and Rockefeller Center.  The service, the luxury and location make this my new favorite hotel in NYC.  Try it ...you'll love it!

title: Worst pre-stay experience
text: This hotel has the worst reservation team possible and also worst revenue manager. I made a reservation for January 2020 and, without asking and without any further information, they cancelled my reservation just telling there was an error in rate. I tried to contact the hotel and they gave no solution to this reservation so I had to book another (better) hotel. My recommendation: if this ever happen to you, keep going to the hotel. If you don’t say you have received any cancellation email they must give you a room or look for another hotel.

title: Terrific Location
text: Stayed at this venue over the Thanksgiving holiday.  A good location if you don't  mind the hustle bustle of midtown.  Between 7th and 8th.  We were on the 27th floor, and it was very quiet.  Great view from our room of Lady Liberty............

title: Great Stay at Renaissance NY Midtown for Titanium Member !
text:
Superb customer service rendered by Sebastian Torres of the Front Desk Team !
Sebastian was superb at checkin, briefed my family on the features of the hotel and the local amenities, and went out of his way.  Hotel was spotlessly clean and very nice lounge with nice amenities.  Great central location and convenient to Penn Station and MSG.

title: Room not ready
text:
As an Ambassador elite member I have to say this was an average hotel experience. 
I had requested a 1pm check in and when we arrived the room was not ready until after 4pm. Was told that reason room wasn’t ready was because there were so many people not checking out until 4pm, meaning that no one was able to check into their rooms u til 4pm.... nonsense.
Rather than accept the responsibility for not having rooms ready the hotel seems to be more willing to count on guest being too thick to understand that the cleaning department are chronically understaffed here, which can be witnessed if you ever ask for amenities or anything related to room service.
There are other better options in NYC the Marriott chain than this hotel, which seems to be counting on its Renaissance name more than its ability to provide a  flagship service.

title: An excellent experience!!
text: I have stayed at RMA in Fashion District with my wife for nine nights this month. A very good location and high price-quality relationship: small spaces but very functional, a very comfortable hotel with all that is necessary to make your stay pleasant. An excellent service: everybody was helpful and polite, in particular Cory at the front desk, Ranie who recommends wonderful restaurants, pubs and rooftops, and the person who gives you the packages of what you buy online (unfortunately I do not remember his name but he he has dark hair, is a little bald and can speak Spanish). Definitely, an experience to repeat next time we go to NYC!

title: Great location and incredible staff
text:
We stayed here for 4 nights and had a great experience with this hotel. The staff were all great and the Lead Navigator Daniel Garcia was great to work with during our stay.  He provided us with sightseeing options, tips and restaurant recommendations. The staff at the street level entrance were always friendly and welcoming. 
Our room was wonderful with a sky - line view of New York City. It seemed a bit small for a Deluxe King, but this  may be how it is in New York City. The location was great. 

We ate at the restaurant a few times and the food was good., but seemed a bit over priced and the night we arrived it was closed due to a private party.   There are many other restaurants and deli's to dine at within walking distance.

We would definetly stay here again on a return trip.

title: Likely the Worst Hotel I've Been To
text:
I've stayed at plenty of hotels in NYC (and elsewhere), and I've honestly never had an experience as bad as at this hotel.

Incredibly rude staff - mostly at front desk.

Didn't let me check in for 9 hours after I got there (to be fair, I was early, but it was still way past was they themselves bill as their 'guaranteed' checkin time of 4pm).

Rooms are old and outdated. Feels a lot like an early 80s hotel in terms of style, cleanliness, and amenities.

Impossible to use elevators - often have to wait at least 5-10 minutes for an elevator.

I'm only platinum status (not titanium or higher) with Marriott, but other than access to the club lounge, which is also the worst I've seen, there are no other perks. No welcome gift (despite Marriott's own website guaranteeing the offer), no room upgrades, etc.

Location - as others have mentioned - is fine. Very close to Herald Square and K-Town. But that's the only upside of the hotel I can possibly imagine.

Would HIGHLY recommend against anyone thinking of booking this hotel.

title: Location is everything!
text: Last minute GIRLS weekend in NYC late November and we couldn't have been more pleased!  Everything was perfect from location, view, facilities and staff!  Will highly recommend to friends - and come back in the future!  Keep it up!

title: Incredible stay!!
text: I recently needed a room very last minute due to an emergency situation. The staff was unbelievably kind and went above and beyond my expectations to make my stay incredible. One of the managers wrote a hand written note to me and really made my stay event better. Highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for the ideal city location with incredible staff!

title: Location, Location, Location!
text: Stayed at Renaissance because of close proximity to MS Garden.  Turns out it was a convenient mid-town location.  Comfortable walk to Times Square and easy access to other parts of town.  Room was small but well appointed.  Grab an apple every day at front desk.  Great bagel shop across street out front door.

title: Perfect
text: Very nice hotel,  modern rooms, great location. A few minutes walking from The Empire State Building. Rooms are clean,  with a great view.  Guests have the possibility to use the fitness center in the same building free of charge.  Staff is very kind.  On the 5th floor a fantastic restaurant is available.

title: Cancelled reservations
text: We have booked several rooms to this hotel but a week before my arrival they just cancelled our bookings. When I contacted them they were absolutely rude and unfriendly. Still dont know why they cancelled our reservation... Not even close to high level hospitality... very disappointed, not recommended!!

title: Reservation cancelled without reason.....!!!
text:
We have a booked flight to New York with my husband and 2 years old little girl. We have just booked a room to the Renaissance New York Midtown Hotel for a very reasonable price I have to mention. One week after the reservation we got an email that our reservation got cancelled and they cannot honour our price cause there was a mistake in their system. It happened to us already that the hotel reservation got cancelled but the hotel OFFERED US an alternative.
We are really disappointed and not only that the reservation got cancelled, because we did not get any alternative hotel in the neighborhood for the same price...what they should have do this in this case.....!!!!!

title: Good location but mediocre service at this hotel
text:
Stayed here for a weekend to see the sights. Location was convenient but hotel is nondescript and hard to spot on the street.  The lobby is on the 6th floor but the staff are very inflexible and lack hospitality training. Although we are loyalty members, they would not let us check in early or get an extended check out that is part of our rewards. Would not even allow us a room on a high floor as they call this an upgrade! The room is poky and minimalist but the TV worked well with a small selection of channels. Bathroom was very small but modern. Bed was disappointing and saggy and we had to ask for blanket and pillows as the ones they provided were insufficient.

Also, impersonal, awkwardly laid out property with indifferent staff. Not recommended if you are seeking great customer service or a memorable experience or even a valued guest!

Luckily, there are lots of eating options and coffee places very close by so we could skip the surly restaurant staff and the overpriced menu! 

Since they have a captive customer base due to high demand in Manhattan, they just don't care in the face of a lot of customer complaints! Won't be looking to stay at this property again as there are many other Marriott properties which offer a more memorable stay. Forgettable!

title: Great location for Madison Square Garden
text:
Approximately 1 1/2 blocks from MSG. Others are only a little closer, but this one is better, IMO. It is part of Marriott.
Rooms are very clean and comfortable. Some rooms have a good view. The shower wall dividing the bath from the sleep area has a frosted glass. If you would like more privacy there is a shade that you could pull down and eliminates that potential issue. However, if that is not a problem you get a bath with lots of natural light. If you are tall enough you can look over the frosted area and enjoy the view. People are very nice and helpful, especially the Bell staff and reception. The concierge is also very helpful.  The lobby has a small bar and the people who work there are equally helpful. Unfortunately, the white wine selection is terrible . Luckily, there is a great wine store about a block away, which solves that problem .Starbucks is close as is a CVS ( I think), sandwich place and Macy's. It is walking distance from many attractions. Security seems good. You need a room key to travel anywhere on the elevators. I do not know how  the accommodations  work for wheelchair ease of access. Our corridor and room would have been tough. Call and check before you go and see if it would work for you. They may have specialized rooms.

title: The hotel that made us close Marriott loyalty program membership
text:
After 3 years of traveling to Marriotts for minimum of 30 nights/year we are never coming to this chain again! Ever! Because nobody ever treats guests in this way!

We have booked Renaissance New York Midtown Hotel to celebrate my birthday.
After 1 week the reservations were canceled by the hotel. Saying that there was a system mistake and our rate is not avaliable and if we want to stay in this hotel we should pay like 6 times more!

The person communicating to us from the hotel refuse to introduce himself/herself and telling us to stop contacting the hotel after the 1 (polite) email we sent. 

Now nobody even replying to our emails including Marriott customer support and any of the hotel staff!

Whoever mistake that was putting the wrong price for the hotel online we have already booked it! And we got confirmation emails! Why shall we suffer now and what kind of attitude is this to just ignore your customer???

We are furious. And done with Marriott chain forever.

title: Room Cleaning needs Improvement
text:
Checked in and the toilet was clogged and floating stuff (see photo).  I called for service and didn't arrive.  They did give me a new room, but it has a bad smell (like a football team was in here).   For a Renaissance property, this is way below standard.  Need to hire new houskeeping managers and staff.

Front desk staff are professional and responsive.

title: Classy, clean and central
text:
The room was clean with modern décor and cleverly designed to make the most of limited space. The bed was very comfortable and importantly, the shower pressure was strong. In addition, access to a well-equipped gym is very important to me.

Ask for Joshua at the front desk for anything you need. Very caring guy!

title: Favorite NY hotel
text: Stayed for a night and loved it! The lobby, rooms, restaurants, bars, all great.  Only criticism is high cost of valet parking.  Other than that it is now my favorite NYC spot.  Location terrific too.  All around great experience.

title: 5 notti ottime
text: Io e la mia ragazza abbiamo soggiornato per 5 notti ad Ottobre, trovando semplicemente tutto perfetto. Hotel in posizione ottimale, tra la 7th Avenue e la 35th Street, a 1km da Times Square e 200m dall'Empire, con la metro a 100m. Cortesia al desk all'ingresso e alla reception, stanza basic di dimensioni più che adeguate (noi al 16°piano), con bagno con doccia enorme e letto king size comodissimo come non mai. TV di almeno 50 pollici con installati canali NETFLIX e YOUTUBE con cui poter collegare il proprio account e usufruirne (ma a NY la tv la si guarda molto poco direi). Vista stupenda, direttamente sui grattacieli attorno al Madison Square Garden, ascensori rapidi e mai pieni. Colazione a pagamento, ma in alternativa appena fuori si hanno Starbucks, un caffè frequentatissimo e vari Mc Donald's. Quando tornerò a NY, sarà sicuramente un hotel da considerare per tornarci!

title: Fantastic Hotel in great midtown location
text: Stayed for 5 nights as a family of 3 and loved our stay.  Friendly staff made us feel welcome.  Had great night sleep in comfy beds which was needed after walking in Manhattan.  Great location for Madison Square Garden, the subway, Times Square & the Empire State Building.  Will definitely return.

title: Fair Price for Comfortable, Modern Hotel in Midtown West
text:
We don't really like staying in midtown on the west side but we were attending a sporting event at MSG and then needed to make a quick getaway from Penn Station to get to EWR.  After a bit of research, we selected the Renaissance NY Midtown and were very happy with our choice.

The location was perfect for our needs, including a back entrance that shortened our walk to MSG by one block -- key during a teeming rainstorm.

From start to finish, the hotel met all expectations.  Fast, efficient check-in; comfortable room & bath -- reasonably roomy by NYC standards,  Nice toiletries.  In-room refrigerator, where we could stash the complementary liter bottle of water that we received on check-in.  Extremely quiet considering the location of the hotel, although we were lucky to have a room on the 19th floor.  We were right next to the elevator but that was not an issue at all - could not hear people talking while waiting for the elevator nor any of the machinery. Efficient bell-stand services for our bags between check out time and when we returned after the game.

title: Great New Property, Centrally Located, Good Views
text:
October is crowded with tourists so surface streets are very slow.  West midtown gave convenience to Chelsea, Soho, Central Park South, Hudson Yard, Times Sq.
Their "rooftop" bar is on the 5th floor, but has a view south.  there are 29+ floors.
good breakfast menu; the voucher buffet is fine.
Reception and Concrg are over the top accommodating.
Cell service is not consistent
Need room key to operated elevators - great security component

title: Nice Midtown Hotel
text: If you are looking for a nice, clean updated hotel in midtown this hotel is a good option. Staff was friendly and room was clean. There is a wonderful bagel shop across the street and it’s in a good location to walk to Times Square, 5th Avenue and Hudson Yards.

title: Wonderful overnight stay
text:
My daughter and I stayed here for one night.  We loved the large, modern room, which was spotless and quiet.  One drawback was there were no drawers in the room, ok for us for an overnight, but possibly creativity needed for a longer stay.  We needed to get used to the elevator system, which was really easy - but unusual for us.  
The staff were excellent, with special shout-outs going to Caleb and Joshua in reception and all the staff at the bell desk.  They were knowledgeable, personable and friendly.
Great location to walk wherever we went, and subway station close by.

title: Terrific Service - Nice Property
text: Many times to NYC and first time at the Renaissance Midtown. The service was excellent. Navigator Daniel Garcia was very helpful in taking care of arrivals and making sure the stay got off to a great start. The rest of the team was able to take care of a noisy HVAC and ensure a peaceful sleep. Property is nicely refreshed and true to the neighborhood. Well done Renaissance Midtown.

title: excellent property, great location
text: Really impressed by the location, staff, and facility - in particular in comparison to the nearby Element and Moxy properties. Clean, spacious room, extra care for frequent travellers, well equipped morning breakfast and afternoon happy hour fare, nice gym attached to the property. Very short walk from Penn Station - will be on my preferred list for my frequent stops in NYC.

title: Great weekend
text:
Spent 3 nights at this convenient hotel. It is very close to Penn Station and within walking distance of Times Square, the Hi line and Empire State Building to name a few.  The rooms were large for NYC standards. Bathroom was large and well equipped with walk-in shower.  The staff was friendly and seemed to go out of their way to 
Help.  The front  desk worked to get us in our room early.  We had 3 rooms and they were able to have us near each other. Breakfast was included in the restaurant The buffet had a wonderful assortment of food.
The Conseiage was very helpful.  He made reservations for us to The Statue of Liberty/Ellis. Island and the Tenament Tour, as well as directing us to ferries and restaurants.  
The elevators were a bit tricky to learn but the staff went out of their way to help everyone learn.
The only negative was the waiter in the lobby bar.  Very slow and distracted.  
But we had a great time at this hotel

title: Great hotel!
text: We really enjoyed our stay here. The hotel is clean, comfy and in a location that is close to anything you want. We enjoyed our skyline view from our room. Cory at check-in was excellent! Attentive, friendly and made the check-in pleasant. Easy walking to MSG and to the Broadway Theatres and close to trains & subways for further adventures. We ate at the hotel restaurant Versa twice. Once for a late bite and once for breakfast and the food & service was great! Looking forward to staying here again the next time in NYC!

title: Perfect Hotel for NYC weekend and a show at MSG
text: Stayed last weekend for fight night at MSG and it was perfect. MSG is a block away and the rest of midtown is at your fingertips. Great service and rooms. The front door/security staff was very friendly and efficient. Also loved the Versa bar with the outdoor patio. Definitely will visit again.

title: Great hotel in great location
text: After much debate chose this hotel as it was relatively new and not tired like many of the hotels nearby for the same kind of price.  It is in midtown in the Garment district. Very near tube stations and Penn street stations.  It is about a 2 minute walk to Maceys and is on the doorstep of Madison Square Garden.  Our room was on the 16th floor and had great views of the skyline from our floor to ceiling window.  Check in was very efficient.  I agree with the fellow traveler about the coffee machine that you also had to use to boil water for tea, etc, it was terrible, spat and dripped all over the place.  I would recommend replacing this with a good quality kettle.  Plenty of plug sockets. Shower good.  Hotel bar was very nice.  Some people complained about the lifts while we were here, we didn't have too many problems with them for the first five days but on the last two days we encountered problems with some guests saying they had waited 20 minutes for a lift on occasion.  The staff were great and very helpful.  If you needed anything for your room it was brought up very quickly.  I would recommend this hotel as it's in a great location, rooms are more spacious than most and it's modern.

title: Great hotel let down by a few oversights
text:
The Renaissance is a relatively new hotel in a city of largely older establishments.  I chose this hotel for this very reason, plus its Midtown location, and a large Planet Fitness gym on-site.  On these counts, I was not disappointed.  

The room in which I stayed - 2208 - offered a nice view of the Manhattan skyline, across adjacent rooftops to distant skyscrapers, and this summed up the quintessential New York experience for me.  The bathroom of grey-veined white marble offered a space-effective design, with excellent shower pressure and instant hot water.  Plentiful supply of quality Aveda toiletries.  The bedroom itself was equally well designed, with a king-sized bed, chaise longue beside the floor-to-ceiling window, fast, free and stable Wi-Fi and individual heating/cooling.  

The downsides which I encountered:

1. Noisy air-conditioning - the compressor unit appears to be situated inside the room, and made a racket every time the thermostat kicked in, especially when in Auto mode.  I frequently adjusted it to low fan speed mode just to reduce the noise.
2. Bed was far too soft - I respect that this is largely subjective - many people prefer a plush sleeping surface - but for me, it didn't offer enough support
3. Wet patch on carpet directly under the dripping AC vent
4. No bottled water
5. Powerpoints in the room (and there were many) do not cater to plugs from other countries - when I rang to ask for an international adaptor, I was pointendly told to go buy my own from a nearby electronics store
6, No kettle.  One has to use a small coffee-maker to boil water - this dispenses water in tiny spurts,  and if there are 2 occupants in the room, you can't enjoy a hot beverage together

Staff overall friendly and helpful.  Planet Fitness gym large and well equipped, offering free access to hotel guests.  

Midtown West location very convenient, with the Subway trains very near, as were countless shops, restaurants, theatres and Macy's department store.  Easy to walk everywhere, including Times Square, which I tried to avoid as much as possible due to the crowds and sensory overload of lights and noise.  

As I had booked several months in advance, I enjoyed a good-value rate, so I can't complain, but I noticed that rates are otherwise quite expensive (over USD 400++ per night).

Given the vast choice of hotels in NYC, I would explore other options on my next visit, but overall, the Renaissance Midtown is a solid choice.

title: LOVED this hotel!!!
text:
Excellent staff, excellent room, excellent bar/restaurant, excellent location. There is literally nothing I can say wrong about this hotel. I was originally concerned about the reviews that talked about Marriott elites being targeted and having reservations being canceled as I had read this on a couple of reviews on here. I e-mailed the hotel my concerns and Justin Ellison e-mailed me back and assured me this would not happen and it didn't. The location is fantastic, it's close to everything. The room was super clean. We were on the 26th floor with an amazing view of the City (great for IG photos).  Staff were very friendly (especially for New York City). 

The only thing I could complain about is the breakfast room service I ordered. For a breakfast that cost $35/person, I would have expected actual plates and silverware instead of a breakfast that came in paper boxes, plastic cups, and plastic utensils. Other than that, everything else was FANTASTIC! Thank you for a great stay!!!

title: OUTSTANDING professionalism and customer service! Awesome Location!
text:
My partner and I stayed at Renaissance New York Midtown Hotel last week and I must say I was amazed yet again by the professionalism and customer service that we experienced. I stayed at this same hotel a year or so ago and had a great experience then as well. This visit as soon as I walked in the door your team made the process entirely simple; specifically Caleb and Joshua. Some hotels make checking in very difficult and drawn out, Caleb quickly got me checked in, was very nice and asked probing questions to find out that it was my partner and my anniversary; this not only made us feel welcomed but also made us feel special like it was more then a hotel stay. I had the pleasure of having Joshua assist me on my last stay and he came up to greet me and ask how everything was, the fact that he remembered me from over a year ago really stood out. 

With all of that being said, thank you and your team for valuing customer service and for being so proficient in all you do. This sets the bar VERY high when I stay at other hotels so thank you!

title: Great Location
text: Hotel is located in a great location for access to trains, MSG, and midtown NY sites.  Rooms are average size for NYC and were very clean.  Elevators need some work.  You scan room card and it allocates an elevator to take (no floors to press when in elevator).  Once in the elevator, you may not end up at your floor and need to get out and scan again.  We were on elevators a few times and saw others with the same issue.  Asked for early check in for 1:00 (Titanium member) and when arrived said room was not ready.  Said they would call.  Never received a call.  My wife and I were celebrating our anniversary and we were given a $30 voucher for drinks and free breakfast.  People at check in were friendly.  Like others have said the area is a little sketchy, but overall never felt unsafe.

title: Great Location
text: This hotel met our needs very well.  Located adjacent to MSG and Penn Station, it was a perfect location to catch a train from Newark Liberty airport.  Additionally, there are 2 subway lines, one at either end of the block which made it super convenient to get around the city.  We were here in January 2019 and thought that our room was very comfortable and the staff was fantastic.  Hotels in NYC are always going to be pricey, but relative to what was available, I found this property to be a good value for a romantic getaway with my wife.  We would definitely stay here again.

title: Perfect Location for MSG not far from the Square
text: This hotel was very up to date with a Euro style.  Rooms were small but frankly we never spent a lot of time In them other than to sleep... so they were outstanding!  Two minutes from MSG and about 20 walk to Times Square.  The entrance is on a no. descript street, but you are not far from the corner of 7th Avenue.  Perfect for what we needed it for!  Highly recommend it.

title: Excelente
text:
Hotel de calidad muy bien ubicado, tamaño de habitación correcta.
Buen servicio de check in e instalaciones para una linda estadía en New York en pareja.
Cuenta con un lobby en el 2 nivel donde puedes tomar desayuno opcional.
Cómodas camas y baño

title: Very Helpful Staff and fabulous view
text:
The hotel rooms are very tasteful and  clean. Our view of the city from our large windows was spectacular. The location was perfect for walking to many sights.   I want to commend the concierge services,  Daniel was extremely helpful and welcoming and made our trip very pleasant with his recommendations and assisting us with travel details.

I would definitely stay at this hotel again on my next visit to NY.

title: Trendy Upscale hotel in a great location!
text: We recently booked this hotel for a concert at The Hammerstein Ballroom. The staff was friendly and super helpful! The room had a great view and was clean. The hotel and room is very trendy. Great place to stay in NYC!!

title: Overcharged just like other feedback
text:
The hotel location is good and accommodation is nice. 

However, just like other traveler commented, they overcharged me as well.

During check out, we mentioned that we would like to split the hotel bill into 2 credit cards as 6 nights were to be charged to corporate card and 1 night (total of 7 nights) to be charged to personal card. When 2 cards were presented, we (my colleague and myself faced the same problem) were charged 7 nights in the corporate card and 1 night (total of 8 nights) to the personal card. After a lot of explanation and checking, they refund 1 night to the corporate card and I thought everything was settled.

Upon returning to home country, I realized that I was charged another USD472 to my personal card though I had already settled for 7 nights upon check out!! 

The hotel is totally messed up in their billing as a 3rd colleague of mine also faced some billing issues.

title: Comfortable beds at the heart of Times Square
text:
We got a room with two qualitative double beds for a family of three. The room, as well as bathroom was spacious and clean. Toiletries were of good quality, and internet connection did not falter. What we did not try out was the breakfast, since it was not part of the offered bookings, and some advised here that it would not be worthwhile. So, we had breakfast in the nearby Sbarro restaurant. We did try their restaurant for dinner, and the food was soso at a high price. You pay more for the view. The hotel is located just right at where the red stairs are. It is across Hershey's. 
Check in did not go as fast as I would have preferred when accompanying senior citizens. It is also a crowded area, and there is a need to switch elevators from the check in area to the restaurant, and then to the hotel rooms.

title: 擦りガラス張りのバスルーム
text:
３０階のキングベッドルームに1泊。
大きなスーツケースが1つやっと広げられるくらいの広さ。
ペンステーションからとても近く、
どこに行くにも便利な場所ですが、
バスルームが擦りガラス張りとは知らなかったです。
これを知っていたら、ここは選んでなかったと思います。
本来目隠しのカーテンがあるようですが、
私の部屋は外れていてありませんでした。
到着時間も遅く、1泊だけで部屋変えてもらうのも
めんどくさかったので我慢しました。
アメニティ類も予約した人数分用意されていなくて、
色々と疑問に感じる滞在でした。

評価低めですが、スタッフがベル係、フロント、サービス係と
どの方も笑顔でフレンドリーに接してくれました。
立地もとても良いので、部屋の好みが合えば、
最高の滞在になるかと思います。

title: Best NYC Suite
text: Recently booked this hotel for a Billy Joel MSG concert. Penthouse floor suite with balcony overlooking MSG. This is the coolest place to stay in midtown and this suite was off the hook. Views outside and amenities inside. Top shelf service in the hotel.  We are returning for another event and planning on another evening relaxing on that balcony overlooking NYC. PS, have breakfast in the hotel restaurant...you will not regret it.

title: New York Getaway
text: Exactly what I expected from this hotel.  All staff courteous and professional.  Helpful whenever needing advice.  Fitness center was a Planet Fitness which was great!! Great hotel in the heart of the city.

title: Zero benefits for Ambassador level
text: Stayed in 2 rooms for 3 nights and were very disappointed to not receive any room upgrade despite our Ambassador status. In addition, room was not ready until after 4pm despite a 2pm arrival which should have been guaranteed per our status. We had 2 king connecting rooms, one of which was a disabled room for 2 adults and 2 children. Not ideal. Stayed on 16th floor which was very noisy with loud music playing until the late evening, again, not ideal for children who go to bed at 9:30. An empty wine glass was left on the counter the first night and never removed during our stay by housekeeping.Breakfast buffet in Versa was interesting...bagels were stale,no cold cereal or oatmeal, and two types of cookies were offered. On the positive location was good and having Planet Fitness next door was a nice perk. Hotel was clean and service was good.

title: Excellent Stay
text:
Stayed five (5) nights in late August in room 807 which is a terrace suite.  The room itself is the normal size but it has a huge (350 sq ft) terrace which overlooks 34th street.  Really a fun feature as we sat out on the terrace at night and had a few drinks. The rooms are surprisingly quiet and while not huge they work fine for two people.

The hotel is connected to a Planet Fitness which was nice for working out and it’s a block walk to Penn Station where we caught the LIRR everyday to the USOpen tennis tournament (15 minute/one stop) trip.  The bar in the lobby on the 6th is very nice but most of the action is on the 5th floor where there is a huge bar/restaurant with an outdoor deck.  

We had access to the club lounge on the 6th floor which is very functional and served everything we needed for breakfast.  Everyone we encountered was friendly and helpful and we would certainly stay at this location again due to its superior location.

title: Flashy hotel with cold staff and seedy surroundings
text:
I think this hotel got a little caught up in concept, and lost a lot in warmth. We were here for our anniversary. When asked about our trip, we mentioned it, got no response, and were just handed our keys to our room. The hotel we had stayed at the night before had gone above and beyond to warmly welcome us for our anniversary trip. That hotel was very personable, where the "welcome" at the Renaissance felt more formulaic. It felt like we were just being processed. The bartenders at the outside terrace bar ignored us until we gave up and went inside where the service was better. The bar was nearly empty, it made no sense. 

They said they'd call when our room was ready but they didn't. Our room was nice, but I HATE those sliding barn doors on bathrooms. No privacy. The view was good and the lounger by the window was fantastic. The sleep was comfortable and quiet. 

The location is close enough to Times Square and Penn Station to be convenient for tourist spots and catching the subway. The hotel itself is VERY secure, however, it is in a pretty seedy area. The smell of urine just outside of the hotel is so strong sometimes you can't breathe, and in the three nights we stayed there, I saw a crack deal in plain sight, two people selling stolen CK jeans, and a man strung out and locked up on heroin, all in the same spot by the phone booths between the hotel and 7th avenue. I know it's New York, but it bears warning for people who might be more sensitive to that.

title: Não Faça sua reserva através de Agência de Viagens. Vc será cobrado duas vezes!
text: Fiquei nesse hotel em março de 2019, 4 diárias, reservei e paguei dois quartos pra minha família através do Submarino Viagens meses antes da viagem. Porém, no dia do checkout o Hotel me cobrou um quarto novamente, sob o pretexto de que não acharam a reserva do segundo quarto. Resumindo: perdi uma manhã inteira tentando resolver, o gerente do hotel sequer teve a capacidade de sair da sua sala pra me atender. Enviei email, reclamei nas redes sociais do Hotel e ninguém deu a mínima. Desci umas 4 vezes na recepção, apresentei o comprovante, etc. No final, quando já havia desistido e perdido meio dia resolvendo isso, me ligaram no quarto avisando que acharam a reserva. Simplesmente inaceitável. Não recomendo. Outro amigo que estava comigo na mesma viagem teve o mesmo problema. Só percebeu quando chegou ao Brasil. E até hoje não recebeu o que cobraram a mais. E estão ignorando todos os contatos dele.

title: They charged me twice and doesn't give my money back
text: I stayed at Renaissance NY Midtown in March this year. I paid the entire stay at submarinoviagens.com, but the hotel charged me once more during checkout. I contacted the hotel, but they didn't answer me. I went to New York again last June and spent some vacation time at the hotel to chat in person. An employee named Allan Blacio answered me and was very helpful. He gave me an email address that could solve the problem, but the man in charge of it (Mr. Derek Liu) doesn't answer me. After 5 (five !!!!) months and they did not return my money. Horrible experience. I really do not recommend this hotel.

title: Lovely and luxurious
text: Fantastic property located on 35th. Convenient walking distance to Times Square (without being in the center of chaos), Macy's, great restaurants and Bryant Park. We were on the 37th floor so admittedly it was very quiet. Nice bed, great linens, well-appointed bathrooms and big closet. Nice gym. Didn't have any meals on the property, although we ordered room service breakfast that is delivered by a nearby deli-bakery. Very reasonably priced, but by the time they add in all the taxes and "fees" you've quadrupled your original cost - so watch for that. Elevators are a little confusing - scan your key and you're told which elevator to take. Seems unnecessary. I'd stay here again simply for the location and the rooms.

title: Great location, great rooms, and great service
text: We went for a 3 night short vacation with the family (Dad/Mom/2 teens) and got a 2 Queen High floor, skyline view with a pretty good AAA rate considering it was NYC in the summer.   The location a block over from Penn Station/MSG was perfect since we took the train in and could just walk a block to the hotel.   The room was very nice with a very good view (34th floor) and good beds.  Room was also very clean.  It is a little on the small side but I think for NYC it was as expected.  Had a giant walk-in shower with a "rainfall overhead showerhead" which was great.   The service was great, front desk folks (especially Joshua) were very helpful as were the guys at the front bell desk and the housekeeping.

title: It is not worth it.
text:
스탠다드 방에 묵고 있는데 진짜 작아요. 청소도 제대로 하지 않았더라구요 침구도 대충 정리만 해놓고 바꾸어 놓지 않았습니다. 침구위에 과자 부스러기가 조금 있었는데 그것도 그대로 있었고 커피잔도 얼룩을 그대로 씻지 않고 엎어만 놓고. 친절은 기대도 하지 마세요. 절대로 럭셔리 호텔 아닙니다. 14일 머무를 예정인데 오늘이 두번째 날이에요.
계속 업데이트 할 예정입니다.
Stadard room is very small. They didn't clean the room properly. For example, there were crumbs on the bed because they didn't change the bedsheet nor did they wash the used cups.This is the second day of our 14days.

title: Nice stay
text: Stayed for two nights on business. Great hotel, very clean, comfortable bed with nice sheets and linen. Two of the elevators must have been down when we first arrived, which was very annoying, but once fixed they worked much faster. There is a Planet Fitness attached that guests can use. I prefer a nicer hotel gym, but for one workout it was fine.We also had a very tasty breakfast at the hotel. I would stay here again.

title: Read negative reviews for before booking
text: Stayed here last weekend with my wife. We booked the room in May using the Marriott Explorer rate. Called a few days before checking in and everything looked good. Went to check in a few days later they not only canceled my reservation, when they did reinstate it they bumped my original rate of $89.00 to $199.00 without letting me know. I’ve showed them proof of my reservation via email which I’ve booked back in May of 2019. Seems like management staff only care for the revenue of the property and not their loyal guest. I love Marriott brand hotels however I will never stay at this hotel ever again. Be careful before booking your room here and be even more careful after booking your room.

title: Cancelled Reservation w/o Notice and Charged More at Arrival
text:
I arrived to the hotel around 6PM, the front desk agent checked me into one of my 2 rooms w/o much issue.  She took my CC, I didn't sign anything as standard, and was given my keys and on my way.  

Later around 11PM when my friend checked in, he was told they had cancelled our reservations because the original CC used to book was invalid.  Having been a former Marriott Rewards Platinum Premier Elite for 5+ years and now Titanium Elite, my CC is attached to my profile, and have not once in over 500+stays over the last 5 years have had any issue.  

This hotel cancelled my reservation WITHOUT even a call or email asking for an updated credit card.  I had originally booked my reservation 4 months prior, and in that time my card number had changed.  So when I checked in, they gave me a room, but increased my rate $110/night WITHOUT EVEN TELLING me when I checked in.  Later when my friend and I discussed w. the front desk they told me my original rate wasn't available (well perhaps cause they cancelled it that day).  When I reached out to the the A. GM. via email he told me they do not take the time to contact all guests in this situation, sometimes just cancel reservations as they feel appropriate.  

Worst is: I never authorized them to charge me the additional $110/night, which is a PCI compliance violation on their part.  

Hotel Wise: rooms are very nice, bar is pretty bad, horrible attitude from their staff at Versa.  Location is TERRIBLE, I am moving to Manhattan soon and avoid this area like the plague.  You don't want to be hit with the smell of urine and homeless people harassing you.  There are tons of better areas in Manhattan to stay, and 100's of hotel options.  

Seems cancelling reservations is a common trend here based on the other reviews.

title: Elite Members being targeted by this hotel.... you may not have the room you reserved.
text:
You may get an email from this hotel before you check in that is unlike the four welcome emails they send you.  This email is important.  This email could inform you that the credit card on your Marriott Profile is not up to date.  This is for rooms booked in advance and they will only send you this email the day of travel.  Apparently they test the card on your profile the day of travel.  Even if you normally pay with a different card or prepaid.  Despite over 75 stays this year, they elected to send me an email when I was in the air telling me to update my profile (less than 6 hours from check in).  They canceled my reservation less than two hours later (4 hours from Check in).  I thought this was a mistake but they responded to my compliant stating the policy.  The manager says that they do this to a lot of Elite Members as a mater of policy in writing?  Amazing... but here it is.  

From Justin Ellison:  Manager

unfortunately we have had an a very high amount of fellow elite members who also do not keep their profiles up today nor with valid credit card. Resulting in a significant impact on our hotel operations from both a guest service and financial perspective. Because of this challenge from elite members we have had to react appropriately by confirming the validity of all guest credit cards and reaching out, as we did below, requesting an updated credit card to secure your reservation. This allows us to prepare for our guests who we expect to arrive and per their profile requests.  When I asked why they would do this to a Titanium customer on the day of travel and not give him time to respond or make   

While we appreciate your loyalty to Marriott and choosing to stay with us during your travels to New York City, unfortunately we have had an a very high amount of fellow elite members who also do not keep their profiles up today nor with valid credit card. Resulting in a significant impact on our hotel operations from both a guest service and financial perspective. Because of this challenge from elite members we have had to react appropriately by confirming the validity of all guest credit cards and reaching out, as we did below, requesting an updated credit card to secure your reservation. This allows us to prepare for our guests who we expect to arrive and per their profile requests.

title: Vacation
text: Stopped in here for a break and had drinks at the bar. The staff was great and the bar area was very nice. Would definitely recommend this place as it is centrally located and is definitely in the heart of the city.

title: It’s the little things....
text:
The Renaissance Hotel is beautiful.  Clean.  Friendly people.  GREAT BEDS - Fabulous linens.  And with the right room - a fabulous view.  In my last picture, if you look close enough, you can see the Statue of Liberty.

The ONLY reason why I didn’t get the hotel 5 Stars - is because of the little things...attention to detail will always make one place greater than the other.

The charges next to the bed (insert cord!) didn’t work....first time I had seen this - they are usually at the bottom of a light fixture - With 4 people in the room, we needed every place to charge the electronics.  AND the lights didn’t work bed side.

Finally, the bathroom sink didn’t drain properly - took forever to empty.  I know, little things - 

With all that said, this is definitely on MRL (Maria’s Return List)!

Happy Travels!

title: Would not stay for 300+
text:
Stayed here for one night with a free night reward on a Saturday. If I had paid for the room, it would have been over 300 dollars and I would not stay for that price.

The hotel website mentions that it's a high-tech hotel but not sure what that means. Nothing in the room has anything to do with technology except for the Internet TV.

There are double shades which I thought would be controlled with a remote or switch but you have to reach behind the standing lamp and pull the chain. Even with double shades, you will still hear street noise.

The switch next to the bedhead looks like a master switch for the room but it's just for the bedside lamp right over the switch and you have to turn the lights off individually or turn off the master switch placed next to the door, which will also shut off other electricity thus stop phone charging. There was also a knock on the door at around 9:20am on Sunday morning 'checking.'

The water pressure is just so bad but I liked Aveda amenities.
The elevator is the worst - it's the kind of elevator that you press the floor first and then you get assigned to one. There are three that go to all the floors and one just between the lobby (6th floor) and the first floor. Pretty sure that it's programmed to run the minimum number of elevator - everyone gets assigned to a single elevator and I have seen people not being able to get in in spite of all the waiting.
There are also just not enough people in the lobby and the bell desk. 

The location is pretty great though - close to Penn station and major touristy areas.

title: Very disappointing experience
text:
I stayed at the hotel for 20 nights on July 2019.
I would like to advise who ever is booking this hotel to check the lock at the room very carefully!!! The lock at my room didn’t close properly and one night a strange man entered my room at 2AM and went into my shower to do number 1!! I woke up due to the noise and had to fight him out of the room. After this shocking experience to which I received a branch voucher of $50 from the management, I experienced another unpleasant situation when my daughter AirPods “disappeared” from our room and the manger Mishka doesn’t think we should be reimbursed for this since no body saw it prior to the event according to her words although the cleaning lady told me she remember she saw it.
Very disappointing experience especially for a long and expensive stay!! I wouldn’t recommend my friends to stay in a place that cannot take responsibility or know what customer service is.

title: Dinner and a show
text: I just returned from an overnight trip into the city where I celebrated my daughter’s  19th birthday, and I cannot say enough about this hotel. Living on Long Island, we come in frequently, and stay at many different hotels, but we have finally found our go to hotel! The staff are fantastic, including Zania, (I hope I got the spelling correct) who checked us in and was so extremely pleasant! The rooms were clean, modern, and the view from the 22nd floor was amazing! Thank you for a wonderful stay, and we cannot wait to return!

title: Check the bathtub if you get a room w/ a tub
text: Good location, cleanliness/maintenance is questionable -when they finally moved us into a diff room due to clogged bath tub for 3 nights that would fill up to our ankles (maintenance came 3x to 'fix' it), my friend and I both got bit by something and this is the first time ever that I have a permanent mark on my leg from being bit by some kind of (hotel) bug. Didn't see any flying around the room so must be hidden in the bed??The worst part was the tub not draining and the female manager suggested we use the shower in the gym next door b/c they didn't have rooms available -wtf?? Not worth the price per night! One front desk guy was nice enough to give us vouchers to use at the restaurant, but still, trying to take a shower and water that won't drain at all Eww I'd rather not have a voucher.

title: Great hotel and location
text:
We loved our stay at this hotel.  The staff were always friendly and helpful. The room was very modern and comfortable. Loved the view, and the location was perfect.  Very close to the subway and train station.  We never had a chance to try the concierge lounge for food, but did grab water there a few times.   At check in we were told they had a rooftop lounge we could go to, but when we tried to we were told it was closed for cleaning after a private event.  We were also there during the Midtown blackout which meant our food in the refrigerator was ruined but luckily our room never got too hot. 

The first night we noticed that the chain was broken on the room darkening shade and it could not be pulled down.  My husband called the front desk and they had someone immediately come and fix it.  Same immediate response when we requested towels. Bed was very comfortable, safe is in the room, plenty of closet hangers and small but adequate counter space in the bathroom.  The only thing we wish we would have known is that there was an entrance/exit on 34th street as well.  An employee told us that as we were leaving (giving us the quickest way to the train station).  That would have saved some walking time on all our other days.  

Overall it was one of the better hotel experiences we have had and we would definitely stay here again.

title: Great stay, location and staff
text: I just completed a stay at the Renaissance and it was wonderful.  The room was clean and a decent size for NYC.  It was very very hot in NYC and the staff was great about handing out bottled water.  The location couldn’t be better for travelers using Penn Station.  It was also surprisingly quiet.  The elevators are all computerized which was a bit freaky since once inside there were no buttons to press.  A special shout out to Guy at the bell hop station who helped arrange a private driver for us.  He took care of all the details, treated my family and me like royalty and everything went like clockwork!

title: Great Hotel
text: Everything was wonderful here - from check in to check out.  All personnel were extremely helpful, pleasant and courteous.  A hiccup was the keyless entry didn't work all the time and then my room key stopped working.  Our room was wonderful, the view terrific.  I will say that the food at the club could have been a tad better.  The warm apps weren't so warm.  Maybe a warmer near by.  They ran out of clean silverware - used plastic until they were cleaned.  Also, having the same food all the time (except for one or two items) became boring.  Loved the room service menu's name.  Loved the hang tag for breakfasts name. I would absolutely stay here again.

title: Excellent hotel
text:
The Renaissance New York Midtown Hotel far exceeded my expectation.  The hotel was modern and very welcoming.  The check-in process was fast and staff was very pleasant during my staff.  My city view king sized room was outstanding.  The room was emaculant and house keeping did an outstanding job daily keeping the hotel and my room very inviting and emaculant.  It was great coming back to the hotel every night to my room.  The bell boy, bartender and staff throughout the hotel were all very pleasant and professional.  The security at the hotel was very efficient and I felt safe returning the the hotel every evening.  I like that you need your room access car to access the elevator.  

The location of the hotel far exceeded my expectation.  3 minutes from Penn Station and minutes from all the various subway lines one would need to get around the city.  From JFK terminal 8, I took the JFK air train ($5) and Long Island Railroad ($7.50) and arrived at Penn Station in about 40 minutes. Penn Station has and is undergoing a full makeover.  I was surprised to see how beautiful and safe Penn Station is now compared to years past.  There is a strong police present in Penn Station and the homeless problem from years past was not visible.  

There are numerous dinning options near the hotel and my favorite bagel shop (Best Bagel & Coffee) is located across the street from the hotel.  

The Renaissance New York Midtown Hotel will be my new go to hotel.  I look forward to my next stay in November.

title: Great, spacious, modern hotel with an awesome huge Gym!
text:
New modern hotel, the best I've had so far in that area.
Great location.
Had 2 rooms. The first, a surprisingly large "City View" room on the 20th floor. Modern, clean, quiet, highly-equipped, and with excellent city views. The other room (on the 8th floor) was much smaller and with only street view, but otherwise had similar fine attributes as the other room and with the addition of a nice reading sofa by the window.
Large lobby on the 6th floor, comfortable and well designed. 
Effective staff service.
Awesome Gym! Huge (occupying 2 full hotel floors!), free 24/7 access to hotel guests, and with super professional and well-maintained equipment!
On the downside, weak water pressure in the shower.

title: Better than Mediocre in Midtown
text:
The hotel is close walking distance to Madison Square Garden, Penn Station, and obviously plenty of shops and restaurants.

The lobby isn’t huge.  It can become busy and congested.  Front desk staff were helpful enough.

The king room I had was New York size a/k/a small.  Not unusual.  The bed was comfortable.  The flat screen on the wall was a good size.  The shower is one of those where there is partially shaded glass looking out to the bed and window.  There is a safe and a little fridge.  There is a sitting chair.

The club lounge was not very big, but it was fine.  Breakfast offerings were slightly above average for such lounges.  There are coke products and large waters available.

Their gym is actually a full-size Planet Fitness located on the second floor.  This is great and allows you to have a complete workout.  

This is a good hotel overall.

title: What a find!!!!
text: Terrific stay. Many choices in NYC, and I lucked into this Renaissance. I chose the hotel for its location - across the street from Penn Station, subways and buses. Excellent. But there is so much more to this hotel than convenience. Staff extra-special friendly, helpful, efficient and professional. Rooms very comfortable, well maintained and clean (what you expect in a Ren hotel). Executive Lounge has so many choices but you can still have a healthy breakfast. Coffee and cold drinks supplied during the day. Evening snacks could be dinner - but, hey, this is NY and you want to try the myriad of restaurants in the neighborhood. Felt super safe in hotel. No one can get in unless they belong there. This will be my go to hotel in NY. Special thanks to Richard and Caleb for enhancing our stay. I wish I could remember the ladies' names at the front desk. Everyone was super.  Thank you.

title: Great Hotel In Midtown New York
text:
This hotel is great for anyone traveling to New York City. I stayed here during my first visit to NYC and I found it to be a great location for getting my bearings. The hotel was either new or recently renovated at the time of my stay. I didn’t interact with the staff very often, but I didn't have any issues while I was there.
