The room was a bit small for my personal preference, but I think that’s kind of the norm for New York City. I’m sure there are rooms which are much smaller. The shower and bathroom, however, made up for it! They were excellent! I loved the climate control mirror so when you got out of the shower it wasn’t steamed up. I didn’t use any of the food and beverage outlets so I can’t attest to them. They also had smart elevators which were relatively new at the time.

There are several points of interest within walking distance. Madison Square Garden was one block south of the hotel. Penn Station was about two blocks away. The world famous Macy’s Department Store was about a block away. Times Square was only about a 10 minute walk from the hotel. You also had great views of The Empire State Building each time you left the hotel. Not exactly sure how far the hotel is from the ESB, but I imagine no more than a 15 minute walk. 

This hotel is perfect for anyone who might be traveling for business or pleasure. If you want to stay in the hustle but not be caught up in the incredibly touristic areas, this hotel is great!

title: Thank You Sebastian
text:
Shoutout to Sebastian for making our stay a memorable one. You were able to turn my girlfriend sad day into a joyful one. I hope you get promoted one day. My girl friend wrote this ....... 
“Sebastian, Sebastian, Sebastian! 
I mean honestly, he does hospitality right! 
Let me tell you, me and my boyfriend planned to leave NY at 3:00pm we celebrated my birthday yesterday and only planned to stay here for a day. 
Unfortunately there was an accident and the Lincoln tunnel was closed off, traffic backed up for hours, and the G.W bridge bridge barely operating. After 2 hours in traffic we decided to just stay here again. I was distressed! I mean crying, upset, anxiety level through the roof. Because NY is overwhelming with all the people and the hustle and bustle, along with me not wanting to stay in NY for the holiday. Anyway, we got to the renaissance hotel took the elevator to the 6th floor and there he was! Sebastian! He checked us in professional yet let his personality shine through which made me so comfortable. He informed me about the complimentary drinks in the lobby,  bars the hotel has to offer, a little bit about the live DJ (Which they have every first Wednesday of the month). I couldn’t tell if I walked in looking stressed, or if he could just tell I was having a TERRIBLE day. Sebastian turned it around just by being nice and friendly, understanding, listening to my complaints. 
Even put is on a high floor with a view without us having to ask. 
He’s perfect! I mean he didn’t even ask me to wrote this review but GREAT HOSPITALITY should not go unnoticed. 
Sebastian should not go unnoticed! 
Thank you. You honestly made my day!”

title: Excellent service, Location, and room
text: Excellent facility and staff. We had one little hiccup with the delivery of our baggage and they (Richard and Ronald) went above expectations to make it up to us. The restaurant has great meals and generous portions. I'll definately be using this hotel several more times in this next year! Or whenever I come to New York!

title: Good business location
text: This isn’t a business hotel, really, but it’s got easy access to Penn Station for an overnight stay and a quick meeting before back to the train. Well appointed rooms, comfy bed. Great HVAC. Lively bar scene. Helpful staff. I attended a meeting in the hotel as well and the room and amenities were terrific. Beautiful space with lots of light. Good for a board meeting.

title: Great hotel even though there are some issues
text:
We stayed at this hotel for 8 nights. The check-in was fast (we arrived at the hotel around 23:30) even though the entrance to the hotel can be a bit difficult to find if looking for the hotel on Google Maps. We were welcomed with a voucher for two drinks as we were visiting New York for our honeymoon which was a nice touch. We booked a Standard King Room on the 13th level, the room was nice, clean and big enough. The view was great as well. We had issues with the noise, the air-con units making a buzzing noise. We have complained to the front desk for in each of the first two mornings and after being shown other Standard King Rooms at different levels and sides of the hotel that seemed to have the same noise issues we decided to stay in the original room. We were asked to pay for an upgrade as a solution even though we were happy with the room but not the noise which we declined as the solution seemed exaggerated. The first person we spoke to on the Front Desk can do with a bit of training, he was not very good at speaking with customers. The rest of the people we have dealt with were nice and much much better at speaking with a customer. We have however made a written complain and on our third morning and by the evening we were upgraded to a Skyline Suite with 1.5 bathrooms on the 36th floor and we were given a $30 voucher to use at the Versa restaurant. The suite was much quieter (not completely quiet), so we could sleep much better for the rest of the nights. The upgrade was a nice touch after all the haggling. 

The WiFi is fast, the Smart TVs can be used with Netflix, the toiletries are from & Aveda.

Ice machines can be found on different levels. You can ask for slippers and bathrobes plus bottled water from the Front Desk. 

The rooms have many USBs so you won't need a convertor. 

Beware that the area is quite noisy so if you're a first time visiter you might have issues especially if you're a light sleeper even though the hotel is advertised as soundproofed. The area is great to get to all the parts of Manhattan.

title: Perfect Stay for our Wedding Night!
text: Every detail about our stay was absolutely perfect. We booked the balcony skyline suite but we were upgraded to the Empire Suite, which was a beautifully appointed room with every amenity we could ever need (including a pool table!). The service was excellent from the bell staff and the front desk, to the engineers helping us with any questions we had about the room, and everyone we interacted seemed eager to help. They also brought us prosecco and macarons after checking in, what a great touch! Thank you so much to the staff at Renaissance Midtown for taking care of us on this very special day!

title: Two sons birthday holiday
text: Perfect location, near everything, Subways, eateries etc. Staff very friendly and helpful, hotel has superb facilities, rooms are excellent, with amazing views. Restaurant has excellent views of NYC, as does the bar. Will definitely stay here again.

title: Disappointed
text:
I chose this hotel after (1) receiving a glowing report from my friend of her stay last year and (2) my experience of the Renaissance brand from the truly exceptional Phuket property.  

There's no doubt that the hotel is fantastically located, within a stones throw of Penn Station, Macy's and 2 subway lines; it is modern and stylish; the lifts are not as horrid as some reviewers claim; the bar and restaurant are pleasant environments; Aveda toiletries are way better than the usual Marriott provisions; rooms are nice enough but typically NYC small; the Club Lounge is an oasis of calm (but note that the usual lounge alcoholic drinks are not offered here, and at the weekend it really is just a coffee machine and a fridge of soft drinks, no food, not even a cookie).

My disappointment stems from a variety of service let-downs and the absence of any real acknowledgement of my Marriott Bonvoy Titanium status.  I've raised the multiple issues with Justin Elliott and apparently they are 'being looked in to'.  

I chose this hotel over the Ritz Carlton and JW Marriott Essex House to splash my hard earned Bonvoy points, as I anticipated that I'd be treated really well - and surely better to be treated brilliantly in a less good hotel than indifferently in a better one.  After staying at The Renaissance, I regret my decision, even more so on realising that there are Marriott group hotels in a similar location for a lot less points - it was the worst of both worlds, 'expensive' but without the 'value'.  Prior to this stay I would have recommended & chosen Renaissance hotel without hesitation - now I'd not be so confident.

What a shame.......

title: Vista su Midtown New York
text: Abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel per 7 notti al 21° piano con vista sulla città. È situato in una posizione ottima per visitare la grande mela, non è in una zona caotica, ne in una via trafficata, a circa 200 metri c'è la fermata della metro Penn Station che collega tutta New York. Camera spaziosa, con armadio e cassaforte, divano sulle vetrate così da ammirare il panorama, una lunga mensola che fa da scrivania e porta accessori, frigo, ferro da stiro, asse, vari cuscini ecc..letto king size ultra comodo!! Bagno e doccia grande con vetrata opaca, grande specchio e varie prese a muro. Pulizia e cortesia di tutto lo staff.  Unico piccolo problema (frequente negli hotel a New York) condotto dell'aria condizionata generale sempre in funzione, causando rumore e aria nella camera, risolto subito con lo staff tappando il condotto con del nastro adesivo!:) Jezebel dello staff numero 1!! :) Lobby e Versa (ristorante/bar) bellissimi e molto accoglienti..Palestra H24. Ascensori veloci e sempre disponibili. Ci ritorneremo un giorno.. :)

title: Nothing Noteworthy
text: New York City hotels are such poor values.  You pay a lot and don't get much in return.  Absolutely nothing stands out as particularly positive about this hotel.  Maybe it's location in midtown, but that's it.  Business travel stay, won't return.

title: Stay Here
text: As a Marriott Titanium I have high expectations on quality and service. As a very frequent hotel guest in New York i do not. This hotel is a gem. Unlike its large sister properties such as the Marriott Times square or Sheraton, this hotel delivers on every level. A quieter calmer and much prettier version of the other big city tourist destinations. From the friendly check in, to the wonderful restaurant to the beautifully decorated rooms to the perfect location ( across street from  Macys and Starbucks)quiet serene yet lovely executive club, this is the place for you to stay. As I was writing this review, the hotel guest services manager Natasha was able to come through on securing the points for my stay. This is how a hotel should be and if you want to stay midtown, this is the place to stay. Take it from one who is picky about hotels!!

title: Unexpected
text:
The positive part: The room was ok, functional. The common areas of the hotel good, the location excellent.
The negative part: They stole money from the safe. We made the claim, they promised to give us an answer and, OBVIOUSLY, they did not give us ANY TYPE OF ANSWER.
Recommendation: find another hotel, if this seems good in relation to price-quality, make no mistake, it is more expensive than it says.

title: Enjoyable stay in a Terrace Room
text:
I stayed at the Renaissance New York Midtown for 1 night and really enjoyed it. 
•	Location: The location is very conveniently located to Penn Station if you’re flying into Newark. It is also convenient to access other Metro Lines and tourist attractions.
•	Service: I was really impressed with the service overall. They also did a great job in explaining the Bonvoy benefits. A special thanks and shout out to Cory who helped me get settled in and refreshed after a red-eye flight. The staff at breakfast were also very helpful and friendly despite being very busy.
•	Facilities: The lounge was nice and spacious and good place to grab a coffee and non-alcoholic beverage. I found the bar style seating near the window perfect to work. 
•	Room: I used my Bonvoy credits to upgrade to a Terrace room. Compared to other rooms in New York City, it was quite spacious and bright. The décor was unique and interesting and the important things like the bed was comfortable and the bathroom very clean. The Terrace was a nice touch to enjoy outdoor space but it was not very private, which is okay. I can also imagine that if people use it to party or for gatherings, it could get noisy. Biggest downside to the room? The burn marks from cigarettes in the carpet and patio furniture. 
•	Bar/Restaurant:  I had the breakfast buffet at the restaurant and enjoyed it, especially the bacon! Next time, I'd order off the menu though as the options all sound good. The bar is pretty neat too and offers up a view so I recommend grabbing a drink here. 
•	Overall: I’d definitely stay here again for a pleasure trip as a home base to explore the city. Compared to other hotels in NYC, you can get decent nightly rates here during less busy times and it is definitely worth it.

title: ¡No ir, roban y no se hacen cargo!
text:
Estuve hospedado 8 noches en el hotel. Las instalaciones son modernas y las habitaciones son correctas. Buena ubicación y excelente relación precio calidad.

Pero lo peor es que me robaron plata de la habitación y nadie se hizo cargo. Volví una noche y no tenía el dinero que había guardado en la caja fuerte. Luego de hacer los reclamos correspondientes, quedaron en avisarme cómo seguir, pero no me mandaron nada.

Si van a hospedarse en este alojamiento, cuiden todas sus pertenencias y no se confíen de la caja fuerte. Los empleados roban y nadie allí se hace cargo.

title: Nice Hotel.  Only a couple of “hiccups”
text:
I’m in NY at least once a year for a theater trip with my adult daughter.  Usually stay at the Westin Times Square for its proximity to all theaters, but decided to try the Renaissance this trip due to a slightly better rate and great proximity to Penn Station (daughter took train in to city).  The lobby area is clean and inviting.  A bit loud during the daytime hours, but was surprised how quiet it was at night.  On our second night we stopped for a drink at the hotel bar.  The bartender (wish I would have gotten his name) was pleasant, even though it was apparent that he was starting to pick things up (we had about 45 minutes before closing).  Drinks were great and it was wonderful to have a bar area where we could have a nice drink and actually here conversation.

Hotel rooms were as pictured.  We were apparently in a “larger” corner room (an upgrade due to my Bonvoy Platinum status).  It was still NYC small.  Room was immaculate.  Great room darkening shades and could not hear any street noise on the 33rd floor.  Nice coffee pot, desk to work and bathroom amenities.  Downside was absolutely no drawer space at all and if I wanted to unpack (which I did—had been in city earlier in the week on business), my only shelf option was the top rack of the closet—something that was hard for me as a relatively short person (5’4”) to reach.

The front desk staff was great at check in.  Very friendly and made sure I had access to the Club Lounge to get some work done prior to our room being ready (I was there by 11 am so this was not unexpected).  As others have mentioned, it would be nice if there was some continental breakfast or something in the Club lounge-and also would be nice if they had out some “snacks” during the day as do many other marriott club lounges (nothing fancy—nuts, snack mix, granola bars?). Lounge was comfortable and inviting and a good place to get some work done in the early afternoon.

A nice change.  We will likely be back.

title: 25th wedding anniversary New York
text: We visited the Renaissance at the end of May for our 25th wedding anniversary. The hotel itself was excellent. Great location. Very close to the Empire state building, times square, rockerfellar centre and You could also walk to Central Park in about 40 minutes. Check in was very efficient, you enter the hotel at street level and check in on the 6th floor. During check in we were given a voucher for two complimentary drinks at Versa which I thought was a nice touch. The room was very good, you get exactly what you see on the hotel website. We could see the statue of liberty in the distance and Madisson Square gardens was just across the road. Housekeeping were very good, I think we only bumped into them once during our 1 week stay and the room was always perfect on our return. Didn't dine in the hotel so I'm unable to comment on the food options. Read some negative things about the hotels lift/elevator system you have to pick your floor and scan your key before entering the lift as there are no buttons to select a floor inside, everybody who just jumped in without picking a floor seemed to take it in good humour. This is the only negative I have about our stay and it was in Versa on the Saturday 1st of June. We had checked out and had booked a taxi for 18:00. We had been in Versa a few times previously during our stay. It is a good big bar/restaurant. Bar staff very good, great selection of drinks. We had returned to the hotel went to Versa and ordered some drinks and went outside to the outside terrace area which was quiet because most people were watching the football. Ordered a second drink and had just started this and a female member of staff approached and informed us the area we were in was closing for a private function but we could move to the area at the top of the terrace to continue our drinks. This was fair enough but within 5 minutes of sitting down in this area a male member of staff a guy with a tartan blazer now said we would have to leave this area also. His attitude wasn't great he had more of a bull in a China shop approach to customer care. We were eventually able to finish our and leave via the main Versa area and not down the fire exit as advised. Overall we had a great stay at this hotel and the experience was good. Only the bit at the end tarnished it a bit. As I said earlier the photos you see on the Web of this hotel are pretty accurate. I have only attached one photo and this was the area we were allowed to finish our drinks on the last day. For a bit of balance I've also attached one of what you can see from the terrace.

Les points positifs sont l’emplacement, la propreté, le décor de ce grand hôtel moderne et les chambres qui sont spacieuses pour Manhattan. 
Toutefois en cas de souci le staff est peu efficace et cherche surtout la meilleure solution pour eux. J’ai vraiment dû insister pour changer de chambre car le chauffage s’était cassé. J’ai laissé la chambre toute la journée et malgré la confirmation que tout était bon - chauffage toujours cassé et un technicien est venu à minuit pour confirmer que rien ne peut être fait. La réception propose des couvertures supplémentaires et confirme la possibilité de changer à la première heure le matin. Puis on m’explique que ma chambre expecteé a dû être donnée à des clients louant deux chambres connexes. L’alternative offerte était, successivement - une chambre à moindre coût sans remboursement, une beaucoup plus petite, une aménagée pour personne en chaise roulante ou bien changer deux fois de chambre durant le séjour. Il faut noter que chaque fois on me la présentait comme l’équivalent, et que ce n’est qu’après visite qu’on cherchait une autre option. Et ainsi de suite. 
Ce n’est qu’après longues et multiples discussions et intervention du manager, qu’une chambre comme celle que j’avais bookee m’a été donnée. A titre d’excuse on m’a offert un panier comportant quelques snacks et des vouchers à valoir dans l’hôtel. 
Le grand moins est également le manque d’espace de rangement. 
Personnellement je ne reviendrai pas dans cet hôtel.

title: Nice hotel in a good location
text: We stayed at the Renaissance for 3 nights in May.  We found the room to be very clean and efficient.  The hotel is well located in mid-town and the service was attentive.  A great hotel for the price.  We will stay there again in the future.

title: Abusive Managers and Staff
text: Great property and lovely staff, except the front desk.  I am a Titanium level Marriott Rewards member (pretty high up) but that mattered not.  I checked in was offered a late check out of 6pm, a nice gesture.  On check out day at 430pm I was in my room with the do not disturb sign on and received a knock on the door.  I told them I was leaving shortly.  A few minutes later, I received a call from the front desk and I informed them the same.  A few minutes later, I received another call from the front desk, same message.  A few minutes later, I received call from someone at the front desk who was quite angry and threatened to charge my credit card if I did not leave immediately.  I actually left the hotel around 5pm.  What a great experience.  However, it gets better.  My AMEX was in fact charged for a 2nd night stay.  I called your hotel the next day and spoke with "manager" at the front desk and I explained the above to her.  She seemed to have empathy and assured me that she would refund the amount but I also asked her to provide the name of the person who made the decision to charge my AMEX; she stated she would call me back.  Nothing.  I called your hotel today and spoke with Marta at the front desk.  She informed me that Ms. Natasha Defrank (sp?) was the person who authorized the 2nd charge on my card.  So, what happened?  Failure #1, I was offered a 6pm check out that was not honored.  Failure #2, I was threatened by the staff.  Failure #3, the person I spoke to after checking out made two promises, both were not kept.  There are many hotels in NYC and this one should be avoided.

title: Excellent location and rooms
text: Spent 5 days in New York and cannot thing of a better location. Very close to time square and 7th Avenue action yet quiet, modern and spacious clean rooms. Prices were high but seems something was happening in New York that week. Buffet breakfast during weekend is very poor. Only a la crate during the week. They need to do better on both. Internet connection was very fast and unlimited.

title: Phenomenal property and excellent staff
text: This hotel is a hidden gem. Brand-new. Beautiful, modern rooms. Excellent Concierge Lounge. Huge thank you to Justin Ellison for going above-and-beyond to make our stay so perfect. Loved the Skyline Rooms. Will definitely be back.

title: Nice hotel but dishonnest: my account has been unduly debited of $480
text:
Such a disappointment after a wonderful week in New York: the hotel unduly charged me $480 without telling me.

When I checked in I had to give my Visa card for a card inprint. When I checked out on April 16, 2019, I wasn't told anything, I wasn't given any receipt, I wasn't asked to pay anything (because I paid the whole invoice 4 months before), but after 3 days my account was debited of $480...
I tried to reach the hotel, I sent an email but after one month I still don't have any answer...
Conclusion : don't trust this hotel, don't give them your Visa card.

title: New hotel in the heart of midtown
text: This is a new hotel on West 35th Street, between 7th and 8th Avenues.  It's perfectly located in the heart of midtown, one block from Penn Station, Herald Square and various key subway lines, and a short walk to Times Square.  The rooms are beautifully designed and decorated with all sorts of modern amenities.  They are bright and airy with lots of natural light.  I was on the 13th floor and it was quiet.  Not a lot of street noise.  The staff is friendly.  There is a restaurant on the 5th floor which has both an indoor and an outdoor seating area.

title: Centralt hotel på Manhattan
text: Underbar utsikt från vårt rum med Skyline. Sköna sängar & välstädade rum. Trevlig personal & kanonläge med T-bana utanför. Empire State Building & Madison Square Garden precis i närheten. Kunde inte blivit mer lyckat för oss som besökte New York för första gången.

title: Accommodating to the Next Level
text: I arrived quite a bit earlier than expected and was sleep deprived from taking a red eye from Los Angeles. Caleb Gaillard was more than accommodating upon my arrival; he acknowledged that I was a bit early, but he would see what he could do. He was able to rearrange rooms to allow me to check in at get some sleep. He then went above and beyond to offer me a bit to eat as he could tell that I was famished. Caleb genuinely cared and made me feel welcome the second I stepped off the elevator. Its employees, like Caleb, that ensure my continued loyalty to Renaissance/Marriott.

title: Great Hotel
text: We traded in our SPG points and stayed here for a couple of nights on vacation from Singapore in 2016. Excellent location, clean and well-appointed rooms. Spacious and roomy for a New York Hotel. It was very new when we booked it, so it was really very clean. Right across from Penn Station. Perfect and convenient location with a kid.

title: FIRST TIME AT THIS PROPERTY: EXCELLENT STAY
text: SUPER friendly front desk staff - accommodating & helped me check in super early (1PM). As Platinum BONVOY member I got access to a beuatifulm well-stocked & clean Club Lounge. They offered HUMUNGOUS LITER BOTTLES of water! WOW! Modern room, great view of Statue of Liberty, modern touches in the room. Bright/modern/large bathroom with tiled walk-in glass shower. I would recommend this hotel & return. Excellent AC operation; room is great.

title: Great people
text: “Attitude is everything “ is written on the wall in the lobby and we found the attitude of everyone from check in staff to bell hop to pre arrival contact to be excellent. We were delighted as platinum members to be given a large corner room with bathtub and shower and had a good stay. The only slight disappointment was no breakfast available at the weekend in the club lounge but points offered instead. We ate  across the road at Andrew’s coffee shop and were satisfied with that. Great location and great people.

title: Great One night stay
text: I am lucky enough to be Marriott Bonvoy Platinum member. I stayed in midtown after arriving at Penn Station. The hotel is 2 streets away from Penn Station I was upgraded to a 6th floor room that had an outdoor patio and the hotel has a 24x7 club room that offered a comprehensive breakfast buffet. My business is in NJ but I’ll stay here again and take the PATH train to my office.

title: Weekendresa
text: Underbart hotell vi huttade hotellet via hotels.com. det ligger bra till på en mindre hata. Ungdomlig stil och mycket rena ovh fräscha rum. Vårt rum var normalstort med en skön kingsbed. Det finns en riktigt bra restaurang i hotellet, Versa och en trevlig topbar

title: Nice and quirky, but....
text:
As a Marriott Titanium, was upgraded to a corner room (was hoping for a junior suite.) The rate I paid was reasonable and that's why I chose the\is hotel - and also because I had good experiences at other Renaissance hotels... but there isn't that much consistency with this brand.

This is not a quiet hotel. The music starts as you enter the ground floor hallways, goes up a few decibels in the elevators to the 6th Floor lobby, where it continues. In my room on floor 32, I could hear voices through the HVAC piing, from the outside, and inexplicably, mechanical equipment noises above the bathroom. And on Saturday night, the street revelers.

The room was nice, and could use a dresser or more storage. The bed is excellent. Aveda toiletries were great. Staff was always professional and pleasant. The breakfast at the lounge was OK, but the weekend selection at the restaurant was wonderful. The   lounge was nice with a selection of non-alcoholic drinks. 

Overall, appreciated it but not my style.

title: Home Away from Home
text:
As a frequent business traveler, one may find it difficult to find a place to call a place a true "home-away-from-home" - the Renaissance Midtown in NYC delivers on all accounts.

Check-in begins with an attentive + friendly Bellstaff who go out of their way to assist both incoming + outgoing guests. Stepping out into their lobby is only enhanced by the front-desk team who have time and time again, accommodated all and any additional requests that I may have had.

The location is perfect, the rooms, luxuriously acquainted, the beds heavenly. 

If only VERSA began handling the In-Room Dining, their Burger is dangerously delicious. It's a "good thing" you need to visit their fifth floor to get it. (Which btw, is one of the most underrated restaurant, lounge, bars in the city) If you're in the mood for something more laid-back, the lobby-floor bar is fantastic as well.

While I could continue to ramble endlessly, the true magic of this hotel lies within the people who operate and have fashioned a true representation of what hospitality should be about - finding a way away from home.

Thank you @Team Renaissance.

title: Very nice hotel with some minor issues
text:
In general, I love Renaissance hotels. These hotels have a refined design while having the amenities of a more traditional chain hotel. The Renaissance Midtown Hotel is no exception. The public spaces and rooms are beautiful.

We have booked a room with a view. We have been assigned a fairly spacious room on the 32nd floor with a magnificent view of the New York skyline. The only problem in the bedroom is the lack of storage space. There is no chest of drawers. Only one shelf in the cupboard can be used; the others are reserved for the safe, the fridge or the coffee machine. For one person, it can be fine. With two, it's difficult to settle in properly. 

We tried to have a drink at the hotel bar on the 5th floor. In addition to being crowded, the noise is unbearable. The restaurant is adjacent to the bar; needless to say, it is not a relaxation area. It's more like a W hotel than a Renaissance. At breakfast, the place is pleasant. The menu is a little off the beaten track and the prices are correct.

This hotel is located just behind Macy's and is close to several metro lines. The reception is located on the 6th floor. You must select your floor before taking the elevator. The system shows you the number of the elevator assigned to you. It's a little complicated at first, but you get used to it quickly. However, one morning, it took us 15 minutes to get out of the hotel because the elevators were so busy. Some people had to take the stairs because it was so full. An adjustment of the elevator management software must be made to avoid these bottlenecks.

In short, a very nice hotel but with some problems: insufficient storage, elevators not always efficient and very noisy bar/restaurant.

title: Perfect Location Trendy Hotel
text: Had the corner room with a beautiful skyline view from the 35th Floor. Excellent location walking distance from shopping outlets, Bryant park, madison square garden, times square, etc.. Friendly staff (I recommend they book you the lift to the airport). Trendy vibes with a nice “rooftop” sports bar. Good sized rooms by NYC standards. Comfy beds. Good amenities. Nice marble bathroom. Prices vary widely from night to night, from simple to double or even triple based on occupancy. Lifts can be annoying especially if you are on a high floor even if “optimised”. Good soundproof on high floor despite being close to busy avenues.  All in all quite convenient and excellent value for money when the price does not spike on peak days.

title: High hopes, disappointed
text: I generally like Renaissance Hotels - usually good service, good rooms.   I was only there for a couple of days for business.   As a Gold member, I have room requests and none of them were done when I got there.   I had a number of requests (more towels, turndown, etc) of the staff and none of them were done - amazingly bad.   Plus after you establish wifi with your devices, it does not readily reconnect back to the wifi - very frustrating.  Below average for a Renaissance Hotel.   Great location mid-town near Penn Station, Madison Square Garden, Empire State Building.

title: Great Value in Midtown
text: When I say "value", I don't mean it's exactly inexpensive, because it's not that. But for the price range it's in, I think it delivers a lot. It has a definite luxury feel to it, but at a reasonable price. The location is great, a very short walk from Penn Station. The people at the front desk and on the first floor reception were were friendly and helpful. I've read some complaints about the elevator system, but I think it moves very efficiently if you know how to use it. And when we checked in, the person at the front desk took me over to the elevators to show me how they worked. We never ate in the restaurant, but we did go to the bar one night and our bartender was great. And the indoor/outdoor arrangement of VERSA made for a pretty nice atmosphere. The room was very modern and cool, and had a great view, including the top of the Chrysler building. You could crack open the window for fresh air. And the bathroom was very nice, especially the rain shower. For breakfast, I recommend forgoing the $26 breakfast buffet (no offense, Marriott Corporation!), and heading across the street to Best Bagels, where all the bagels, other baked goods, and breakfast sandwiches are made fresh. There's also a Starbucks on the corner and a good diner (Andrew's) right across 7th Ave from that. Having the Planet Fitness in the building was very convenient - much better than your average hotel exercise room. The hotel felt very secure, due to a combination of the elevator system, the staff on the first floor, and reception being on the 6th floor.

title: Wonderful views
text:
We had an exceedingly comfortable double-queen room on the 35th floor with amazing views all the way down to Statue of Liberty and beyond.

The decor is fairly luxurious if a little dark. The bathroom was well equipped and the whole room was very clean. As well as the two beds we had a desk and a chaise-lounge. 

The service was very friendly, and I echo the shout out below to Josh on front-desk who was very gregarious and helpful. We didn't use the restaurant so can't comment.

It's New York, so yes the room was a little small (and associated restricted storage space, especially hanging) and yes the drinks were quite expensive in the bar.

Unlike others, we didn't have much of a problem with waiting for the lifts. Perhaps we avoiding peak hours.

Location is very convenient: Penn Station, Macy's, Empire State Building are all on your doorstep, 4 different subway lines are within a couple of blocks, and there are delis, bars and coffee-shops right on the same block.

title: Nice location
text: I really like the hotel except the breakfast was so so.  The other complaint every had was the elevator system.  No buttons on the inside and programmed from the outside and extremely slow and annoying.   Every time we used them guests were complaining about the set up and sometimes spending 20 minutes getting in and out.  Beds very comfortable.

title: Beautiful hotel in Midtown
text:
The hotel location is perfect, the restaurant and bar was very hip and had great drinks and food.
Special shout out to Mr Josh Hunter at the front desk. His personality and guest relations was above and beyond. 
Everyone at the hotel was super nice, helpful and welcoming. The room was amazing with a great view of the city.

title: Amazing hotel and great restaurant!
text: We enjoyed our stay.Our room consisted of 1 king bed-City view. Over all, very clean and quiet. We did breakfast,too.(kinda pricey but great!) The location was great for walking distance. My husband was very pleased. We will be back with our kids,soon!

title: Our New Home Away From Home
text:
We were on the hunt for a new Midtown hotel after our former favorite was dropped from the Marriott Bonvoy program. We didn't care for the Times Square Renaissance so didn't expect much from this one.. and boy were we wrong.

This is a great hotel. I found the room to be very clean and modern. The room was a little tight with 2 queens but we typically request a king which my husband has had and said makes for a more spacious feel. Although we were in Midtown, we had a beautiful view of the Hudson River and the Statue of Liberty. We were also really pleased with how quiet the room was. I know you avoid a lot of street noise being 27 floors up but we heard nothing above us or even from the hallway. We also appreciated the efficient and fast elevators- a common issue in NYC hotels. 

The club lounge is a great feature of this hotel. It is frustrating when the lounge is tied to having a room on a certain floor. You then feel like you're at the mercy of your complimentary upgrade. The lounge was very spacious and the offerings were impressive. We were only able to grab breakfast so I can't speak to other times of the day. We did pop in and grab waters before heading up for the night.

My husband typically stays here on business but on this trip, we had our kids. I wouldn't say anyone cared or that they stood out, but it was more of a business crowd during the week. Also, the hotel has a bit of a sexy vibe (hello, elevator #4) so it wouldn't be my top choice for a family stay!

The staff we encountered were all really pleasant and helpful. My husband travels to NYC several times a month and plans to make this his new home away from home.

title: Small prison like rooms
text:
I am a frequent traveler and I am always looking to try different hotels.  This Renaissance always had high rates and when the rates dipped, I took a chance.  My room was clean, the elevators worked, the club lounge had great non alcoholic beverage options 24 hours per day.  If you wanted to shop Macy's you are a block away and if you want to see anything at Madison Square Garden you are also 1 block away.  

This all said, the hotel is located on a VERY busy crosstown street.  As Manhattan has grown, many streets have become more limited cross town, so 35th street is a BUSY street.  Many garmet factories, fire engines, police etc.  lots of noise driving by at all hours.  Rooms are quite small and 260 square feet.....I am writing from a 400 square foot room at a different hotel now.....the space is liberating!  NY has big and small and new and old and the new hotels are indeed box like rooms......If you are European or South American, I think they are more used to these sizes....as an American.....with the open concrete ceilings and walls, I felt like I was in a coffin.    This hotel reminds me of a Four Points that was converted last minute to a Renaissance.....it was ok.  

Staff was friendly and helpful and really tried.  out of 4 mornings the wakeup call only was missed one time.  So 3 out of 4 aint bad.  Food at the lobby restaurant was surpsingly delicious and large portioned......I would actually come back just for the Food and Bev at this hotel.  Also friendly helpful staff.  

Mosts guests here appeared to either be working in the garmet industry or were from Europe or South America here to shop.....Macy's one block away.....I met people from Chile, Barcelona, Buenos Aires, Holland and Germany in a relatively short amount of time.  Would I stay here again.....probably not....small rooms and difficulty getting Uburs who want to cross town to get here.....problematic and I would choose a quieter location next time with larger rooms!  Safe Travels to all.

title: Perfect Location
text: We stayed over Christmas weekend.  The location makes it so easy to get around.  Lots of dining options and shopping of course.  Very easy to walk to most places.  Only bad part was when we went to leave one of our bags was missing.  They did jump right on it and reviewed cameras to find out they took it to someone's room.  They called the room and was able to retrieve the bag.  I was a nervous we would not make the flight home but it all worked out.  I would stay again.

title: Hotel Correcto en Manhattan
text: Nos alojamos una semana en este hotel dada su ubicación. A 7 calles de time square, y al lado de Pensilvania Station, por lo que te da mucha movilidad y juego para desplazamientos. A dos pasos caminando de Macys. El hotel es pequeño pero bastante cómodo. Nos ayudaron para reservar restaurantes y con temas turísticos. Siempre tuvimos buena atención por parte de todo el personal. Me volvería a alojar en el sin dudarlo.

title: Comfortable, Stylish and Accommodating
text:
We arrived just after lunch and while the hotel was not able to check us into our room early (check in is 4PM) they did take our luggage and phone number and promised to call us as soon as it was available. The staff was able to suggest some great options for getting some lunch while we waited and a leisurely lunch and a couple of beers later they phoned to let us know everything was ready.

As with most New York hotels the room was not large. It wasn't cramped either though and it was spotlessly clean and comfortable with a large walk in shower, comfortable bed and cozy sitting area.

The hotel is conveniently located next to Penn Station and Madison Square Gardens. Times Square, Broadway and all the major subway lines are within short walking distance and it was very centrally located for travelling either up or downtown to see other sights.

For the entire three days of our visit the staff was constantly friendly and went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. They were also able to help us with an extended departure time on the day we left.

I would be happy to stay here again.

title: Loved this hotel!
text:
I stayed here for a girls weekend during the Christmas season, and it was wonderful!

I arrived early in the morning and tried to check in then, but no such luck.  They did manage to get me in by 1pm, and I just hung out in the lounge until the room was ready.

I am Platinum, so I got free access to the lounge, and breakfast on the weekend which was great!  Also got a great room on a high floor with a really nice view.

The room itself was clean, modern and spacious.  It was fairly quiet at night, too. The bathroom was roomy enough for two ladies trying to get ready at the same time, as well!

The location is perfect - right in the Herald Square area and very close to Penn Station.  I love this area!

Even though some reviewers complain about the elevators, I found them to be very efficient.

All in all, I really loved staying at this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

title: 再訪間違いなしのお勧めホテル
text:
夫婦で個人手配旅行で宿泊しました。Penn駅が目の前で地下鉄＆鉄道移動派には最適な、スタイリッシュで清潔感あるホテルです。私達は31階の北向きのスカイラインビュールームに泊まりました。目の前に高層ビルがなく大きな窓からNYCの街並みが見渡せることができ、満足度は高かったです。ベッドや水周りに問題はありませんでした。快適でした。やや空調の音がうるさいかも知れませんが、その時はAutoでなく、Loに設定して下さい。もっとレストランやバーを利用すれば良かった！
再訪間違いなしです。

title: Great location and service!!
text:
Loved this hotel! Location was walking distance to everything including Time Square, Chelsea market.  It was nice that it was located on a street not quite as busy but walkable everywhere!

As soon as you walk in, the lobby is on the 6th floor.  We felt so welcomed from Alan after a long flight. He offered us water and let us check in hours ahead of check in time!! Then, Joshua was able to check us out early when we had a family emergency!
That kind of flexibility from a hotel made ALL the difference. Will definitely stay again.

title: Legal
text:
Hotel bem localizado, excelente área para refeições, prestadores educados, bom atendimento.
Quarto aconchegante, porém não é grande. O banheiro é pequeno, possui bons armários. 
No geral, é um bom lugar para ficar.

title: Perfect in every way!
text:
We are native New Yorkers and travel back to the city once a month.  This was our first visit to the Renaissance NY Midtown Hotel and also the first time I feel compelled to write a glowing review.  The location is excellent if you are going to the theater, visiting Hudson Yards, Chelsea, the Village or anywhere on the west side.  It is down the black from Penn Station/MSG/Macys and convenient to every subway line.  Since it is a congested area with tons of foot traffic, having the lobby on the 6th floor is very wise.

Sebastian checked us in and was friendly and accommodating.  He explained the workings of the hotel in detail.  Our loyalty to Marriott was recognized and we were upgraded to room on the 23rd floor.  The Club Lounge staff was considerate and helpful.  The food choices were perfect for us - healthy options and small plates.   The "greenness" is also appreciated.  Larger bottles of water as opposed to so many tiny bottles and no Styrofoam in the lounge; master switch in rooms for electricity, ceramic cups and glasses in the rooms as opposed to Styrofoam cups.

The hotel and rooms are designed to reflect the location of the garment center -- totally authentic and beautifully decorated.  The bed was very comfortable and towels were somewhat plush and large.  Aveda toiletries are a nice touch.  Even the shower was superior.  Glass sliding doors which were installed properly.  The shower floor is flush with bathroom floor and all of the water stays in shower.  

The hotel is in a very congested area of NYC and surprisingly quiet.  Of course you hear sirens, construction and trash trucks - but those are background noises of the City.
.  
I do not have one negative comment about this gem of a hotel and will definitely be back.

title: Loved it
text: My husband and I went to see the Knicks and decided to pick the Renaissance, in walking distance to  Madison Square Garden, which I'm glad we did. The room was spacious for the location, the staff was very helpful and nice. We would stay here again, and I would recommend this hotel to friends and family. There is some street noise but it is expected for you are right in the middle of everything. Staff was excellent.

title: MSG concert
text: Looked for a decent hotel close to MSG. This is a 3 year old Joel about 2 blocks away. Courteous staff with a curious hotel design. They make the tight spaces work with design complimenting the garment district. Day of arrival staff was overwhelmed by a private event that cut off bar service. Next morning breakfast was outstanding. Great shower in room. Will book again.

title: Great stay thanks to great service
text: Stayed for tourism with two teenage sons, in a room with two Queen beds. Rooms are stylish, modern and clean and relatively quiet. Views from higher floors are nice. Location within a block or so from three different subway stations as well as Penn Station is a big bonus, making it easy to return to the hotel for a quick stop in the course of the day while exploring all parts of the city. Although the immediate surroundings of the hotel are not the most attractive, ease of subway connections so close by makes all the difference. What made this stay excellent was the on point personal service received from employee CB before and during the stay. Thanks!

title: Great Location
text: Right in the middle of everything - great location. Modern hotels. Room are the usual NY small but nicely decorated and walls are concrete. Service is great. Bar and social areas are lively. Marriott lounge is very nice.

title: The staff are amazing
text:
We chose the hotel as it was central and had a skyline view for a reasonable price. 
On arrival at check in we were asked if we wanted a complimentary upgrade. We were even given a $50 voucher to spend at the bar whilst we waited. 
The room was spacious, clean and we had a view of Madison square gardens and the Statue of Liberty in the distance. 
There was everything we needed in the room but we were disappointed there was no kettle. Just a coffee maker. 
The staff were so friendly throughout our stay and remembered our names. A lot of the guests there were there for business but there were some tourists too.
I would recommend this hotel to anyone. It’s so central. Tick tock diner round the corner is great for a proper New York breakfast. The hotel is really close to Macy’s and Times Square.

title: Comfort, quality and location
text:
This property is next door to Madison Square Garden so it is ideal for seeing an event, but it is also very well situated in midtown for visiting all over the city. As a Platinum member they did treat me very well with an upgrade to 28th floor with great views of the city.  Room is not overly spacious, but very comfortable. The wall of windows gives you a wonderful view day or night. The bathroom was nicely updated, with roomy shower and large sink area. Bed was super comfortable. Room was very quiet.

The Club Lounge offered a very nice evening appetizer spread of meats and cheeses, salads, cookies and snacks. Soft drinks are available 24 hours. 

The front desk staff were extremely pleasant. Check-in was a breeze and they helped explain their secure elevator system that insures guest-only access and optimizes travel to minimize wait time. They had already put me in for late-check-out when I checked in and were very accommodating to make it even  later for me. 

As a long-time SPG member I really enjoyed the new Bonvoy experience at the Marriott property.  We had a great stay in the big city.

title: Fabulous NYC Hotel
text:
When you search the Marriott web site for Manhattan it seems like there's a Marriott property on every block... and more on the way... but this is where you want to stay... the Renaissance is one of the best!  We were looking for a hotel that was close to MSG and this was a perfect 2 minute walk.  As a longtime Marriott Platinum member, I've stayed at many spots in the city.  We were pleasantly surprised here... so impressed with the hotel design, amenities, restaurant and overall service that we will now make this our "go-to" NY spot whenever we can.

Check-in is on the 6th floor... always good to have a ground-floor check-in in a big city.  We were very impressed with Joshua as the front desk.  This guy has such a great attitude and knows what service is.... very professional, courteous and efficient.  This first impression carried over to the rest of our stay... top notch, professional.

Our room on the 25th flooor was very well appointed... just big enough to not be a problem.  The rest of the hotel makes up for the lack of space in the room, so you don't mind as much.

The restaurant, Versa, was very good.  Great layout, food, drinks, service.  Loved hanging out there for dinner while our son attended the concert.  Breakfast in the morning was fine too.

The Club Lounge was nice, although just drinks during the weekend... nice, high-end selections though.

Loved our stay!

title: The best hotel experience I’ve ever had
text: Me and my boyfriend travelled from the UK to celebrate his birthday. As soon as we arrived the man on reception was so polite, we were given drink vouchers for the bar (which is gorgeous) and they upgraded us to a city view no extra cost, check in was fast and simple. The lifts are great - they make the time spent waiting for them a lot less I don’t know why people have left previous reviews which criticise them. The room itself was even nicer than the pictures, it was much bigger than the rooms I’ve experienced before here in NYC. Every single member of staff was friendly, and happy to help with anything and everything. We ate in the VERSA restaurant one night and the food was amazing, the portions were so big we shared nachos to start and I had to take my main back to the room because I was so full! The subway station is 2 minute walk from the entrance and this takes you all over the city which is so useful. Check out was again fast and easy. I cannot fault this hotel, it exceeded our already high expectations and we cannot wait to return

title: Decent Hotel with Small but Comfy Rooms
text: Though the restaurant and room service leave a lot to be desired, I've stayed at this hotel a few times for business due to its proximity to Penn Station (I take the train from DC).  Love the Aveda products, the beds are cozy, the rooms are spotless, the staff is personable and responsive. While the rooms are small (it is New York...) they don't feel too cramped, though I've only stayed solo; it may be a different story with two or three guests... For quick trips in and out of the city, or for those who want to be in the city center, this hotel is a fine option.

title: Good Hotel, Horrible Customer Service
text: The room was good, great location but what turn me off about this place was their customer service. 3 days before my stay I found a lower rate through a different website. Since I had booked through their website I was eligible for their "Best Rate Guarantee". I filed a claim through their website to have my rate lowered. What happened next leads be to believe that this guarantee is complete BS and the Marriott does not care at all about its customer. First I was told that my claim was denied because the site I referenced had a higher rate. I promptly sent them screenshots of the lower rate and refiled my claim. I was then told that my claim was being denied because I used a different name when I booked my room then when I filed my claim. I Had used my first name for one and my middle name, which I go by, for the other. All other information was the same, last name, confirmation number, email Etc. I promptly again refiled my claim. I was then told that my claim was denied because it was now too close to the check in date. They were stalling and we trying to find ANY way to deny this claim. So Marriott, I hope that the $40 I would have been discounted was worth losing a customer for life and all the bad press I will now give you.

title: Incessant overnight construction noise
text:
Let me get the tired, grumpy part of my review out of the way first. Today is my birthday. I’ve not slept a wink all night due to the constant construction noise on the street below. Metal hammering, banging, clanking. ALL. NIGHT. LONG. It’s loud, even from our 20th floor room. It finally stopped just after 5am. I have 1 more night of this to endure (6 night stay but the construction guys got Saturday and Sunday night off so I did get some sleep!) I do understand that the hotel can’t do much about external noise but I feel potential guests need to know the situation. 

I love this hotel. I really do. It’s become our go to choice whenever we visit NYC. I’ve given 5 stars in a previous review, I’ve recommended it to many friends but I’d need a guarantee of a super high floor to get me to book a stay again. 

On a more positive note, the hotel itself is beautiful. The rooms are a good size, the bathrooms are nice. The beds are a dream and I usually always sleep so well here. There are very few rooms  available with a bathtub, which is a slight downside for me, but I did request a room with a tub and I was lucky they could move me. The staff have always been very helpful, I’ve got no complaints about service. We have club lounge access and the breakfast provided there every morning is really very good, delicious pastries, fruit, coffee etc and a nice well stocked fridge for drinks throughout the day.  

Not sure if we’ll come back or not, but I’ll definitely be packing some earplugs next if we do.

title: Downright Disappointing.
text: *Sigh* I’m upset even having to write a scathing review like the one that’s about to follow but, alas, such is life. I SO wanted to fall in love with this hotel. A representative reached out to me a week before my trip, making an impeccable first impression. However, this advance first impression quickly diminished upon arrival at the hotel. Where do I begin? Let’s start at the unhelpful bell hop personnel who stood around by the front door and watched my associates and I struggle to pull our luggage inside without even doing so much as holding the door. Frustrating. Following our encounter with the front door service (or lack thereof) we made our way to the lobby. The front desk employees were friendly, helpful, and greeted us as soon as we exited the elevator. This made up for the subpar service we initially received upon entering the hotel and is partially the reason why I’m even giving this hotel more than 2 stars. We checked in early, came back at 4 and still had to wait an extra 30 minutes after standard check-in time for our room to be prepared. We were told the extra wait time was due to a surprise being set up for one of my associate’s birthday. Plot twist- there was no surprise. I had to talk to the front desk reps for the third time for a thrown together presentation to show itself in the room in the late evening. I could go on and on about where this hotel fell short with service but I’ll stop here. Long story short, this hotel is GORGEOUS- the rooms are spacious and clean, the bathrooms are tidy and functional, and it’s in a great location in close proximity to MSG. Truly, a beautiful gem in the city of New York. However, I wish the customer service matched the beauty of the hotel. It’s unfortunate the opportunity that was missed to leave a positive impression. Tragic.

title: Warm stay
text: I had a great time and very comfortable stay. I wanted to extend my appreciation to Gilles, Ranie, Michelle, Alex from the Bell hop, restaurant manager (tall gentlemen), our server from Versa, guest services (on the phone) and housekeeping they all very nice and did a fantastic job! All my request are granted on time. Amazing customer service and interior is excellent. Thank you!

title: Stayed here from Jan 16th - 18th 2019 : Business Travel
text:
Very good room, clean, with a nice view.
Room size is fine, not that big, but not that small.
Clean Restroom.
Very well located. Around 4 blocks from Times Square. Good options for breakfast, outside the hotel just around the corner.
Internet worked well.
Although did not use it, seems to have a very nice bar.
Two things can be a bit better : early checking, and elevator usage for the rush hours (took so long).

title: Stylish, clean and great room views
text:
Stayed here for 13 nights, very clean and friendly. 

Room was cleaned daily and have no complaints. 
Staff seem friendly and very helpful.

Had a couple of meals in Versa (hotel restaurant) which were nice and the bar staff are friendly. 

The room had free WiFi which seems rare these days for such a necessity, so this was greatly received. The TV allowed for Netflix streaming via a personal account which was great. 

The room had Aircon which kept me warm when needed and cooled me down after a shower. I stayed on the 26th floor with a view of the statue of liberty. 

Absolutely no complaints and wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel and even considering it for any future personal trips. 

[Photos added]

title: Great service.  Great location.  Beautifully maintained
text:
This is the hotel for me when going to NYC for business or pleasure.  It is close to Penn Station which is extremely convenient for me since I take Amtrak into NYC.  It is close to subway, shopping, restaurants, etc.  More than that though, the hotel is beautifully done and well maintained.  The staff is awesome and extremely friendly and helpful.  The club room is well stocked.  The rooms are immaculate and clean (definitely ask for a high floor ; the view is always better).

All in all, an excellent choice for a hotel.

title: Beautiful hotel with wonderful customer service
text: Our family of 4 recently stayed at this hotel for a night while in town to see Hamilton.  The decor of the hotel is beautiful, the room was very clean & comfortable.  The location was perfect as it was an easy walk to the theater, restaurants and subway.  What stood out to us was the dedication to customer service.  Each employee we encountered was friendly & helpful.  In particular, Joshua at the front desk really set the tone for our visit.  He was friendly, engaging and helpful.  Joshua recognized that we are a couple stays away from Marriott rewards platinum elite status and offered us access to the club lounge. This was very much appreciated.  We truly enjoyed being able to sit and relax with a drink after a long car drive.  I highly recommend this hotel & definitely plan to stay here again on our next trip into the city.

title: This is the NYC hotel you've been looking for!
text: It's rare that I feel compelled to write a review WHILE I'm staying at the property, but in this case, it's appropriate. In search of good service and a nice bed, I booked the Renaissance through SPG (now Marriott)  knowing nothing about it. I was pleasantly surprised to discover the unique design elements of the hotel upon arrival. I was checked in by the AMAZING Sebastian, who was so friendly and kind-I asked for a quiet room, and he completely delivered. Honestly, he was one of the most helpful hotel employees I've ever encountered. Ever. And I travel a lot. He also gave me a nice voucher for the hotel restaurant Versa, which to be honest, I'm not sure I would have tried otherwise. But I had it, so I invited my friend...and it completely over-delivered. Food was AMAZING, great service, good drinks. Food was actually so good I ate there again a second night and my friend (who is a prominent NYC designer) commented that he would eat there without staying at the hotel. Beautiful outdoor patio that is heavily heated in the winter-it was hopping both nights, which is saying something for a Renaissance hotel.  If you are Platinum, there is also a really lovely club lounge with comp beverages off the lobby. The lobby bar also seemed chic and was very popular both nights I was there. Rooms are compact as per NYC space, but so well designed with floor-to-ceiling windows and gorgeous design elements (thank you marble shower and rainfall shower head), that it seemed almost spacious. My new go-to in NYC. Don't hesitate to book here-you won't regret it.

title: Good place to stay
text: I found the hotel to be clean, comfortable and well located for what I needed. Subway is a 1 min walk and there are heaps of cabs going by every minute. Weird not... check in is on the sixth floor. I would stay here again.

title: Our NYC “go to” hotel - good service, convenient lication
text: Second time here; this will become our regular stop for Broadway shows and other NYC visits.  Right around the corner from Penn station.  Modern with all essential conveniences; very efficient maid service; direct guest access to large Planet fitness two story gym; nice concierge lounge; modern and convenient restaurant (“Versa”).

title: Pricy but worth it
text: Spent my first night in New York in an absolute dump.  Transferred my reservation here at 6am and they let me check in early to catch a nap.  Restaurant was wonderful, location was great, safe, and comfortable beds.

title: Great location in Mid town, adjacent to MSG
text: First time staying here.  Nice rooms.  Excellent bar staff, very friendly.   Nice touch allowing complementary drinks in the lobby bar.  Enjoyed out stay, would recommend.   View out towards MSG was cool...ask for upper floors if possible

title: Excellent Hotel, Excellent Service
text: We stayed at the Renaissance New York Midtown Hotel as part of our trip to NYC between December 20th, 2018 and December 23rd, 2018.  I want to start by saying that the hotel itself is beautiful, the rooms are really nice, modern and clean.  The location of the hotel is also perfect (pretty much right at 34th St and 7th Ave, in the heart of the fashion district).  We had a room on the 26th Floor with a perfect view south to downtown.  As amazing as all of this was, I have to say that the even more amazing part was how great and attentive the staff were.  We were dealing with Ariel at the Front Desk who was excellent at her job, very friendly, and a great help to us.  In addition to to Ariel, the crew on the main floor at the front door who were holding our bags, etc. were excellent as well, as was the staff in general.  An example would be where one of the LED lights in our room wasn't working so we called the front desk to have it repaired (really, this was not a huge issue in my mind).  Not only did they fix it but they bent over backwards to make sure we were totally satisfied with the repair.  Again, the staff at this hotel is second to none.  We just want to say thank you to the team at the Renaissance New York Midtown Hotel for a very enjoyable stay and we hope to stay with you again the next time we're in the great city of New York.  Steve and Julie from Toronto.

title: Lamentable...
text: 4 nuits dans cet hotel fin décembre 2018... nous avion réservé 4 chambres au Renaissance New York Midtown Hotel par le prestataire MisterFly.com agissant pour le compte de vente-privee.com . Lors de notre arrive à 19h, une chambre n'était pas prête, nous avons récupéré celle-ci à 21h30 non sans mal, dans un état de propreté inacceptable ... imaginé notre surprise et notre colère quand nous avons découvert au sol une SERINGUE USAGEE au pied du lit... du verre cassé sur la moquette d'un autre chambre... réponse de l'hotel: 2 petits déjeuner gratuit... finalement un simple changement de chambre. Réponse de MisterFly.com : 131,80€ de geste commercial Ma réponse? fuyez ces entreprises! le tribunal décidera de la normalité de cette situation.

title: Fantastic in Every Way!
text:
We stayed at this beautiful hotel from 26th till 30th December and it was everything we could have hoped and more. The location is absolutely perfect!

Check in was quick and easy and the staff were lovely. My fiancé had booked a skyline room and we were not disappointed, we could even see the Statue of Liberty. The room was a great size, very clean and the bed extremely comfortable. As this trip was a 30th Birthday present the staff had even left a bottle of prosecco and some treats which was a lovely touch. 

A lot of reviews are very negative about the elevator system, however, as someone who doesn’t get in them anywhere else in the world due to claustrophobia I found them extremely efficient and easy to navigate. 

Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel and will definitely return!

title: Once again a winner
text:
Of course we are loyal Marriot folks but this hotel and team are outstanding.
Although a NY hotel, the common areas are inviting and calming.
Lobby bar and adjacent seating area have a modern yet home like feel!
The rooms are a treat for NY size and the design and style points a “10”.
We find this to be a favorite NY hotel. Very relaxing ng and close to Garden

title: Splendide
text: Hôtel magnifique, bien situé dans Manhattan, propreté irréprochable. Nous étions dans une suite au 37 eme, avec une vue sur Manhattan à couper le souffle. Le personnel est très agréable. Le petit déjeuner est tés sympathique. A refaire

title: 立地良し、ブティックホテル
text:
直接ネット予約、プラチナエリートです。年末年始に3泊しました。
ペンステーションすぐそば、どこに行くにも地下鉄で簡単にアクセスできます。繁華街で真夜中でも賑わっているので、劇場街から0時ごろ歩いて帰っても自分は危険を感じることはありませんでした。
部屋はゆとりがあって機能的、スタッフは丁寧です。予約が混み合っていたり、午前中のアーリーチェックインで空室に入れてもらったので、期待していたような大幅なアップグレードは受けられませんでしたが、窓からは遠くに自由の女神が見えて部屋には満足でした。
ただし、ラウンジでの朝食や夕方2時間ほどのミールサービスは貧相なので期待は持たない方がよいです。水やジュースは好きな時にラウンジの冷蔵庫から持ち出せるようになっていたのは良かったです。
また、立地柄、高層階でも騒音はかなり聞こえます。

title: Total disappointment
text:
We stayed here from Dec 27 to Jan 3. 

It took us 2.5 hours to check in, we arrived at 4pm but didn't get a room key until 6:30. There were many other people in the same situation and the lobby was chaos. The room was noisy - the music from the bar on the 5th floor was loud and kept us awake 3 nights in a row (it was around new years eve, but still not expected when staying on the 18th floor). We could also hear the people in the room next door and below. We had no towels one day - not ideal to find out after having a shower. There was no ice in any of the ice machines (we tried 3 different floors). The room was clean but tired - the carpets were poor and the bathroom needed some repairs (cracked sink and toilet and mouldy silicon in the shower). Service in the bar on the 6th floor was hit and miss - table service one day and not the next. All in all, totally disappointing for the price paid and we cannot recomend staying here.

title: Favorite hotel in the city
text:
This new(er) hotel is my personal favorite in NYC.   I love the midtown location, away from some of the hustle and bustle of Times Square, yet still keeps just about everything within walking distance.  

The VR concierge is an awesome concept and fun to play with on the first floor - recognizing your movements and asking questions to help decide where to eat, attractions to visit, etc. 

The rooms are somewhat spacious as well.  As a platinum member, I receive a very kind upgrade to a high floor city view room, which was spectacular.  

The concierge room, on the lobby floor behind the check in desk has an adequate breakfast and snacks/drinks all day - truely a lifesaver during the stay.  

Service was also excellent.

title: Great Hotel
text:
Stayed over Xmas with Partner, really cool hotel.  Very stylish inside and great location.   For NY these are large rooms (and beds) and all aspects of the stay were good

Check in good.   Rooms good.   Cleaning of rooms was good.  No hesitation in recommending hotel.  It’s one block from MSG (Madison Square Garden / Penn Station) and a few from Times Square

title: Nice but not organized
text:
Family trip checked in at 11:30 and checked our luggage and hit the town. Went site seeing and returned at 3;30. Our room wasn’t ready yet which true check in is 4pm which I find is kind of late. Sat in lobby area and went back at 4:30 and hey said they were behind because of late checkout from silver members. Makes me mad because I’m a Marriott Rewards holder and you should be able to check in on time. To me late checkout should not be later than 1pm so cusotmer can check in on time. 
I didn’t get my room until 5:20 and it took another 30 minutes to get our luggage. We missed dinner reservations because we couldn’t shower and get there in time. The staff was nice no issue with them.  They also said they had an issue with towels and sheets because of the late checkouts. 
The hotel is nice and the rooms were nice. We are on a one day trip with our boys who have never been to NY. When we got back to our room later in the evening we had to call down to get two more towels and wash cloths, which took 40 minutes.  
At the end Marriott did pick up our parking and give us 20% off the bill which I’m thankful for. It wasn’t what I’m use to with Marriott, but I can tell you the city is great during the holiday!

title: Amazing!
text: Amazing hotel - very chic and modern. The room was very clean and the amenities were good. The staff were very professional and friendly. The hotel is very close to shopping, Times Square, MSG and lots of bars/restaurants.

title: Vacation
text: I love  staying   in the best hotel  I  new York city    breakfast   is  100% it's a  fantastic vist  I go back to same hotel   in  2019 I enjoy myself its lots of fun  to stay in this location  I love new York city  its one of my favorite  cities  in the United states

title: A Great Christmas Vacation!!
text: This hotel is close to MSG, Macy’s and Times Square. There are so many restaurants close by as well. The restaurant and bar are are very great and accessible. It is a great value and would stay here again.

title: Ariel at front desk is extremely rude
text: Said she would make us a dinnner reservation for 15 people and confirmed it only for us to arrive at venue and the host explain that there are zero reservations under our name and group size. She is extremely rude each time we’ve had to interact with her at the front desk and left a bad taste for the hotel. She should not be at guest services. It requires a pleasant personality and people skills which she does not have. Ariel should not be out in front of people and should be at a desk somewhere. She’s ruined the image of the hotel for us.

title: Great base to tour NYC
text: The hotel has outstanding accommodations and great staff. They are walking distance from Penn Station and offer a free bag check both before you check in and after you check out. The room was awesome and the staff was great. The hotel is a few blocks from every subway route in the city, which makes it a great starting point for everything you want to visit. Well worth the money.

title: Best room in town
text: I stay here every time I am in town. Great club lounge which is always open. Great bar area. Room is nice but shower is really nice. Very close to train station and central to entire city. Great staff. Versa is a great spot to dine and drink. Like having it all in one spot. Gym is great too. Access to planet fitness. What more could you ask for.

title: Close to Penn Station
text: Stayed 2 days before a cruise. Large king bed in an average sized room. .Coffee maker, small fridge, modern TV. Macy store is nearby. Madison Square Garden close by. Modern decor and elevator system. Aloof staff at the front desk on the 6th floor. Buffet breakfast if you are really hungry. Probably better choices of hotels near theaters.

title: Just ok
text: We stayed three nights starting Dec. 14.  The hotel uses the new smart elevators which cut down wait times immensely.  The front desk staff was constantly spot on and were very helpful.  The room was TINY.  The closet is in the walkway between the bed and the bathroom so when the closet doors are open you can’t get by.Bathroom is ok and has some upgraded features like marble floors/walls.  However, the shower floor is VERY slippery so you need to be careful.  The restaurant/bar is ok.  Service at the bar was a little slow and the food is just ok.  The location on 35th St is a little sketchy.  It is pretty close to the subway and close to Herald Square and some pretty good restaurants.  In December, still too far to walk to Times Square or most anywhere else.

title: Great location, well outfitted, great experience!
text:
I stayed here on business last week. The location can't be beat (for me, at least). While the hotel is officially on 35th, there's an entrance on 34th St, right across from Penn Station and my company's office at 1 Penn Plaza (it's the door on 34th with the "R" right above it).

The only knock I can come up with is the elevator system. It's one of those fancy "put in what floor you're going to, and it tells you what car to get into" kind of systems. I'd much rather simply hit the "Up/Down" buttons and pick my destination floor from the panel inside the elevator, thanks.

Apart from that, very nice. It's a relatively new property, and has a very nice, modern style of decor.

Definitely recommended, and if I need to spend a night in the city again, there's a good chance it will end up being here.

title: Cool vibe
text: Close to Penn Station.  Hotel and restaurant have a fun vibe.  Club lounge in lobby has nice breakfast, all day access to a wide variety of soft drinks/yogurt/snacks, and a nice spread in the evening.  Comfortable rooms.

title: Our New NYC Hotel
text:
Can't find any fault with this nice Renaissance property. Within a 5 minute walk from Penn Station and an easy walk up to Rockefeller Center or down to Union Square, the location was perfect. 

We arrived early and went to the front desk just to ask if we could store our bag. We didn't ask about checking in, but the lovely receptionist looked to see if she could give us a room. She had a city view on the 25th floor but said it was next to the elevators. Just grateful that we could check in so early, we said that would be fine.

The room was a nice size for NYC. It was clean, well laid out and had every amenity that you would expect from a nice hotel including a safe, coffee maker, mini-fridge and Aveda toiletries. The Internet connection was easy and worked well. The king bed was comfortable and the bathroom had a great walk-in rain shower that, unlike most glass enclosed showers, didn't leak. The only minor problem in the room was that the reading lights by the beds didn't work .

Being by the elevators did not bother us at all. Noise was a minimum until the 7am traffic and trucks started in the morning, but even then it wasn't bad.

Being a platinum member, we had access to the Club Lounge, so we headed there the next morning for a bite to eat. The breakfast is served between 7 and 9am on weekdays only (lounge is closed on weekends). The lounge is pretty small and it was crowded. At first there was nowhere to sit, but a couple of stools along the window soon became available. There was a small, but very nice, selection of hard-boiled or scrambled eggs wrapped in tortillas, bread/pastry items and fruit to perfectly start your day.

After checking out we were allowed to store our suitcase so we could spend the day unencumbered by luggage. When we returned we enjoyed a glass of wine in the lobby bar prior to heading back to the train station. The gentlemen at the bar could not have been nicer. The whole staff were extremely nice and helpful.

We usually stay in Times Square at the Marquis or Renaissance, but we enjoyed this smaller Renaissance, its location, rooms and staff much more. This will be our new hotel for all our future visits to the big apple.

title: MAGIQUE !!!! Parfait.
text:
6 nuits dans cet établissement de prestige en hiver. 
Personnel charmant et à l'écoute. Accueil personnalisé agréable malgré la taille de l'hôtel.
La chambre...... splendide !!!!! avant dernier étage la vue est juste à tomber par terre. Je crois que j'ai passé le premier matin à regarder cette vue non stop de 5H à 7H (merci le jet lag) avec le levé du soleil. Lit très agréable. Propreté parfaite. La suite en angle est parfaite, environ 50 m2 je pense.
L'emplacement est nickel pour visiter et découvrir NYC. 
Bref c'est sûr la prochaine fois je retourne dans cet hôtel. 
Nous n'avions pas pris le petit déj donc je ne peux pas me prononcer dessus par contre.

title: Lots of amenities for a NYC hotel!
text: Stayed 5 nights here...nice, modern rooms.  Lots of amenities....concierge lounge open every day!!  Planet fitness right next door available to hotel guests.  Cute lobby bar and a full service restaurant.  Only complaint is the lack of privacy with the frosted glass sliding bathroom door...awkward.

title: "Awesome Hotel/Staff & Exceptional Location"
text:
Just back from a fabulous Christmas Shopping break in New York....What made it extra special was this hotel and their staff and the 'Room with a City View'...The room/bed and facilities were second to none.. The room was spotless and if you ask for anything it happens...Cannot allow this review to finish without mentioning two of the exceptional staff members who made our trip extra special and that being both Marta Owsiana***** & Jade Monsegue***** "Thank You for the breakfast on the House" and here's to our next trip...

George Paterson

Scotland

title: Tap Convention
text: Traveled to the city for the Big Apple Tap Festival and chose Renaissance midtown for our stay which was only a stones throw from Pearl Studios.  We were absolutely thrilled with not only our room, but all that the hotel had to offer.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.   Room was clean and modern, and the restaurant, bar and breakfast were superb.   I will definitely stay here again.

title: Awesome hotel - great location
text: Beautiful hotel located minutes from herald square, Madison square gardens, penn station, etc. Easy walk to subway stations. About a 20 minute walk to Central Park. Very comfortable and spacious (for nyc) rooms. Hotel bar/restaurant is beautiful but staff aren’t awesome. Food and cocktails are great. Marta at front desk was amazing and went above and beyond to make our honeymoon stay memorable. The concierge was very friendly and tried to be helpful but just googled everything. Two of the places she recommended we went to and they were terrible! We should have just googled ourselves. Overall great hotel and majority of the staff are amazing! Some staff just need more training!

title: Excellent Staff and amenities
