text: I recently was in New York on business and had a great stay at the Renaissance Hotel. I have to give appreciation where it is due, although traffic was absolutely horrible, the staff made the atmosphere so much better. The bitter cold did not make things any better either, however, while walking everywhere else, I had the most wonderful experience. While the hotel was another great experience I know that I will be staying there again. The restaurant on the 5th floor with an indoor/outdoor experience was different, but again phenomenal. Thank You Renaissance for my first time Great experience to New York!

title: Wonderful, Modern Hotel !
text:
The Renaissance Midtown is one of those rare mid-range NYC hotels that exceeds your expectations with its modernity and use of space. I have stayed at countless hotels in New York (mostly Starwood) and am usually, if not, disappointed, then at least underwhelmed. Most hotels are dark, cramped and show signs of age. This property is one of those lovely surprises that catches you off guard.

Upon arrival, I was a little disappointed by the lack of staff to welcome me or even assist with the elevators. The bell staff just stood around as I tried to figure out the confusing elevator situation (complicated to use at first, but makes total sense once you figure it out). The front desk staff were very friendly upon check-in, or anytime I needed them for anything. Ariel always had a smile on her face and was lovely in assisting me. The rooms are extremely well-designed, with modern woods and tiles. Of course, the rooms are small as it is NYC, but the layout and design techniques make these rooms feel more airy and spacious. The bathroom was just fabulous with a glassed-in shower and great bath linens and amenities. 

This hotel doesn't have its own gym - but even better, it is directly attached to a full-service gym that hotel guests get free use of during their stay. This was such a nice surprise for someone like me who works out and never knows what to expect at the different hotels.

Unfortunately, I didn't try any of the hotels bar or dining venues due to so much amazing food in the city. The hotel's location in Midtown is perfect and within walking distance of so much.

I will definitely be back. Depending on price (as the pricing fluctuates wildly in NYC), this is my new go-to property in the city. Marriott/Starwood has a real gem with this hotel!

title: 對遊客來說交通位置很好
text: 這趟生日入住，白金會員酒廊24小時開放，裡面有熱咖啡和飲料，早上可以在這裡用早點，房間訂了天際線景房，風景還可以，值得一提的是白金會員不會升等，就算app上仍然有房間，就算你生日入住，總之會員福利升等這項可以當作沒有就是了；交通非常方便，附近晚上也有很多超市，隔壁不遠就是梅西百貨，時代廣場，帝國大廈都可以走路抵達。

title: Conveniently Located
text:
The Renaissance is in a good location, close to many restaurants, Macy's,  and the subway.  The room and bathroom are small but  comfortable.  Good amenities, towels and sheets.  We had a room with a nice view of the city. 

Elevators are different than most hotels.  We felt it provided more security but can be slow.  We were on a high floor and many times we waited a while for the elevator.

Front desk staff were friendly and helpful.  Female concierge (apologize we forgot her name) was very helpful and provided good suggestions. A  hotel to consider when traveling to New York.

title: Above Average Renaissance Hotel
text: My family and I enjoyed our stay at the Renaissance Midtown. All the staff were excellent from check-in to check-out. They were able to get us into two of the four rooms early at 11:30 am that morning. I loved the modern decor with all the little touches that reflected the hotel's location in the Garment District. The location of the hotel was perfect to getting around NYC. As a Marriott Platinum member I was able to access the club lounge. The offerings were excellent and a step above other renaissance club lounges I have visited. This hotel will be at the top of my list when I'm considering a hotel for my return visits to NYC.

title: Annual trip-first stay here
text:
First, we love the location of the hotel as it is close to many subways but far enough away from the crush of Times Square. We booked this by accident as our friends were at the Times Square Marriott. The room was stylish, well appointed but smaller than rooms we were used to in NYC. The bathroom was well designed and we liked the shower and sliding doors. The bed was quite comfortable as were the pillows. However, we did find the room small compared to others we have stayed in. About the size of a cruise ship room, but with a much better view and a bigger bathroom. We stayed here 4 nights and there was a service problem that after the first night our room was not serviced when we had been gone all day shopping. However, the service and cleaning has great after nights 2 and 3. 
The front desk staff have all been great as well as the staff downstairs on the street level. The elevator takes getting used to, but like the extra protection it provides. One day we had to wait when we were leaving at one of those peak times. There is coffee in the room and a Starbucks across the street as well Andrews Cafe, which was quite good for breakfast. Might come back again, but would need a bigger room.

title: great hotel
text:
excellent location, new hotel next to Penn Station, subwAY, MSG, Macys and all that you might need in Manhattan. Natasha at the check-in is absolutely the best one, amazing and friendly! 
She made us feel comfortable like at home  and definitely made our time in
hotel much more nicer. Thank you!

title: Pas à la hauteur
text:
Un vrai point positif : l’emplacement !
Points négatifs : chambre petite et mal entretenue, peu de place pour ranger ses habits et pas d’espace pour les valises,  mauvaise isolation des fenêtres (froid et bruits) et des murs (bruit des voisins et des couloirs), propreté douteuse de la chambre et des espaces communs, draps non repassés, couverture et peignoir sales bien que changés, petit déjeuner non compris hors de prix et peu varié, personnel aimable mais peu serviable.
Au final très cher pour ce que c’est... sûrement mieux dans le même quartier...

title: So so
text:
Great Location. Modern Hotel. Quiet rooms while sleeping. 

But a few gripes.  The elevators stink. They take a while to come and they are too high-tech. Just want to push a button and go to my floor. 

I was VERY disappointed because I was never offered a enhanced room upgrade with my gold status. I also was not offered a welcome gift upon arrival (250 or 500 bonus points per Marriott website) 

The front desk never explained the breakfast and club lounge amenities. I called this morning to ask about breakfast in the club lounge and the guy who answered said they don’t serve on weekends but come to front desk and get voucher for the restaurant Versa. 

Went down to the club lounge, got access with my room key, and grabbed some complimentary water and coffee (they also have juices and coke products to drink.) I stopped by the front desk and asked Mao about the voucher and she seemed confused. She told me the club lounge is only available for platinum guest NOT gold because of the “merger” and I said well how did my room key gain me access to the lounge?  She had a blank stare. And past reviews and informational the website shows gold members have access to club lounge as well.  So I am not sure what the situation is if the employees need better training or she didn’t seem to care. 

She said “well this one time only” I’ll give you a voucher for the restaurant. 

The management needs to better train their front desk about these amenities. I would not have a lot of confidence in a stay back st this property again, I would do your research there are many many other hotels in NYC (THE W Times Square) that I’ve stayed with in the past and never had an issue there. I wanted to check this property out since it seemed so nice and in a good location.

title: My favorite Reinassance
text:
This hotel is relatively new and situated very conveniently in midtown. It is walking distance to broadway, times square and has many shops and eateries around the hotel. 

The room is surprisingly spacious for New York City. I love the mattress and pillows. I slept very well. The windows were large and overlooks Manhattan. 

The bathroom were all marbled and products provided were from Aveda. One thing I dislike was the leaky shower. But I turned the shower tube and it was fixed. 

Their elevators needed special hotel room access cards and your destination level has to be maneuvered from a computer screen outside the elevators as there are no level buttons inside. It seems like a hassle but I feel safe. 

Wifi is free and fast. Housekeeping is excellent. Staffs are polite and helpful.

title: A wonderful property with great staff
text: We had 3 rooms for 5 nights and were delighted with the location and service we received here. This would and will be our go to location for being central to everything in NYC based on this experience. Daniela at the Concierge desk was extremely helpful with planning and recommendations and each individual to a person at the front desk was helpful when we interacted.

title: Never Before Experience
text:
Instead of the usual routing of off Amtrak then off to the LIRR to Queens route, I decided to take a Sunday night vacation in NYC.  The Renaissance, directly behind MSG and Penn Station had an ok AAA rate - inflated a bit for a Billy Joel night.  

After a 5 minute walk from Penn Station, check in was (i think) on the 6th floor and after a few issues with the mobile key and the elevator it was up to my room.  The agent said I'd gotten a really nice upgrade, and he wasn't kidding.  The room turned out to be a mini suite with a full length of the room outside terrace.  It was a nice night so it was a perfect evening to be outside and even be able to watch the Sunday night game through the full length windows  IT was a real treat -- the room was brilliantly designed and included a sitting area, a large bedroom area and an equally nice bathroom.  The terrace made me even feel pretty special that I'd gotten the room itself.

Service was great - the lounge was another cookie cutter breakfast point (I've stopped worrying about what they feed us for breakfast)  and the hotel location lent itself to one night away whether for fun on having to catch an 730am train out to the office  BUT - the hotel was lively and conducive to enjoying onself.   I'll use this plan again - with or without the use of a room with a terrace.

title: Would rate it 3.5....Good, not Great
text:
We stayed 4 nights in October, family of 4, 2 queen beds with city views.  Room was small as previous reviews have stated but it was clean and nicely appointed.  They did have a frost shade to cover the bathroom glass partition - something that many people complained about so it's nice to see they remedied that.  We requested a high floor room with a view so could see Lady Liberty in the distance.  Elevators were fine-- definitely a little crazy when things got busy and people would elect not to get on the elevator b/c it was too crowded but we'd have to stop on their floor regardless.  Bell staff were very friendly and helpful.  Appreciated the central location and proximity to transportation.  

Lobby bar was always very busy during the evenings and very difficult to get service.  We sat and waited at a table for service for about 10 minutes before giving up.  Server was apologetic and kept saying he would get to us as soon as he could but it was obvious he was more interested in serving the business crowd.  We left and never went back.  

Side note- loved the bagel shop across the street! Yum!

title: Zentral, geräumig und neu
text: Das Hotel liegt mitten in Manhattan, ganz in der Nähe der Penn Station. Es hat auch eine kleine Lounge für Elite members, Personal sehr nett, allerdings ist die Auswahl beim Frühstück eher klein. Das Zimmer war für New Yorker Verhältnisse sehr gräumig und machte einen sehr neuen Eindruck. Insgesamt sehr empfehlenswert!

title: Perfect location
text:
My wife and I visited New York as part of our honeymoon. We got a skyline view room on a high floor with and amazing view of the water and the Statue of Liberty! As a gold member, they immediately fulfilled my request to have a high floor, with good views, away from the elevator (which I recommend as you can easily hear anyone in the hallway and doors slamming).

The room itself was clean, very comfortable bed, and very friendly staff. The hotel is so close to multiple subway lines (ask the hotel for a map and this shows all the lines with express trains - once we got a handle of the routes it’s so easy) and a short walk to Times Square. We had dinner at the restaurant which had good food, although we never tried the breakfast.

If I were to fault anything, the air conditioning can be very loud intermittently, but mostly you don’t notice it. Another fault is hearing doors slamming. I noticed previous reviews found the glass to the bathroom to be odd. They’ve fixed this now with a pull down blind so this shouldn’t be a worry for those people now.

If I’m ever back in NY, I would stay here again in a heartbeat! Highly recommended. Wish I didn’t have to leave.

title: An oasis in the middle of everything!
text: Very nice hotel in a great location. Like all of NYC...very busy scene in lobby, bar and restaurants. But rooms offer an oasis of solitude which is not easy to come by in a Manhattan property. Very quiet, comfortable and extremely functional. Since I was there on biz, I appreciated these attributes of the room even more. As a platinum-level guest, I had access to the club lounge. It was fine, nice lay-out, and the food offerings were adequate. Lounge is closed on the weekends which seems strange for a NYC hotel that caters to both business and leisure travelers. But you are able to get a nice buffet breakfast in the restaurant on the weekends in lieu of the lounge and the actual lounge remains available on the weekends with sodas/water just no food offerings. All in all, a great addition to the wide-variety of hotels in Midtown. I would definitely return.

title: I thankfully didn't pay for this - only with points
text: The hotel is quite stylish and nice in decor inside. When we arrived after 2am in the morning, the concierge was really nice and friendly and chatty, but they did not have our room ready - at least not feather-free as I had requested upfront. It took for ages! Finally at 3:15 we could get into the room. There was a view on the city. The room smells for wet cement, which means there's humidity-mold building up somewhere. But okay, we are only going to sleep here, it didn't cost us anything but Marriott points, the view is on the city and not the next building (actually I did pay an extra 400$ for the view!), it's central and the hotel is pet-free.

title: Great Hotel and great staff!!
text:
I Booked this hotel for a Birthday get away. The room was absolutely great! The view was over Madison Square Garden with the Statue of Liberty in the background and a great NYC skyline. Great great view!
The staff was very welcoming and knowledgeable. Rada even sent up a Happy Birthday note with a few goodies. Thank you Rada! 

Book this hotel and you will not be disappointed.

title: Great location hotel
text:
I booked this hotel for me and my husband. I booked it for our wedding anniversary but this was not acknowledged at all. 

We booked a city view room and it was a nice view of downtown. We stayed on the 26th floor. 

The room was nice and relatively spacious. 
Great selection of tv available in the room. However in the bathroom the shower taps were not easy to use and very stiff. 

The concierge and staff were great! The person to offer advice on where to go was always available. 

Nice vibe in the bar and nice restaurant to eat at. But we did unfortunately find a fly in one of our meals which was slightly disappointing as the food was good! 

Overall, we had a nice stay and would recommend this hotel to others

title: Good quality hotel right in the heart of Midtown
text: Very enjoyable stay at this hotel, lovely, quality spacious rooms conveniently placed for midtown tourist attractions, check out the bagel & coffee place over the road for breakfast and there are a few nearby bars for a night cap. All in all no complaints about this hotel, very enjoyable stay indeed...

title: Great hotel in the theater district
text: This is a great hotel in the theater district t.  Location is wonderful. Service great. Check in and checkout streamlines.  Amenities are good.  The room is Very comfortable,   Staff is very comfortable.  We are Looking forward to our return visit.

title: Summer stays
text: Stayed at this hotel several times over the 2017 summer.  Convenient location to Penn Station and MSG Arena is a plus!  Rooms are small but nice and surprisingly quiet.  Great onsite restaurants, and the staff is very good.

title: Shockingly poor service esp re lifts
text:
OK location is great, rooms are modern, bathrooms rather good

Staff is nice... But totally incompetent
1) awful service at the bar. No-one takes care of you, then order gets mixed up, you have to take the stuff by yourself to your table..

2) more important the lift situation is abysmal. One is broken. Of the other 3 the computer system is totally screwed and th e allocation asinine. So it can take up to 20 mins to get a lift, and you have no idea when (if ever) it will happen 
I took stairs most times but with luggage or after running a marathon it is really annoying
And it has been going on for THREE days without end in sight and the staff not seeming to know the extent of the problem

Absolutely shocking for a 4 star hotel

title: Elevator situation is AWFUL!!!!
text: Just stayed here for one night. The few hotel staff members that we interacted with were friendly and helpful. Our room was small, but clean, modern, and perfect for what we needed for one night, after a show at MSG.  And, the mini products that they provide are Aveda!!  The elevators, though...…terrible!!  The system for getting an elevator seems modern and awesome, until you're stuffed in the elevator with a bunch of (mostly rude) humans, stopping at lots of floors for no reason.  Seriously, this hotel is gorgeous, but our experience with the elevators will, most likely, make it so we do not return.

title: Fantastic, Modern Hotel
text: Really loved my one night stay at the Renaissance. Great location near Penn Station and the Fashion District. Super friendly and helpful staff. Room was modern and chic with a Full Planet Fitness gym in the same building! Can't recommend enough. Best deal may be on Marriott app where I booked for half the rack rate last minute same day.  (Maybe a once in a lifetime deal for a 5 Star Hotel).

title: Fabulous Stay
text:
I spent a weekend here with my 20 yr old daughter and we absolutely loved the hotel. Clean rooms and pleasant staff made it comfortable and the location to may attractions was great. 
We enjoyed Versa rooftop restaurant that has great views. 
Loved the stay and hope to return soon.

title: Nice hotel...
text:
It’s a really nice hotel. Good location. The staff is very personable. The rooms are very nice. Especially the beds. Super comfortable. And they use Aveda products. 

What prevents me from giving them 5 stars is the elevator system and the mobile key.  It’s one of those new “smart” elevators and for the most part, it worked well.  But there are only 3 for nearly 40 floors. And then when only 1 is working, we waited nearly 15 min from the 30th floor and stopped on almost every floor until the 5th floor.  Unacceptable. 

The mobile key in the app never worked for the elevators nor the room. Not for a lack of trying. Ultimately it was easier to use a card key. And that stopped working right after we checked in. So another stop on the 6th floor to the front desk. 

As platinum premiere elite, I wouldn’t take a chance on this hotel again.

title: good hotel
text:
the hotel is good, Staff is friendly, the rooms are normal.
i got disappointed because the bed cover ad an hole on it, pretty big, the bathroom exhausting fan didn't work properly.
mine cel phone felt under the bed and we had to lift the mattresses , i never had seen so many dust in mine life.
honestly i do expected more from this hotel

title: A Modern New York Hotel
text: The Renaissance Midtown is a sleek, modern hotel in the heart of Manhattan. My king bed room was a nice size and beautifully appointed. The rooms and the hotel were decorated in a sleek, modern style. The hotel restaurants and bar are cozy and comfortable. The hotel staff were attentive and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Easy location and shockingly quiet!
text: I was thrilled by how quiet this hotel is , especially given the location.  Good size rooms for NYC - though I have Platinum status that might help.  Only issue is the elevators.  Hotel was booked and I literally waited more than ten minutes for an elevator.   Plan ahead if going out - be ready to wait.  I was on a high floor so walking down not my best choice.

title: Tripping in Midtown
text:
This should be called the M as it's Marriott's version of a W hotel. It has all the amenities to attract the hip and happenin' who happen to be NYC to see what's happenin'. Go ahead use the Planet Fitness Gym next door, or simply line up at 
6:30 AM across the street to get a bag of bagels, but then you'll have to ask yourself if waiting in line for 2 hours to a eat a bagel constitutes exercise. 

The Hotel is in a great location, just moments away from a perennial traffic jam in both directions. 

Parking your own car is a mystery as their is no Valet that I saw, but then why would you be driving in NYC anyway?  So, no doorman, and no buff dude in a Cheyenne's feathered war bonnet and underpants hailing a taxi for you. 

However hailing an elevator as the hotel begins on Floor 5 is another matter requiring a bit of study and acquired skill. Swipe your card, stab at the screen once it flashes the floors, and some AI algorithm loaded elevator will get you there. Make sure to pass your elevator exam or you could be sleeping in the entrance hallway. 

There is a sleek restaurant, Versa, on floor 5 and the rooftop Thread Bar for showing off that new $900 shirt you bought on Mad Ave. 

Room 2506 had a nice City view and a King bed with Down Pillows. After a visit from engineering and housekeeping the bedside lights worked, and Robes appeared.  

Staff on the other end of the phone were helpful, pleasant and friendly even though you'll never see them or recognize them in the elevator assuming you could figure out how to make that work during your stay. 

The bathroom was on the small side, which is no big deal as hopefully you're not spending your weekend in there. There is a Rain Forest Shower, and if you run around you're bound to get wet. Life with minimal pressure is good...until you want a shower.                    

All in all this Hotel was utilitarian, reasonably priced and had access to all things NYC. I'd go back and stay again. I would.

title: Spacious rooms were a pleasant surprise
text: Oftentimes you'll find rooms the size of a cardboard box in NYC.  So, we were pleasantly surprised by the size of our room upon arrival.  This hotel is very nice and in a great location.  Just a block from Macy's and other great shopping.  The rooms are modern with comfy beds and great views.  The reception staff could have been friendlier in my opinion but overall they were ok.  I noticed them walking everyone else to the elevators upon check-in but they did not provide us the same courtesy.  We had to ask the concierge how to operate the elevators.  Though the Bellmen were very gracious and helpful.  Skip the breakfast buffet because it's not good and overpriced.  Overall, we enjoyed our stay here because of the excellent hotel rooms and location.  We would definitely stay here again.

title: Hotel a 10 min a piedi da Times Square!
text:
Abbiamo prenotato in questo hotel per 8 notti, appena arrivati dopo 9 ore di volo e spostamento vari ci dicono che la camera non c’era perchè l’hotel era tutto pieno! Viaggiamo spesso e non ci è mai capitato! Ci hanno spostato in un altro hotel vicino di categoria inferiore con una camera abbastanza brutta.
Il giorno dopo ci recchiamo nuovamente nel hotel per assegnarci la camera ma non ci è stata data perchè dovevamo tornare il pomeriggio/sera...senza parole! 
Devo dire che per farsi perdonare ci hanno regalato un upgrade con una stanza stupenda al 35^ piano con la colazione il giorno dopo e una bottiglia di vino (ringrazio il ragazzo della reception molto gentile).
Per il resto della vacanza di siamo trovati bene, pulizie fatte tutti i gioni, tutto il personale gentile tranne le due ragazze alla reception una bionda molto antipatica!!
Ma comunque sta il fatto che una cosa del genere non deve capitare avendo prenotato la vacanza e la stanza mesi prima.
Ci tornerei per l’hotel in quanto le stanze sono belle e la posizione è ottima ma non per l’organizzazione ho paura che ricapiti ancora.

title: Terrific everything
text: Great curb appeal.  Wonderful greeting at check-in.  Super suite on top floor - beautifully decorated and appointed.  Great view of Chrysler Building and all things NYC.  Staff could not have been better - its like they came to work specifically for us.  Free one-day WiFi.

title: Nice room but breakfast lacking
text:
We had a king bed suite which was spacious; had plenty of drawers and closet space. Nicely furnished kitchen. Balcony doors did not open.  Air conditioning was loud (two units in the room). Received Marriott bonus points by opting out of having our room cleaned every day. 
Bottled water in the room was $3.50!!! It, like internet should be free.
Breakfast: Several days the food was pulled from the buffet 10 minutes before the end. One day the English Muffins were visibly moldy. On Saturday there was no Decaf coffee.  Breakfast offerings were OK though the scrambled eggs were "watery." We would stay here again. It's a good location.
Internet was free because we're Marriott Rewards' members.

title: Great Hotel in the garment district
text: Really nice hotel! The rooms were very nice and modern. The bed was very comfortable and nice view of the city! The staff was very friendly and helpful as well! Great hotel!  We had drinks and appetizers in hotel bar and bartender was excellent and very nice! Food was good too! Thanks for a great stay in The City!

title: Great room, busy location
text:
Hubby and I stayed 3 nights on points, thankfully - New York is otherwise so expensive! Our King room was spacious and the bathroom was bright and big. Nice view from the room on 31st floor. Good service. Bellman are friendly and efficient. 

Cons: Our room was near the electrical and linen closet rooms so at times the doors would bang shut loudly. Bath towels are hard and crunchy. There was only 1 set of robe/slippers. Bottles of water would have been nice. The location of the hotel is in a very busy area - steps from Madison square garden and a 15 min walk to Times Square. So in that sense it was very central to everything, but too chaotic for me. 

Next time, I would choose to stay in Greenwich or Gramercy areas. We also spent a couple nights in Williamsburg, Brooklyn which I enjoyed.

Trip highlights:
Gramercy tavern
Bar Beau in Brooklyn 
Confectionery vegan sweets
High Line
No. 1 Tacos in Chelsea market

title: Facilities ok, some reservations about the service
text:
Modern, upgraded facilities - plus point. However, service was inconsistent. The only professional departments are reception and reservation. Emailed me personally for my check in time and checked me in earlier and understood my tight business schedule. However please review your check in policy as it is quite strange for a hotel to check in guest at 4pm and check out at 12pm, there goes an afternoon wasted. isnt the standard check in time 2pm everywhere else in the world? 
Concierge was not helpful, well, at least to me. Hope im not being so sensitive but the fact that my sister and I had to carry huge luggages without any staff attending (they were just talking to each other and we were trying to open doors to push the luggages out), and when a big family of a different race came in they were rushing to greet, help with luggages and put on welcome smile really bothered us.

title: More than location, location, location.....
text:
A great stay at a relatively new hotel (opened in 2016) - There's a sense of wanting to be hip and so it has its quirks, there's a party type atmosphere in the lobby most evenings, which is located on the 6th floor. Monday - Friday they serve a different alcoholic drink each night, free of charge until the bottle runs out......which as you can imagine is pretty quick - why not give each guest a free drink ticket?

The staff throughout the hotel are great and helpful. There are 12 rooms on each floor that are on the small side (it is NY) however they're QUIET. 

If you're not in the city for any particular reason, the location is perfect. Very close to Penn Station, MSG and a 10 minute walk to Broadway. The streets are still crowded, but not as crazy as Times Square. If you are heading towards downtown use the back door.

title: EXCELLENT TWO-NIGHT STAY
text: Chose this hotel for its location to Union Street station. Room a bit smaller than expected but very good. Comfortable bed. Restaurant ok but breakfast not as good as expected. Staff very helpful, especially young concierge who advised that the station was just across the road out the back door. Then helped carry luggage across.

title: Great location; clean and modern
text:
I had never stayed in this hotel before, but since it is a Renaissance with a great price, I gave it a try.  

The main lobby is on the 6th floor of the hotel, with access to Planet Fitness on the 2nd floor and a really cool restaurant on site (Verve) that has an awesome outdoor terrace.

It's great to have access to a full size gym!

Rooms are nice.  A little on the small size but super nice for New York.  Great bathroom layout with plenty of counter space and a great shower.  My room came with robes which was a nice touch.  Contemporary design.  I also found the room to be quiet but I was also on an end with a great view.

The location is great as it is a short walk to Penn Station and about 8-10 minutes from Times Square.

I couldn't find bottled water anywhere, and that was my only complaint.  I'm honestly grossed out by hotel room glasses so I had to go to the nearby market to get a bottle.  Not a big deal, but one of those things...as a Platinum member can a girl get a bottle of water???  

Excellent staff.  Would definitely stay here again.

title: Third Stay/Excellent!
text: My Husband and I have stayed here before. Our family lives in NY so this is now our go-to place.  Great location for walking everywhere and near Penn Station for visiting Long Island relatives and getting to the airport.  We had a beautiful suite on 36th floor this time that was awesome (clean, spacious, beautiful decor) but have stayed in regular rooms which are also nice.  Staff is great, housekeeping is excellent.  We like the lobby lounge where you can get soft drinks all day (some beer and wine would be welcomed :)) and the lounge food service is great!  I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel when staying in Manhattan.

title: An Oasis in the busy city.
text: Sadly, I could only stay one night but want to come back!! Since I took the train to New York, the location was perfect. Meghan at check in was super helpful. I arrived frazzled and tired, luggage in tow. She had me checked in, amenities and fancy express elevators explained, and settled in my delightful room super fast. I loved the modern decor a d the bathroom. Even when I checked out, the service didn't end. I was hauling aforementioned luggage when the door attendant noticed I was heading out the 35th Street door. He quickly asked if I was headed to the train and showed me a different public entrance that saved me a HUGE chunk of walking (with suitcases). Renaissance Hotel, you're def my new go-to in Manhattan.

title: Fantastic location, very clean, comfortable would stay here again . 4.5 ⭐️
text:
Service was great, even the maintenance workers smile and greet you. The room was beautiful, very clean and comfortable. Lobby was on the 6th floor which was different but I guess it was formulated to keep the riffraff out of lobby. I believe if you are a Marriott rewards or prestige member you get a nice breakfast and happy hour apps, but may want to check on that. 
Location was perfect right near all prime shopping and Macy’s.
Highly recommend would and will return!

title: Close to MSG
text: Closest nice hotel to Madison Square Garden and Javits center. Modern, sleek and sophisticated with incredibly helpful staff. Spotlessly clean and welcoming and very comfortable too. Also in the heart of the garment district, it’s easy to get to.

title: Perfect location and staff!
text:
Some friends had suggested this property for a recent stay in NYC and we were very pleased!  The location is superb with easy access to all points in Manhattan.  We arrived via train at Penn Station and simply walked to the property and were greeted by very helpful, kind staff.  The Front Desk staff arranged a lovely room for us prior to official check-in time and Daniel, at the Navigator Desk, provided us with numerous restaurant suggestions, both prior to arrival as well as during our stay.  We highly recommend this property!
Ken and Kari

title: Fabulous find
text: The hotel was very modern and unique.  Although at 56 it is a bit different for me I found the hotel very pleasing.  Jade went the extra mile getting us to our room early with a double upgrade at no charge.  We will be back.  Its close to the subway for travel which was a plus

title: Fabulous
text: This hotel was absolutely fabulous!  The rooms were spacious and beautiful!  The bathroom shower was to die for.  It had a large waterfall shower head and a handheld shower head if you didn’t like the waterfall and room for 2.  We had a beautiful skyline view.

title: Great Location and Staff
text: The Renaissance is in a great location and is a fun hotel. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the staff is wonderful. Our last day we missed breakfast in the concierge lounge and the staff made us a to go basket, great people!

title: Great Hotel
text: We had a wonderful stay at the Renaissance New York Midtown Hotel.  The location was perfect -- within walking distance to Times Square; hence, close enough without being directly in the Times Square traffic.  The staff was great.  Allen was very accommodating, helpful and pleasant.  Initially, our stay was for 1 day, but after checking in, we decided to extend our stay for 3 additional days.  Allen facilitated the change to make the process very easy and stress free.  Richard was always beaming and gave great suggestions for places to go and ways to get around town.  The room was organized in a way to feel spacious with a great view.  The bathroom was a great size and the shower was large -- large enough for two people to enjoy with their spouse.  I spent 3 hours looking for the perfect hotel in Manhattan.  My criteria: a room which did not feel cramped, a 24-hour accessible concierge lounqe, walking distance to Time Square and walking distance to subway station.  The Renaissance New York Midtown Hotel was over and beyond my expectations.  This will be my hotel of choice anytime I visit New York.

title: Moderno e trendy
text: A pochi passi da Penn Station e dalla stazione del Path, quindi molto comodo per spostarsi anche fuori da NY verso il New Jersey, bello e moderno, con camere abbastanza ampie per gli standard della Big Apple, così come il bagno, grande e bello.  E’ un hotel di ottimo livello.

title: Genial
text:
Nos alojamos 10 días unas amigas durante nuestro viaje y la verdad que ha sido todo un acierto.
La ubicación es perfecta ya que está justo al lado de la estación Pensilvania y muy cerca de Timesquare, pero a la distancia perfecta para no tener todo el agobio de gente que hay en esa zona.
Las vistas de la habitación muy buenas y la habitación genial también.
La cama es muy cómoda y grande,en el baño teníamos todo tipo de accesorios, hay secador de pelo grande, nevera, plancha de ropa.
Los enchufes tienen salida usb para poder cargar lo que necesites sin necesidad de adaptador.
Es un hotel muy moderno y nos ha encantado, si vuelvo a Nueva York sin duda me volvería a alojar en el.

title: Excellent Spot
text:
Located conveniently in Midtown Manhattan I was lucky to discover the Renaissance Midtown.  The Ren Midtown is 2 blocks from Madison Square Garden but far enough away that you don’t have to deal with the craziness around the arena.  Yet if you want to include a sporting event it is a really quick walk.   

Th staff were terrific and Joshua H at the front desk was excellent!  Rooms are on the smaller side but well appointed and comfortable.  Beds and pillows were comfortable and clean.  

Versa is a fun bar with views to the Garden.  The concierge lounge for Platinum status guests was excellent.  There is a Planet Fitness club in the building that guests get access to as well.  

On in all an excellent experience at the Renaissance Midtown!

title: Beautiful Modern Midtown NYC hotel!
text: This was my first time in NYC in almost 10 years and after extensive research and going back and forth amongst hotels, I decided on The Renaissance Midtown NYC hotel. I was highly impressed. To preface, I currently work in a 5 star, 5 diamond Marriott (Ritz-Carlton) property so I know a thing or two about service and as far as NYC standards go, this particular hotel definitely doesn't disappoint and exceeds expectations on multiple levels. As soon as I arrived, Justin downstairs immediately took my bags and notified me that rooms weren't ready yet. At lobby level check in, the clerk (a beautiful blonde girl) told me the room wasn't quite ready as well but will call me once it was. I waited less than 1 hour and it was ready before noon. She and Ranie were exceptional! My room on the 10th floor was perfect for me- beautifully appointed, very modern and clean with a great view overlooking the roof top and Midtown NYC. I needed 2 champagne glasses and while that took some time, I walked down to the lobby bar and Marisa was just setting up for the day. She gave me the most solid list of places to go to while I was visiting- she was great! Each of them were exactly what I was looking for. While the roof top restaurant isn't affiliated with Marriott, I must give a MAJOR shout out to Barry at the bar. He worked the "tequila focused" satellite bar and he was amazing. He made the perfect Casamigos Margarita's and was so pleasant to chat with while enjoying a nice cocktail with a view. The location of the hotel is perfect. Close but far enough from Times Square, right next to Madison Square Garden and walking distance to the Empire State Building. When I return to NYC soon, I won't even think twice about staying here again. Beautiful modern hotel, great staff, awesome roof top and well-appointed, clean rooms! Highly recommended.

title: Viaje en famila
text: Excelente hotel, pasamos 10 días increíbles en familia muy cerca de todo con una vista espectaculares , estuvimos alojados en el piso 18 y desde allí todo se ve muy bien , no hay casi ruidos , en conclusiion fue una muy linda experiencia , muchas gracias

title: Nice place, nice location
text: I've stayed here several times for business, including utilization of their conference room and catering services. The hotel is modern and centrally located. Nice bar, nice views, modernized rooms, and the noise level (for NYC) is manageable. My room had some minor cleanliness isssues most recently - dust across the top of the mirror and the sliding bathroom door had smudges and was not cleaned - but nothing worth really complaining about. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others.

title: Epic Midtown Views & Service
text:
On my travels to New York, I try to experience different hotels each time. After my stay at the Renaissance midtown - I think I’ll stick to the best from now on. By best, I mean best in service by far. Particularly, Nate Belizaire; the front desk supervisor. He and the entire staff I came across went above and beyond to ensure an amazing stay. 

Thank you, Nate & the Renaissance Midtown staff! I look forward to returning.

title: Nice small room
text: Nice and clean, all you expect from Marriott. The restaurant was hot and slow for subpar breakfast.    I’ll stay again if in this area because the room and staff were all you know and expect from the brand.

title: Nice hotel and fair price
text: We stayed here on a quick visit to see a show. The room was appointed well and very clean. Hotel staff were great. The folks at the restaurant on the 5th floor had a bit of an attitude, but we survived it. Would stay here again.

title: Great hotel in a wooded setting
text: Had dinner downstairs at the hotel restaurant.  Sat at the bar to eat and my bartender Jessica was very friendly and welcoming. Enjoyed the nice restaurant settings and good conversation.  Nice hotel tucked in a quaint wooded setting

title: Fantastic contemporary hotel in midtown
text:
Great location to explore Manhattan, short walk to lots of major attractions including Times Square, Empire State Building, the High Line, Madison Square Garden and dozens of shops, restaurants and bars.

Upgrade to a skyline room and you might get a view as far as Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island (room 3111) but it's not a cheap hotel. The room was not large but clean and comfortable plus every time I hit zero on the phone I got courteous and prompt service. Worth it? Probably just, but you can find cheaper rooms and certainly cheaper hotels.

Food and amenities are of a high quality so you should expect a commensurate bill, the bars and restaurant were all very nice places to hang out both during the day and at night. Look out for the curious built-in TV studio broadcasting sports opinion while you eat which makes an interesting talking point!

The staff and location make this place well worth considering for your midtown stay, close to Penn station and the subway too if you want to travel further afield.

title: Excelente!
text:
Excelente ubicación!. A 1 cuadra de la estación Pensilvania (Penn Station). Todo se hace cerca. 
El cuarto con una excelente distribución, moderno y con todas las facilidades. Una limpieza y cuidados (arreglos) impecables. 
Sin ruido ni molestias. Estuve en el piso 31 (High Floor, Skyline View, Guest room, 1 King)
Si se quiere desayunar está disponible una barra de desayuno o una opción con mayor estilo, el restaurante Versa.
Mi viaje fue en pareja y nos pareció un sitio ideal.

title: A Fantastic Team - A Great Location
text:
The hotel provides the High Standard that I gauge all other of the Marriott brands and locations to.
The Guest Service Ambassadors and Guest Services Managers are great.. My Thank you to Ariel, Caleb, Justin, Mishka, Rada, and all of the team.. You are the Rock Stars of the Hospitality Industry.

A convenient location, modern rooms, and a fantastic restaurant always make it an excellent stay.

title: Great Hotel near MSG
text: Had a chance to check in here just this week after one of the other hotels I was planning to stay in suffered water damage. I was glad I did. The sixth floor lobby is very well appointed, modern, and beautiful. Great little bar scene and restaurant to boot. My hotel room was on the 15th floor and was absolutely beautiful. Well appointed room, very modern, and a great view of the city. I could even see the Empire State building spire. Really a great hotel and a fabulous location near Madison Square Garden.

title: とっても便利な場所にあります
text:
ﾍﾟﾝｼﾙﾍﾞﾆｱ駅近くのとても便利なﾎﾃﾙです。一流のﾎﾃﾙのような大きな豪華なﾎﾃﾙではなくて、ﾋﾞｼﾞﾈｽﾎﾃﾙをちょっと良くした感じです。
ｱｰﾘｰﾁｪｯｸｲﾝをお願いしていたので、まだ準備できていなかったのは残念でした。ちゃんと公式ｻｲﾄで予約してたのに。
ﾎﾃﾙ自体はいいﾎﾃﾙだったと思います。ただ入口はちょっとわかりにくいです。慣れないと通り過ぎてしまうかも。ﾛﾋﾞｰは6階で、ｴﾚﾍﾞｰﾀｰも、ｾｷｭﾘﾃｨばっちりのﾎﾃﾙでした。客室は、設備はｱﾒﾘｶのﾎﾃﾙにしては十分すぎるくらい。
ｺｰﾋｰﾒｰｶｰ、冷蔵庫（ﾐﾆﾊﾞｰではないですよ）、ｽﾘｯﾊﾟ、ｱﾒﾆﾃｨはちゃんとそろっています。歯ﾌﾞﾗｼとﾊﾞｽﾀﾌﾞはありませんでした。
ﾊｳｽｷｰﾋﾟﾝｸﾞは、ほんと日によりけりでしたね。とってもｷﾚｲにしてくれている日もあれば、ｱﾒﾆﾃｨの補充がなかったり、ﾄｲﾚが掃除されてなかったりと。
ｽﾀｯﾌは優しい人ばかりだったので、過ごしやすいと思います。
ﾎﾃﾙ周りはなんでもあります。ﾒｲｼｰｽﾞやｳﾞｨｸﾄﾘｱｽﾞｼｰｸﾚｯﾄの大型店（本店かもしれない）、ﾏﾃﾞｨｿﾝｽｸｴｱ、Kﾏｰﾄ、ﾀｰｹﾞｯﾄ、ﾏﾝﾊｯﾀﾝﾓｰﾙ、ﾉｰﾄﾞｽﾄﾛｰﾑﾗｯｸなど、なんでもあります。ﾀｲﾑｽﾞｽｸｴｱより静かですので、夜もまだﾏｼですね。
地下鉄もなんでも乗り入れていますので、どこでも行きやすいですよ。
ﾌｧﾐﾘｰには不向きかもしれませんが、一人旅や２人くらいならじゅぶんかも。

title: Nice hotel - great access to Penn Station
text: I'm a regular Marriott hotel customer -- this is an above average Renaissance property.  Freshly renovated and hip decorations hide the buildings old bones. Service was solid and the property boasts a nice bar restaurant.  I would come back again as the location is a quick walk from Penn station and lots of great spots nearby

title: Like new, great service and beautiful room
text: We loved this hotel.  The room was trendy, clean and new.  Nothing negative at all.  The front desk staff were super helpful and a pleasure.  The lounge was beautiful and decorated with a very fun design.  The bar was also a pleasure to spend time in.  What a great hotel and a definite must for a stay.

title: So convenient!
text: Within walking distance of everything and if you can't walk, the train is literally right around the corner! It is in a great location too and there is always someone there. The rooms were clean and being that you are in the midst of all the hustle and bustle, you can't hear the commotion below. Would definitely recommend staying here!

title: Nice & Chic Hotel
text: I stayed with my family for 8 days and we were upgraded.......location is very central and busy all the time, times square is 10mins walk, Penn Station is 1 block away. Starbucks is just opp. If you miss breakfast which closes by 9am then 2 options are 1min away to order your own breakfast or lunch.

title: Muy buena ubicación
text:
El hotel es bastante nuevo, y muy optimizado.

Quizás tan optimizado que se han olvidado de que los niños pueden ir también el hotel y la verdad es que no encajan demasiado.

Lo recomendaría para parejas y negocios pero no para familias con niños.

Los días que estuvimos era solo desayuno a la carta

Repetiría sin duda pero viajando en pareja o negocios.

title: Nice Hotel / Good Location near MSG, Penn Station, Empire State Building
text:
I've stayed on this hotel a few times over the past year and a bit while on business and its a very good location, accessible by public transition from EWR airport, and across from Penn Station for easy Amtrak and other rail connections.

Staff are extremely friendly.
Rooms are a bit tiny but comfortable beds and nice bathrooms.
As a Gold member, the Lounge was nice and had a nice breakfast selection (didn't use it apart from breakfast).

In a busy area of NYC in Midtown but easy to get everywhere.  Much better than a few blocks up in the horror show that is Times Square.  Still lots of tourists around but not nearly as annoying as being near Times Square.

Will continue to stay here in the future if this quality is maintained.

title: Beautiful Hotel / Great Location
text:
I decided to take my wife to see The Lion King on Broadway. This hotel was highly recommended by reviewers. Love the location (close to Amtrak). The employee at the front desk was very welcoming. After a few laughs with him, he upgraded my room from a city view  to a skyline view which was amazing. 

Now the ugly: Since we were so high up I decided to sleep that night with the blinds open. The following morning I got up to look at the Statue of Liberty in the distance but then I noticed someone looking at me. Across from our hotel is an office building were some guy was looking into room windows with binoculars. Checking to see if he was looking at me, I gave him the finger. I take it he saw that I noticed him because he immediately backed up from the window thinking I couldn’t see his white short-sleeve shirt. After I pointed at him again he put the binoculars in a bag down on the floor and walked away. After that we no longer felt comfortable keeping the blinds open and enjoying the view. Pic #4 with the first white board on in the window is where he was standing. 

Overall the facility was beautiful and the room/bathroom was gorgeous. FYI to all future visitors, if you have a view of Madison Square Garden keep your blinds closed until the police catch this perv!

title: Modern hotel in the heart of Manhattan with a fantastic staff who are eager to please
text: This modern hotel is a block from NY Penn Station making it super convenient. Everyone from bell desk, front desk to lounge attendance were super friendly and helpful. As Platinum elite, we were offered a room upgrade to a higher level with a nice view of Time Square. Beds were super comfortable and room big enough for our family of 4.  The M lounge is small but adequate, its a nice place to grab a cool drink and relax after walking around in the city.  24 hour access to Planet Fitness which offers lots of equipment is a nice alternative to cramped hotel gym.  Will definitely stay here again for its location, super modern decor and friendly staff, all at a reasonable price.

title: NYC great location
text: Overall very modern hotel, Gym very good. Rooms sparse and modern but clean and good facilities. Overall one the best value hotels in the heart of New Your and walking distance from macys in less than 5 mis

title: Excellent Service + Stylish Rooms With Great Amenities
text: In terms of service, the most personalised and authentic I have received when staying in NYC. Special thanks to Joshua who checked us in and Mishka who manages the front desk - she leads a great team. There simple genuine care made a difference to our experience. Rooms are modern; great bed, bathroom and critically, great shower. Nice layout to make the most of limited space.

title: Work Trip
text: It was overall an OK experience. The service at first was terrible. They were extremely rude about almost everything. And those elevators are Extremely annoying. It's a good location if you like that area near Times Square. I'll give it this though - the view is pretty fantastic.

title: central location, well updated and maintained. access to a proper gym through elevator
text:
I liked: 
- comfy bed
- central air taking care of nice temperatures in the room
- modern interior design (concrete, decor wallpapers, modern wash table, walk in shower, huge windows)
- Cooperation with a local in-house gym (2 floors). 
- very comfortable bed
- location next to Penn Station (a block away)

not that great: 
- room size a little small - for one day trip with big luggage, making it challenging to access it (open close) due to little space in the room. 
- high temperature in common areas (elevator and entrance) making it quite hot.
- three elevator seem to be too few for size of hotel - often a long wait while staff already kept using the stairways themselves a lot!

title: Great property and super rooms, good location
text: The hotel is clean, modern and really great rooms. I would stay at this hotel again. the fellow at the front would go out of his way to go get a taxi which was very helpful. There is access to the gym right beside the hotel, accessable by the elevators - planet fitness, which was great.

title: Ottima posizione
text: Abbiamo soggiornato 1 settimana per la nostra prima visita a New York, albergo in posizione strategica centrale, ma zona piuttosto tranquilla. Abbiamo provato la colazione in albergo non male, ma consiglio di uscire e viversi la città! Camere pulite e staff molto gentile! Consiglio!

title: Ottima posizione
text: Hotel tipico di Manhattan molto pulito e in ottima posizione. Mobili di design sia nelle camere sia negli ambienti comuni. Colazione buona ed abbondante sebbene non ci sia molta scelta. Stesso discorso per il pasto consumato a cena. Personale della reception gentile ma poco preparato nel fornire indicazioni turistiche.

title: Comfortable Stay at the Renaissance
text:
This being my first time in New York, I Was looking for a nice place to stay near Javit’s Center and have always loved the Marriott beds, so I thought I would give the Renaissance midtown a try.  Great choice!

It was a great location just a few blocks from where we would be setting up for NyNow2018. My daughter has always said a lot of hotels in NY have slow elevators, not the case for the Renaissance. A very different type of elevator without floor buttons, but quick just the same.

The room was not large but adequate and well appointed. After setting up the show booth it was a pleasure to go to sleep on the Marriott bed. Super comfy and the bedding is always nice.

The staff here was very friendly and helpful with directions and suggestions for a variety of questions.

The Club Lounge had a great breakfast on weekday mornings and I loved that it was open 24/7 for water, juice, yogurt, etc.

We had rain most of the time we were here and the bellmen were handing out umbrellas should you need one, super cool!

It was a great stay and I will be back!

title: Modernly Elegant Hotel with Decent Views in a Decent Location
text:
My first impression of this hotel was that of the attentive bellman and friendly associates at the check-in desk.  The lobby is on the 6th floor which cuts down on the crush of people from the street. 

I received a room on the 30th floor which was spacious by NYC standards and provided decent, partial views of the lower Manhattan skyline.

Being a Marriott Platinum member I had lounge access which was open 24 hours.  It was great to be able stop in for a quick refreshment and hors d'oeuvres after walking the city all day. 

This hotel provided my first interaction with a digital/"smart" elevator controller which seemed to speed up the process.  As a details person I appreciate the utilization of this technology.  The internet could be faster with top speeds of 5Mbps regular and 15Mbps "enhanced."

During my only negative experience, I dined at the rooftop restaurant "VERSA" which served undercooked, mediocre food served by apathetic wait staff.  On the other hand, the bar area looked a fun spot to hang out at however I can't attest to that first hand.  

Another bonus to this hotel is easy access to subways/trains via close proximity to Penn Station.  This made easy work of catching a train to JFK during rush hour.

While centrally located within Manhattan, there are probably better properties to consider as a tourist.  If you're looking for a place in that specific area then I would definitely recommend.

title: New - so good
text: The hotel was new and my trip was flawless - which is rare - and I live in hotels so have pretty high expectations. The staff was good at the bar next to check-in and the room was pristine and extra toiletries were delivered promptly.

title: Uma decepção
text: Hotel muito bem localizado, a poucas ruas do agito da Times Square. Para turistar é ótimo. Sistema bom de segurança. Ótimo restaurante no 5 andar, ótima ducha e TV. Minha grande decepção foi com o cheiro forte do edredom. Cachorro molhado, muito ruim para quem paga o preço elevado que é cobrado. Outro ponto é. Que o staff é educado mas, durante a noite não ficam na recepção, o lobby fica no 6 andar e cheguei por volta das 22 h para check in... mas não havida ninguém! Esperei, esperei... até que tive que “adentrar” em um escritório que fica atrás da recepção quando um funcionário simpático veio nos atender (não havia sino algum nem nada achei muito constrangedor). Uma pena, mas não pretendo voltar!

title: This is the best hotel in NYC
text: I have stayed at this hotel over 20 times. They never disappoint. I have brought groups as big as 25 and small as 2 and we always get great attention. Marriott rewards members they will always upgrade you if rooms are available. They also have a great lounge. I have stayed at every Marriott property in the city and this one is the best.

title: Great Location, Awesome Staff, Clean, Fabulous Decor!
text:
I have stayed in at least 30 different hotels in Manhattan in the last 30 years.  This by far was one of the best!  Before we even arrived I received an email from Justin, Director of Guest Services asking if we had any special needs.  Didn't know hotels did that anymore!
The hotel is located in the garment district just steps away from Times Square.  Great central location to all the Subway lines, restaurants, shows, etc.  
The staff and facilities were amazing.  The Free Breakfast was the best free breakfast I've ever seen.  Everything was fresh!!!! The young lady tending to the breakfast area, I'd hire her!!
Rooms are typical NYC size rooms, although not too small.  Bed quite comfy.  Only odd thing is how the opaque glass bathroom wall separates the 2 rooms.  I was with my husband, so not a big deal.  But may have been a little too close for comfort if I was sharing the room with a friend.  
There's a Roof Top bar which was fun and a nice lobby bar to enjoy a drink!  
I would have expected to pay a lot more for this hotel in NYC.  We will definitely be back, can't wait!!

title: First visit to NY Midtown, Ideal Location
text:
Being a solo traveler, I was looking for an ideal location and I found it at the Renaissance NY Midtown Hotel.  Personally, I found the hotel to be centrally located to everything as I walked everywhere.  
The Hotel:  check-in happens on the 6th floor, which was efficient and very friendly. Elevators have no interior floor buttons, everything is networked via main panel outside the elevators, sometimes a little slow and if that's the only complaint it's a minor one.
The Room:  very pleased with the room, it was clean, well appointed with a comfortable bed, good shower, ample closet space and a great view of the city
The Hotel Food:  Not as good as other Marriott properties I've visited in other US cities.
Sound:  It's a big city so expected some street noise at night, but it wasn't too bad.
The surrounding area:
Penn Station:  Is around the corner, handy if you're using the Long Island Rail Way to get elsewhere such as Long Island.
Shopping:  Macy's is right around the corner, along with Designer Shoe Warehouse and many other shopping havens.
Eating:  Lots of options within a NY minute to get something to eat.
See & Do:  Chelsea Market, Highline Walking Path, Broadway, Times Square, Central Park all within walking distance provided you don't mind walking.
Would stay at the Renaissance Midtown again in a NY minute!

title: Hotel com atmosfera nova iorquina
text:
Ótimo hotel, com atmosfera despojada e atual. Espaço prático e descomplicado. Como chegamos antes do horário de check-in, nos disponibilizaram um quarto no décimo andar. Ao entrarmos na recepção sentimos uma deliciosa fragrância que inspira frescor e elegância. O quarto tem bom tamanho, com camas super confortáveis que oferecem noite de sono revigorante após muita caminhada pelas ruas de NY. Os banheiros tem bom tamanho, com ducha forte. Localização estratégica, ao lado de estações de metrô, do Empire State Building e lojas como Macy’s, Gap e Old Navy. O café da manhã acontece num local agradável com vista bonita. Tem opções ao lado do hotel para refeições, caso prefiram algo mais em conta. 
Com Certeza voltarei com minha família.

title: Excellent Mid-Town Theatre District option
text:
We had a great stay here in July 2018.

It was 15 min stroll to Theatre District, yet far enough away from the trashy tourists of Times Square that you could still enjoy a trip to NYC.

Room was plenty big, odd that it had no drawers, but plenty of space for 2 people for 4 nights.  

Concierge Lounge was nice, but lacking enough places to sit down.  Weekend brunch was kind of lame, they could do nicer for the price of the hotel and the space and facilities.

title: Second stay here, best thing is gym
text:
Have stayed here before. Staff is very friendly and accommodating. Find the lobby on 6th floor to be cumbersome but elevators are generally quick. Exception is after work as people are using elevators for popular restaurant on 5th floor.

Rooms are a little tight, but well equipped with fridge and coffee maker.

Best part of hotel is the full service Planet Fitness attached to it

title: Best 4 Days of Service
text: I've traveled extensively and have never had such a great experience in every aspect ever, which makes this review important.  The staff was exceptional in all regards.  Front desk, security, housekeeping, bell staff, bar staff, where amazingly helpful and friendly to my family during our entire stay.  Could not promote this location more.  Separately, great location, steps away from subway.  Highly recommend.

title: 方便的不得了
text: 飯店是在紐約曼哈頓Renaissance ，不管是外型還是房間內都很時尚的酒店，Lobby又大又漂亮很棒, 氣氛很棒衛浴備品是Aveda超棒的我愛洗髮精。

title: Muito bom Hotel
text: Ótimo hotel e muito bem localizado com estação de metrô próximo. O acesso ao andar somente é feito com cartão magnético. O banheiro é muito bom como nas fotos. O quarto para 4 pessoas com suas malas é um pouco pequeno mas deu para o gasto. As camas são muito confortáveis. Os funcionários são bem atenciosos. No geral eu recomendo a estadia neste hotel.

title: Ok hotel with ok service.
text: Ok hotel with ok service. Front desk staff has that arrogant attitude! Location is good, room is not very big. No proper restaurant inside the hotel, however, you get food anywhere hereby, was not a big issue at all

title: Un buena opción
text: Gran hotel, bastante céntrico, limpio y con unas vistas impresionantes. Además el trato del personal fue exquisito, resuelven todas tus dudas y al comentar que era una ocasión especial nos mandaron champan y fresas a la habitación.  Una gran opción para hospedarse en Nueva York.

title: Visited June 1 - June 4, 2018
text:
This hotel is located perfectly in the fashion district.  Very clean, great staff at the front desk and bar/restaurant.  My sister is a vegan and the front desk was able to give us some advice on places to go that would be vegan friendly.  
We drove from near Toronto, Canada.  Valet was $60 per day, not bad.
Housekeeping friendly, accommodating. 
Would stay there again.

title: Excellent Location if traveling by train into NYC
text: This was my first stay at this two year old property.  The staff was truly awesome upon checking in and providing information about the property.  The lobby is on the 6th floor.  The rooftop lounge is on the 5th floor.  Our room was on the 36th floor and it was larger than your typical NYC hotels.  Great views as well.  Only issue with this property is the elevators take a while to come back and forth.

title: Renaissance Midtown
text:
Beautiful, modern, very clean hotel, located 10 min.fast walk from Times Square, but without hustle and bustle, still near really busy 7th Avenue. Flagship  Macy’s  around the corner and Madison Square Garden 2 minutes walk.
Best New York  bagels right across, big lines everyday,many little places around to have a breakfast, lunch or cocktail ! Delicious 2 Bros pizza just next door, my teenagers were  getting out for a quick $1 cheese slice every day ! Stayed 8 nights in July 2018, first day after extremely early flight we came few hours before checking in time , it was a heat wave and 101 F degrees outside, we were tired and hot. ! SEBASTIAN was extremely helpful and had a room for us right away, so we could refresh and rest ! Thank you so much, we will definitely be back !!!

title: Great hotel with a few nits
text:
The Renaissance Midtown boasts a terrific location and great facilities.   The staff are generally friendly and helpful.  The breakfast buffet, both in the restaurant and executive lounge, pretty lacking.  I got them for free as an elite member.  Would have been very unhappy if I had paid for either.   One very frustrating thing is that I’m having a terrible time getting my Rewards points and nights credited.  Several emails and still no progress.  This is disappointing as it should be an automated process and when that process fails, a manager should be able to resolve.  

Again the locations, facilities and frontline staff are great.  Breakfast needs help.

title: best stay
text: I stayed at the Renaissance Midtown Atlanta and had several issues, dirty room, dingy towels, food unpleasant. I was extremely upset and had to admit was somewhat disruptive to the front desk and the front office manager. I was very impressed with her level of professionalism. I will return because of how Shermaine dealt with my wife and me even after how we treated her and the team. "Job well done" I will return

title: Amazing hotel in the heart of NYC
text:
For a night away in the Big Apple, this hotel ticks all the boxes.

We stayed here for just one night after a long trip, and thanks to the excellent location, modern stylish décor and my favourite Aveda shampoo in the rainfall shower, we can’t fault it. The staff were great, from the doormen to the reception staff, and the elevators are pretty fun too.

Be warned that drinks in the rooftop bar and restaurant are not cheap, but there are views of the Empire State Building. It was lit up rainbow-coloured for Pride during our stay, so that was cool.

title: Excellent
text: Excellent from the moment you enter the lobby.  Extremely friendly and helpful staff.  Rooms are a little small but very modern and clean. Floor to ceiling windows with a great view.  Centrally located to major sites. We will stay here again.

title: Just Okay...
text:
My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights on a recent trip to NYC.  While the Renaissance is not a bad option, in my opinion it was not worth the money and we probably could have had similar amenities and more convenience at a lower tier Marriott property (e.g. Courtyard or Residence Inn) in the same part of town.  I really did expect more when compared to Renaissance properties we’ve visited in other cities.

Positives:
- Lounge was nice and the breakfast and evening appetizers were good
- 24 hour access to a Planet Fitness was a plus
- All the staff we interacted with were great
- Room...size was what I’d expect for NYC. The bed was comfortable and the shower was great 

Less positives...
- There is no other way to put this...the elevator situation sucks! Wait times of 3 to 4 minutes were typical and at busier times of the day you might be greeted by a full elevator after your wait. My wife actually timed me and said it took 19 minutes to go and fetch ice. Most of this time was spent waiting on the elevator. I did have to go to two different floors as the ice machine on 26 was out of order, but still...
- The complimentary breakfast buffet on Saturday was very disappointing. So much so we opted to go elsewhere on Sunday
- Room again...blinds were difficult to operate. Room was either too cold or hot so we opted for cold given it was July. Lastly, not a fan of the exposed concrete ceilings. Looks unfinished

title: Convenient and clean inside
text:
Very clean with good service. Staff is nice and the gym is useable. 

Inside the rooms, it is very clean. Also, the bathrooms are modern and provide Aveda soaps which I love! 

Location was perfect, right in the center of Manhattan and it made it so easier to move around the city for the week. There is amazing New York bagels across the street...that were great for breakfast.

Highly recommend this hotel. Despite being near Times Square, rooms insulated sound well and I had a great time

title: A pleasant surprise
text:
I was looking for a hotel near Penn Station, as I would be arriving in Manhattan via NJ Transit from Newark Airport after midnight.  I sometimes gravitate towards historic hotels, but the 2 near Penn Station, the New Yorker and Hotel Pennsylvania, did not look that great, and the Hotel Penn had some pretty lousy TA reviews.  I ended up booking at the Renaissance because it looked pretty good online, was a block from Penn Station, was a good value, and because I have Marriott Gold Level status.  This was my first stay at a Renaissance branded hotel.  Although I was only there about 9 hours, the stay was a joy, a pleasant surprise.  Service overall was very friendly.

I find the area around Penn Station rather gritty and has never been my first choice for lodging location.  Macy's and Madison Square Garden are very close, and the Theatre District is about 7 blocks away.  The Renaissance's main entrance is on 35th St. between 7th and 8th Ave., but also has an entrance on 34th.  The ground floor only has a bell/security desk.  The Lobby is on the 6th floor, along with a public bar/lounge and the Club Lounge.  The main restaurant and bar (indoor/outdoor) is on the 5th floor, meeting rooms are on the 7th.  Elevators are the touchscreen kind where you indicate where you want to go and the screen tells you which elevator to wait for.  Access to room floors requires a key scan as well for security.  The lobby and bar/lounge/library areas were stylishly decorated in a contemporary fashion that I found quite appealing.   Throughout the hotel are clever homages to the area's garment district past and present.  In the lobby, this included dressmakers mannequins.  In the Club Lounge, there were bolts of colour-coordinated fabrics lining the walls.  In the room, there was a sculpture of a sewing machine and a dish for knick-knacks shaped like a button.

Although I had booked a standard room, I think I was upgraded to a slightly larger room with a view on the 20th floor (I think the hotel has just under 40 floors).  The room had floor-to-ceiling windows on one and 1/4 of the walls.  I again loved the contemporary style and modern design.  I always look for electrical outlets and USB ports conveniently situated by the desk and bed; this room had both.  There was no minibar, but a very convenient minifridge instead.  The bathroom was well-lit, with a large shower with rain and hand-held heads.  I liked the stylish bean-shaped sink.  My only complaint would be that the towels, although stylish, were more like kitchen towels than fluffy, absorbent bath towels.  

As a Marriott Gold member, I had access to the Club Lounge, which is open 24 hours for access to a fridge full of water, soft drinks, juices, milk and yogurt from which I stocked my room fridge.  The Lounge is not large but again, very stylish.  A small breakfast buffet is served starting at 6:30 am that included warm items (bacon, sliced-up burritos filled with scrambled eggs and cheese) plus continental breakfast fare.  I'm not sure about food offerings later in the day.
I took a peek at the hotel's restaurant and lounge which was called Rock and Reilly's, but has now been renamed Versa.  It's a large space with indoor and outdoor bars and dining.  The outdoor lounge is apparently quite popular.  

In spite of my thoughts about the area, my stay at the Renaissance was surprisingly nice.  I would definitely return here, hopefully for more than 9 hours.

title: Top Hotel mit freundlichem Personal in guter Midtown Lage
text: Das relativ neue Haus liegt gleich neben der Madison Square Garden und der Pen Station. (Ideal, wenn man mit der Long Island Railroad zum JFK Airport möchte) Die beiden Hoteleingänge sind leicht zu übersehen, da sich die Rezeption nicht auf Strassenebene befindet. Das Personal and der Rezeption ist sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit (was gerade in New York keine Selbstverständlichkeit ist). Das Haus verfügt über einen Pub mit angrenzender Dachterrasse. Hier werden Burgergerichte und Cocktails serviert. Die Zimmer sind modern und die Betten sehr bequem. Das Bad ist mit einer Glaswand vom Zimmer getrennt. (Hier kann jedoch eine Rollo gewünschte Privatsphäre garantieren).

title: Location
text: We decided to stay at this hotel primarily for the location. The property is walking distance to times square and Penn station is across the street from the rear entrance. You can take the subway or Long Island Railroad from JFK to practically the hotel's doorstep. The hotel and room were both clean and the staff was very nice.

title: Lo Mejor
text:
Nuevo hotel muy bien ubicado! Servicio Excelente desde la entrada al hotel!
Habitaciones comodas y super lujo! 
Excelente restaurant para desayunar o cenar.
 
Si re hospedad en los Marriots es una exclente opción!

title: Very good hotel
text: It is a very nice and professional staff. Very clean and well located.Could have fridge in the rooms. One of the weakness is the parking that is very expensive as I was charged $ 57 per night but it is NYC.

title: Modern, sexy, stylish & comfortable
text: My wife and I stayed here on a Thursday night to see a Broadway play (Beautiful). We used the valet parking ($60) and had a room over looking West 35th St. (not much of a view). There is a Planet Fitness available for guests but we didn't use it. We sat at the bar and had a late lunch (burger & chicken sandwich respectively) which were good. The bar/restaurant has a patio/rooftop area and there was sports themed podcast taking place in an adjacent studio. There are two Irish pubs on the block and Andrews Coffee/diner is 200 feet away on W. 35th & 7th. Times Square is an easy 7-8 block walk as was our play on W. 43rd. The room was very modern, clean & romantic and the I loved the bathroom and shower area. The whole place a sexy vibe about it and I would like to stay here again. Great for couples.

title: Great location in the heart of NYC!
text: I stayed here while in NYC for a conference, with a couple of vacation days tacked on to the end. I had a few challenges with the actual check in process, but the staff bent over backwards to rectify the situation and then make up for the inconvenience. I ended up getting upgraded to a balcony room overlooking Times Square for the second half of my stay when my husband joined me. The hotel is right in the middle of all of the activity of NYC. It was perfect for being able to walk (healthy distance) to conference events at the Javits Center and Radio City Music Hall, and ideally located to attend the theater. All of the rooms are big. The balcony suites are huge. I would definitely stay here again for a weekend adventure in the city.

title: Birthday Broadway trip to the City!
text: All my 5 year old daughter wanted for her birthday this year was a NYC trip. So we surprised her with tickets to Frozen and booked a room at the Renaissance Midtown so we could stay overnight (we are from Nashville but were visiting family in Delaware.) We are Marriott silver elite members and were pleased at the deal we got when we booked. When we arrived we were greeted by Ariel, who was so kind to my kids and made my daughter feel really special when she found out it was her birthday.  Our room wasn’t ready when we arrived so we left our bag with the valet and went to play at Central Park (riding the subway is super easy from this location.) When we came back, we were so surprised and excited to have been upgraded to an incredible room with an amazing view. Ariel also sent up cake pops and milk for the kids, with a birthday note for my daughter. It was so thoughtful and we were impressed by the attention to detail by so many of the staff we encountered. The hotel is beautifully decorated and the location was central to everywhere we needed to go. We would definitely stay at this property again!

title: New, clean fantastic location
text: This hotel was great for us. It is new, so it's shiny, updated and clean. The rooms are stylish but the best part is that they are huge for a NYC hotel. The location was perfect for us. It's super close to Penn Station so it was an easy commute from JFK (cheaper and faster than a taxi or car service) and made it easy to navigate the city by subway. The hotel staff surprised us with Presecco and strawberries for our anniversary which was a nice treat. We had access to the Concierge lounge and were able to get get water, juice and soda during the day which was a god send during the July heat in NYC. I have to agree, however, the breakfast was a bit underwhelming. Coffee was not great but can carry you over until you hit one of the terrific cafes near by.

title: great value in NYC
text:
Location of this hotel is very convenient, walking distance from the Penn station.  Hotel is very new and stylish.  Bathroom functions very well, is clean and enough room.  Beds are comfortable.  Room is great.  For the price, it is great.

Breakfast in the Club house (as part of Marriott gold membership)  is the only part that is underwhelming.  Not edible, and watery coffee.

title: 뉴욕중심가의 아주 좋은 호텔
text:
무엇보다 35번가에 있어 위치가 끝내줍니다. 방은 작은 편이지만 뉴욕인 것을 생각하면 어쩔 수 없는 부분이고, 인근 호텔에 비교해 봤을 때 300불 내외에서 묵을 수 있는 호텔 중엔 퀄리티나 서비스가 아주 좋습니다.

매리어트 플래티넘 멤버라 로비 옆의 라운지를 이용할 수 있는데, 라운지도 동급의 뉴욕 호텔에 비해  아주 잘 꾸며져 있습니다. 깨끗하고 올드하지 않아서 좋습니다. 음료도 괜찮은 것들로 구비되어 있고 조식은 가지수는 적지만 먹을만 합니다.

title: Trendy hotel centrally located!
text:
If you are looking for a modern, clean, new & trendy hotel which is located centrally in Manhattan then this hotel is for you. 

We had a room at one of the upper floors and the view of the city skyline was really nice. Room was spacious enough for us couple. Not too noisy and beds were comfortable. Elevators had a control panel which took some getting used to which was ok. Lobby is not located at entrance level. We had a bit of fun at the interactive digital wall near the elevator. Service was good. No complains. You can get some drinks at Rock&Reilly’s but the view is nothing great. The view from our room was better. 

The location is awesome..few steps away from Macy’s and view of Empire State Building. Walking distance to most of major spots at Fifth Avenue. The hotel is also connected to a Designer Shoes Warehouse. So shopping is not a problem. There is also a cinema nearby and Hillsong Church is not too far. Subway station is nearby too although I find the subway in NYC pretty confusing though no fault of the hotel. 

All in all, we enjoyed our stay here! Would recommend to any friends visiting NYC. Comfort & convenience.

title: Great location
text: Lovely rooms with all the amenities. Very modern and chic. Concierge lounge meets all the needs of the travelers. Continental breakfast was nothing to write home about... everything was lukewarm or cold at 7:05 (5 minutes after they opened). Great location and I will return again.

title: Stayed in >10 hotels in NYC, this one is best all-around experience
text:
Being newly opened has it's advantages.  The rooms are fresh, the lobby is nice, it caters to guests needs that other older hotels in NYC can't.

This has a great location in the heart of the city, away from Times Square, but close enough for a short walk.  Close to Penn Station and MSG.  

The rooms are nice, they offer pretty good views of the city if you end up with a higher-floor room.  Staff are friendly and always smiling.  

The only downside (or upside) is that the hotel gym is a Planet Fitness - with other non-hotel members working out - which for the time I was there it was always relatively crowded.  I'm fairly used to the hotel gym's being empty, but this was rather crowded.  It was nice having a wide range of equipment to use.  

The club lounge was nice and had a nice array of snacks in the afternoon and breakfast was good as well.  Nice that it is accessible at all house for drinks.

I'll be returning to this hotel for my subsequent NYC stays.

title: Tight but Alright
text: You r in New York, don't want to spend a fortune and want a central location....this hotel probably fits your needs.
