The room is probably close to 300 square feet, but is very tight between the end of the bed and the desk/shelf that goes along the wall opposite the two queen size beds.   That shelf is close to 15 feet....There are no drawers or dresser.   There is a desk chair and lamp above a small table.....There is a tendency to bump/bruise yourself on the base of the beds.   There are excellent pin-point lamps for each bed....good for reading as well as more conventional lighting..  There is a bench under the shelf on which I put some of my clothes as well as using the shelf that runs across most of the room for the same purpose.   Great T.V. with wide range of choices.   Very warm colors throughout the room.   Closet with refrigerator (no mini-bar).....great for putting personal items.  Ironing board and iron as well as a safe.   2 Shelves in small closet.   Bath room about 70 square feet...6 foot Pullman.   Marble and tile throughout bathroom.   Very good overhead shower (don't like overhead showers) and wand in the stall shower   Lit Magnifying mirror.  Fairly good lighting.  Soap bars (very good) and liquid as well as shampoo, body lotion, conditioners.    This area is thronging with people....close to the theater district.  Wonderful staff.     Some individuals complained about the unique way that you call for the elevator, but once you use it.....no problem.    Favorite restaurant:  L'Artusi, Bodrum, and tree Bistro.   None are overly expensive providing good value and very good food.  Our party thought L'Artusi was the best restaurant of our five night stay.   Tough to get a reservation so reserve as early as possible (3-4 weeks if possible).   Wait staff was exceptional.   I would probably prefer a hotel that was closer to Central Park on our next stay.....out of the hustle and bustle as the subway system takes you everywhere in an expeditious manner.   For a quick lunch.......try Pret A Manger.  Great soups and sandwiches....very casual and reasonable.

title: My New Favorite Hotel in Manhattan
text: My recent stay at Renaissance Midtown has given me a new favorite hotel in Manhattan. Located near Penn Station and Madison Square Garden, the location was idea for traveling to and from the airport as well as hitting all of my favorite spots in the city. The room was beautifully appointed with modern styling and thoughtful amenities. It had a nice city view with the Statue of Liberty in the distance. The wi-fi speed was excellent. All of the linens were luxurious which made for a comfortable stay. The white marble bathroom was gorgeous with a fabulous rain shower. After a long day of travel, the beds were perfect for relaxation and restful sleep. All of the lounge spaces were tastefully decorated and inviting. Thread Bar was a fun space to grab a crafted cocktail. Rock & Reilly’s was buzzing. It had a hip, energetic vibe without being too pretentious. Every employee I interacted with was ready to meet my needs and ensure I was having a great stay. It is clear the leadership have assembled a team focused on positive customer experience. It was a nice touch to have my elite rewards status was noted in my interactions with the hotel team. I appreciated the follow-up email from the director of guest services to ensure everything met my expectations. Overall, the experience exceeded by expectations and I look forward to returning again for a much longer stay.

title: Great central location and beautiful hotel
text: The Renaissance Midtown is a favorite of mine. I've stayed twice and will be back soon. Beautiful rooms that are quite roomy especially by NYC standards. It is in a great location with easy access around the city.

title: EXCELLENT STAFF AND FANTASTIC LOCATION!
text:
I have stayed at numerous Marriott properties at all class levels, and this was one of the best!

Joshua (front desk) was excellent in recognizing me immediately with that wonderful smile and anticipated my needs and made sure I had a great room.  He even offered me a free drink after a long travel day.  Unexpected and greatly appreciated....
 
Later that day, I was in the restaurant and asked to speak to a manager as I was unclear where my server was....the manager, Eric, responded right away with apologies, took my order, made sure I got it....and checked back with me several times to make sure I was doing well. And he did it all with grace, patience and a beautiful smile.
 
All of the employees I encountered were very pleasant, including those with the housekeeping services and others in the restaurant.  I would absolutely recommend this property to others.  It is stylish, clean -- and most importantly to me -- has a team that provides first class service.  This reflects very well on the leadership of this property.  Well Done!

title: Perfect hotel
text:
Let's start with the obvious, the perfect location! Right on the Penn Station (from witch you can get anywhere...)
Very close to Times Square, right on the 7th Avenue  (fashion Avenue), and close to the 5th too.
Next are the big Manhattan watching rooms. Ours was watching the medison  square garden and the penn station. The room was big, very clean, equipped with a big screen TV including cables, Internet TV (netflix, hulu), a small refrigerator that was just enough for us, a perfect bathtub and two huge beds. The staff were perfectly nice, helpful and informative. Anything we needed they helped without any delay. The room was cleaned up and tidy every day and It was so nice to come back to every day. If you arrive earlier than check in time they provide a free storage for your luggage, and the same if you check out before you leave the city.  Also included is a very big jim that we did not try
The price we paid was more than worthy.

In short: perfect location, perfect room, perfect staff

You'll enjoy every minute!

title: windows not sound proof
text: The room was nice, but I couldn’t get much sleep at night with the constant noise from the streets below and construction nearby. Even though our room was 19 floors up, it sounded like we’re on the ground floor. The all night drilling and jackhammering kept me all night, in addition to sirens, car engines etc.

title: Gem in a great location
text:
Located a block away from a major mid town transportation center, Penn Station. The area is bit touristy but very convenient to mid town attractions and subways.

We were meeting friends for dinner in the city and I didn’t want to drive home to NJ after dinner. So we booked a room for Saturday night and given my Marriot status, we received a free upgrade to a room with a terrace. The terrace was as large as the room with outdoor cushioned furniture. The room was new and clean and the bathroom had an overhead and hand held shower.

We also took advantage of the bar in the lobby where the service was very good with real bartenders who knew how to make very good cosmos.

The only challenge was the elevators which were slow and took a while to understand how to use. I used the valet which worked out well but was pricey at $60 a day.

title: No Cell Service, Concrete Walls
text: In town on work trip, had to make calls from landline while in room.  Made conference horrible.  Room service food below expectations.  Spring Rolls were nasty and cold.. location is great, but for $500 a night, pick another location.

title: Good location but...
text:
This is the second time staying in this hotel and in general it was ok, but in the second night we were in the bed and out of sudden someone tried to open our room and luckily we blocked the door so it was not open.. we called reception to complain since we were worried that someone was able to open our room; after 10 minutes they called and said that one employee was moving guest room to other and opened ours by mistake. We believed that this mistake is not acceptable and also reception should call us to explain instant waiting for us to complain.
Very unfortunate accident.

title: Newest Marriott Property in Midtown
text:
My wife and I visit NYC at least once a year to celebrate a birthday or anniversary.  We normally stay at the Marriott Eastside or Lexington hotels.  We tried this new Marriott property and were very pleased.  New hotel, next to Madison Square Garden/Penn Station.  The staff was great.  Got upgraded to a nice room overlooking the city.  Room was clean, bed comfortable, nice shower and efficient.  Room wasn't huge but there was a place for everything.  Refrig in room, etc.  Received email before stay and told the hotel we were celebrating our anniversary.  Hotel sent a nice bottle of red wine with a note.  Received an email after the stay thanking us.  The emails seemed more personal than the normal emails coming from other Marriott properties.
The other properties are closer to Grand Central Station and the heart of 5th avenue but this property is newer and very nice.

title: Way overdue Review - Visited in Feb
text:
My wife, 12 year old daughter and myself visited NYC for the first time this past Feb..  We utilized the rewards points via Marriott that I had accrued due to business travel.  We were trying to decide between the Renaissance MT or Time Square.  We were very happy with our decision to utilize the MT location.

We had a 2 queen city view room.  The room was small but we heard that is the norm for NYC.  The room was very modern and very well equipped.  

Being a Platinum Member, we had access to the concierge lounge,  That was very nice so we could grab some snacks and bottled water.

The location & staff is what made this a 5 star hotel for us.  We were close enough to TS and the great shopping of NYC.  We walked a lot during our trip.  The girls did ice skating at Rockefeller Center, went to the sports stores (Nike/Adidas; have soccer enthusiasts!!) and ate lunch by Central Park.  We could walk to everywhere and never had to get a cab/Uber!!  The staff was also great.  Everyone was very nice, gave great ideas for restaurants nearby.  

We would return to RMT on a future trip to NYC.

title: First time here - great experience, great room and great location
text: Booked this hotel not knowing of it and I had booked a room with city view in the 30th floor. I was pleasantly surprised....the room would have been more than suffisent for a couple. So me being alone this was great. And the view overlooking the city and Madison Square Garden - AWESOME to start early NY-days. This is def. a hotel to remember for my next trip to NY.

title: If you stay here, be sure to put your valuables in the safe!
text: If you stay here, be sure to put your valuables in the safe! I had expensive jewelry taken from my room. I know that isn't the hotel's fault per say, but the response from the hotel has been less than adequate. They did not seem overly concerned, I have heard nothing from them regarding what is going to happen going forward other than they will launch a claim with the claims department. I have yet to see any evidence that this has been done. Getting information requires me to ring them, (re)explain the situation, get passed around to multiple people, leave messages etc. and still nobody has any answers. It's frustrating and disappointing. Given the response I have received so far, I can only assume that the person who took my things is still working there and still helping themselves to other people's property. Hopefully this review saves others from losing their valuables.

title: Bien placé
text: Hôtel très bien placé pour visiter Manhattan a pied. Accueil efficace et classe. Chambre et vue très bien. Rapport qualité prix excellent. Bar branché bondé le vendredi soir ! Tenue très correct de rigueur. Entrée sécurisée rassurante.

title: Great Business Hotel
text:
I stayed at the Renaissance 12 nights over 4 weeks in May. The rooms are consistently clean and comfortable. The staff is friendly and helpful. And the location is central enough where you can walk to restaurants and tourist attractions. 

While Planet Fitness isn’t a high end gym, i really appreciate having a full size gym open 24 hours a day. 

The hotel restaurant is good, convenient and has a fun vibe with the outdoor rooftop.

title: nice but I can't stay there anymore
text:
I've stayed here a number of times for business travel. The rooms are very nice and the staff--particularly the bellhops--are lovely. I did get annoyed when the front desk wouldn't let me switch rooms (saying it was because I had checked in early).  But a different time the bellhops gave me a $30 food/drink voucher when I couldn't check in early, so I feel like that made up for it.  Also security found my jacket after I lost it. 

BUT a few things ruin this hotel for me.  First is that the room service food and drinks only come in paper trays--there are no real dishes at all. So when you get coffee, they won't give you real milk, just milk in those tiny little plastic containers.  And secondly, another room service issue: they won't sell you wine by the glass--just by the bottle. You have to go down to the bar to get wine in a glass.  It's just too annoying for me and I'd rather stay someplace where I can get real coffee, in a cup, with milk, and get a room service glass of wine.  That's just me though and if you don't mind these things, it really is a very nice hotel. I just won't be back.

title: Contemporary, stylish rooms and top-notch service
text:
I've stayed at this Renaissance a handful of times, most recently in May 2018. We've typically had Skyline View rooms, although had a suite on the top floor most recently (which was an unexpected but spectacular upgrade for my birthday). Although the hotel's location isn't quaint, sort of between Madison Square Garden and Times Square, it is amazingly convenient due to being able to catch so many subway lines within a couple of blocks of the hotel. Within a few minutes, you can be on a train going directly to most parts of the city except the Upper East Side.

The rooms are relatively new, well appointed, perfectly clean, and have an industrial/modern decor I really like. The views from the upper floors are stunning. Apart from elevator traffic that gets a little cumbersome during busy hours, I have nothing negative to say about this hotel. I have stayed, and will stay, here for future trips to the city. Breakfast is generous and good, as was dinner on the one occasion we had it at the restaurant.

Marta at reception has helped us more than once and is just fantastic, and Justin Ellison has been kind in his communication with me in the past. I enjoy this hotel and recommend it.

title: Two night stay for anniversary
text: This was our second visit to the hotel. It’s very contemporary and a great location near Madison Square Garden. Reception staff was very polite and full of information. Our room was nice but like last visit there are no drawers in the room at all. Shower is interesting with glass walls to the room but frosted from chest down. We had the inclusive buffet breakfast. It is not a large buffet but adequate. What was strange was the quality of the scrambled eggs and coffee was good Saturday and sub par on Sunday. This is a nice place for a short stay but with the lack of room storage for clothes not a place for us for a long stay.

title: Very good for what it was
text: Hotel was very pleasant for the most part. The location is very convenient to Penn Station, which was the reason we stayed there. And, it's within relative walking distance of the theater district. The room was well appointed and seemed clean, save for a piece of mop that must have fallen off from the mop that was used to clean the floor. We appreciated being on a higher floor although there was still some street noise that we could hear. The check in process was very efficient and all of hotel employees were friendly and helpful. The bed was comfortable (firm).

title: Great place!!
text: I stayed here for two weeks...the staff is amazing, very helpful (from making a hair appointment for me, to putting extra tea and kleenex in my room, making dinner recommendations, etc etc).  Rooms are larger than the standard NYC midtown hotel rooms, the workspace is more than adequate, bed is super comfy, location is PERFECT... I cannot say enough about this place.  It is the place I will be staying every time I visit our corporate office.  Did I mention how amazing the staff is!?!?!

title: Dont stay here if you have a family and need 2 Queen Beds
text: The rooms in this hotel are extremely small when there are two queen beds. There is no space to move around or put luggage and this should have been highlighted in the room description. For being an updated hotel, the hotel already looked dated and worn. Carpet in the hallway on our floor was dirty. Room was horrible. If you have a family and are considering this hotel. Do not stay here. You will regret it. Thank gosh we only stayed for one night. Beds also appear to be smaller than normal residential queen beds.

title: Great hotel
text: We have just returned from a great week in a very clean, modern, comfortable hotel - the staff are very helpful and friendly. The location is perfect just out side Times Square (10 min walk) so you are close to the action but also far enough away for some peace and great bakeries and shops on the doorstep!

title: Let's talk about the shower...
text:
The location is AMAZING!  Close to Madison Square Garden, Penn Station, Macy's, Manhattan Mall, and any restaurant you can think of.  It's about 9 blocks from the theatre district and Times Square.  

Our room and the hotel in general was very clean and felt new.  The elevator was confusing to some people, so I'm guessing the staff maybe didn't explain it as well to them.  You had to choose the floor you wanted from a touchscreen and then scan your room card and the screen would tell you a specific elevator to get on.  There were no floor buttons on the inside of the elevator.  

Now let's talk about the shower design, which was really the only downfall to this hotel and the reason I didn't give it 5 stars.  The bathroom overall is clean and beautiful with a modern design and marble finishes.  However, the outside wall of the shower is glass and faced the living area so anyone there could watch you shower.  The glass was frosted but it still left little to the imagination and was negated if you got close enough to the wall.  I could understand if this was a king bed room which would suggest a couple, but not in a room with two queens, which would suggest a family is staying there.  Whomever thought the glass wall in a family room was a good idea should have their head examined.

title: Nice Hotel
text: Bang next to Penn Station. Accessible to trains, and all other amenities. Walking form Broadway / Times square. All shopping is just walking from there, including times square too. You can just spend time with an evening walk.

title: Good Hotel
text: Booked the Renaissance New York for a last minute trip. Hotel was clean and decor was nice, family and I felt safe. No complaints on overall stay. Hotel restaurant Rockin Reily's was good (ate their for dinner and brunch) Walking distance to Empire State Building and Herald Square. Slightly confusing elevator system and not much assistance from ground floor employees. With the exception of Nadia in housekeeping ( I really hope that is her name, who was WONDERFUL ) I think all of the staff was just okay, no one seemed to really want to be bothered to assist. ie: my niece lost a ring and we believed it was in the business center, when I asked the ladies working the desk neither of them responded right away (again having a conversation among themselves just like the 1st floor employees always seemed to be doing) One of them did call security, who did not answer and her response was "I think I saw them all on break" - my response was "good thing this isn't a real emergency!" Never found the ring but that is no fault of the hotel. Again just lack of effort from all of the hotel staff. I would stay here again because I rarely interact with hotel staff minus check in so that is not a big deterrent but it is cause for 4 stars.

title: Memorable for all the right reasons. Outstanding!
text:
New York first timers visiting during my partner’s birthday. The hotel staff went above and beyond to fulfill a few requests which made our trip truly memorable. The room was immaculate with fantastic views and the hotel’s location is perfect for the main attractions. 

A special thanks to Brendan and Ranie who clearly work very hard to exceed guest’s expectations.

Faultless in all areas.

A very big thank you from Sophie and Ben.

title: Wonderful experience
text: Just spent the weekend at the Renaissance Midtown with two teenage girls and had a really wonderful experience. The hotel is modern and digital. New experience for me with elevators and room key access, no floor buttons to push. The bell person was very friendly and helpful in explaining how it worked. We are Marriott rewards members and they were very accommodating with early check in and late checkout. So helpful when traveling and at mercy of flights etc. We were also given a voucher for 2 breakfasts. I don’t know if it was because it was a Sunday, but our complimentary breakfast buffet was plentiful and delicious. (My only suggestion would be to provide coffee in the members lounge in the morning.) Our room was clean, modern and felt new. Very comfortable and great place to relax after hectic New York day. Will not hesitate to book again.

title: Good hotel and location but bad experience with a concierge
text: This is a very good hotel , pleasant , cozy , mostly decorated with ,vintage environment . The room was not too big , but in very good condition and nice . The location of the hotel is excellent .  the only black point , was a very disappointing service we received from a concierge who was a young lady called Ranie, we asked for some tourist information , and we received a very nasty cooperation from her , she showed us a very bad feeling in clarifying us some questions (she treated us as unworthed customers), very dissapointed situation and happened just after we checked in. She seems to be , she is not very well trained by MARRIOTT , as she does not understand what does customer service means . Honestly , this one was the only black dot in our stay at this hotel .

title: Nice property, good location
text: As a Marriott Elite member, this hotel was an enjoyable place to stay for a couple of days in the city.  Location was wonderful for Madison Square Garden, in the garment district, and close to Highline and Battery, as well as West Side.  The room we stayed in was small but very comfortable with a nice shower.  Great views towards the city.  Club Lounge was fine, not as upscale as most but worked, as and not opened during week, breakfast coupons were offered and food was delicious, although limited menu, but that was okay.  Nice property and very nice staff...not sure what others noted, but you get more with sugar than vinegar!

title: Good Midtown Hotel
text: If you’re looking for a modern, stylish hotel in the midtown area or even close enough to Times Square, but not with all the tourist and chaos that comes with Times Square, then you should look into the Renaissance.  The rooms are very modern for a Marriott and many of the rooms offer excellent views of the city and New York harbor.  The other great thing is that there are plenty of good restaurant/pubs within a short walking distance and many are open late into the night.  The only issues about this hotel is the rooms are a little tight, which is not uncommon for Manhattan hotels and the price can be steep at times.

title: Anniversary Stay
text:
To celebrate our anniversary, my wife and I decided to take a trip to NY.  Within a day of making the reservation, received a welcome message by the Lead Navigator Ranie K.  Given relatively new to the city, she made sure we had all relevant information we needed to ensure we had an enjoyable stay.  This included transportation suggestions, restaurant options recognizing my wife's vegan diet and anything we needed to make our stay more enjoyable...  That alone was good enough in my books, but upon checking in (btw were greeted with smile and was prompt), we were surprised with a complementary bottle of champagne and macrons in our room!  With a nice note wishing us a happy anniversary, it was a gesture that helped to make this special trip even more memorable.
Room was clean, had a pleasant subtle scent, size was more than adequate, bad was super comfortable and house keeping was very accommodating... They made us feeling like we were their only customer.  Needlesstosay, we will definitely stay here again the next time we are back in NY!  Well done Renaissance!

title: Not bad for being part of a larger chain
text:
I’ve started avoiding chain hotels for boutiques in NYC for reasons anyone that travels here will know, but decided to give the Renaissance a go. So here it is:

The good:

-The location is great as its right by Penn Station, flagship Macy’s and Madison Square Gardens. The Empire state building and Times Square are a short walk away as well.
-The rooms are spacious compared to the average hotel room in the city, and they’re well-appointed. 
-The décor is on the boutique side as opposed to the generic look most hotels that are part of a big chain have
-Service was friendly
-Depending on the floor and direction you look in, there are some decent views of the city.

The bad:

-The elevator system is a nightmare at times, especially when things are busy
-If you can, avoid facing over the restaurant at the hotel, I would. It can get quite loud.
-It may just be for adjoining rooms with an internal door, but there were time I felt like I was sitting in the room next door as a part of their conversation, when the AC wasn’t on.

If you're staying with friends, be wary that the bathrooms are modern i.e. all glass, so you may not get the type of privacy you're expecting.

I didn’t try the food at the hotel, so no comments there. Overall, while I’m still more of a fan of the pure boutiques, I’d consider giving this one another go.

title: Lovely hotel, a little disorganized
text: We stayed in April and booked six rooms for a ladies weekend. I absolutely loved the location and the hotel was amazing.  The bathrooms were gorgeous. There is a bar located in the hotel which makes for a convenient night cap.  The staff was very friendly.  My one complaint is that a few of us were charged for parking and did not park at the hotel.  I had organized the trip and tried to assist the staff at check in with keeping our cars, people and rooms straight.  I would still go back. I would just make sure to write everything down ahead of time. I have now stayed in all 3 Manhattan Renaissance hotels and this is my favorite.

title: I regret booking here...
text:
I paid for room in advance . On arrival they ask for my card and billed me about $550 without saying a word or giving me a receipt. I thought they just wanted a card on file . After having my car decline I checked statement and saw the charge and called . They said it was $50 a night incidental charge or something. Ok but still only adds up to $250 and at least say so at the desk but still that wasn’t $500 . They checked and said it was a glitch and I’d have my money in 5-7 business days. That was my vacation money . Now I’ve been using credit cards and paying interest for random stuff because of a glitch . They said if I called chase they could refund my money so I had to cancel my plans because this whole call and fiasco took about a little over an hour to resolve making those calls and being transferred around . Not cool . They offered and sent wine and a $12 gin and tonic, but that still doesn’t make up for it because it’s now 3 days later and I still haven’t had my money deposited . 

Not to mention, the faucet in the restroom isn’t secure so when you turn it on it just turns and no water comes out . One of the curtains is broken . They had to come fix the reading lights upon arrival and we got two nights left so this may not be over. I thought I booked into a good hotel. I did get an apology note and the breakfast they promised never came . I’m no longer complaining to them as I’m tired of calling downstairs, so I figured I’d let others know that this maybe isn’t a vacation hotel . It feels more like work sadly with 24% interest rate. 2 stars because I got the note and wine but that hasn’t even come close to making up for it as the wine was very cheap.

title: Wonderful hotel
text: Stayed here for the weekend and absolutely loved my stay. This was one of the best Marriott hotels I have stayed in. My room was gorgeous with a great city view from the 35th floor. I could practically live in the bathroom- it was so nice and clean. The breakfast was very good and the access to the lounge was for drinks only at the weekend but they gave us vouchers for the breakfast. The location is excellent especially if you travel via Penn station. Times Square is a few blocks away. I would definitely stay again.

title: Multiple stays here
text: I travel to NYC on a monthly basis and prefer this location because of the location, room size, decor and staff.  The elevators can be busy and the call system is very modern.  The bar/restaurant on the 5th floor is busy with guests and local young professionals, food was very good but the place is loud.  Even number rooms face 35th street and odd number rooms face the back...the bar has a terrace and they play music fairly loud until about 11pm.  The bathrooms are large by modern NYC hotel standards and the rooms were well appointed.  This is normally my first option around Penn/Harold square area but it books fast.  The exec lounge has a wonderful evening offering and wasn't overly crowded.

title: Terrible in all aspect of hospitality professionalism!!!
text:
It was busiest time of the year around the Christmas. We had to book two rooms (both were breakfast included for 2 adults and children under 12) based on the advice which was given by Marriott reservation staff over the phone. They told me that " Because you have two children with you, this is why you could not book the room through the website under one-room reservation."
We were only given two breakfast vouchers at check-in. The receptionist told us that children does not need it. When we first sat down at the restaurant in the morning, I handed the vouchers to the server lady first. She said that we can order anything from the menu. But at the end she refuse to bring the breakfast item for my husband and refill the drinks for my kids. She treated us like that we were begging for food from her with " food stamps"!!!

title: Nice stay but be forewarned
text:
Checked in for a weekend stay and had a reasonably nice stay until...we checked out and received our car back.  Hotel doormen were very polite and welcoming.  Found the front desk staff somewhat snooty.  Rooms were comfortable and restaurant downstairs was excellent .  Staff were very polite in restaurant. Located around the block from Madison Square Garden.

Had a sinking feeling our car was being driven over weekend as we made the mistake of telling the doorman we were here for the weekend. Upon checking out found both trip odometers set to zero.  Bellman was very apologetic and stated he would report it.  After pulling away turned on the radio only to find out it was tuned to a Spanish speaking talk show,  and not one we had any reason to listen to.

We immediately called the hotel and asked for the manager.  He was extremely apologetic and promised to get to the bottom of the issue.  After numerous tries we were refunded the parking fees but were told the garage advised no one used the car. Unconvinced we tried to go up to the general manager and never received a call back.  Seemed like this has been an issue for others per some staff that asked to remain anonymous.

The unsettling thing is that no one in upper management ever reached out to us.  We are experienced travelers and from the N.Y. area and expect better.  This hotel, as well as others, contract with independent garages and really have little control over the garages. Be forewarned if you valet your car here.

I gave the hotel time to respond to my queries before writing this review and lost track of time.  Mgt.really booted this one,

title: Extremely Convenient Location
text:
The location is near Madison Square Garden, Penn Station, Times Square, groceries, convenience stores, anything else you need. The hotel has a modern vibe and the staff is helpful, personable, and definitely improved our experience.The indoor and outdoor space was massive and quite a surprise for NYC. We tried the food on a few occasions and were pleasantly surprised. The elevator system at the hotel was a hot mess. The only real complaint we had were the bathrooms lacking a ventilation system. The room is already compact due to space in NYC so this may not be the best hotel if you are not very secure with your significant others bathroom habits... If not, the terrace room gives you a chance and allows you to open the terrace door. 

We stayed in a room with a terrace which added the perfect amount of space and ambiance. The terrace rooms are on lower floors and still provide a sweeping views of the area.

title: Nice staff but lame lounge
text: This is the only Renaissance we have ever stayed in that does not serve complimentary beer and wine in their executive lounge during happy hour. Nor does their lounge have free coffee/espresso all day. These are standard offerings for platinum elite members at other Marriotts with executive lounges. The staff is very friendly and responsive. Would like to mention our housekeeping staffer Dolkar who is doing a stellar job in our room and left us a sweet note. We are here all week celebrating college graduation, a birthday and Mother’s Day and picked this hotel in part because of the perks of the executive lounge but also because we have been brand loyal to Marriott for many years. Hopefully management will realize that their lounge needs to be improved to be on par with other marriotts. The food offerings are also subpar, with pre-dressed soggy salad, sliced fatty meats and deep fried Mac and cheese bites. For the price per night and this brand we expected higher quality.

title: Hidden Gem in New York!
text:
After having stayed in many hotels in NYC, I was beginning to despair that there were any decent hotels in Manhattan. This hotel is amazing for location! It's about 2 years old and it's modern, quiet, clean and trendy. I am so in awe of this hotel and impressed, I had to write a review...while I am still staying in it!

The staff are amazing! Joshua H at the front reception is checked me in and I have to say it was a lovely experience to have such a friendly and knowledgeable person greet you after a long day of travelling.

All the staff are super friendly and genuinely delighted to work in this hotel. It makes such a difference to see happy staff. Everything is so comfortable such as the bed and the bathroom. NYC is a bit space deprived but this hotels is very cleverly decorated and constructed. 

I will only be staying in this hotel in the future!

title: Family Trip to Manhattan
text: This hotel was centrally located for all of the sites to make a memorable trip to New York with my family.  What made it extra special was how the staff treated us, especially my young kids.  The views were spectacular and the scene was vibrant.  Richard G. in main entrance area was especially helpful and kind.

title: Overnight stay
text:
Stayed here one night mainly due to its prime location to Penn Station / MSG where we were seeing a concert.  Check in at 3PM was pure madness !!!  Elevators were so crowded we actually went up to check-in floor in freight elevator.
The room, while industrial in feel, was fine, albeit a bit small (NYC) for one night.  I certainly wouldn't want to stay here on a long stay.
Breakfast the following morning and location were tremendous, and the personnel did the best of what was a no win situation.

title: Best NYC hotel
text:
During our week atay in NYC we stayed at 3 top star rated chain hotels
1. Renaissance Midtown 
2. Marriott marquis times square 
3. Moxy hotel times square

The Renaissance was the best! Location was perfect with Penn Street station across the road and shopping outside your doorstep. The room was spacious, comfy and had modern touches (usb chargers; it is the little things that count) and the bathroom was stunning. Our room had an actual shower, not a shower tub that most hotels have.
Really enjoyed my stay here, will definitely be back!

title: Staff knew me by name
text:
Central location to the Garden made it an obvious choice for a short two day business trip.

I was particularly delighted by Caleb who helped me at check in. Throughout my stay I worked with him on a couple questions and extending checkout.  He was the epitome of professionalism and personal warmth, a hard combination.  He remembered my first name and I saw him do the same with another guest as well.   Justin Ellison was also a great help, everything from checking up on the service throughout the stay to waiving down a cab for me in the rain with a smile and a joke. 

I travel all over the world with the Marriott chain, went from NYC to Dubai and then DC in this same week.  I was really impressed by the personal attention to detail and friendliness of this staff more than any other location including a JW.

title: Our Favorite Midtown Hotel
text: My husband and I have stayed in a dozen chain hotels in NYC over the last several years, and like the Renaissance Midtown the best.  As a gold level Marriott member, we were upgraded to a skyline view both times we stayed.  The breakfast at the club lounge was very good.  The staff were friendly and professional!

title: Wonderful stay in the heart of midtown Manhattan
text: This was a last minute booking (< 24 hours) using Marriott Rewards points. Check-in through the app worked well and the gentlemen at both the bell stand and reception were very accommodating and helpful when we arrived. The elevators were a little confusing to most guests and seemed exceptionally slow which made the fact that you had to rely on the computerized scheduling process a little more annoying. The room was nice and comfortable and we appreciated the green nature of the master power switch. AC pumped quickly and kept the room cool even though it did not run when we were out of the room. Huge television with lots of options for entertainment and good power access near the beds. Very quiet in the rooms as well from our 21st floor location.

title: Horrible Customer Service!
text: This place is pricey but it was our anniversary so we thought we would splurge. Our Anniversary Weekend was a total bust. The service was horrible from the moment we valeted the car. They don't explain the way the elevators work, they are not your normal elevator so everyone that checks in is super confused and asking each other how it works. Nobody knows how the elevator works. We tried to get a bite in the restaurant after we checked in and dropped our bags in the room and when we arrived the people in line in front of us were seated and when it was our turn they said, sorry come back in an hour and a half to eat, we aren't seating anymore people. I wasn't sure why they didn't seat us when they sat the couple in front of us just 5 seconds prior. We found a great spot across the street to eat but it would have been super convenient to just eat at the hotel we were staying at. We were woken up SUPER EARLY by banging, it literally sounded like they were moving furniture upstairs from our room. We couldn't believe the noise. They were not moving furniture, they were washing our window. It would have been nice to know that we would be woken up that early because they were washing the windows that day. Then for breakfast we thought it was cool that they had an outside on the roof to eat by the bar so we sat on the chairs and took our breakfast which we got across the street at the bagel place which was awesome and we were eating and relaxing only to be yelled out in the middle of our meal by some lady on the roof above us telling us that they are washing the windows and we had to leave. Then we went to see Billy Joel and he was awesome and after we were hungry so we thought we would give the restaurant another try. The girl sat us and we waited 15 minutes and no one came over to our table to take our order or offer us a drink so we got up and ask for the manager to let him know about our experiences. He was kind and very apologetic but our time there was OVER. We headed across the street again and had another good meal. I took a shower and the entire bathroom was flooded because the shower is the same level as the flooring so I spend 20 minutes mopping up water with the towels we had and had to order more towels from room service. Also, it takes 45 minutes to pull your car around from valet. This place was horrible and it was our anniversary. So disappointing. My husband still loves me but next time he will pick the hotel. I have written this review on many sites and the management has not even reached out to me to apologize also, I am a Marriott Member and contacted them through email with this review and NO RESPONSE. Never Again!

title: Wish I'd stayed elsewhere
text:
I picked this hotel mostly for its location, and I regret it. The location was convenient as the train from EWR takes you just a block from the hotel.  But I passed on staying in a much nicer hotel because I thought the service for a Marriott Platinum elite would make up the difference. It did not!

My stay started off horribly with my interaction with Ariel. Though I checked in using the app and was told I could get my room early, Ariel coldly told me that was not happening and I would have to come back in the afternoon. Very disappointing given I was just coming off a red-eye.

Additionally, as Marriott Platinum elite I am normally entitled to automatically be given suite upgrades, breakfast, lounge access, etc. 

Ariel very gruffly refused to give any upgrade, claiming the hotel was fully booked. A few hours later I overheard her warmly offering a suite to another person as they checked in. Further, she offered nothing but a $10 voucher or points as the welcome gift, when I later saw her giving a gift bag to another platinum elite member.   All in all, this left a horrible taste in my mouth to start the stay.

The room itself was mostly fine, if small. But a number of the pillows had old stains on them, which again was quite a turn off. 

Add to all this a weird elevator system that often leads to only 1 elevator out of 5 being called to attend to a full floor of people waiting. 

I only used my breakfast voucher on one day as the breakfast in the restaurant was inedible.

I couldn't wait to get out of here.

The stay was somewhat saved by the front desk performance of another individual whose name I unfortunately did not catch, and the maid staff that came promptly to clean my stained sheets.

If you must stay in a Marriott hotel, try the Lexington further uptown.

title: A Pearl You Did Not Know About
text: From the outside and the shared entrance, the first impression is not that impressive. Once you reach the reception on the 6th floor, the ambiance changes significantly. The hotel theme is about fashion. The rooms are nicely designed and well insulated for noise considering being where the action is in NYC. The rooms are a little tight but the design and lay-out gives you spacious feeling. Being tight, the A/C can get be a little noisy and the air blown can be a little annoying. The bathroom has contemporary design. The number of rooms on each floor is limited so less noise. The Club Lounge serves good breakfast variety. As with many other hotels, there is no good coffee machine in the lounge that can serve espresso and so options are limited and the coffee served is not that great. There is a Starbucks just across the street but come on just add a decent coffee machine in the lounge that can serve variety of coffees including espresso. Would not give it 5 as I usually rate globally and many hotels outside the US are far better. For NYC, this will be my hotel for sure!

title: Nice surprise after getting delayed in NY
text: After spending eight hours on a train ride from providence I booked an unexpected stay at the renaissance New York. My original plan was to only stay in the city for five hours. I had dinner with friends then checked in around midnight. I hand not realized when I booked it the hotel was new. It reminds me a normal version of a Starwood W. The lobby was several floors up (I think six) with a nice bar which did close early.  Everyone was super friendly without any attitude. I like a king bed but he said I was upgraded to a double queen on the 29th floor. It’s one night so I took it.  Boy was I not disappointed. I felt like my bed was in the corner with the windows. I laid in bed watching tv drinking my beer from the bar with the window open looking out at the city. It was amazing. After missing my meeting and spending most of the day on the train it was breath taking. The next morning when I woke up I realized the ceilings were concrete which was really cool. I also had the window open all night since I like a cooler room and I live in the city so I am used to road noise. I was high  enough that it sounded like white noise. I only wish the hotel was in a better location. Also I read something about a rooftop bar but no one mentioned it in the lobby and I am not sure if it was open. The new elevators are cool. You press a touch screen with the floor you want. Next it tells you which car to get on and then theirs nothing to press once your in it.  If your in the area it’s worth the money for a higher floor. I will put it on my list of nyc hotels to stay at again.

title: Not impressed. Quite claustrophobic
text: I was really looking forward to staying at this midtown hotel and left completely disappointed. Rooms are extremely small which is somewhat understandable given it's midtown location. Rooms are definitely too small for a family of four. Lobby very small. Elevators take forever to arrive .Even though I have elite status, lounge was closed during the week leading to Easter, no room up grades and way too crowded. I really wanted to change hotels midweek but it just would have been a pain by that point. We arrived around 2pm Fri afternoon, check in was long and no rooms were available yet (understandably given 4pm check in). I was told we could leave bags downstairs by bellman. We later called as we went to dinner and asked if it would be possible for bellman to place our bags in our room as our room was ready at that time. After dinner, we went back to hotel to find our bags still downstairs. The woman who checked us in told me that I could check tomorrow for an upgraded room. Next two days I checked for room upgrades only to be told that there wouldn't be any upgrades and that all rooms are the same size (wish the first woman just told me that so that we would have looked for another hotel earlier in our trip). All in all just a disappointment.

title: Terrible Anniversary Weekend! Don't stay here.
text: From the moment we arrived we had issues. I would not recommend this hotel at all. The staff is NOT accommodating and made every chance a total inconvenience for us. It was our anniversary and we stayed the entire weekend. Our anniversary was totally ruined because of this hotel. When you are not comfortable and you spend more than needed it really makes you angry. We saw Billy Joel and he was awesome but to have to come back to this place sucked.

title: Ottimo
text:
Hotel bello e in posizione super ottima: in 5 minuti si raggiunge time square
Le camere nn sono piccolissime rispetto agli standard di ny. 
Hanno delle grandi finestre e un bagno a vetri sulla camera. Unica pecca essendo un 4 stelle , sono carenti di kit bagno e non ci sono le ciabatte
L hotel ha un ristorante al 5 piano, che nn abbiamo provato, un bar al piano della lobby dove si possono mangiare dei piatti veloci, come panini, insalate , pizza e un bar con terrazza esterna.
L hotel e' abbastanza caro ma sempre in linea con gli standard di ny
Consigliato

title: Charmaine Stewart
text: Immaculate, the staff were friendly and very informative. They go above and beyond to assist my friends and I with directions and nearby things/ events that we surely enjoyed.This is a  Great clean and modern hotel. The rooms are beautifully decorated with modern furniture and, Smart TV,and alarm clock with Bluetooth capability. The Club/ Lounge is also great! We enjoyed our stay and look forward!!

title: I loved the whole experience
text:
I was looking for a midtown hotel in NYC and found this gem! I chose the Renaissance because at the moment it was the best rate from all the options on marriott.com. 
I can say I will definitely keep choosing it for every stay in NYC. 
A few days before my check in, the Guest Service Director, Justin, reached out through email with details of my booking, plus recommendations and pointers about the hotel. 
Once i arrived, the guys on bell desk were very friendly and helpful with my luggage and any questions I had. 
I went to check in, but my room wasn't ready (I arrived earlier than Check In time). So they told me if my room is ready before 4pm,  they will text me. And it was. I had my room at around 1pm, which was great since I had a red-eye flight. 

The hotel: I loved every inch of the hotel. It is so chic and trendy! The decor and design is amazing, very fashion-ly. The halls to the rooms, the industrial-kind of look on the rooms, the paintings on the wall, the decor. All of it!

Bars + Dining: I had a 'welcome myself' cocktail at the Thread the first day I arrived. Found it reasonable pricing and with many cocktail options if you're into the cocktail trend. Also, I had brunch on my last day at Rock & Reilly's and found the $ as being very reasonable / normal compared to any other restaurant outside of the hotel. Plus, it was amazing food! I had the Norwegian Eggs Benedict <3 yumm! It's recommended to reserve to make sure you don't miss out.

Elevators: It is a little tricky at first, but then you get the hang of it. I never experienced 'traffic jam' at the elevators but I've read that there is high traffic between 3pm-6pm.

Fitness people: You have a Planet Fitness 24/7 in the 2nd floor, and it is complimentary for hotel guests. Will most definitely use it next time!

Close to 34th St. Penn-Station Subway: Took the E Train for a direct trip to JFK and viceversa.

Only one thing I did not appreciate very much was with the A/C. It was programmed to be turned on only as "Auto", which means that once it has reached the desired temperature it turns off for a little while. This is a minor issue for some, but for me it interrupted my sleep every time it turned off. :(

title: Great, clean & new modern hotel
text: Love this hotel for my business travel - great, friendly staff who go above and beyond.  Great clean and modern hotel rooms.  The Club Lounge is also great! When I am going in and out of Penn Station this is always the hotel I book.

title: Worse than you can imagine
text:
I stay at Marriott whenever I can and this is a decent hotel near penn station (I have stayed several times because it's convenient to leave my bags for after a matinee).
The elevators make staying here unbearable.   It often takes 10-15 mins .  
Other guests were also complaining

title: A modern fun hotel with great decor in a top location
text:
I stayed here for four nights and it proved to be the perfect location for my visit. Located a short walk from the subway for getting around or Times Square if you like that sort of thing, it’s the best of both worlds.

The rooms are immaculate with interesting decor and a great view. I was on the 21st floor, having requested a city view and I wasn’t disappointed.

Oddly, reception is on the sixth floor, which threw me a bit when I arrived but it’s not a problem, just a bit confusing.

The beds are really comfortable and helped me finally beat some annoying jet lag that I’d been fighting. The bathrooms are light and well equipped.

My only issue is that breakfast in the restaurant is a little expensive but there’s a Market Crates next door that offers a great healthy breakfast for a more reasonable price.

WiFi is free and fast, and helpfully charging points are located on the bedside table.

A highly recommended hotel that I’d be happy to revisit.

title: Nice surprise, with a cool modern feel
text: Needed to spend a night in midtown, and was super pleased with the hotel. Loony is on 6th floor, with a nice bar. Room was good size for NY, and had a cool exposed concrete wall, power shades, and nice marble in the bathroom.  M CLUB was very nice and had friendly staff ( as were all staff).  I'll definetly stay here again.

title: Magnifique !!!!
text:
Rien à dire juste fonce !!! 
Nous avions réservé avec mon mari du 20 au 23 avril 2018 !! 
Et franchement rien à dire hôtel magnifique , personnels au top surtout au lobby du 6 ( Marta) toujours souriante et avenante . 
Nous avions la chambre 2312 ( je crois ) au 23 étage avec vu sur la ville !!! Du grand luxe luxe luxe ***** nous avons-nous tellement aimé notre chambre :  la propreté , le service de ménage (impeccable ) , la lumière de la chambre , la vue , le grand lit King size , la beauté de la dallent bain , la qualité de la télé !! Bref tout est parfait 
Nous y reviendrons l’annee Prochaine sur et certain , et vous recommande vivement de réservé dans cette hôtel !! 
Merci aussi à la serveuse du restaurant Marwa d’une gentillesse. 
Ma première fois à New York et cet hôtel m’a fait rêvé !!

Yves & Duvie DJIMBILTH

title: Nice hotel, good location, doesn't really recognize loyal customers
text:
Second time staying at this hotel. First time a few months ago they gave my husband a hard time about lounge access as a Platinum. Thought it was a one off and that they really did value loyal customers .... Tried them again this past weekend and determined that they really don't value loyalty ... 

Don't even think of an early check in. Even though guests check out early, they don't have housekeeping start until 9.30am ... so even if a room is empty, nobody is there to clean it ... A long line of people for early check in ... given rooms on a first come, first serve basis - regardless of status in their loyalty program ... 

Club lounge is crowded. Not open on weekends. Instead you can choose points or go to the restaurant (but to do that, they tell you to make reservations....) Although its nice that you can still access the lounge on the weekend to get sodas/waters ... and they have both flat and sparkling water ... plus Coke products! (Yahoo! soo much better than Pepsi!)

Rooms are ok. Kind of small but very modern and everything works. Very comfortable beds. Wifi was free for everyone - which means gold/platinums don't have any option for high speed/enhanced internet (took 3 hours to download a 60 minute TV show...)

Bell desk staff very friendly and helpful. Front desk staff a bit snooty. I'm sure when everything is going ok, they are just fine and super pleasant. When they get any pushback, they simply don't know how to respond. Happy to try to upsell you though.... 

They seem to have a lot of platinum guests, but if they keep up their current levels of service - I wouldn't expect them to keep them ...

title: Teeny room with a weird bathroom
text:
Would absolutely never come to this hotel with our kid. The bathroom is a frosted glass wall that doesn’t leave much to the imagination. Sure there is a privacy screen but it’s still just so weird. 

Room was teeny. Bed was ok but pillows were awful. Ac unit blows the air right on your head in the bed. No way to change that. Room darkening shades didn’t do the job at all. 

Plus side... it was quiet. Very convenient to theatre district but not with the craziness of Times Square. People working there were nice. Valet parking made driving in easy. 

Just think there are better places for that price with a little more wiggle room and better bathroom layout.

title: The Time of My Life!
text: My recent stay at the Renaissance Midtown was excellent. This wasn't my first visit to NYC and I am a Mariott rewards member so I've stayed at Marriott properties all over the world. Stayed here to be close but also far enough away from a major conference. Wanted to relax and unwind a bit with my wife as well as work. This hotel had it all! We LOVED our room AND the service! The staff was friendly and everyone went out of their way to be helpful. Richard, at the Bell Desk, was the most AMAZING staff person we encountered. He was friendly, he was helpful, and he was knowledgeable about the area and he was so energetic! He remembered our names and greeted us when he saw us, I looked forward to walking out on that side of the hotel just to run into him. I will definitely stay here when returning to NYC.

title: Want to Rate Higher
text:
I normally would give this a hotel a higher rating, but to be honest, I stayed here on points and it almost ruined our evening.  Requested and early check in well in advance.  Took 7 hours (luggage took 8).The bathroom door was broken, but there was no time to change anyway (otherwise my husband would need to leave so my teenage daughters could get changed).  We showed up for a fancy dinner in jeans and were almost late to our show.  All those points and total frustration.

The girls at the desk was very nice (she asked me how my stay was).  There is only so much she can do.  

Don't stay here on points - you will wait behind the paying guest.  Its a good location and has a nice bar, with outdoor space.  That's a positive since you will have to sit there waiting for a room.

title: Hip and Well maintained propoerty
text:
The property is very well maintained, room is very clean, modern, millenial design, and well lighted. Size of the standard room is pretty huge.
Location wise, the hotel is across from penn station which make it easily accessible + cheap to / from EWR. Also tons of stores
This is my first time staying at the property and definetly will be staying here again next time we visit NYC.

title: My new favorite hotel in NYC
text:
I travel to NYC every couple of months for business and have stayed at many hotels in Midtown.  The Renaissance has everything I am looking for in a great hotel:
-Spacious room with new furnishings
-Great location (Near Macy’s Herald Square)...just far enough away from Times Square!
-Easy check in and check out
-Great in room amenities (Coffee maker, refrigerator, iron, desk, sofa)
-I love the Aveda line of soaps, shampoo and lotions they stock the bathroom with!
-This is the quietest room I’ve had in NYC for years!

I’ll definitely be back!

title: Great hotel, excellent service and good location
text: Great hotel, excellent service and good location.  I stayed there with my family during the weekend and we all had a great time. The size and design of the room, the view of the city, the cleanest of the room, plus the welcoming service Executive lounge, made our trip enjoyable.

title: My favorite NYC hotel
text: My favorite NYC hotel.  Good location (depending on your activity), nice modern room, view (if you get a room with it).  Two night stay and I really enjoyed it.  I honestly had nothing to complain at this hotel.  Highly recommended!

title: Good hotel, great location, awful elevators!
text:
This hotel is in a great location in Midtown, especially if you don't want the hustle and bustle of Times Square. There are lots of delis and restaurants around that are excellent.  We chose this location over the one in Times Square Face on other TripAdvisor reviewers.
Check in was quick and easy, our room was supposedly upgraded, but still was smaller than average.  We phoned housekeeping and asked for more towels to be sent to the room, we left the hotel room for a couple of hours and came back and the towels were still not delivered.  We phoned down again and asked for another robe and mouthwash as well, in addition to the towels.  Towels were brought up, but not the other stuff. As we were leaving for the night, turndown service was offered, which we gladly accepted.  But funny, on the second day of our stay, we did not receive turndown service. After our phone call to inquire why we didn't get it the second night, we were told that we didn't ask for it.  But we didn't receive it the first night, and got it automatically.  They said it might be requested every night??  How does that make sense?
The club Lounge was a nice area, and was fully stocked with a variety of beverages except at night when they took the tea Station away??  Not sure why they do that when everything else is available.
The elevators!?!  I understand the need for security in the hotel, but the elevators are not a great experience.  You have to punch in your floor, and it directs you to one of the four elevators. You can only access that particular Elevator as there are no buttons in the elevator.  Numerous times we were left waiting for our assigned elevator, will other people that had arrived after us had come and gone.  They definitely aren't efficient. There was only once that we went top to bottom with no milk run.  
Not sure if there was a convention or something going on in the hotel but the lobby was quite noisy as the bar is in close proximity.
Our room was located close to the elevators, but was okay as we only heard people access them in the morning.
I would stay here again, as front desk staff were very friendly and accommodating.  Housekeeping could be more accommodating.
As a platinum member, we didn't stay there for breakfast, as there are a lot of cheap Alternatives at the deli around the corner and much tastier.  
You won't be disappointed if you book this hotel.

title: Great Hotel, Excellent Staff
text:
What a treat! 
Fab hotel in a great location!
The rooms may be a tad smaller than what I’m used to, but they don’t feel small. Plenty of space for clothes on a 3 - 5 night stay. Lots of natural light & high ceilings. 
This is a newer hotel. New tech throughout the building including several things to keep it eco-friendly and flowing well, even if the hotel is completely booked, as it was for our stay. 
Honestly though, the people make the visit! Our check in with Marta, and then “visits” with her, Nate & Ariel were such fun! Also, the truly wonderful “concierge” personnel, Daniel & Ranie. They all have great personalities and are so knowledgeable! These are the sort of people I want to stay friends with! 
Thank you to everyone for just being you!
I will absolutely be back!

title: Awesome!
text: Such a great hotel in midtown! This was my first time staying and really enjoyed it! Great size rooms and bathrooms, especially for NYC. Joshua at the front desk was fabulous and so sweet to my friend and I. Very cute bar and great location!

title: Should have known better
text: I stayed here a year ago and it was just terrible no help with the luggage room not ready it’s the same story this year except with a bad attitude from the front office staff explained to me about hotels I then showed them my Marriott platinum award of 2557 nights in Marriott hotels that kind of shut them up a bit but anyways always a hassle here it’s a good location if you’re in and out but if you’re carrying bags or need any assistance you’re just out of luck the manager will respond to this with the guy was busy or something like that the same as he did last year but actually he wasn’t He walked right by us ignoring us very typical anyways we’re changing hotels canceling 11 nights

title: Amazing hotel!
text: This was mine and my husband's first time staying at this hotel. Let me tell you, it's amazing. From the moment we walked into the hotel, every staff member was awesome! Everyone was so friendly and polite. We were able to check in early, which was a plus. I recommend using the Marriott rewards app!! It's the perfect location- close to Penn Station and Madison Square Garden and not too far of a walk to Times Square. There was also another door out the back way, with a Starbucks next door. The room was spacious for New York City standards. It had an industrial feel to it, with the concrete ceiling, but also luxurious with the marble bathroom (which is beautiful, by the way!). The bed was comfortable, but I have stayed at other Renaissance properties with better beds. The only complaints I have- the reading lights by our bed were broken, the door to the bathroom was only a frosted sliding door that didn't close completely, and the elevator system took far too long! While it's definitely a cool idea, it didn't seem very practical. My husband and I visit NYC quite often and we're always in search of cool, comfortable hotels with perks. We'll definitely be returning to this hotel!

title: You must check this Hotel out....
text: I travel and stay in Hotels for Business and Leisure about 60-70 nights a year. At the last minute I booked this Hotel. From dropping my car off (valet), to being greeted at the Front Desk was/is probably one of the best experiences I have had. Remember I am in Hotels all the time. The Front Desk Staff, allowed me to check in early, they explained the area, they asked me how many keys (room) I would like. One of the classiest acts was a young women walked me over to the Elevator, offered to assist with my bags, "literally walked me into the Elevator". Where do you ever see that in NYC? Not too many places. The Room was excellent. Concierge Staff- actually said hello and Good Evening, and Good Night both nights I was there, and both mornings when having breakfast, I was greeted with a Good Morning and when I left "have a great day". Again how many Hotels do this not only in NYC, but anywhere for that matter. Again I tip my hat not only to the Management, but the Staff. You can tell the Staff is treated "respectfully". Great experience. I will be back AGAIN.....

title: I’ll Be Back
text: I have never stayed in Midtown, so this was a first. I loved the location of this hotel. The subway, Starbucks and Macy’s are right around the corner. Best Bagels is across the street which I highly recommend (see review). This hotel is a sleek and modern in design. We arrived on a Thursday evening and the bar on the check in level (6th floor) was  hopping with activity. Normally, that would be a concern but it was a nice welcome to the city. We asked for a quiet room and were given 3312 which was on the 33rd floor. I thought the room had ample space with beautiful decor. It turned out to be incredibly quiet. There was a safe and small empty refrigerator for use in the room. The elevators were a bit tricky to figure out since you had to swipe your room key, then select your floor before entering. Once inside, it took you directly to your floor with no way to change the floor you entered. It’s a nice security measure with a little bit of inconvenience. One of the features of this hotel that I really appreciated was the Planet Fitness on the second floor. Unlike most hotels that have 3 cardio machines and a weight rack stuck in some back, windowless space, this hotel housed a completely separate gym for members and allowed the hotel guest free use. It is located on the 2nd floor of the hotel. It has about 25 treadmills, a section of bikes and stairclimbers and plenty of weight machines. It wasn’t crowded when we were there and we had plenty of options for machine use. The only miss was the coffee bar in the room. For some reason they never replenished our decaf coffee and condiments even though we used it everyday. Both times I had to call the front desk and they were able to bring some up but this should be a no brainer for the housekeeping staff. Otherwise, it was a great stay and I will definitely be returning.

title: Interesting bathroom!
text: We selected this hotel because it was across the street from Penn Station and near an exhibit we wanted to see. The first hurdle was discovering the lobby was on the sixth floor and the elevator buttons were more sophisticated than we'd seen. (Once we learned how they worked, they were great.) The room had plenty of room for the three of us and the curtains did an excellent job blocking the manic lights from outside. Everything was clean and beds were comfortable. But the bathroom had a glass wall between the shower and the bedroom! My sister had to turn off all the lights just to wash in private! My husband and I decided to await our return home.

title: Beautifully designed rooms deliver a luxurious stay
text: This is the best Hotel in Manhattan we have yet stayed at. The place has been beautifully designed by a talented architect and this shows most of all in the room/bathroom which are stunning. However what really makes this place special are the Hotel staff who we found to be not only professional, knowledgeable and competent but also warm and caring. This combination of high style and great human warmth made for an unforgettable stay

title: Amazing hotel but App communication needs work
text:
I booked this after doing a ton of research, and this hotel was amazing. This is one of the few Marriott NYC hotels that does not charge a destination fee which was a big factor in me booking here, otherwise I would have booked elsewhere. The location is perfect as the Subway is right there, MSG is next door (along with Penn Station,) the High Line is a few blocks over and so is the Manhattan Center.

The staff at this hotel is great and anyone I ran into during my stay welcomed me and asked how my stay was (even if it was someone from Maintenance getting into the elevator.)

The elevators are a little bit different than most hotels and I preferred this "digital" interface setup. The speed of the elevators was super quick vs. most other hotels I have stayed in.

As a Marriott Elite Member I got Lounge Access and the breakfast buffet in their restaurant on the weekend. The restaurant staff was amazing and the breakfast buffet was more than filing. The normal lounge breakfast felt very bare in terms of offerings vs. the restaurant.

The ice machines are only on certain floors and I couldn't find anything in the room to tell me where they where located. I actually had to check TripAdvisor to figure out there is a directory menu built into the TV with the ice machine locations.

The bathrooms are very luxurious and so is the walk-in shower. The tile on the shower floor can be a bit hard on your feet if you have been exploring the city for the entire day, but not much you can do about that.

The only part of the hotel that needs improvement is the App communication and e-mails.

I had requested an early check-in prior to my arrival and used the App for a mobile check-in with my early check-in time. Check-in is 4 PM and I had not received any communication that my room was ready by 2 PM, so I used the App to message and ask if my room was ready. I got a response saying "My room is not ready yet and if there was anything else that they could assist me with," and not "eta" was given for when a room would be ready. I did end up heading down to the hotel, and when I got there a room was ready for me. Almost felt like had I went down to the hotel earlier a room would have been ready for me vs. asking in the app messenger. Then being an Elite member one of the privileges is a late check-out up to 4 PM. I had a confirmed 1 PM check-out booked (instead of 12 PM,) and used the app the morning of my departure to ask if it would be possible to have a 1:30 PM check-out instead and I got a response saying "I'm confirmed for a 1:00 PM check-out and if there was anything else I could be helped with." Felt like my message was not even read or they could have at least said "sorry, we cannot accommodate a 1:30 PM check-out instead of ignoring it.

Before my trip I received an e-mail asking for my information which I responded too and never got a response back (not sure if I was supposed to get one, or just even a "thanks, we got your info." A few days after my trip I received another e-mail saying "We hoped you enjoyed your stay and to let them know of any issues." I responded about the "app" issues but again never received a follow-up e-mail (not sure if I was supposed to, but figured I would.)

This is an amazing hotel and I absolutely loved my stay here and the staff I met in person, but it felt like if it was not face-to-face communication, you were not given the same level of service, especially using the App.

title: Great Hotel
text: We stayed hear in August 2017, The service is great and the rooms are very modern and nice. I believe its less than a year old.. We come into the city a lot we definitely feel this is the best hotel we have stayed at.  Location is quiet and theres great views

title: Cozy Stay
text: What an amazing experience. It started much prior to our arrival as we had many requests to the concierge. Daniel García gave us amazing recommendations, was able to get us a couple to tickets for events. The hotel room had an amazing view a bit of the hudson and even could see the Statue of Liberty. If tou have Lounge Access , one of the best "Continental Breakfast" these hotels offer. All the staff was friendly and the best part hotel is just like a block from the metro, steps away from everywhere. This hotel has a great location.

title: The best service ever at a hotel
text: Booked the Renaissance for the Big Ten Basketball tournament March 1-4.  Easily the best service we have ever received at a hotel.  In addition very nice rooms, facilities and location.  Our 5 couples had a riot and were treated like we were family.  We arrived at noon, checked our bags and revived an apology, even though our rooms weren't due to be ready until 4pm.  We were treated to a free drink.  After the game we got our bags and found great rooms. We went to the lounge talked with the staff,who did everything for us including anticipating when we might need chairs, not getting them we we asked.  Perfect service from everyone at all times.  Directions, where to eat, or time to chit chat, no problem.  They were always there and personally engaging. Eric was our informal host and was unbelievable and made things happen. Not a single imperfection in this stay. A++++

title: Nice hotel
text: I stayed 3 nights at the Renaissance Midtown and it was a pleasant experience. The rooms are nice and modern. The gym is big (external provided) but a bit factory like. The lounge was a bit disappointing.

title: Excellent NYC Hotel
text:
Location: This hotel is located in the Midtown/Fashion District of NYC. It's right across the street from Madison Square Garden, Macy's Herald Square, and is a 10 minute walk to times square. The Neighborhood is VEERY noisy, we had room 1407 (14th floor) and heard things all night. 

Hotel Common Areas: The hotel lobby is on the 6th floor. It has a very modern, hip, design vibe. The restaurant (Rock and Reilly's) located on the 5th floor is very good. I recommend the nachos, and the classic burger. Finally, the fitness center (A Public Planet Fitness) is located on floors 2, and 3. Very clean and well maintained.

Room: The rooms have a Modern, Industrial design, and are very large for the midtown area. The bathrooms are huge, with a walk in shower, rainfall shower head, and a full size vanity. As for noise, we heard no noise from the inside of the hotel, but the street noises penetrated the room like we had a window open. Maybe rooms higher up are quieter?? Quick side note, during our stay the in room freezer went into a defrost cycle, and began to leak. We also had access to the "club lounge" they served complimentary evening horderves, breakfast, and drinks were served all day.  

Overall: This is a very nice Midtown/ Times square/ Fashion District hotel, with good proximity to MSG. Rooms are large, bright, and brand new. Insulation, and street noise reduction could use work though. Lastly, the elevators could use some work. They were fast and equipped with a destination dispatch system. On the other hand, they were quite buggy, not accepting calls, and once taking me to the wrong floor. I have seen this same system working better at the Boston Marriott Copley place, and when working is quite useful.

title: Thank you Renaissance!
text: I took a group of students to NYC in the middle of a snowstorm. The trip was challenging to say the least. Front desk associate Sebastian was beyond gracious. Knowing that it took us over 24 hours to get to NYC and that we had so much difficulty finding a block of rooms...when we got to Renaissance, he got us situated and upgraded my room on the second night with a sweet view and some chocolate covered strawberries! It was an extremely thoughtful gesture that made my day. War Eagle to Midtown Renaissance!

title: Excellent, eclectic hotel in fantastic location
text:
About the only thing this hotel doesn't have going for it is a view.....but you're surrounded by NYC....go outside and get your view!  Location is always important, but here it is just 'in the middle' of one of the great metropolis's in the world.  I walked easily to Central Park (20 blocks N, right thru Times Square)....and from there you can stroll up to the Met or wherever.  I walked two blocks to Penn Sta., very handy if you've come in on a train.  I walked over to the High Line (5 or so blocks to one of the urban wonders of the modern world), and down to Houston.  You're not stuck at one end of the City, you are right in the middle!

This Renaissance has the usual high end Marriott bedding, always welcome, and a low key, friendly staff that was always ready to help but not intrusive.  The rooms are spacious and the showers are excellent.

The decor is pretty cool, prestressed bare concrete runs into various wall trim all over the hotel....at first I thought they might be in the middle of a re-do but then I decided they just wanted it this way.....and I really like it.  

The Lounge!---If you're a general hotel goer, or a Marriott, fan, you know a lot hangs on this.  This Lounge is first class.  No eggs to order, but lots of variety and fresh fruit and hot coffee in the morning (and the staff there were very cool/seemed to be really enjoying their work and working with the guests), along with some very nice breads and pastries.
The evening options are even better....I was tired from a long flight and gratefully bought a nice glass of wine and had it in the Lounge to accompany quite a nice dinner.

Enjoy!

title: Tight small rooms that are modern
text: If you like modern hotels that are trying to be on the edge. You will like this place. I tend to like more of relaxed hotel. I was here for work and they picked it. The one good thing the staff was very nice. Parking is a bit much!!!

title: Simply the best....
text: One of if not the most well run properties in NYC. A hidden gem just behind MSG/Penn Station. The team there is simply amazing. I traveled a group with 150 people (including some celebs) and everything was executed flawlessly by the team there! From the GM & Sales team to the front desk team and bartenders I have never felt more at home in NY.
