Sure there are bigger and fancier hotels but this place is the perfect match of location/luxury and style. A true Marriott flagship. Can't wait to come back.

title: Top choice while in midtown
text:
Incredible staff and service - from the ground level staff that greet you when you arrive, to front desk desk at check in and check out. Great rooms, really cool lobby,  and the restaurant Rock and Reilly's was great. Also loved having access to Planet Fitness.
Like others have indicated - the only downside is staff and offerings in the concierge lounge. Hotel is certainly not one of the lower priced options in Manhattan but you get what you pay for...

title: Everything I needed
text: Room was small Manhatten type but very nice and well laid out. Get off the elevator and go right into a Planet Fitness gym. Everyone that worked there had great customer service skills. Nice room service menu.

title: Great location- fabulous stay
text: Professional and courteous staff, decent sized well appointed rooms, and the new elevator technology exceeded our expectations.   Love the convenient midtown location, close to Penn Station.  Bring comfy shoes as there is so much to do and see.

title: First time stay
text:
Stayed here for the first time for business.  Hotel is clean and rooms are nice and spacious. I loved the closet w/indoor lighting.  Bathrooms are really nice.  Rooms and hallways are very clean.  It was very quiet too.  Staff were very friendly.  It's located in a great location and nearby many attractions: Penn Station, Madison Square Garden, Empire State Building, Time Square, etc.  

It was a little confusing at first as to where the lobby is when you first walk in (it's located on the 6th floor), but hotel staff will direct you when you walk in.  Will stay here again next time I am in town.

title: Localização Perfeita
text: Se faz de tudo nas proximidades desse hotel, tudo está próximo, compras, comidas, bares, pontos turísticos. O atendimento e limpeza do hotel são excelentes. Indico para quem está indo a NY pela primeira vez e quer fazer tudo com agilidade.

title: I CANT GET ENOUGH OF THIS PLACE!!!!!!!!!!
text: I travel every week on the East Coast, usually in Marriott properties.  I fell in love with the Renaissance Midtown from my first stay and now, I won't stay anywhere else when I am in town!  This place has the BEST customer service from the Bellman downstairs, to the always helpful concierge staff, to Nate, Marta, Ariel, etc at the Front Desk to Schouba (spelling?) at the bar!  If you are looking for the amenities of a larger Marriott property with all the personal touches (the staff remembers your name!!) as a smaller property, the Renaissance Midtown is your place!!  I actually hesitated writing this review because I don't what everyone else to discover this Hotel making it difficult for me to get a room....but this place is too beautiful and the hotel staff is too wonderful to not publically congratulate them on a job always well done!!!  I cannot wait for my next stay there!!!  I will see you guys soon!!!

title: Great Midtown Hotel
text: Wonderful hotel with high energy vibe. Lots of folks attending the BigTen Basketball Tournament stayed at the hotel. Warm, professional reception; great room with city view; enjoyed breakfast in the 5th floor restaurant. When’s the last time your server asked if you want a coffee to go?

title: Gorgeous hotel
text: We had a great time at this hotel. We were lucky enough to get a great deal because my husband is a Marriott employee, but I was pleasantly surprised by how nice this hotel was. Perfect location close to everything, very helpful and friendly staff (especially the bellhops and valets), cool aesthetic. We had a great view of the Madison Square Garden area. I would say if you are driving in to just do valet parking. We did a loop around the block and couldn't find the parking garage on 34th street. Valet was only $10 more and definitely worth it. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Hospedados pela 2a vez e com vontade de repetir.
text: Não tem localização melhor para compras e restaurantes. Centralizado, conseguimos fazer quase tudo a pé, menos qdo fomos para o River Café, que pegamos um Uber. No mais, qse todos os restaurantes que separei para conhecer eram de 400 a 700m de distância, ao lado da Macy’s, perto da B&H... aconteceu mais de uma vez de está na rua e voltar para o hotel para deixar as compras para não continuar andando com sacolas porque era fácil, simplesmente caminho de tudo. Nada a reclama de atendimento, bom impressão de limpeza. Essa é nossa 3a visita a NY e repetimos esse hotel pela 2a vez. Na próxima vinda, certeza que reservaremos novamente.

title: NY
text:
Great location, very nice hotel right in midtown close to Penn Station and Madison Sq Garden

Staff very friendly and helpful so wouldnt hesitate to recommend a stay here. Access onto 34th street a plus.

title: Great Vibe
text: This hotel is super nice.  Great vibe in midtown NY and Penn Station is right behind you.  Cool Hotel bar and good restaurant in the hotel.  Hotel staff is very friendly.Definitely recommend it.  Rooms are very modern but are pretty roomy compared to other NYC hotels.

title: Such a wonderful stay!
text: Traveled to NYC solo to see a special show.  The hotel staff could not have been nicer.  From the check-in, to the bellmen, to the restaurant staff and the staff of the lounge, everyone was polite and friendly.  The hotel itself is very cool with modern/post-modern furnishings and very upscale room features (full disclosure, I got an upgrade).  I travel a great deal for work so like to be in a more upscale hotel when I travel for fun.  This hotel really hit the mark for me.

title: Lovely Midtown Hotel
text: Stayed in this recently opened midtown hotel with the family for Veterans Day Weekend. Wonderful remodel to make into a modern style hotel. Good size rooms for midtown and the location of the hotel is ideal for anything in midtown due to walking distance or location by two major subway lines. Very helpful and friendly service too. Will return.

title: Wonderful stay ~ perfect location ~ great service.
text: Great romantic Fri-Sun stay. Great location. All staff was exceptionally friendly from the bellman who told us how to get to check in, the check in staff, the maintenance man who had to put a new battery in our safe.   We asked many questions of the Bell staff and they were patient and knowledgeable. They even offered us umbrellas for our stay. Room was clean, comfortable. Bathroom was odd, did not like the fact that sliding door does not shut all the way. Very strange, you can see and hear everything.  Room is a good size (NY Standards), you can walk to anything you need.  Great café for breakfast on the corner (Andrews). Bed was great. Very comfortable and clean. Heating unit was a little loud.  Woken by sirens but otherwise fairly quiet (again, NY standards).  Would recommend to anyone.

title: Good
text:
Excelente localização 
Limpeza a desejar , não trocaram lençóis em 6 noites de diária e a limpeza no geral deixou a desejar . 
Ar condicionado muito barulhento, não pude dormir com ele ligado 
Restaurante impróprio pra jantar com crianças pois é ambiente de bar !

title: Very modern and comfortable hotel
text:
The renaissance New York mid town hotel feels like an appointment in the sky. We asked for a high floor and they gave us a room on the 36th floor with an excellent view.

The elevator system is a little weird but once we got the hang of it, it was ok.

Great food with lots to do in the building with an interesting atmosphere along with great service from friendly employees. 

Near everything that a tourist would want from Time Square to the Empire State Building. Train station and bus station.

title: Hi-Tech Hotel Convenient to Penn Station
text:
This Renaissance Hotel bills itself as hi-tech. Hallways are industrial-looking with concrete walls. Rooms are a decent size for NYC and the view from my room from the 35th floor looking north was great. The king size bed was comfy, the armoire featured a nice rob and slippers, the bathroom was a decent size and featured Aveda products you find throughout the Renaissance brand. Two of my kids live in the city and visited me in the room, and got a chuckle out of the frosted glass on the bathroom wall that looked out toward the bed and window, but there was a shade there and it wasn't an issue. However, there was an issue with the malfunctioning ice machine on the 34th floor. The next closest one was on the 30th floor. Overall, not a big deal. The elevator system was confusing to a lot of people. You punch in the number of the floor to which you want to go, then are told which of the four elevators to enter. There are no buttons inside. 

The staff were friendly and remembered me when I checked out, even inquiring how my one son's musical performance at a club went. I did not eat at the hotel, nor did I use the lounge, which has minimal offerings on weekends anyway. Since breakfast is not served in the lounge on weekends, I was offered either 750 points or a voucher for breakfast at the restaurant on the fifth floor. I joined my kids for brunch at Almond on East 22nd Street instead (and it was great).

I received a decent rate that weekend and since I came into the city by Amtrak into Penn Station, the hotel was convenient, just a three block walk. Also convenient to Macy's and the subway. There is also a Planet Fitness in the building. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Perfect Location and Wonderful Hotel
text: I took a weekend trip from Washington DC to New York on Amtrak and this hotel was the perfect location.  It is a block away from Penn Station and a relatively new hotel.   The staff was extremely professional and well organized.  The Hotel looks new with computerized elevator functions.  Reception is on the 6th floor.  Being a Marriott Platinum member, I was offered an upgrade with access to the Club Lounge.  On weekends, the lounge had newspapers, boxed water and soft drinks.  There are a couple of restaurants in the hotel.  I did not experience them.   The room had a wonderful view of the New York Skyline with the Statue of Liberty in the background.  To my luck, it was mostly misty during my stay, although for brief periods of time, I had good views.  The proximity to Penn Station, as you can visit of New York from here via the Subway, LIRR and even Amtrak.   The famous time square is a few blocks away.  The hotel is located in the garment district.    Many great restaurants and carry outs are located very close to this hotel.   It should be a fun experience to spend a weekend here.

title: Great, Friendly Staff, Nicely Kept Hotel
text: The hotel was very nice--the staff made us feel so welcome. Night auditor James was helpful more than once. Thanks to Alan for putting us in a high, corner room when I told him we were celebrating my mother's 80th birthday. We had a fantastic view. The housekeepers did an outstanding job. Thank you also to Sebastian helping accommodate our breakfast needs. Your hotel truly made this celebration memorable! Centrally located with lots to do close by.

title: Top Notch
text: My girlfriend and I had a quick stay here from Friday to Saturday while she was attending a work conference.  I don’t usually stay at “big box” hotels but I was quite impressed with this facility.  It was very modern and well appointed throughout. Fantastic walk in shower.  Great views from our room on the 27th floor.  And the bed and tv were ace. The staff were exceptional - extremely friendly and professional, especially Rhoda, who arranged for the return of a valuable top coat that I inadvertently left in the coat closet. Very close to Penn Station and thus maximally convenient for Amtrak, LIRR, NJTrans, etc.

title: Great Location. Very trendy Remodel.
text: I am a big fan of Marriott's Renaissance brand.  I seek them out as I travel the US on business.  This is their new flagship hotel remodeled to show off their new "Fearlessly Chic" design direction. The public spaces and the rooms feature a very industrial, modern, and cold look, which is just not my style.  It feels like a very large boutique hotel, not an upscale luxury brand.  The staff all had an aloof trendy attitude, and except for housekeeping and the bell staff, were less than outgoing. I suspect Marriott is targeting a millennial audience, which I completely understand, but it's not what I have come to expect from the Renaissance brand.  There is no executive floor or lounge for Rewards members, just a business center type space off of the lobby that is apparently accessible to all hotel guests. The hotel's location is great: bordering the garment district, next to Madison Square Garden and Macy's, and a short walk from Broadway & Times Square.  The outdoor deck off of the bar and grill looked like it would be a great space in the summer.  Long story short:  If you like Marriott's new Moxy brand, you will likely be impressed by this property.  Otherwise, look into the Marriott Marquis or Marriott Eastside for an "old-school" upscale hotel experience in this area.

title: 便利なホテルです
text:
クリスマス時期に3泊しました。
複数路線の駅から近く、どこへ行くのもアクセスはいいです（ホテルの裏の出口からだと駅のある通り）。またタイムズスクエアのようには混んでいないので、近くレストランやカフェもそんなに待つことなく入れます。
ホテルは新しく部屋も綺麗です。レセプションやコンセルジュもとても親切に案内してくれました。個人的に大規模ホテルより小規模のほうがエントランスやカウンターが混みすぎず快適なので、そこもプラスでした。
たった一つ残念だったのは、ラウンジの女性の一人が白人のお客さんにしか挨拶せず、こちらの二度の挨拶も無視したことです。これはホテルに報せましたの今後はないと思いたいです。

title: Presque excellent
text: Chambre parfaite et d’une propreté irréprochable. Lit tres agréable. Très joli design. Service en chambre efficace bien qu’un peu junk food(emballage en carton). Wifi impeccable. Juste dommage que l’insonorisation ne soit pas parfaite.

title: Contemporary and quiet, but a weird bathroom
text: The hotel is very modern.  In the public spaces and hallways, they did a great job of decorating with pictures and props related to fashion and the Garment District.  The person who checked us in was so friendly, as was the bell hop.  Our room was on the 31st floor, and only once did I wake up to sirens; otherwise I heard nothing from outside.  We could even see Lady Liberty from our room, which was cool.  The beds were very comfortable, and we appreciated the robes and slippers.  The one odd thing that may keep me from returning is the bathroom.  The frosted glass door slides shut but doesn't lock, and it also has a gap which means you can see someone sitting on the toilet when you walk toward the bathroom.  The glass offers absolutely no sound-proofing, either.  I could hear my husband fiddling around with the shampoo bottle while he was taking a shower.  Also, the light streams through the glass so if you're trying to sleep in while someone else is up, good luck with the extra light and noises.

title: hotel pas à la hauteur de son prix
text:
Le renaissance est un hotel bien placé et propose des chambres spacieuse et bien agencées.
J'ai cependant été très décu des prestations suivantes :
- Pas d'eau disponible dans la chambre : Il faut faire au room service qui apporte de l'eau filtrée en brique (gout infect) pour 7 dollars par bouteille (sans le tip)
- Soufflerie continue dans la chambre (qu on ne peut éteindre car indépendant de la clim)
- La salle de sport proposée par l'hotel est une salle indépendant voisine de l'hotel. Pour y avoir accès, vous devriez venir avec votre passeport et passer 10 minutes à créer un compte. La salle de sport ne propose pas d'eau (il fait donc venir avec du cash pour acheter des bouteilles à 3 USD) et ne propose pas de serviettes.
- Enfn le WIFI n'est pas inclu

Ces point ne sont pas à la hauteur d'un hotel de cette gamme.

title: Great stay in perfect location
text:
Being a bit of a perfectionist, it took me some time to shortlist and then choose a hotel for our stay in NY. Now having stayed at Renaissance Midtown NY, I can safely say it was a well informed and thought out decision!

Check in was extremely easy as hostess was very informative with regards to local amenities and explaining all details of the room.

The room itself (King room with city view) was a fantastic size and looked exactly as it did on the website which is always a bonus these days! Large, comfortable bed, ample sized seating area, long desk, big TV, massive bathroom with walk in rainfall shower - exactly everything we wanted down to a T.

In terms of locations I believe we were perfectly placed. Times Square was a 5-7 minute walk which meant we were away from the hustle and bustle in our own peace and quiet. Madison Square Gardens was a 10 minute or less walk in opposite direction. Penn St Station (main train Line) was less than 5 minute walk. Empire state building was a 10 minute walk. 

We had a fantastic all day breakfast spot on top of our road accessible in 1 minute along with a Starbucks and a few other smaller cafes. The world's largest Macys (as they advertised it) was a 2 minute walk from the hotel as well as a ton of other designer shops and numerous restaurants.

I honestly cannot fault the hotel in any way as the stay was near perfect from start to finish.

title: Wonderful Hotel - Great Location
text: I just loved this hotel.  It was close to everything but away from the crowds at Time Square.  Beautifully decorated and great amenities.  They have added the privacy curtains on the shower wall so rooms are family friendly.  There is a Planet Fitness gym connected to the hotel which was great.  For the Marriott members the lounge was well stocked and offered a great breakfast during the week.

title: High Marks All Around, Great Stay!
text: This hotel is all around great.  It's in a relatively quiet area, which is ideal for escaping the  chaos of the city.  The lobby is modern and open, and the staff are pleasant.  Although the rooms are small, they are well designed and contemporary.  The rooms are clean and comfortable as well, as is the bathroom.  Modern Luxury at its best.

title: Another perfect stay
text: This property has really become our go-to place when in NYC. Staff is ever attentive and warm. Rooms are spacious (even for NYC standards) and well designed. Love the bathrooms and showers. Most importantly the rooms are very quiet and have blackout shades. Beds are great. We always have a pleasant stay!  Highly recommend.

title: Excellent location, modern hotel
text: The hotel is in an excellent location allowing you to access the city very easily and enjoy the local cafes, delis, and restaurants all within walking distance. The hotel decor is very modern and stylish. We had a skyline-view room which offered beautiful views of the city skyline, while relaxing on a lounging couch right next to the window. The room we had was perfect us (a couple), the shower has a glass window that looks into the room but can be covered with some blinds if you need some privacy. This wasn't a problem for us anyway. The staff prepared a nice surprise for me and my fiancee, it was so perfect. Lastly, for some reason the staff came to check on us several times on our first night to see if we needed anything, which was fine the first time but we said we didn't need anything so we were a bit surprised and annoyed when they came to our room again a few more times asking the same thing.

title: Great location and modern luxury meet
text: Went up to Penn station and it was a great to find a convenient location and a great hotel. the room was nice, we even had a view of the Empire State building. Very modern decor, great bar's and the club was excellent. Enjoyed our stay and it was so easy getting in and out of the city, I'd love to go back. Loved our stay.

title: Very very good hotel
text:
The hotel is very modern,top technology,very fun.Location is great ,400 meters from Victoria Secret  next to Macy’s.
The breakfast at Reilly is really good,croissant and pain au chocolat amazing like in Paris.we ate our 2 evenings at their restaurant And it was great!!!!
So nice ambiance at the restaurant bar,very good cocktails,good food and we had great time stayed until it closed,must eat there
The room is a little bit small,I love the  bathroom ,I asked by chat to receive more towels,in few minutes I received them,really good service
We will definitely come back to this hotel

title: Great time at Renaissance thanks to Richard!
text:
Last night (1/8), after a great but long day, my fiance and I checked out of our hotel elsewhere and headed toward Renaissance Midtown to have dinner upstairs at Rock & Reilly's before catching a late bus home. 

Upon arriving, we were warmly greeted by Richard Gonzalez who took great care of us even though we were not guests of the hotel. He checked our bags so that we wouldn't have to lug them around the restaurant, was kind when we had operator difficulty with the elevators (haha!!), gave us advice about how to leave to avoid a long walk and in all was just a charming, warm and positive person!

As we got on the elevator, my fiance and i chatted about how nice he was and we were surprised and it made us feel good about the long night ahead of us. We are not frequent travelers but had just spent the night elsewhere and had also been in a hotel the week before and immediately wished we had the type of welcoming Richard had given us - as if we were old friends returning home.

The greeting we received once at the restaurant was unparalleled - not even by the hosts, server or managers. They were nice enough. The atmosphere was great. LOVED the fact that Planet Fitness was attached (we are members) and immediately knew we had to stay at THIS hotel again on our next NYC visit.

Upon our departure, there was Richard. Still happy, charming and positive. As we got ready to head into the cold and on a bus, it was great to see our new "old" friend be departing and let him know that because of not just "doing your job" but completely exceeding expectations in regards to his hospitality, we would definitely be back in NYC but we would only stay at Renaissance because of him and hope that he is there when we do!

title: Girls Trip
text: I cannot say enough positive things about this hotel! Trendy, hip, excellent location and a very professional staff! We loved the digital hotel experience, exposed concrete walls, creative shower space and room size. Everything was immaculate. I’m a Marriott platinum elite so we did have club lounge access. The lounge is beautiful and offers pretty much the same food and drink options you’d find in an American Marriott property (i find the European club lounges to have a more extensive offering). I’ll definitely stay here again!

title: Awesome Midtown Find
text: Best Midtown Hotel. Staff is A+! Justin and Natacha have the BEST Customer Service. Location is very convenient to Time Square, Rockefeller Center, Empire State Building and Penn Station. Look no further than this Allstar Hotel! We will be back!!

title: Great property and amazing staff
text:
Hotel is alright. Staff is way above average in their courtesy compared any other Marriott property i have stayed at. This includes right from the bell boy (Caleb) to the hosts and room service. Room was spotless with fantastic views. 

only downside is that for $400 night stay i earned only 300 marriott rewards (??) and the executive lounge is pretty lame other than during breakfast hours. 

There is a teeny tiny driveway to pull your car over to load/unload. they allow you to park there for 10 - 20 minutes if you leave the key with bellboy.

recommended.

title: Trendy, Hip - But Not Pretentious
text: Stayed here for a birthday celebration in November.  We had a nice corner room on the 26th floor.  The room was clean and well appointed.  The lobby and restaurant were very good.  The service was prompt and courteous.  I will call out that the bartenders (understatement) in the lobby bar were amazing (Shuba and Marissa).  Ask Marissa to make you something amazing "off-menu" and you will not be disappointed. She made a Smoked Manhattan and a drink with homemade cherries that will blow your mind.  She is a genius and fun to chat with.  We will definitely be back to this property.

title: Fantastic Visit to NYC
text: My wife and I decided to celebrate her Birthday, and bring her parents along for their wedding anniversary, and the staff of the Renaissance Midtown couldn't have been better. Our favorite part of the stay was when we arrived back from dinner one night and there was a jam session with local musicians (I think) that was incredible. The rooms were also great with views of the skyline. I would definitely consider staying here again.

title: Great hotel!
text: I was in NYC in November for business and stayed at the Renaissance Midtown - what a great hotel with fantastic staff!  The place is nicely situated and once through the door you can easily forget you are in one of the worlds busiest cites.  Inside the place is lovely and peaceful, the rooms are very smart and the restaurants are really good.   I will be back in NYC late January and planning to stay at the hotel again - would recommend to all.

title: Great Location if you want to be in Midtown
text: Fairly new, good room size and good bathroom. However house keeping lets the hotel done. Location is ideal if you need to be next to Marcy's and want to talk up town or down town. Close to metro station. Floor housekeeper needs to check the rooms each day as they don't replace what is used like shampoos, pen, tea. Good hotel for short stay. Beds are very comfortable. Try to say above 17th floor. Very quite compared to New York Hotel

title: Great Hotel - Convenient to MSG, Penn Station, etc.
text: I stayed at the Renaissance for the first time last week, and I was pleasantly surprised.  The staff could not have been more friendly or accommodating.  The hotel was extremely clean and well-maintained, and the room was a good size for a New York City hotel room.  I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Great Stay - Amazing Staff
text:
Spent a long weekend here with my wife and daughter.  Check-in staff was great (they sent cake pops up w/a card welcoming our 3 yr old to NYC) and the rooms were clean and comfortable.  Having access to the lounge (Gold w/Marriott) was nice as well as we were able to grab plenty of waters as we came in/went out.  The food at the Hotel bar/lounge was great as well (priced accordingly, but very good)  

The location, for us, was perfect given the short walk to Penn Station / Empire State Building / Times Square etc.  

Only negative mark was I requested a crib for our daughter at check-in but was told they don't have cribs due to the size of the rooms --- only to find a crib in our room when we went upstairs.  We also were not given breakfast vouchers and didn't realize we needed them until the 2nd day.  Upon checkout though we received the points offering instead (at check-in you can either get extra Marriott reward points OR vouchers).  Might have just been a new employee when we checked in and ultimately did not affect our stay.  

Would absolutely stay again.

title: Overnight Stay
text: This is a new hotel, excellent location near Time Square and Madison Square Garden.  Very nice room and beds.  Rock and Reilly's is a hip new bar/ restaurant in the hotel.  The staff was very friendly.  I recommend this hotel.

title: Great location
text: Love the location - just a half block off Broadway, and half block from Macy's and Penn Station.  Rooms are tight - but this is NYC, right?  The concierge lounge was awful.  Never had coffee available outside of breakfast hours, breakfast selection was lacking at best, lounge was often out of stock for many of the sodas and juices - management of the lounge needs to be tightened up alot!  Service gets "average" primarily because of the concierge lounge!

title: Nice Hotel, Nice Location
text:
We stayed here for a night.  Main entrance on 35th Street even though you can enter/exit through 34th Street.  Check-in was done on the 6th floor (Executive Lounge also located this floor).  Not your typical hotel, with the elevators as well as the decor.  I want to point out that the elevators worked well; we did not wait 15 minutes for the elevators.  You select the floor you want to go on the screen and it'll tell which elevator to take (there are 3 elevators you can take from the 6th floor to your room; from ground floor to 6th floor you have 4 elevators), you get in and it'll bring you to the desired floor. Kind of hi-tech.

Room is on the small side (this is NYC, what do you expect) with a nice view (we were on 27th floor).  I can see the Statue of Liberty far in a distance.  Everything in the room was nice and clean.  The Executive Lounge is open 24/7, with breakfast served till 9:00am and light snacks from 5:30pm-7:30pm.  Note that the Lounge is open on Christmas Eve.  Very nice.

This hotel is conveniently located, with easy access to the subway (5 minutes) and Times Square (5-10 minutes walk).  Shops and restaurants are in abundance within a 10-minute walk.  Starbucks on both corners 34th & 8th and 34th & 7th.  Madison Square Garden is also within a 5-minute walk.  Can't really beat the location.

This is a nice hotel located in Midtown New York, but probably won't stay here again (for reasons I choose not to go public with).  I would rather try out other properties in the city.

title: Decent stay in a nice location
text: I stayed here on points while attending a friend's birthday event. I wasn't able to experience the lounge for breakfast, as I tended to sleep in (it was the weekend and the nights were all long ;)). I will say, that the lounge is kind of smaller compared to other renaissances. They also have boxed water. Something that was a new concept to me. The annoying thing about it is, if you go in to the lounge at night to grab some water---there's almost never any left. It's like someone takes the entire crate of them back to their room. Go in the morning or afternoon, and stock up on a few (or hey, take a crate since that might be the thing to do). The only other issue I had with the hotel was that my keys stopped working--so upon getting a new key, I realized it wasn't configured to have lounge access. So I then had to get it re-programmed again. Nothing too crazy. The room was pretty cool. It kind of had this modern/re-designed feel to it. I was a fan of the waterfall shower. It was also surprisingly quiet/sound proof despite being in the heart of midtown. I was expecting sirens to be heard all night. The outdoor bar area was awesome. I was able to catch some football and have a few beers the sunday I flew out. It seems like it draws a crowd of not just hotel guests, but locals as well. Uber/lyft were all really easy to access by the hotel as well too. I was also told that they didn't have any suites at all at that hotel. Something that was strange, since every Renaissance I've been to had some suite rooms. I think the best employee btw was the valet. I needed to grab a taxi to catch my flight (uber surge was insane at the time), and he literally ran outside to go grab one for me. It was awesome.

title: Poor service from start
text:
Arrived to find no rollaway bed and no-one bothered telling me in advance they don't have any. Instead they insisted on charging $35 a night extra for another bed - 2 queens instead of a king. I'm a Platinum Elite and NEVER been charged extra for another bed. Then I complained about the heating TWICE and its still really cold. Also a very rude receptionist mislead us about the breakfast policy and changed her story 3 times!!!! Then the front office manager wasn't very helpful on check in either!

Now I tried to catch reception but no answer and the flush isn't working. Also dirty towels mixed with the clean ones by housekeeping.

They've really spoiled our expensive trip. Awful!

DONT COME HERE! Simple Advice.

I want to try and move out as I have another 5 nights to go!!!!

title: Very nice!
text: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. It was easy to find, they have valet parking, most of the people who work there were really friendly and helpful, our room was spacious (which is rare in NYC) and it was very clean. The atmosphere and set up of the hotel were very cool. We didn't hear any noise from surrounding rooms during our stay. The best part was the location - it was so convenient! We could see Madison Square Garden from our room. We had a couple minor complaints that were addressed by the hotel staff. But we would definitely return!

title: Great room with only two minor flaws
text:
This is a great hotel and one of the best that I've stayed out in Manhattan.  The rooms are new and very clean.  They think of everything including the ability to leave your cell phone plug at home and just use their many ports built in to the room.  Shower was huge.  The room was very spacious and came with a nice robe and slippers.

Now the downside - We had to run the shower for about 15 minutes to get hot water.  Trying to get it from the sink was even longer.  What a waste of water!  We were on the 15th floor.  Not sure where the hot water tank or heater is located but wow.  You have to plan for your time.  No quick jump in and get your shower.

The second downside was the lack of towels.  We booked the room for two adults.  They gave two towels, wash cloths, and hand towels.  Most places we go, we get four.  Because of the hot water issue, we postponed a shower until later in the day because we had to get somewhere in the morning.  When we got back to get our shower, the room was already done so only the two towels.  We got our shower for our evening event.  Then the next morning, we did not have clean towels.  Yes.  We like a new towel and wash cloth with each shower.  

There was a glitch with the key system that they could not issue keys when we tried to check in.  But they worked with us and escorted us to our room so we could get ready for our evening out on the city.  By the time we got back to the hotel, they were up and running again and we could get our keys.  They handled it the best they could.

title: Great stay almost as good as we expected!
text:
We are long time fans of the Renaissance 57 up on East 57th.  For us, it's enough out of the craziness of midtown and convenient to what we usually do in the city.  This time around more of what we were doing was in midtown and south, so we opted to stay at the Renaissance Midtown for the first time.  I don't care for that area generally as it's too loud and crowded for our liking, especially in December, but our agenda had us there.  Our expectations were high for this hotel and we expected a similar, excellent experience.  We almost got that.

The double queen room was wonderful high up on the 35th floor with a view over Madison Square Garden and the Statue of Liberty off in the distance.  It was a quick run out of Penn Station across the street to the "back door" of the hotel and its lobby.  The reception area is up a few floors and is quite loud and rowdy due to the bar that is right off the reception area (we checked in around 5 p.m. on a Friday).  Our room was ready and off we went.

The room was more spacious than expected.  The bathroom has frosted glass walls, which you will certainly want to pull the curtains for if you intend to sleep while anyone is in there.  The shower is waterfall and good quality water pressure.  Beds are comfortable and it was a quiet sleep, well away from elevators and other guest noise.

We ate at the Rockin Reilly's restaurant onsite.  I'd tried to book it via Open Table a few different times over the weekend, and it said it was fully booked but we were able to walk in and be seated for two dinners and breakfasts.  All meals were reasonably good and at NYC's usually inflated prices for the quality that it was.

We found the staff friendly and competent, but for the bellhop on check-out.  We left the hotel at 10:00 a.m. and made plans for him to have a car for us to go to LaGuardia at 2:30 pm.  He wrote our room number down and took our luggage for the day while we went to museums.  We returned at 2:25 and he had no recollection of us, our luggage or the car he was to get for us.  A bit of a scramble ensued and I think we ended up with someone else's car.  While minor and not fatal, it's that type of service mistake that ended our weekend.  And we know it would never have happened with the excellent bellhop we always have at the Renaissance 57!  I did bring this to the service manager's attention when he checked in with us after we'd returned home, and he said he'd bring this up to his staff as a training issue, which I think is fair.

All in all, a decent stay for a holiday weekend, but nothing to sway me from staying at the tried and true up on 57th next time.

title: Business or Pleasure
text:
So I flew in from Doha, Qatar where I live and work to teach up near New Haven. I decided to stay in the city for the weekend before going up. I’ve always wanted to do Christmas in New York, so I couldn’t have planned a more perfect weekend to come. It was magical. 

But if it had not been for the Renaissance Midtown, my visit wouldn’t have been so delightful. I travel a lot and I’m very picky about where I stay. Some of the things that are high on my list are contemporary furnishings (check), club lounge (check), hip bar or restaurant (check), bed made of clouds (check) and a rainfall shower (check). 

I debated going back to the Ren-Times Square, but since I had been there and done that (and it was great - see my review), I wanted to step it up. This hotel is really cool (as at met my expectations of the things I look for in a hotel) and was very “techy”. I know NY gets a bad wrap on hotels being pricey with small rooms, but you get what you pay for depending on whether you are there for business or pleasure. You could come to Midtown for either. I found the location superb as I had quick access to all the places I wanted to go. And all of the clientele coming out of the hotel looked super savvy. This made me feel safe and comfortable. 

The room was gorgeous, with an ultra comfortable bed, great WiFi, TV (I got to watch a little - channels I don’t have abroad), the view was nice (which the staff recommended and picked for me)... and the shower was YAASSSSS! I could have just stood there forever! I really wish I could have stayed longer and spent more time in the lounge and gym. While most people travel think of hotels as just a place to sleep or pass through, to me it’s a destination in and of itself. If you pick s great one, you really never have to leave. 

David and Nate truly have inspired the staff to collectively execute the vision of the hotel and brand. While not perfect, it’s Excellence! Well done!

title: Nothing special here - and some deficiencies
text: Very small euro-style rooms.  Pretty uncomfortable for two people - not enough place to sit. Very low-end coffee service in room and no bottled water - even for a Marriott platinum visitor. We had a nice view of the skyline - which we paid a premium for.  And, the bed was very comfy.  Room was also nicely appointed - but there are some bizarre touches - like pencils without a sharpener.  What is the purpose of that?  All-in-all for a Renaissance we expected better - but gave an average after contemplating a poor rating.

title: Good location
text:
Nice rooms but very impersonal. Elevators are very slow particularly at busy times, can take 15 mins to get to your floor. Great shower but very noisy heater, very good room cleaning staff. Room well presented each day. 

Thank you Rada for the bottle in our room to celebrate our anniversary, nice touch.

title: Not so golden rule
text: As the previous reviewed mentioned, I too was looking forward to spending a New Year’s Eve trip (4 nights) at this hotel since booking in May of this year. Apparently management felt it was more beneficial to bump guests to another hotel of the hotels choosing to accommodate a large group booking the hotel for the holidays. I put a lot of time in effort into choosing a hotel when traveling and as a gold elite I look to book at a Marriott first when we travel. I cannot stay at their chosen hotel and use my points as I had planned for 2 of my 4 nights, So less than 3 weeks from my trip and a lot of back and forth emails and phone calls, I either pay more for another hotel or cancel our entire very anticipated trip. Disappointment is an understatement especially for a Marriott Renaissance hotel. Obviously Marriott’s #goldenrule commercial does not apply to this hotel or its employees.

title: Great Place to stay
text: My husband I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights.  The staff at the hotel are very friendly and they gave excellent service.  We had arrived very early in the morning after taking a red eye flight from the west coast.  We did not expect the hotel to let us check in that early, but they had a room available for us.  The room was small (expected this in a big city), modern, and nicely decorated.  The bed was extremely comfortable.  It's a great location as well with Penn Station just a few steps away.  We would definitely stay here again.

title: Awful customer service.
text: I was hoping to be able to tell everyone what a fantastic hotel this was, once we arrived back home after spending New Year in New York.  However.............receiving a phone call 3 weeks before we are due to arrive and telling us that we are being moved to another hotel and there is nothing we can do about it, is nothing less than the worse possible service ever!!!  The fact that my Fiancé and I spent months deliberating which hotel to stay in for our first visit to New York, makes the cancellation all the more upsetting.  What really annoys me, and I’ll refrain from swearing, is the fact that we are getting bumped, because some company wants to book the hotel for the festive period.  Well how about my festive period, seeing as we had booked the room in April, and you are now only just telling us.  Personally the manager is thankful that he spoke with my fiancé and not me, I for one am glad that we are not staying there if this is how they treat prospective customers.

title: Very well rated and did not dissappoint!
text:
Booked to stay during the Thanksgiving holiday period and prior to travelling we undertook some serious research into hotels in New York! 

We were looking for a property that was centrally located to Times Square, offered good views and was modern and this hotel came out on time and within our budget.

Prior to arriving at the hotel I made contact with them and the Lead Navigator (Ranie Khemraj) replied very prompltly providing me with a list of sites and excursions that we should consider during our stay as well as recommendations on restaurants, rooftop lounges and speakeasy's. All of this came in very handy and on the back of the recommendation we made reservations and I am pleased to say that they did not disappoint. The other purpose of making contact was I was wanting to have some tickets delivered to the hotel prior to our arrival and I wanted to make sure that this would not be a problem and that they would be kept safe. As before Ranie responded promptly and provided the necessary reassurance that the tickets would be kept safe and on arrival these were duly handed to me without any need to ask.

The hotel is situated a short walk from Penn Station, on arrival we were greeted by the Bell Hop who promptly took our bags and assisted us up to the 6th floor which is were the reception is based, from here check in was very smooth and efficient with minimal hassle which after a 12 hour journey is just what you need. As instructed we handed over our bag ticket and were then directed up to the 27th floor.

Within minutes of entering the room our bags were then delivered.

The room, what can I say, floor to ceiling glass windows with views out towards Times Square and the Chrysler building. This for me is definitely what made the room even more special. The room itself was well appointed and was of a modern design in keeping with the rest of the hotel, it was well decorated and very clean. The bed has to be one of the comfiest beds I have ever slept in. Yes the bathroom has a frosted glass panel but there is a blind which can be used if you want and to be honest this is just one of the quirky features that the hotel has to offer.

Whilst in the hotel we made use of both the hotels bar on the 6th floor as well as Rock & Reilly's which is the hotels bar and restaurant located on the 5th floor. the service in both of these as well as the food was very good and we have no complaints, all of the staff we encountered appeared to be happy and went above and beyond putting our needs first always.

On departure day, check out again was smooth and efficient and the Bell Hop (Martin Vega) took care of our bags for the day as well as organising a private car to take us back to the airport in style.

Overall the only negative is that we had to leave, yes lots of people commented about the strange lift set up but as long as you request the lift and get in the correct one then you wont have any troubles.

Thanks again Renaissance New York Midtown for making our stay in New York even better.

title: Great Location
text:
We stayed as a couple for 3 nights mid-November having chosen the Renaissance after a really meticulous research for midtown hotels in NY. The location is perfect, a 3 min walk from the lights of Times Square and many nearby attractions, on a quiet (ok quieter) street than the very busy one parallel to it. We opted for a skyline view room on the 30th floor and the view really did not disappoint - uninterrupted view of Chrysler building and Empire state with floor to ceiling windows. However, a few negative points. The hotel experience was was relatively detached and cold, much like the bare stone walls in the room. For example the lobby is on the 6th floor and they were not overly friendly. In fact we only interacted with hotel staff at check-in and check-out, which is fine for some people, but i felt the personal service was lacking a touch, and it was more like a furnished appartment we were going to. Secondly the elevators.....a disaster. There are 3 elevators on ground floor and they are not very big. With the bar on 6th floor, they are often full of drunk people going up and down, so not great if you are with families. By the 3rd day we were fed up of the elevators. The room itself was quite small but just about enough room. However there was very little storage space or even where to put luggages which we ended up putting on the floor in the corner. The bathroom was spacious but there was a very thin door meaning a lack of privacy, and also no toilet brushes.

All in all i would recommend this hotel primarily for its location and better suited for couples (without children) or for business.

title: Great Hotel
text: Stayed her during my recent visit to watch my son play at the Madison Square Gardens for the recent Under Armour Tournament.  The staff were helpful and accommodating.  I will stay here on my next visit to the city.  The location was great and everything was within walking distance.

title: Great NYC Stay
text:
Stayed here for a long weekend in NYC and thought the property was great. Start with the Lobby and Bar, great energy and a really great crew of bartenders and servers. The Bar area is pretty lively and has a good mix of drinks and crowd. The lobby area above that on the 6th floor is a bit more subdued, but still nice feel.

Rooms were decent size for a NYC room. We had a king bed and it was roomy enough to move around it. Also a nice chase under the window (which opens which is always nice). Certainly been in smaller rooms. I felt the wood to carpet transition on the floor by the bed was a little worn and a little uneven. The bathroom was awesome. Great standing glass shower and a lot of room. Felt the room was very trendy.

Location was awesome as well in midtown. Definitely would stay again if I get the chance!

title: Nice Location
text: Good stay at hotel. Location was nice,everything was walkable, shoppin, theater. Staff friendly, Alan at check in was superb. Nice bar on lobby level. Rooms are small and as alway nyc in December is pricey.

title: Excellent in every way
text:
My wife and I recently stayed at the Renaissance for 5 nights to celebrate our 25th anniversary. With so many hotels to choose from I read all the reviews I could and finally decided on the rennyc because of the positive feedback from other visitors.
I had emailed the hotel and asked for rates to upgrade to a Skyline room but was really pleasantly surprised to receive a complimentary upgrade to the 35th floor. The view was absolutely sublime - we could see everything from the Chrysler building to the Hudson river & everything in between, sunrise and sundown were pretty awesome. The room had quality fittings and the bed was very comfortable.
The location couldn't be better and access to the subway is at the end of the street. Plenty of choices for breakfast within 2-5 minutes walk and a great bagel shop across the street and 2 Irish bars within 50m which was useful after a long day visiting the sites.
The staff are amazing and can't do enough for you, special mention to Radairis who made a wonderful gesture on our 1st evening and to Richard who recommended a great Italian restaurant for lunch.
Nothing in life is perfect - there were a couple of minor issues - we could hear voices in the next room via the air con ducting but they were simply people enjoying themselves, the bar in the hotel Rock n Reilly's is quite expensive even by NYC standard and the food is average, made worse by the sullen attitude of the young ladies who greet and sit you - they do the hotel a disservice.
Overall a really this a high quality, comfortable hotel in a great location but its the staff that work there that make it that bit more special - we'll return to NYC and will definitely be booking the  Renncy Midtown!

title: Weekend in December
text: My wife and I spent a weekend hear for her birthday. Good location steps away from Hearld Square, subway, restaurants. Modern hotel. Comfortable but smallish rooms. Room was not ready until 7pm! They gave us a free drink at the bar to compensate. Would stay again.

title: Loved it!
text: I recently stayed at the Renaissance with my husband for 5 nights, We were celebrating our 3 year anniversary and had the best trip ever! The bartender IVY was the best...Make sure you ask for her if you go!! Best drinks ever... and the food was really good too! Love this hotel.. I'm going back for Valentine's Day, I hope! :)

title: Compelling / personal / value
text:
What a hidden gem - next to Penn Plaza so easy access in from the airports - a very compact and comfortable hotel made so much better by the quality of the team.

Rooms are small - but efficient - service is excellent- I always leave a gratuity for the room team - here they appreciate in style (pictures) 
Front desk and lounge team super friendly - Bill Marriott would be proud as they hit all the Marriott values and more.

New York is noisy from the outside so expect that - but it all fits together.

Gym is outsourced and huge - staff are friendly and appreciate the hotel business.

If you want to see NYC and feel at home at the end of a busy day or are on business and want to be central and looked after - this is the place for you - fully deserved 5 stars

title: Industrial vibe, central location
text: I spent three nights here after debating between this hotel and a traditional Marriott downtown. Now I understand why the reviews vary so much. The Renaissance Midtown has a very specific vibe, in keeping with Renaissance's brand of originality at each location. I enjoyed being in a chic, high-energy atmosphere, but if I had wanted a tranquil getaway, I wouldn't have been happy here. The ceilings and some walls are bare concrete, and with my skyline view upgrade, I had fun pretending I lived in an industrial-style loft apartment. About the glass bathroom wall: the architect clearly designed this so that the wall lines up with the room's window; I was able to see the beautiful skyline view from the shower. If I hadn't been traveling alone, I could have pulled down the very stylish roller shade to create privacy. The rooms are clattery; you'll hear everything going on in the room next door, and you'll hear street noise. This is not unusual in Midtown. Bring earplugs and run the fan, and you won't hear the noise anymore. The common areas, elevators, and dining areas all have high-energy music piped in, and there are big-screen televisions in all of those areas. I didn't mind it, but I scheduled client meetings at a restaurant around the corner so that we could have a more sedate atmosphere. That said, I had brunch in the hotel restaurant, and the food was outstanding: fresh, delicious, inventive, but with sports bar atmosphere that was not a good fit for me. There are no drawers in the room; instead, you get a beautiful, very long shelf. The closet space was ample. My room included a chaise longue (nice long lounge chair) which was great for long stretches of working on my laptop.

title: Hotel was lovely, food was a let down
text:
I stayed over night and really enjoyed this hotel.  The staff at the front desk were great, and the room was very cool.  I had requested a skyline view and was not disappointed.  The appointments were all nice and modern.  I got a great night's sleep - most important.

Like some other reviewers, I wound up getting let down by the food.  I ordered a basic breakfast to be delivered to my room: avocado toast, coffee and "fresh squeezed" orange juice.  I got a tiny piece of bread with guacamole on it (not fresh avocado), and the juice was definitely from a bottle not fresh.

title: Weekend Getaway 11/17/17
text:
We wanted to getaway for a night in the city for some dinner, comedy show and shopping. We also did not want to drive so we settled on this Renaissance property that is a couple of blocks from NY Penn station after reading some reviews. Let me just say this is now my NY hotel to frequent on any overnight stay.

Checked in a little early on Friday afternoon. With my Platinum status, I was upgraded to a skyline view of the city. Also, we were given a drink voucher at check in. We were also given breakfast vouchers since the concierge lounge was not open for food on Saturday. I do not recall the name, but the young lady who checked us in was very professional, smiled and made the process smooth. 

The room was very nice with a nice glass shower. Nice size room, nothing huge. This is a NYC high rise building, so you must realize the rooms will not be the size of other rooms in different parts of the country you may be used to. A perfect hotel for couples, not a large family with children.

This hotel's location was perfect for our visit. Time Square is only a 10-15 walk, Macy's is right across the street and Madison Square Garden is 2 blocks away. There is also a bagel shop across the street from the hotel. Very good bagels!

We had drinks at the bar before hitting Time Square. The bartenders were both upbeat and nice. Breakfast the next morning was also good. Buffet style, fresh breads and fruits included. After checking out on Saturday, we grabbed lunch and then hit NY Penn station to catch our train back to Jersey. A perfect hotel for couples!!!

Thank you
EM

title: Stayed here twice, time to move on
text:
I didn't give this hotel the best review in the summer and not sure exactly why I returned but now is definitely time to move on. 
We had a view of Madison Square Gardens and both nights the noise was unbearable. No point complaining as it was out of their hands.
The rooms are modern. This one had the tiniest of baths which I could have done without. There is no draws and only two small shelves for putting away your clothes so with two people in the room it was impossible and the room was constantly in a mess.  The executive lounge has a fridge full of water juices and yoghurts which are free to take but nothing more. Nice but not at all which is expected from an executive lounge.
Towels and linens are good quality and having Aveda toiletries was lovely.

title: Terrible staff & drilling overhead
text: I️ was counting on having a place to rest in between my early-morning commute from Boston and my afternoon meeting in NYC. However, when I️ tried to rest in my hotel room, heavy drilling commenced directly above my ceiling. It was so loud that when I called front desk to complain, I️ could barely hear the person through the phone. They told me it would stop soon and did nothing about it. The drilling then went on for another hour. When I️ checked out, I️ complained to the front desk again and their response was “I’m sorry. I️ hope you come back again and let us make it up to you.” Of course I’m not coming back again. You should have planned for that room to be vacant that day if you knew drilling was happening overhead. FYI management I’m an SPG platinum member. I️ will be looking for other properties to stay in NYC from now on.

title: Comfort in Big Apple Chaos
text: Let me open by saying I live in NYC, but I needed a hotel in the midtown area so that I could attend two functions over the course of the weekend without having to travel back and forth to Brooklyn.  This not only met my needs, but it exceeded them.  Sleek, stylish, modern, clean, comfortable, roomy, safe, and convenient.  That is what I found at the Renaissance.  It made this (somewhat jaded) New Yorker enjoy time in Manhattan when all he usually wants to do is get away from it.  I felt as if I was on vacation. Highly recommend.

title: Moderno e bem localizado
text: A localização do hotel é uma das melhores para quem vai se conectar pela Penn Station, que fica do outro lado da rua (a menos de um minuto) pela saída do hotel na 34th. Fica igualmente perto do Madison Square Garden e da Macy’s na 34th. O hotel tem instalações modernas, com quarto de tamanho normal, cama bem confortável e banheiro claro e com ótimo chuveiro. Os elevadores são rápidos e a rede wifi gratuita também (assisti vídeos por streaming sem travar). Tem uma boa academia e um lounge a céu aberto bem bacana. O atendimento ganhou pontos ao facilitar um early checkin, muito apreciado para quem chega de manhã cedo vindo do Brasil. Muito bom no geral!

title: Thank you Richard Gonzalez
text: The gentleman at the front desk, Richard, was the most helpful employee I've ever come across. He is a gem of this hotel. I will definitely revisit. The service at this hotel is excellent and more than accommodating. I would recommend to anyone looking to find a well located hotel in NY, especially if you require the highest level of service - they deliver. Thank you Richard!

title: Quick stay in the city
text: I loved this hotel! The room and bathroom were a good size. Everything was very clean! The bar is on the lobby level and is very pretty. There’s a restaurant on another floor too. Service was great! Everyone who worked there seemed to be happy to be there! My daughter loved the technology of the hotel. It takes a minute to get the elevators but then it’s no big deal! Highly recommend..... Great for Marriott members too with a club lounge during the week!

title: Amazing Hotel onsite restaurant lets it down
text:
We decided to spend my 50th Birthday in NYC as a Platinum member I was expecting an upgrade however a couple of my friends had contacted the hotel to inform them of my birthday, on arrival they thanked me for spending my birthday with them, told me I had an upgrade to a skyline view room ( Which was amazing) gave me a voucher to spend in the restaurant.  On entering my room there was a bottle of champagne, strawberries and macaroons, the staff were so welcoming.
As we had dinner plans for most of the time we were there we decided to use the  voucher for breakfast and I'm kind of glad we did...... my pancakes (when they arrived were lovely ) although falsely advertised, should have come with a fruit compote but was just fresh fruit but I could live with that ! 
My husband ordered an American breakfast I'm sure this was brought out to another diner about 20 minutes earlier as when my husband got it it was cold, they assured I him they would prepare him another ....... 5 minutes later it reappeared ! Not a fresh breakfast as promised but clearly had just been put under the grill...... and reheated, what I didn't tell them was my husband is a chef and cannot be fooled as some customers. 
 So although they didn't charge us any additional they did keep the $50 dollar voucher, but later a bottle of wine turned up in our room ....... I would rather have enjoyed breakfast ....... 
I wouldn't say this spoilt our stay but I would certainly mention to friends about the restaurant,

title: Beautiful hotel
text: The rooms in this hotel are beautiful, really modern and clean.  The bed is so comfy and the bathroom was lovely.  The staff were nice and the location was brilliant.  You were close to Times Square, but you weren't so close that it kept us up at night from the noise.

title: Excellent Location
text: This was my first visit to New York and I felt that this hotel was a great jumping off point for exploring the city.  It was fun to have Times Square just a few blocks away and the coffee shop next door was great for my morning coffee.  We were on the 31st floor and the view was wonderful.  The rooms were spacious and house keeping did an excellent job.  The lobby is a little goofy if you are meeting friends since it is on the 6th floor so we usually met on street level.  The door men were always friendly and eager to help.  I would recommend this hotel to friends visiting New York.

title: Wouldn't recommend
text:
Have been pleased with prior stays at other Renaissance properties but this one left us completely disappointed. While the location was good the room was extremely small and we did not get any sleep during our stay due to the constant noise from the street.
We were on a reasonably high floor so it is most likely even worse on lower floors. May as well if slept on the street as there did not appear to be any double glazing to keep the noise out.
There are much better properties in NY for the price. Would definitely not recommend.

title: Great Hotel. Great Location.
text:
Stayed one Friday night after a week long business trip as a base for some shopping in Manhattan before heading home - this place didn't disappoint

Have stayed in several spots in NYC on similar visits and this place gets the nod as the best of the lot.

Location wise its superb. Caught the train into Penn (its about a 10 minute walk if you want from Grand Central) and it was a few minutes stroll away. Its across 7th avenue from Macys and next to the herlad sq subway and Penn st as mentioned - a walk to central park is about 15 minutes. 

When I figured out where the lobby was (a sign mightn't be a bad idea?) I worked out the lifts and got to check in. Although I was early (2pm) I was checked in without any drama. I was given a room with 2 twins beds even though I pointed out I was alone and they could have shoved me somewhere smaller. 

The room was great! 2 really comfy queen beds, lots of space, great bathroom and the view of 35th st which just oozed New York. Room is contemporary, no false ceiling so you are staring up and solid concrete which some may not like but I thought added to the place. Good TV, plenty of glasses etc for a refreshment and a mini fridge to use - everything you could ask for. One other huge plus it had for me was the USB charging points in the beside lights - too often I complain about having to charge the phone overnight in the far side of the room but not such issues here - loads of charging points (this may sound frivolous but a big plus for me)

The bathroom as mentioned was bright, roomy and plenty of towels but the toiletries deserve a special mention - some sort of minty shower gel which was surprisingly great :-)

I had dinner in Rocky O'Reillys which was packed. Food was ok - nothing great and the lighting not great for reading the menus but the atmosphere here is hopping. Expensive and average quality wise but well worth a trip.  I also had breakfast here as I wanted to watch an early morning soccer match and they couldn't have been nicer. Breakfast was reasonable value but taste wise was superb.

I requested late check out and was given a stay until 1 which was really appreciated. When I did check out I left he bags with the bell hop on the ground floor for the few hours I had left. He also organised a car service to take me to JFK (and helped me find my luggage key later when I dropped it!). Really great service here. 

5 stars for this place in my view. Service, quality, location, value - its got it all and really couldn't find any reason not to give it 5. Will definitely come back if the price is right on future trips.

title: Great stay, excellent by Manhatten standards
text:
I just completed a week long business trip staying here on L33.

Checkin was OK, hotel is nice and recommended.

Breakfast at the weekend was good.

Lounge was so-so

Room comfortable and house cleaning excellent.

One of my best stays in NYC and price was very competitive

title: Lovely hotel with some kinks to work out
text:
Myself and my ten yr old son stayed here for four nights to do some sightseeing. 

Overall the hotel is well positioned on 35th or 34th (it has dual entrances) and between 7th and 8th Avenue. Close to Macy’s, 3x Starbucks, the Manhattan Mall and the Empire State Building. It’s v close to Penn station which had many of the subway lines coming in and out. 

Check-in: this was a disaster for us. We arrived at 1.30pm having requested an early check in and went back numerous times after it was promised our room would be “30 minutes”, and “before 4”. We were exhausted by the time we got our room at 4.10pm. Luckily I am a Marriott Gold member and we went into the lounge for some refreshments while we waited. The team also stored our luggage so we had less to carry round. 

Lifts: the lifts were quite self explanatory... we did experience one day of problems which caused delays. 

Room: we had a twin room with two comfy queen beds. The room was well decorated and had a decent bathroom and wardrobe, safe, fridge etc. There was not much vacant floor space however to put your suitcase down! There were some niggles with the room such as the tap in the shower had been put on back to front so trying to turn to a rain shower squirted is with the hand held one. Additionally they had obviously put the sink taps on against usual users as the fixtures were v loose from being turned the wrong way frequently. I’ve seen some comments about the frosted door, however this did not present us with any concerns during use. 

Food: we ate in rock & Reillys for lunch and breakfast. The food in general was good and I recommend the American breakfast and the burger. I don’t recommend the mac & cheese - too creamy! 

We also used the lounge for breakfast and drinks etc. They only serve food in the lounge during the week (not at weekends). The range of drinks available at all times was good. I’d like them to also offer fruit in line with other lounges from Marriott. The breakfast was generally nice with a selection of hot, pastries, bagels, fruit and other bits and bobs. The fruit selection was disappointing though with the same fruit salad choice every day. The snacks served in the evening were also nice. They were generally meat, cheese, salad etc. You could had dinner in there most nights with the selection available. The only downside of the lounge was it’s location, it was too visible, and there was not a door person like in the Marriott East Side. I felt that pretty much every time we used it there were people hovering to follow you in once the door was open, they didn’t appear to have access themselves. 

We also tried the room service which was disappointing. One night we were just too tired to move, however the choice was too fussy for my son and I didn’t find that anything jumped out at me as being exactly what I wanted to eat.

Staff: bell staff were super friendly and helpful... great! The front desk staff were friendly but often sounded unsure or a bit vague. We did have a few problems with housekeeping who only did a partial clean two of the three days without removing plates, cups, etc.

title: Good hotel.....best bell desk in NYC!
text: Visiting NYC for a long weekend.  Recommended by a friend for its central location and they were right. As many have mentioned it's next door to Macy's and Penn station. Also, easy if you need to catch the F train to 5th....literally a few stops! The room was good - didn't love the shower....a lack of water pressure but other than that not too bad. Now on to the bell desk....while the service generally in the hotel was satisfactory given the design and layout of the hotel the bell desk is effectively the front desk. You do not encounter reception / concierge / check in desk unless you specifically go to the 6th floor. All the risk of client service falls on the bell desk. These guys are super!! Richard 'Richie Rich' and Justin and the team provide the face of the hotel! Knowledgeable, efficient, quick, helpful! They are the real 5 star concierge! As an example one evening we wanted a taxi... I asked Richard where the best place to catch one was....he went out and disappeared around the corner...next thing he has got a taxi for us and told the driver where to go. Justin new the quickest way to get to anywhere and organised our car back to the airport with every detail sorted. Now you may think these things are run of the mill.......But when they go wrong it changes the perception of the hotel and your stay. These guys never missed a beat and were polite, courteous and friendly. Well done guys....true VIP service!

title: Perfect Weekend Getaway
text:
It was my wife's first time in NYC for her birthday and the Renaissance NY Midtown Hotel provided the basis for a weekend that she'll never forget.  I reached out to management prior to our stay and they were very responsive and upgraded us to a Skyline room.  Upon our arrival, our room wasn't ready, understandable since we arrived at 10AM, but found out we were upgraded to a Skyline Balcony (I am Platinum)...AMAZING VIEW!!!  

I can't wait to stay here again since we have an office literally next door.

Pros:
- Location, location, location.  Right by office, right next to Penn Station, right next to Macy's,  You can also enter from 35th or 34th which is big plus especially on our last day there when it non-stopped rain.
- Rock-n-Reilly's is a great bar and restaurant option attached to the hotel
- Planet Fitness is the workout facility, we used it several times and beats your normal hotel gym by leaps and bounds.
- Rooms - Clean and modern and for us a wonderful balcony skyline view facing South and East.

Cons:
- Elevator - As most have mentioned, the elevator situations is a little strange but once you understand how the system works, it's a no brainer.  You'll find that once you do pick it up you start educating others that have seen it for the first time.  We didn't find our waits too long and expected some delay with a hotel where the primary floor is on the 6th and a restaurant on the 5th.  

Overall this hotel is excellent and highly recommend it for personal and business.

title: Elevator Anxiety
text: First thing to know: only the bellhop is at the entry level. The lobby is on an upper floor. The elevator routine is designed for strict security but I found it somewhat complicated and not user-friendly. The decor is post-modern/industrial/stark and “cold.” If this is what you like, go for it. The room was clean and bed comfy but the single desk chair was very hard. The modern bathroom was beautiful. I would not go there solo again but with a companion it might be more comfortable.

title: Smart choice with great vibe
text:
A great vibe at this hotel with decor and style paying homage to the Garment District and world of fashion. It also has a beautiful bar and a good restaurant on site. 

If you have access to the Club Lounge it is worth it - fabulous appetizers in the evening and plenty for breakfast in the morning.definitely not a Residence Inn pre-packaged food deal! 

The rooms are surprisingly all the same size. Small but incredibly well thought out and with beautiful bathroom -if you like bathroom privacy be aware that they follow the new trend of a glass wall between the bedroom and bathroom - it is partially frosted and their is a blind you can close to gain privacy.

title: Trendy hotel - excellent location
text:
Modern, trendy, boutique hotel with a great vibe.  My second stay at this one.  Great location in the city.  Close to Penn Station & MSG (3 mins walk) and easy access to subway.  There's a Starbucks on corner outside hotel.

You arrive on ground floor (bellman on ground level), go up to 6th floor for check in.  

Very friendly welcome on arrival.  Nice trendy lobby area with large bar off to the left - massive windows, lots of casual comfy seating.  Reception was buzzing with life.  Fun place to hang out.  The Marriott Lounge for members is also just off reception and one of the nicest I can remember for atmosphere and decor.  It had the usual selection of drinks, (plus some bottled waters you don't see in all Marriott Lounges) and a good nibble selection on display - enjoyed the samosas.  Again, a very comfy area to sit and relax, with big windows, so plenty of daylight.  Breakfast buffet for members in that room was very good too.  (We stayed on a mid week night - may be different offerings at the weekend).

We booked a midtown standard King room.  Decent size, big floor to ceiling windows.  Roller blind for privacy and second blind for blackout.  Comfy bed, clean white bedding.  Big chair to sit in with small table so you can look out at the view, plus desk and swivel chair and a long foot stool.  We had a great view from only the 15th floor over to MSG looking downtown.  Imagine higher up would be even nicer.  Room had a few items that were there for interest as a nice touch (model ceramic sewing machine and button). Aircon was efficient and not noisy - an added bonus!

Wardrobe with light, ironing board, full length mirror, fridge and 'pull out drawer' safe.  Not much room to unpack if you have lots of clothes for a weeks trip (no chest of drawers), but fine for an overnighter or long weekend.  Bathroom a good size.  Clean, white and bright with Aveda amenities (shower gel/handwash, shampoo, conditioner) and rain shower.  Shower, with sliding frosted door, was really big.  The glass wall from bathroom to the bedroom is frosted but there is a pull down blind for privacy - in case your sharing the room with a friend!  Plenty of room to store stuff in the bathroom by the sink and underneath.

Liked the changing projections on the walls in the foyer and lobby.  Offered great flexibility for changing the atmosphere, rather than the standard framed pictures.  I liked the way the elevators open out onto each floor and you see straight into that level.  So we saw the restaurant on 5th (Irish Pub) and also the Gym (on 2nd?).  It looked massive with lots of equipment.

Elevators are a bit weird until you get used to them.  You have to pay attention or you miss the screen saying which elevator to go up in and the doors shut really fast.   But you do need a key to go beyond the 6th floor - good for security if a lone traveller.

Only thing I didn't like - the exposed cement ceiling in the bedroom. I didn't mind in the corridors and other communal areas, but would have preferred, in the bedroom for it to have been sealed off with a shiny finish or maybe a trendy blueprint design on it, rather than just exposed grey concrete. Purely personal observation.  Overall I liked the room.  Would definitely stay again.

title: Nonworking elevators and luggage problem
text: Luggage is checked on the ground floor.  The hotel lobby is on the 6th floor.  There are 4 elevators, 2 of which were not working. Receptionist took my luggage ticket and said bags would be delivered to my room on the 15th floor. After seeing our room, my daughter and I went to the hotel restaurant on the 5th floor using the stairs because of the backup at the elevators.  Upon return to our room an hour later, using the stairs, no luggage.  Called the desk and was told the bellhop would be delivering. Within 5 minutes I received a call and was asked to describe my luggage.  It was suggested that I go to the ground level to find it and using the stairs would probably be quicker than waiting for an elevator. We walked fifteen flights of stairs, went into a storage room and retrieved our bags.  Waited 15+ minutes for an elevator to return to our room. Stressful because we had dinner reservations in another part of town in less than 2 hours when this all began.  If you have plenty of time and love to do stairs, go for it.

title: Top spot for NY leisure visit
text: Renaissance Hotel on 35th St is VERY conveniently placed for access to most Metro lines (thereby giving access to all tourist icons) and Penn Station. This is a quality hotel providing excellent friendly service at a reasonable price by New York standards. No hesitation to visit again!

title: Great stay
text: Friendly staff, clean and great location and quite. Rooms are also really big with a great bathroom and bath. I would recommend this place and stay here again.The only thing we noticed was there was no fridge in our room.

title: Ottimo
text: Posizione ideale a fianco del Madison Square Garden , all'Empire State Building e ai grandi magazzini Macy's . Pulito, raffinato e arredato con cura. Personale gentile . Lo consiglio vivamente. Ottimo punto di partenza per scoprire la città. Non abbiamo provato la colazione in hotel e nemmeno il ristorante.

title: Great Stay
text: Tried this hotel in midtown.  It was exceptional.  Prior to arriving received emails from Natacha DeFrank, Manager to arrange arrival and any needed reservations.  Room was really nice and trendy.  I never got the name of the bartender just off the reception area but he was fantastic.  Great location in midtown.  Will definitely stay again

title: Comfortable Hotel for Business Travel
text: Comfortable hotel for a business traveler.  I appreciated the Aveda bath products and the modern decor.  I was impressed with the room service -reasonable room services prices, fresh high quality food.  Great location and great service.  I would recommend this hotel.

title: Nice enough hotel, very annoying elevators
text:
Yeah, weird right? To complain about elevators? The hotel is nice, friendly service, good location but I'd rate this a full star higher if they had normal elevators. They have this slow and painful external of elevators system that probably sounded great on paper but just suck. I wasn't the only one making this comment. If I had read a review like this that prepared me for elevator annoyance I feel I would've been ok with it so, here you go lol 

Ps, the pic is cool because we invited a bunch of our students

title: great stay!
text: Very comfortable room, and a very nice staff.  The room was nicely appointed, Aveda bath products, comfortable bed.  Front desk and lobby bar staff were great.  The hotel is conveniently located in midtown.

title: Modern, quiet and great location
text:
