This is a fairly new hotel just south of Time Square.  Loved the decor in the lobby and in the restaurant/bar on the 5th floor.  Much of the seating is outside, but there's a retractable roof should it rain.  The food and service were excellent in the restaurant.  The breakfast buffet is kinda pricey at $25.00, but it was tasty.

The room was clean and modern with a nice king bed.  Not a ton of storage space other than the closet.  No drawers to store stuff.  The bathroom was modern with a glassed-in shower.  Everything worked great.

Two minor gripes.  Our room was not ready by 4pm check in.  After a long day of travel, we arrived around 2:45 hoping to crash in our room.  So it was kind of a long wait, and then at 4pm, the room still wasn't ready.  They were nice about it but it squeezed us on our evening plans.

Secondly, the elevator system is a little wacky.  You have to swipe your card then pick your floor OUTSIDE the elevator, then watch the monitor to see which elevator would take you to your floor.  A bit of a learning curve, but we figured it out.

The location on the west side is walkable to lots things in NY, and is a short block from the Penn Station subway station.

Staff was VERY friendly and helpful at all times.  Overall, we were quite pleased with our stay.

title: NYC VACATION
text: Second time to stay here in about a year.  It is starting to show some wear, but it remains a great hotel located in an area with easy access to all the sights.  One word of caution, we booked transportation to our cruise port through the bellmen.  They quoted us a price of $65, but when we arrived at the port the driver charged us $120.  Make sure you confirm the price with the driver before you leave the hotel.

title: Beautiful views
text: I really enjoyed staying here.The views are spectacular and they have very friendly staff also.You will be right in the center of everything in Manhattan with great restaurants and shops in walking distance.

title: Stellar
text:
Everything about this hotel is amazing, from the Staff, rooms, and restaurants. We spent 3 night here and almost didn't want to get out of the bed cause it was so comfy. Nice large room, with a view of MSG and 7th Ave.

The Breakfast buffet was complimentary and much appreciated. Nice way to start the day before walking the streets of Manhattan.

I would recommend this hotel to my friends and family. Well done Renaissance.

title: Valet Ruined the whole experience - New Hotel Alert
text:
Location:  If you are looking to be near the Theater District but don't want to be in Times Sq this is a great option.  You are about 12 blocks away from all of the Theaters as well as close to things like the Chelsea Market.  Nothing immediately great around as far as restaurants.

Hotel:  This is a fairly new hotel and it shows that way.  They did a nice job in the design and finishes.  You arrive at the main level but need to go to the 6th floor to check in.  Beautiful check in area, nice 5th floor restaurant.

Rooms:  Very nicely appointed with high end finishes.  Very comfortable bed and good sized rooms.  The bathrooms are a good size with great shower area.  Heating/cooling worked as it should.

Price:  Around $330 all in.  The restaurant was pretty overpriced, especially for breakfast, even for NYC standards.  

Service:  Decent service as they brought extra pillows fairly quickly.

Biggest issue:  If you valet, at $55 a night, you need to give them 1 hour to get your car and it will take 1 hour.  Our valet took a little over an hour and then when he finally showed up he was on his cell phone driving my car.  When I asked for the keys because he was sitting in my driver's seat, he seemed annoyed that I was interrupted his phone call.  Horrible.

Overall:  Because of the cleanliness of the hotel I will probably try it again but I was not happy about the valet situation.  It was just ridiculous.

title: Location, Location, Location
text: Arrived at 10AM on a Wednesday, and although I asked for early check-in, it was not available.  The newly renovated hotel is very pleasing. We enjoyed listening to open-mic night in the lobby/bar area and then enjoying an afternoon cocktail in the rooftop bar.  Our room was a typical NYC room, however, it had a nice size bathroom with large rain shower.  The room was clean and bed was comfortable.

title: Gutes Hotel an zentraler Lage
text: Das Hotel ist an zentraler Lage, praktisch neben der Penn Station und dem Empire State Building, unweiter der U-Bahnlinien A,C,E und 1,2,3; aber auch die B,D,F,M und N,Q,R,W U-Bahnstationen sind unweit. Der Time Square ist gut zu Fuss erreichbar. Das Hotel stellt „Free WIFI“ zur Verfügung. Wir hatten ein Zimmer im 18. OG mit 2 Queen-size Betten die sehr bequem waren und wir gut darin schlafen konnten. Unser Zimmer war sehr sauber und hatte einen Save. Die Lobby ist im 6. OG. Das Hotel verfügt auch über ein sehr gutes Restaurant mit Terrasse das sich im 5. OG befindet. Mit der Schlüsselkarte gelangt man in die Obergeschosse zu den Zimmern.

title: Wonderful 2 Night Stay in Great Location
text:
My husband & I decided to extend our cruise from Liberty with a short stay in NYC.  The Renaissance was the perfect choice.  It was our first time at this hotel as we usually stay near Bryant Park.  The room was large and most comfortable.  A great perk is the onsite restaurant Rock & Reilly's.  It's a lively rooptop setting with superior food.  Great service as well.  So after a long day, it was the perfect location and not at all what we had expected.  
The Club floor closed rather early and didn't have a great selection, but i would definitely stay here again!

title: Friendly staff and great rooms
text: My husband and I have stayed at this property twice in the past two months and both times have been great. The staff is very friendly, the location is great and the rooms feel new. The lounge for members is also always stocked with water and other beverages.

title: A wonderful 5N stay in NY!
text:
Hotel room is modern, clean, and has standing shower. Tip: top up a little for the higher floor. Is worth it!

Location is fantastic; 3-4mins walk to the Penn station.

All staffs at this hotel are very friendly and helpful, especially so for the crew and concerige on the ground floor.

title: Great Location & Service
text: Thanks to Justin Ellison & staff for their professionalism, cheerfulness & great recommendations. Accommodation were good but the staff service & helpfulness for getting around town & helpful short cuts were super. A better Marriott experience for the City & location to explore From DUMBO to Upper East Side would be hard to find!

title: Lots of potential
text:
While in New York for business, I had the opportunity to stay at the Renaissance New York Midtown Hotel. While there is lots of potential here, and lots to like about the property, a few drawbacks lowered my opinon of this hotel. 

First, the hotel is new, and the design is modern yet comfortable. Everywhere from the lobby, to the lobby bar to the expansive outdoor bar was spacious, well designed and had a nice look and feel to it.

When I entered my room (#1506), I was impressed by the size, the spacious bathroom and the well-thought out design. There was ample lighting in the room, there were plugs/USB ports bedside. The bathroom had a nice rainshower and glass enclosed shower. 

Unfortunately, when I first arrived in the room, there was a very large clump of blond hair in the shower. I'm not sure how housekeeping could have missed this, but it immediately made me wonder what else was overlooked during cleaning.

The next morning I ordered room service for breakfast. I left the tray in my room and while the room was cleaned, the tray was not removed--for 2 days. Again, this is just lazy and I'm not even sure how it was overlooked.

On Thursday morning, I was extremely upset to be awoken by VERY loud drilling right above me. I understand that hotels must take on projects throughout the day to keep the property functioning and looking great. However, at no time should very loud and disruptive projects be started at 7:30am. 

I wanted to like this hotel, and there are several great things to like, but ultimately questionable cleanliness would keep me from returning.

title: Best Hotel in NYC
text:
We had an awesome stay at Renaissance Midtown Hotel. Actually, everything was perfect. First of all, the location is great. You can reach everything really easily & quickly and are already in the centre of Midtown Manhatten.

The hotel itself looks great and has a nice, modern style. All the employees are friendly & helpful. We booked a city view room and didn't regret it. There is nothing better than waking up & getting asleep with New York's skyline right in front of you.

If you stay there you should for sure check out the small bagel shop next to the hotel - it's called "New York's best bagels" - true dat!

We can't wait to come back to Renaissance Midtown!

title: LOVED this place.
text: Stayed here for two night using Marriott points and loved it. Room had two queen beds and was large for NYC hotel room. Had a great view looking south down Manhattan. Beds were very comfortable and we slept well. Bathroom was decent size and had rain style shower which was nice. Location here is ideal, just a few blocks and a 10 minute walk from Broadway and Times Square areas. Very quiet (relatively) around the hotel. Service and staff were excellent. GREAT choice in NYC.

title: Increíble
text:
El hotel es impresionante. Todo muy lujoso, al detalle, limpio y muy buena atención. Cuando bajábamos a desayunar al restaurante del hotel la atención no podría haber sido mejor, nos ofrecían mucha variedad, y en mi caso que soy intolerante a la lactosa disponían de leche de soja. 
La única pega que puedo poner son los ascensores, que tardan un poquito en venir, pero salvo eso todo genial. La ubicación es perfecta ya que estás justo al lado de times square pero sin tanto alboroto. 
Lo recomiendo sin duda y repetiré!!

title: Great Stay
text:
We arrived late Friday evening and were greeted and checked in extremely fast. We were told the club lounge would not be open (we are Marriott elite) over the weekend so we were offered free breakfast passes at the restaurant downstairs for Saturday and Sunday. We were able to take some drinks from the club lounge to keep in our room refrigerator for the weekend and enjoy the nice breakfast. 

Hotel is super close to all the attractions and we walked almost everywhere. It’s convenient to subway as well. 

The views from the 38th floor were amazing- worth the upgrade to skyline view. 

My only complaint was that our window shade often got stuck- you had to use a chain to pull the shade up or down. On our second night, the chain broke. Hotel staff was extremely quick to send up maintenance to fix and we did not have any other issues. 

We will definitely be staying here again!

title: Shockingly Great Stay
text:
I come to NY on an increasingly frequent basis - four times in the last six weeks. Over the past two decades I have stayed in many hotels in the city and never fund a "home hotel" like I have in many cities such as the Ritz Carltons in Osaka, Chengdu and Seoul, the Westin Bund in Shanghai, the Shangri-La in Bangkok. 

This was my first stay at the Renaissance Midtown I read a few nice things about the property online but was not overly optimistic before I arrived. When I checked out on Friday I told Ariel at the front desk that I had far and away the best experience I have ever had in a New York hotel. Great modern room, fantastic view, friendly & attentive  staff, club lounge with a lot of complimentary food options  at happy hour and a nice breakfast. Access to a quality gym and fast internet. A truly great stay worthy of a great city. Thank you - I will be back soon.

title: Lovely Modern Hotel
text: This is a lovely hotel, bright modern and very clean.  Staff friendly and helpful.  Our room was on 28th floor, I had asked for a high floor so I was pleased to be on the 28th which had good views.  The outdoor bar, Rockin Reilly's is tastefully furnished and plenty of space, however it is a bit pricey.  Penn station is only 3 or 4 mins walk. There are several coffee shops within 1 min walk inc. Starbucks. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

title: A rare sense of accountability
text:
I type this review as I stay at this hotel. I am a frequent guest, essentially because of the hotel's convenience to my place of worm but also because it's a very new hotel with high quality furnishings. But where this hotel truly stands out is service - the front desk is always a welcoming place for a returning guest at this hotel. 

Where this hotel really went over and above was when I misplaced my apple headphones during a previous stay. The box was found, but not the buds. The front office supervisor, Natascha, not only took responsibility to find them but when she couldn't she arranged for a pair to be bought and delivered to my room. I think that sort of gesture is rare and needs to be recognized, but it's also the overall culture of a Hotel's work ethic that cultivates such an environment. 

My congratulations to the leadership of this property as well as Natascha personally, for creating a profound and rare environment of hospitality, and truly setting the standard.

title: Excellent modern hotel in the heart of NYC
text:
With all of the Marriott properties in NYC, I frequently find myself bouncing from property to property. As soon as I find one that I think will stick, it's on to the next for a variety of reasons. That said, I really do hope to be returning to the Renaissance Midtown on all of my frequent business trips to NYC. 

First of all, the location, with an entrance directly across the street from the northerly entrance/exit of Penn Station is difficult to beat. Despite this central location, the hotel is quiet. I, for one, am a fan of the lobby being up on the 6th floor as I think it creates necessary separation from the hustle and bustle of the street. 

I arrived fairly early with a numbers of my colleagues as we had just taken the train in from Boston. All of us have some level of elite status with Marriott and were given rooms ahead of check-in time. Nate, the front desk supervisor, was friendly and put me in a really nice upgraded city view room. Marta, another front desk agent, was also very warm and welcoming. 

As a new hotel, it is in great shape. Beyond being in great shape, it has a lot of touches I have not seen before in a Marriott. All of the walls on the first floor have digital projections that change through the course of the day. Many of the interior walls, both hallways and in the rooms, have exposed concrete. While small (although fine by NYC standards), I found the room to be laid out very well and had some unique touches to it (such as an old fashioned sewing machine for decoration). Other than the normal NYC street noise, the room was quiet and clean. It offered me a great night sleep both nights. 

The Club Lounge was definitely a highlight. I've been in countless lounges and the beverage selection in here was definitely in the top two or three of those I have seen. Very few lounges offer Perrier and San Pellegrino in addition to the normal selections.

As others have said, the hotel has Rock & Reilly inside, I really enjoyed the food for lunch and thought the service was solid. 

I also was glad to take advantage of the Planet Fitness that is on the lower levels of the hotel building. While crowded, I had no problem using the equipment I wanted to. I know a management response previously addressed the lack of water and towel service so I do hope that gets figured out as my only frustration was having to go back to the hotel to get some water to avoid paying for it at PF. Also, note, don't plan on leaving your ID in the room as they require it for access.

I'm looking forward to my return stay in less than 3 weeks!

title: Super Hotel direkt am Madison Square Garden
text: Super Hotel direkt am Madison Square Garden / Penn Station. War zum zweiten mal für eine Woche in diesem Hotel sehr modern und geschmackvoll eingerichtete Zimmer. Tolle rooftop Bar. Personal absolut perfekt von der Rezeption bis zum Zimmermädchen. Im Hotel befindet sich das Restaurant Rock and Reillys.

title: Nice place to Stay near MSG, Macy's and TImes Square
text: My wife and I took in a Bruno Mars concert this weekend for her birthday celebration and stayed here for the first time.  We will be back.  The hotel was sold out and we checked in at 4. They needed more time to clean our room and called us about 30 minutes later to let us know our room was ready.  The hotel is very new and the room was nicely appointed.  I have to give Kudos to the front desk team.  Rada made sure to send up some beverages for my wife's birthday and that was not expected but very much appreciated. Ranie and Marta were also outstanding in answering our questions and taking care of us for check in.  We walked to Times Square for dinner and that only took about 15 minutes.  The great location also put us right near MSG, Macy's and TImes Square. Our walk to MSG was less then 10 minutes.  If you are going to a show or event at MSG I would highly recommend this location for convenience.  I would also recommend it for its great staff and because it is new.

title: Nice staff, small rooms
text: Really close to Penn Station which is why we stayed here. (Admittedly, not my first choice, but only because I'm partial to Le Méridien.) The receptionist was awesome and made my daughter feel very welcome. The elevators are pretty strange, and the rooms are small. Granted, it's NYC, but still. We left our luggage at the bottom with the concierge/security and had no problems. If you need to be near Penn Station, the Renaissance is a solid choice.

title: Not bad but not my first choice
text: We were in town for a Yankee game.  The hotel is in a great location but not my favorite hotel.  It is convenient to Macys and the Empire State building.  We were disappointed that the executive lounge contained little of the amenities we've come to expect.  All that was available on the weekend was soda and water - not even coffee.  Rooms were ok - on the small side but comfortable.  We had a nice view from the 31st floor.

title: Excellent hotel in a super location
text:
My family and I spent 2 days in NY at this hotel and had a fantastic time. It is perfectly located, walking distance to the Empire State building and Times Square. The rooms are well appointed and room cleaning is early and well done. The best thing is the
restaurant and bar. The food is amazing and the bar hums with life and occasional bands. The staff at reception are friendly and efficient. I would recommend any visitor to NY to stay here.

title: Great hotel in a very convenient location
text: My first time at the Renaissance Midtown hotel - it's only 1 year old. The rooms are very nice, although a bit on the smaller side (not surprising for a midtown hotel). Decor is modern and big flatscreen TV and king bed is very comfortable. The shower has a glass wall looking into the room - which is fine if you're alone - but not if you're with someone else. It's only 2 blocks from Penn Station - so it made it easy to commute to NJ for a morning meeting without having to fight traffic. The hotel shares a fitness center with Planet Fitness (on 2nd Fl). It was crowded with afterwork crowd at 6pm. Although there are many more machines than a typical hotel fitness center - it did not have the water, towels or WiFi connections that you typically get when it's part of the hotel.

title: Conforto e qualidade
text: Hotel novo, quartos apertados, porém bem decorados e banheiro grande. A torneira do banheiro estava quebrada e demorou alguns dias para ser consertada. O secador de cabelo queimou e também demorou dois dias para ser substituído. Tirando esses contratempos foi uma estada maravilhosa, funcionários da recepção extremamente gentis e solícitos, pois aguardavamos caixas de encomendas e todos os dias eles gentilmente verificavam se ja haviam chegado. Hotel bem localizado para quem gosta de ficar perto do agito.

title: Great stay
text:
Myself and my partner stayed at the Renaissance Midtown Hotel for 5 nights in Sept 2017.

Location
Excellent location. There are a variety of subway stations locatedd within very short walking distances outside the hotel. The hotel is also a 10/15 min walk from Times Square. The hotel is also within walking distance from a variety of restaurants and shops such as Macy's, Old Navy & Sephora.  Also the hotel is around 5 mins from Madison Square Garden.

Room
We were kindly upgraded by Ranie to a city view room. Room was a good size, clean and nice decorated. The bed was very comfortable and we enjoyed watching the variety of TV channels most evenings. The view from the room was okay, was faced with buildings which appeared to be offices. 

Food
There was a restaurant called Rock and Reily's located within the hotel. This served a buffet breakfast and a al la carte menu. Food is good and decently priced. I would recommend. 

Other
The massive downfall of this hotel was that there was no mini bar service. A fridge is provided however no drinks were inside not even water! I felt this was very inconvenient and I found myself very thirsty on many occasions, having forgotten to buy water whilst out. So if you're visiting be sure to stock up on drinks.

Overall 
We enjoyed our stay at this hotel and we would highly recommend. We would like to say a massive thank you to Mescha at the front desk. Thank you for your patience and your kind hearted nature, it was highly appreciated.

title: Moderno, novo e bem localizado
text: Uma excelente hotel na região midtown, ou seja, no meio da cidade. Fica quase na esquina da 7ª Avenida com a rua 35. Bem no meio do distrito da moda e dos restaurantes italianos. Ao lado do Madison Square Garden e em frente a loja Macy´s. O hotel é novo, possui bons quartos, excelente limpeza e um serviço de entregas de encomendas feitas online muito bom. Seu café da manhã servido no restaurante um andar abaixo da recepção tem um buffett muito bom(se puder inclua na reserva). O café do Executive lounge é bem pobre. Os andares mais altos possuem um vista fantástica, vale a pena pagar um pouco mais para ganhar um mirante particular. Wifi gratuito de alta velocidade e serviço de bellman para ajudar com as malas. O único defeito é o sistema de chamada de elevador, muito moderno, que demanda seu cartão-chave para acessar o seu andar, mas funciona muito lento, algumas vezes chega a irritar. No geral, se a reserva for feita com alguns meses de antecedência, consegue-se uma tarifa que é quase metade do preço, com excelente custo benefício. A linha azul ACE do metrô fica a menos de 5 minutos de caminhada, a linha amarela NQRW fica a menos de 10 minutos de caminhada.

title: Fabuleux !!!
text:
Superbe hôtel, chambres spacieuses avec vue superbe sur New Yok. Proximité de Times Square, très central. Mobilier neuf, chambres parfaitement entretenues, lit king size confort absolu. Personnel de ménage top : le doudou était chaque jour rangé sur le lit de manière différente et originale ;) nous avons apprécié ce clin d'oeil humoristique. Les autres personnels de l'hôtel sont tout aussi à l'écoute.
Ce fut un vrai bonheur et nous avons hâte de revenir !

title: Perfect!
text: Very nice hotel!  Upgraded to a high floor city view room. Room was very chic and modern and very clean. Very nice shower and comfortable bed. Enjoyed the rooftop bar on the 5th floor.  The elevators take a little getting used to as you select your room before getting on the elevator and can't make changes while on the elevator.

title: Service can't be beat! Awesome Location! Above and Beyond Expectations
text:
We stayed at the Renaissance NY Midtown for 4 nights from 9/6 to 9/10, 2017.  We couldn't possibly be any more pleased with our stay.   From the second we entered the hotel, we were greeted by smiling, eager to please staff.  Our room was very nice, with a super city view.  It was not huge, but I don't expect a NYC room to be huge unless I spring for a suite, and we didn't.  It had plenty of room for my husband and I (and quite honestly, we weren't there to spend time in our room!)   The room was SUPER clean, modern, and everything was new and worked well (including the iron, hair dryer, and other small appliances). The rain showerhead was fantastic. 

Our room was made up promptly each day, and we received extra towels, as requested. 

We had a nice meal in the hotel restaurant--not a gourmet meal, but very good, served promptly, and at a reasonable NYC cost. 

The location of the hotel is fantastic.  We had tickets to see Eric Clapton at Madison Square Garden for two concerts. It was less than a 5-minute walk, so no hassle with getting a cab or train after the show.   It's an easy walk to Times Square and MoMA. We took a cab to Central Park and then visited the Guggenheim and Museum of Natural History and actually walked back to the hotel, stopping to eat around Times Square on our way back.  It was a good stretch of the legs, but do-able for two out of shape folks who are not used to walking very much.  We also took a short cab ride to Greenwich Village.  The hotel is located in midtown, so it's not far to anything.  Much better than staying on one side of town and having to take a long cab ride to get anywhere.  

There is a fabulous place right across from the main entrance to the hotel that came in second place for the best bagels in NYC, and I can't believe they didn't come in first! The bagels and croissants were excellent. You can get coffee, sandwiches, etc. for breakfast and lunch.  The line may look long, but don't let that fool you--they move everyone through quickly.  

Instead of flying in and having to pay a huge cab fare to get into the city from the airport, we took the Amtrak train into Penn Station. We came out onto 34th Street, about a block from the hotel!  No need for cabs, again. 

I can honestly say that this was one of the most relaxing trips we've had, and a lot of it was due to the location of the hotel, the absolutely fantastic and attentive staff, and the hotel amenities.  We loved it and will definitely be back.  I can't imagine anyone not enjoying their stay here, but then you just can't please some people!  We've stayed at the Ritz and other "five star" hotels and have had crappy service, old rooms, and lousy locations in town.  This place might not be five-star, but it beats all the five-star places we've stayed in recently! We'll be staying here every time we're in town and will recommend it to all our friends!

title: Gorgeous Hotel with Great Service for our Family Trip to NYC
text:
Recently stayed at the Renaissance Mid Town with my husband and son for a fun weekend in NYC. First, the hotel is stunning and the staff go out of their way to ensure your needs are met. Their club lounge is accessible 24 hrs a day so you are always able to nip in and grab a water, juice or yogurt. They have a great bar scene, gorgeous city views from your room, and a lovely outdoor patio/bar. 

The only downside for me was that we had to deal with tons of traffic when hopping in cabs to get around the city but if you take the train you are steps away from Penn Station and MSG. Also I was forced to change my son's diaper on the floor in the women's restroom since they did not have a changing table/flat surface I could use in the lobby restroom.

title: Try somewhere else
text:
From the moment I got out of my car and my wife and I were not helped with our luggage I knew I was in for a bad time 
Bad meal in the restaurant downstairs  ( at least they comp it) to being out all day Sunday to come back at 430 and not have room cleaned and be told I had sign on door figured we had enough
Had 13 nights booked here but canceled and moved. 
This hotel is NOT recommended 
I'm a Marriott platinum member so that should say something

title: Fantastic staff and hotel at a quiet but in centre
text: I think the begining was excellent with Joshua doing everything to the T with his great attitude while he checked us in, the housekeeper in my room 3307 during my stay was wonderful with room service and the elevator system is superb. Close to many excellent breakfast places like bagel and coffee, Macys and time square which is like few minutes walk. Room with skyline view is to die for...over all I would say a great choice for families or anyone alone

title: Perfect location in the heart of Manhattan.
text: It's located a few blocks from Times Square, but it's good to be a little bit away from Time Square where it is not too. List and bright. The beds were very comfortable, the shower was pretty cool as it features a walk in shower where you don't have work worry about slipping when lifting a leg but I would still be careful of the marble flooring. Overall, I most importantly felt safe and comfortable here.

title: Awesome!
text: We stayed at Renaissance Hotel over Labor Day weekend and were totally impressed.  The customer service was amazing.  The staff at front desk called us by names by second day. Every employee went out of their way to be extremely helpful. The hotel is a wonderful oasis in the midst of busy area.  Walked from PennStation, subway around the corner.  Breakfast, which was included was delicious with wide variety of choices.  The rooms were very comfortable and I liked that you didn't have to walk far from elevator to get to room.  Will stay here again.

title: perfect location modern gem
text: this hotel has it all - well located great staff excellent gym right next door and very well equipped rooms - the only irritation is the lift system which can cause frustrations other than that i would highly recommend this for a new york stay

title: Midtown surprise
text: This is a great hotel.  Modern, great staff, cool bar and restaurant that has a delicious brunch / breakfast.  The rooms are a good size for NYC and fairly new.  This was a much better deal than the sister hotel Marriott east side from where I moved earlier.

title: Stylish, luxurious with great views of New York City
text: Amazing hotel in NYC with elegant rooms and amazing views of the city. The service is good and so is the food. We had a very comfortable stay. And it is close to all attractions like the Public Library, Times Square and tons of shopping spots.

title: Incredible Property - Incredible Staff!
text: We spent 3 nights at this incredible property and loved every minute of it! The hotel itself is beautiful, the location is pretty ideal, and the staff was great! We were given a great upgrade as a result of our status with Marriott - so we had a top notch room with a spectacular view. I want to give a special thanks to Joshua who saved the day (or the night really) when I had issues printing out our tickets to Hello Dolly - thanks to his advanced computer know-how -- we got to the show just in time! He displayed the type of professionalism and graciousness that the Renaissance and the Marriott should be proud of! Will definitely stay there again next time I'm in NYC!

title: Very Disappointed...
text:
My wife and I traveled to NYC for our 20th anniversary and did not leave the Renaissance Midtown with very many good things to say.

When we first check in, Sebastian asked us what brought us to their hotel.  When my wife said it was our 20th anniversary he looked at us and said, "Well, maybe you'll find something in your room when you return this evening."  Nothing was ever left, which really disappointed my wife.

We went down to have a drink at the hotel bar, but when my wife asked for a certain drink the waitress said the bartenders do not like to stray from the menu.  She did not ask for anything they did not have on hand.  The next night we went right to the bar and they had no problem making her drink.

When we checked out they said it would take about 30 minutes to get our car.  We received a call that it was out front an hour later, but it was not.  They said to contact the bellhop, but he was too busy talking to a girl.  When I finally asked for assistance he just laughed and told me it's coming.  Another 45 minutes passed before it arrived.

I am a Platinum Marriott member and have never had a bad experience at their hotels (and) I very rarely leave negative reviews, but seeing my wife's disappointment annoyed me.

On the plus side, Daniel the hotel concierge was very friendly and genuinely seemed to want to help, but I would think twice about staying at this location.

A 20-year anniversary is a special occasion and should be treated accordingly.  We didn't ask for anything, but when you offer something...follow through.

title: I can't recommend this hotel enough!!!
text: Spent 3 nights here in September 2017. It was the best hotel I've stayed in while visiting NYC. The design is outstanding and the rooms are great. The newly built hotel offers glass showers, marble bathroom floors and counters and an incredible view of the city. I've stayed in many downtown hotels, this is the only one I'm looking forward to returning to soon.

title: Fantastic Week Stay with Family
text: Was able to use points to stay here for a week. Upon early check-in, Marta was able to get us a room right away so we could rest for a few hours after our red-eye flight and we were upgraded to an amazing skyline view room. We chose this hotel since it was one of the few that had two queen bed rooms and it was well located. The room was indeed a very good size for our family of four and the location was very ideal for sightseeing (close to many subway lines and walkable to many main attractions). While the room had a closet, there were no drawers. Housekeeping was excellent and even left kind notes welcoming us. As this is a relatively new hotel, beds were comfortable and the shower had good water pressure. The hotel had a Club Lounge which offered weekday breakfast, evening snacks from Sun-Thurs, and a refrigerator filled with beverages any time of the day. On weekends, the hotels gave us vouchers for the breakfast buffet at Rock and Reilly's which was very good and ended at 11am. I wished the weekday breakfast at the lounge also extended to 11am vs. ending at 9am.  The modern elevators did enhance security, but they were a bit challenging to catch some times. The ground level staff was able to arrange car service back to JFK at a fixed rate. Overall, the staff and services at this hotel made our NY stay very enjoyable.

title: Great hotel, location
text:
Located perfectly next to Macy's and Penn Station. Great hotel, great service. Very clean and modern. The bell/valet service was excellent - a shout out to Richie. 

The hotel restaurant is just OK. It was very crowded and the music was blaring. The food is average but the outside area is great 

The club lounge was small but nicely serviced. Our only complaint was that breakfast was only served until 9. Way, way too early for vacationers. 

Rooms are big and clean - and quiet. The biggest issue is the bathroom. It's all glass. There is a privacy screen for the shower to the room but the bathroom door door is a piece of thin frosted glass which slides shut - there is a big gap and if you want modesty or privacy, this is not for you.

title: Great stay - Thank you Justin Ellison !
text:
I generally don't call out people in the headline section of a review, but Director of Guest Services, Justin Ellison, deserves a special shout out!

I'm a Marriott platinum guest - so I may be biased - but what a nice touch to receive a welcoming email several days in advance asking if there we had any special needs and to advise us of the various options available.  

We had asked for a slightly earlier check in and we're advised they would try to accommodate.  In addition, Justin suggested reservations for the rooftop bar area -

title: Modern & Stylish
text:
Absolutely wonderful hotel. Check-in was painless (special mention to Sebastian for excellent service) and the overall vibe of the place on entry was pleasant. The elevator system was peculiar but was easy enough to figure out. Our room was on the 18th floor next to the elevators but never had a problem with noise.

Room was a decent size, ample wardrobe space and great bathroom (great lighting too!). The style of the room is very chic, with a nice view across the city.

The one issue we had was hot water - we had maintenance check it out, who told us the valve had been switched off by housekeeping. Eventually got it working, but we found that the shower needed to be left running for 10 minutes every morning before we got hot water. Not too much of a issue, but not great if you're in a rush.

We tried the bar downstairs on the first night but wasn't too keen, it seems to be very popular with the locals and we found it hard to find a table. There are plenty of other bars in the local area to discover anyway.

The location is great for exploring Manhattan, just a block away from Penn Station, Macy's down the street and Times Square about 15 min walk away. I'd definitely stay here again.

title: Hi-Tech Midtown
text: As others have noted, this is a new hotel, and the elevators in particular are quite advanced.  There are no floor buttons inside the elevator.  You swipe your card at the elevator bank, pick your specific floor, and it will tell you which elevator will take you there.  Problem is, it often takes two or three swipes to access the system, and it seems unnecessarily complicated for what would otherwise be a simple trip.  The rooms are reasonably sized for Manhattan, and nicely laid out with a minimalist decor.  Opting for a city view room, there was a fine view of the Brooklyn Bridge. The midtown location was convenient, and the staff was uniformly helpful.  Reasonably priced (for New York), this is a fine option for a midtown stay.

title: Top notch customer service friendly staff. Beds were so comfortable
text: Located in busy midtown, however once you enter hotel , there is a sense of peace & serenity. Just like to shout a few employees who rock & display genuine care for their guest! Airelle, Guy &Richard!

title: Amazing night stay
text: I can't say enough about the hotel, staff, rooms, location, rooftop bar! The young ladies ranie, rhada and Ariel were so friendly and sweet. The doormen were so attentive every time and polite, shout out to guy. I was there for a concert at msg, which is 3 blocks away. Time square is .4 miles away. There is a Starbucks at the corner. Pubs at both ends of street and the rooftop bar is pretty darn cool(rock & reillys). Had midday drInks, lunch and breakfast there. Over all I was extremely satisfied with the hotel! Perfect little gem in the middle of what can be a chaotic big apple!! Will definitely return!!! Aidelisse

title: Professional and Welcoming
text:
We arrived at 11am and received a room right away. Lucked out as I wasn't expecting early check in. As a Gold Rewards Member they acknowledged it and gave me access to the lounge to grab water and yogurt. 

Allan in check-in was extremely welcoming, providing the breakfast vouchers for the restaurant below and welcome drinks & App. He also showed us how to use the elevator. It's a bit confusing the first time but after the first time it makes sense to have elevators like this.

Our room is typical for New York. Great view, comfortable bed and clean bathroom. 

The room had a smell of sweat when you turn off the AC. It wasn't very noticeable. Also the wood flooring appeared to be coming up and there was a rip in the blind. I'm usually a stickler for these things if they affect the quality of the stay but they were not. I didn't want to make a fuss about it so I did mention it at check out. Once I did say something the team was apologetic and they literally sent up housekeeping, and two engineers within 10mins.

That is incredible as I've stayed at various places around the world and this was the first time where they really care about the feedback you give. 

Overall, I would say the staff is a 10/10. They really educate their staff well and everyone seems to enjoy their job. Will definitely return going forward.

title: Great location for MSG
text: Took my son to NY for a concert at MSG. Wanted something close.  Great location. Cool restaurant and bar on 5th floor. Rooms are a decent size for the city. Would certainly come back but not would not say it's a 5 star.

title: Beautiful and Modern
text:
My family and I drove from ATL to Baltimore MD for a family reunion and we decided to add a few days in NYC before heading back to the ATL. 

What can I say about the Renaissance Midtown.  This a prime shoppers location and convenient to most landmarks.  Directly across the street from Big MACYS!!!   

The property was very nice with modern decor.  The concrete walls & ceilings, button-less elevator and the smoked glass bathroom walls added cutting edge touches.  The restaurant and bar was very comfortable and the food was amazing!!!

The staff was super friendly.  I will definitely revisit this property!!

The only negative was not concerning the property, but rather Marriott Rewards.  

While in Baltimore, I received an email for an early check-in for the Renaissance New York Midtown as a perk for being a Marriott Rewards Member.  I thought that was wonderful so I submitted my early check in request. The full amount of our stay was held on my credit card which was fine. However, the Rewards system did not communicate this with the property.  So, upon check in on Sunday a second full amount was held.

After speaking with Brendan - AGM at the Renaissance,  the issue was resolved and I couldn't have been more impressed by this young man and all of his assistance.  

Thank you and see you again soon!!!!

title: Great Mid-Town Hotel
text: Great location as the hotel is right across the street from Penn Station. But so are alot of hotels - what sets this one out is the great bar on the 6th floor which has a terrific outdoor terrace and the ability to use Planet Fitness for your workouts. Rooms are good size and nicely appointed. Try to get a room on a higher floor since you are in mid-town so street noise can be a problem.

title: great location
text: We really enjoyed our stay here! great location just blocks from Penn Station very easy to walk to, also close to Times Square! Hotel itself very nice, decor all modern, the room was small but still comfortable, nice design great bathroom. Only odd thing was took VERY long to get hot water, especially in the shower! WIFI was fine and the staff helpful. Enjoyed the bar that shares the hotel property also.

title: Woke up to view of Statute of Liberty
text: Great hotel. Incredible views from our room. Fantastic gym as you get to use Planet Fitness. Nice concierge lounge. One of the tops bagels in NYC across the street. And being a little further south in Manhattan put many reasonable and fantastic dining options close. Being off Times Square was also a plus as you didn't have to always contend with the endless throngs of tourists. Room was great. Nice bathroom with a glass shower so you can take in the awesome view while soaping up. Nothing but positives about our experience.

title: Great location
text: Just returned from a visit to New York. this hotel is central just a short walk from Time Square. Very clean, modern comfortable beds and helpful friendly staff. would definitely return if visiting New York again.

title: Exceptionnel
text:
Nous avons séjourné 9 nuits dans cet hôtel.
L'accueil est chaleureux, le personnel compétent .
La chambre que nous avions été située au 19 elle étage . La vue était sublime ! 
La loterie est de très bonne qualité , il y a la WIFI dans la chambre .
La décoration de l'hôtel et des chambres est de très bon goût .
La propriété de l'établissement est très bonne . Tous les jours les nécessaires de toilette nous ont été changés .

Je conseil vivement cet établissement qui est idéalement situé .

Seul petit bémol, le prix qui reste quand même élevé à mon sens bien que ce dernier soit en adéquation avec cette ville qui est extrêmement cher !

title: A pleasant, clean and modern hotel.
text: The Bell staff were really helpful and knowledgeable and are a great asset to your hotel. The room was clean and had the comfiest bed. We were next to the lift but there was no noise or disturbance from it. A great location next to Penn Station and the subway. Walking distance to most of the attractions and the subway makes the rest easily accessible.

title: Modern hotel
text: Really nice location next to Penn Station and a short walk to Times Square (but not too close).  Free fast WiFi was nice.  The elevators are odd, but I liked them after a while.  I didn't eat here, but I appreciated the reasonable prices that the had for room service.  Definitely recommend.

title: Maravilhoso!!!
text: Nos hospedamos na nossa lua de mel e ficamos apaixonados por esse hotel!  Novo, moderno e super bem localizado. Fomos recebidos pela recepcionista Marta, muito educada e gentil.  Há um bar/restaurante ótimo, ambiente muito gostoso p/ almoçar ou ir à noite. Quarto e banheiro bem decorados e muito limpos. Recomendamos para casais e grupos de amigos. Adoramos tudo! Com certeza voltaremos a nos hospedar lá!

title: Great business hotel
text:
This well located hotel is brand new and modern tower in the heart of manhattan. Its well designed and the bar located on the the lobby is very trendy and popular. 
The rooms are fancy and has some surprising gadgets such as Jbl audio set and an electronic clock.

title: Nice place
text: This is a nice hotel, we loved the location because it was a few blocks away from the insanity of Times Square yet still convenient to everything. We suggest upgrading to the skyline view as our view was beautiful day and night.  The only drawback to this hotel is the marvel floors in the bathroom. PLEASE ask for extra towels to cover floor because they are a slip hazard if there is any moisture on the floor. Other than that no complaints, we would stay there again.

title: Nice property in good location
text:
This is a rather new hotel in an excellent location in NYC very close to Penn station and Macy’s. The hotel may get crowded sometimes especially with the high-tech elevators they had that may take a while to understand how to operate them.

Room was small as it is the norm in NYC but very well appointed and clean. Breakfast was a simple buffet spread but fair enough with good service as well.

Highly recommended place if you want to be in a very central location in NYC with so many shopping and dining options nearby. Central Park is 30 minutes walking distance, but the subway can also take you there much faster as there are many lines in closer Penn station.

title: New Years week-amazing
text: We spent New Years week at this beautiful property.  Manager Justin made sure we were well taken care of with our accommodations.  The view of MSG is amazing and we can't wait to come back to celebrate our anniversary and New Years again!   Thanks for the fun time.   Did not enjoy our meals (tried for breakfast and dinner) at the restaurant, but there are so many options in NYC that it was something we overlooked.

title: Sweet 16th birthday holiday
text: Absolutely gorgeous hotel...could not fault it in any way. The staff were all incredibly helpful and so accommodating. Our stylist who looked after our room did an amazing job every day. Would highly recommend and will stay again without hesitation. Thank you all for making our holiday so memorable.

title: High Tech Hotel in Garment District
text:
We stayed at this hotel for four nights. The hotel is located in a very convenient location to Penn station, all the subways, and is on a bus line that drops you basically in front of the hotel on 35th St. It is across the street from Macy's Herald Square, Madison Square Garden, and a few steps away from Lower Broadway. You can either walk to time square with no trouble or catch a subway that takes you right to 42nd St.

Service at the hotel was excellent, staff was very attentive, and the hotel has high tech elevators, so be sure to pay attention when they tell you how to work the elevators. There are no buttons inside the elavator. 

Although we prefer staying a little bit more uptown, this hotel was perfect for what we needed. We were with a friend who had never been to New York City and wanted to take in all the sights Manhattan offers. We highly reccomend this hotel.

title: Great Service and Amenities
text:
The service here is top notch. Justin Ellison emailed us several days prior to our arrival and accommodated our city view request (Perhaps due to Marriott Gold Status). Nonetheless, this was a welcoming surprise to reach out and personally ask us if we needed anything.

Upon arrival, Marta at the front desk was both sweet and helpful. She gave us a rundown of the property, recognized our status, and provided us with breakfast vouchers at their onsite restaurant. Alternatively, they offered us 700 Marriott points in lieu of breakfast which we politely declined.

As for the property, this is a newer hotel and it definitely shows. The location is great (right next to Madison Square Garden). The rooms are very clean, our bathroom looked great, and they upgraded us to the city view on the 26th floor. I highly recommend visiting their 5th floor restaurant as they have a great roofdeck and full bar. Tons of restaurants and bars nearby. There was a bagel place across the street that always had lines so worth a visit if you don't mind the wait. There's also a Starbucks at either direction of the hotel. 

For Marriott Elites - The weekend breakfast is good. It's better than the typical concierge lounge offerings with bacon, sausage, creamy scrambled eggs, potatoes, yogurt, granola, fruit, pancakes, freshly squeezed OJ, etc. There are no made-to-order omelettes but the food is good and the service was excellent. The actual concierge lounge has complimentary boxed water which was a nice touch for eco minded folks.

We really enjoyed our stay here and will definitely be back. Thank you Justin and Marta for helping make our NYC trip a memorable one!

title: Beautiful Hotel, Excellent Service and Location
text:
Thank you to Justin and the entire staff for making our stay spectacular! From the upgraded corner room to the complimentary breakfast to the club lounge access, we felt completely spoiled. I have been to New York many times, and I have stayed in a number of different hotels. This was the very best of them all! This was a special occasion, as my sister and I brought my mother to celebrate her birthday. She was thrilled with the entire weekend, but told us that the hotel was her absolute favorite part of the trip. 

The room size was large by New York standards: two queen-sized beds with plush comforters. The bathroom was beautifully appointed. Our view was spectacular, and the hotel was surprisingly quiet at night. We were able to easily walk everywhere from the High Line to Times Square and beyond. The breakfast was delicious and plentiful.

Honestly cannot say enough about how wonderful the Renaissance made our New York weekend!

title: FABULOUS Location!
text:
If you love to walk- as I do- this is the very best area to stay in.
Near all the restaurants and museums and transportation.
The hotel itself is really nice if you don't mind secure elevators.
Would definitely return to this hotel.

title: Value and location
text: Good choice for the theater district or west side exploring.  Overall a good experience. Staff is very attentive and friendly.  Good price point for a new hotel.  Decent size rooms and nice bathroom.  One complaint was that the mechanisms for the window shades were poorly installed and failed.  Elevator system takes a little getting used to.  Starbucks on same street.

title: Great location
text: This hotel is perfectly located.  My husband and I arrive to NYC by train from Canada and this hotel is located only a short walk from Penn Station.  It is also only a blocks from hotel to Time Square.  We were looking for a decent hotel, nicely located but not in Time Square.  Room are small but this is NYC.  I would come back here anytime. I felt very safe, day or night.  Their restaurant is really nice and can accommodate for a gluten free diet, (my husband has celiac disease). Thursday 5 to 7 there is a DJ.

title: Brand New Lovely Hotel, Ugly Neighborhood
text:
This hotel has been open for about a year and is really a lovely place.  The hotel is modern, clean and the service is very good.  However, the neighborhood makes it a bit difficult.  Although very well located, right next to Macy's, MSG and Penn Station, when you walk out of the hotel the streets are dirty and extremely crowded.  I get the feeling that over time this neighborhood will get better, but you should be warned.

Some of the other highlights, the lobby is very well done with a nice bar that is quiet compared to the sports bar one floor below, which is also great but can be very crowded.  The lounge is also very nice, with a good breakfast and snacks at cocktail hour.  The rooms are comfortable but a bit small, which is not at all unusual in NY.  The showers are excellent with rain heads.  The only real issue I have with the hotel is that the elevators are a bit slow, which again is not unusual in NY.

Overall, it is my favorite hotel when I am in NY.

title: LOCALISATION PARFAITE
text:
Nous sommes restez 6 nuits et 8 jours dans cet hôtel du 29 juin au 6 juillet 2017.
La localisation est parfaite si vous ne restez pas longtemps à NYC. A 2mn à pied de Penn Station vous pouvez prendre le Air Train et LIRR depuis Jamaica Station pour y accéder.
A côté de ESB, et très proche de la nation de métro également.
Plein de petits restaurants à côté. 
Les chambres sont propres. Un peu petite pour 4 (2 adultes et 2 enfants de  13 et 10 ans) la chambre standard. Et même si nous avions réservé sur Booking la vue était très bien au 15eme étage.
On a pu avoir la chambre dès 12h00 même si le check in était prévu à 15h00.
Et pour le départ, il y a un service bagagerie et nous avons pu quitter la chambre à 14h30.
Le personnel était très serviable et souriant.
Le restaurant est superbe (un peu cher) mais une ambiance très américaine avec un studio de télévision que l'on peut voir en direct.
Le WI-FI fonctionnait très bien. Il y a un petit réfrigérateur dans lequel on peu entreposer des choses, un coffre fort et l'Air conditionné.
Il y plein de petits endroits à côté pour prendre le petit déjeuner (Andrews Coffee shop est mon préféré et starbucks bien évidement) et une laundromat (laverie) à l'angle de la 9eme avenue et 35th rue (5mn à pied) moins cher qu'à l'hôtel.
Le seul petit bémol, la douche ou l'eau s'évacuait par le sol mais nous ne l'avons pas signalé alors nous ne pouvons pas vraiment nous plaindre.
Sinon, très bon rapport qualité prix avec booking.

title: Central Location, Pricing Odd
text:
We were strictly here five nights for pleasure, a birthday trip for my husband.  Our hostess, Ariel, was fantastic, and sent up a bottle of sparkling wine as a treat. 

Our room was on the 24th floor.  Even though our Marriott room profile states away from elevators, this room was right next to it, and we didn't mind since the walls are concrete and never heard noise.

The safe in the room was inoperable, and for who knows how long.  The room view on the 24th floor was very nice, and mesmerizing.  The room size is bigger than most NYC hotels, and fairly efficient.  I would have liked to have seen a luggage rack.  The iron had black gunk that came off on our clothes when used.  The carpet either needs replaced or cleaned, as it was a bit worn.  The seam between the carpet and hard wood had debris and a penny wedged in it.  The box spring cover on the right side of the bed was stained.

The bathroom was very clean.  No stray hairs or funky mold. 

Some days we got the right amount of towels, and other days not so.  Some days we got a shower floor towel, other days not.  This is really important to have since the floor can be slippery.

The hotel pricing is based off of need, but varies so much.  I wish we were told that there was a back door that opens to the Penn Station street, rather than walking around the hotel every day.  Funny we found about this as we checked out with our luggage.

The hotel smells nice, but not overwhelming.

Major CON:  no coffee in the Club Lounge!  Even lower priced Marriott chain hotels have coffee and hot water out in the lobby most hours of the day.  Here, not so.  This is very odd.

We ordered room service two nights, which consisted of the Chinese Salad each time.  It was just the right amount of food, if you're looking for something light, perhaps after having a big lunch.

Overall the room was great to come back to after spending all day out and about the city.  We would consider staying here again.

title: Fantastic service in a great location
text:
My wife and I spent 5 nights in the Renaissance to celebrate our silver wedding anniversary in New York. The hotel is fantastic, staff are so friendly and knowledgeable and our upgrade to a room looking down to the Statue of Liberty was breathtaking. Location is perfect on 35th and 7th, 2 mins walk to Penn, across the road from Macy's, local bars and deli's within yards of the hotel and less than 10 mins walk to Broadway, Times Square etc. 

Rooms had everything you would want with a very modern, warm yet voguish contemporary feel to them. Beds were very very comfy, and showers etc excellent, as was the coffee pod machine. Rooftop bar (not on the rooftop but a massive 5th floor patio garden) is one of the 'in' places to go in Midtown NY and is full of local office workers with the live music giving a great vibe midweek, but a little quieter on the weekends. Tony the bar manager realized we were 'new faces' and made a beeline to welcome us and sent over some drinks when he knew it was our wedding anniversary. Bar food looked wonderful, the buffet breakfast was good but not exceptional. My only negative (and its a very small one) would be at busy times you can wait a few minutes extra for a lift but given the surroundings, this was not really any hassle. I found the prices a little expensive compared to UK / Europe but reasonable to other comparable NYC hotels and we would both recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a balance of  a modern, contemporary vibe with friendliness and comfortableness at its heart, in a great location. Thank you to all at the hotel for helping making our stay in NY so wonderful,

title: De lo mejor
text:
Excelente en todos los sentidos, hotel con diseño, y decoración exquisita. Las habitaciones limpias y con vistas al midtown de NY. Atención impecable, nos ayudaron con reservas y consultas en diversas ocasiones. El restaurante fue una grata sorpresa, con una terraza con vista al Maxi son square y empire! 
Lo recomiendo y volvería siempre

title: Amazing Pre and During Stay
text:
My husband and I celebrated our 22nd anniversary in New York and opted to stay at the Renaissance New York Midtown Hotel last May.  Prior to checking in, we received a couple of emails from Justin Ellison, Director of Guest Services.  Since we were celebrating our anniversary, he wrote that we will be upgraded to a city view guest room which I thought was very nice.

Upon arrival, we were greeted by the very friendly front desk staff, Mishka.  Since we arrived at around 10 am, we waited a couple of hours before we could get to our room which was no problem.  

Our room was modern and very clean!  We thought the upgrade was already a sweet gesture by the hotel, but we were welcomed by a handwritten card from Mishka and the staff along with some treats including a bottle of wine!  It is so rare to get handwritten notes nowadays so we were quite touched by that!  

We took the subway from Newark to the city.  Station was about 2-3 blocks away which was convenient.  Times Square was about half a mile which allowed us to walk to see a couple of shows.  We are grateful that we were a few blocks away from Times Square as the area was too busy for our liking. 

We will definitely stay here again!  We are already planning on visiting back next year for our 23rd anniversary!  Thank you so much for taking GREAT care of us as we celebrated an important event in our lives!

title: Amazing Hotel!
text: My husband and i stayed at the Renaissance for 5 nights in May.  I had spent a lot of time picking our hotel as this trip was super special for us and didn't want a crappy hotel.  Even after lots of research up until the point we arrived i was still nervous.  I needn't have been. What a hotel this is!! From the moment we arrived till the second we left, we loved every minute. The staff we encountered on our stay were great. Friendly and helpful in every way, special mention goes to Lando and the lovely lady who served us at the bar when we arrived. We upgraded our room on arrival and as it wasn't ready we were given two complimentary drinks at the bar. Our room was on the 34th floor and it had the most spectacular view of the city. The room was immaculate, the bed unbelievably comfortable, the bathroom was stunning and roomy. The room was a great size compared to NYC standards. When it came time to leave we didn't want to. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and if you are wondering if you should book it? DO IT! My husband and i are actually planning another trip for my birthday in January and we cannot wait to come back to The Renaissance.

title: Nice place....dismissive staff
text: There is nothing that turns me off about a property more than been dismissed by the staff...and this was the concierge manager (How is this person in this role)?  Beautiful hotel and great location, yet there are so many choices in NYC, choose somewhere else.

title: Great hotel convenient location, but it is in Midtown...
text: I would highly recommend this hotel any time. Lobby check in on a higher floor, fortunate to get an upgraded room, view was spectacular could see a great view all the way downtown, and you could make out the Statue of Liberty in the back. The room itself is wonderfully outfitted with JBL speakers and a TV that allows screen mirrroring. Bathroom super neat and beautiful with white counters. Also loved the lounge with boxed water and Greek yogurt always, and weekend breakfast served in the restaurant downstairs. Convenient to Penn Station and many subway stops for different lines. Loved this hotel! Also arriving was easy from the train station, but all the sights we went to see were not that nearby, so sometimes it was a trek back to the hotel.

title: Nice hotel; experienced both positives/negatives
text:
Positives: Customer service, the city view, the modernness, and the bar area

Negatives: Car being moved without an explanation is terribly sketchy. 4 rooms to get a clean room upon check-in is extreme. Hallways could be cleaner.

We had an interesting two night stay at the Renaissance New York Midtown Hotel. I called a few days ahead to get an early check-in, but when I arrived at 2:30, there was nothing available and we had to wait until the regular check-in at 4. I understand the early check-in is not guaranteed,  but we were still disappointed. The front desk gave us a drink/appetizer voucher while we waited so that was nice. He also said we would be upgraded to a city view. 

At 4 pm, I went back to the check-in desk and they said the city view room was not ready yet but a standard was. We took the standard because we needed to get going. When we went the standard room there was crumbs on the ottoman and a booger on the bedspread. I went back downstairs to ask for a new room and they said we could get a city room but at an additional cost. I said the first guy said he was already upgrading us, but didn’t say anything about an additional cost. I agreed to pay extra because as I said we needed to get going. Once we got up to this room, we were not happy that it was the first room off of the elevator and not told about that. We did not want a room that was at risk of being loud, especially one that I was paying an expected upgrade for.  So I went back downstairs and they there was a standard room that we could have. When we got to this room there was hair and crumbs on the side of box spring. It was gross. I called the front desk and the manager came up and said there was a city room view that we could stay in at no additional charge. She would take us up there to make sure the room is good. When we got up there we noticed a white stain on the side of the mattress and the nightstands were also not completely clean. At this point, we were almost running late so the manager, who was very, very nice agreed to do a deep clean while we were out. That was fine because as I said we needed to get going. After coming back that night, the room was great; nice and clean and nice note and treat was left for us. As I said, the manager, was very nice and she made sure things were right.

On to the next day. We went out for the day and when we came back to the hotel we noticed our vehicle parked in the valet. We were shocked to say the least!! We didn’t call for it and have been out for the day. I went right to the valet and no one there knew who called or why our vehicle was there. This was very sketchy and quite disconcerting. Our vehicle should not be just sitting in the valet, especially without an explanation. Furthermore, someone should have called us to tell us that our car was sitting there if they brought it around and we never showed. 

We checked out the next day. I said there were definitely some positives and negatives to staying here. It’s like with most things in life, you just need to stay on top of things.

title: Bello e posizione otyimale
text:
Bello e raffinato
La posizione e la migliore vicino a Square e dove passano metro, bus, treni
La lounge bar e veramente molto bella, vedi foto
Le camere chic
Eccezionale di poter aprire la camera con lo smartphone e l'ascensore solo con la Key
Mi è piaciuto

title: Great hotel and fantastic location.
text: I upgraded to a room on a pretty high floor and it was worth it, the views are fantastic. My room was nice and quiet I slept really well here. The room itself was great and pretty big by NY standards. The gym is run by a separate company but linked to a hotel, it's fantastic really good. The on site bar/restaurant is also very good but with a ll the other options locally I only went once. The staff in the hotel are really friendly and welcoming. Would def go back.

title: A great gem
text: I've stayed at the Renaissance in Midtown twice, and both times have been fantastic.  While the fitness club is shared with Planet Fitness, it's the bedding, modern decor for the lobby and rooms, value, and a fun bar that makes this a treat.

title: Great Hotel
text: Booked last minute because of cancelled flight. Received a great room at a reasonable price. Exec lounge was truly excellent. Would highly recommend. One downside is the "smart" elevators, which required a few attempts each time to get it to acknowledge the key.

title: Bestes Hotel in NYC!
text: Lage ist top und das Personal sehr zuvorkommend. Unser Zimmer war atemberaubend! Aussicht auf lower Manhattan. Sehr modern alles und gepflegt. Habe mich rundum wohl gefühlt. :-) Komme gerne wieder einmal und empfehle Euch weiter!

title: Good location but needs tweaking
text:
Great location, a few minutes walk to Maddison square garden, Macy's, Empire State Building etc.
Rooms are small but modern, we travelled with my son as the hotel said they offered so many things........ didn't get any of them......
Staff at the hotel are incredibly friendly and the concierge (Daniel was AMAZING) except for the staff who work in the lounge who are uninterested and lazy...... nothing is replenished, dirty plates are left and the staff are nowhere to be seen.  The lounge doesn't have hot drinks all day like other lounges and to be fair if they did they would be left empty like everything else.  The canapés are quite dull and dry.... they do cheese and meats but don't provide crackers or bread and they are always empty.  No kettles in the room... just those one cup coffee machines that you can't use for tea.  Breakfast buffet at the hotel is very dry and again at busy periods you have to queue, only to get to the front and everything is empty......
The restaurant is nice, try the steak it was delicious.  I personally wouldn't stay here again, there are too many other options around.

title: Great experience, great staff...
text: I have stayed at the Renaissance Midtown two times, and this is my go-to hotel because the rooms are gorgeous (perfect in size, luxurious detail,) and the staff is so warm & welcoming & helpful.  Daniel and Raini in particular have made my stays memorable... they have assisted with dinner reservations, getting show tickets delivered to me, and overall being great hosts.  There are multiple bars/food options in the hotel.  Great location for all things.  But really - its about the staff - and Daniel & Raini are the best!

title: Great for business travel
text: I've stayed at this property for about 10 stays now and it covers every need a business traveler could ask for. The lounge is very convenient and the staff will take the effort to learn your name. Rooms are on the smaller size but that's the norm in New York. The rooms are very very clean which is key for me and I can walk around without shoes without a second thought of stepping on dirt or debris.

title: Newly opened but with some terrible design faults
text:
I understand this hotel was opened around 12 months ago.  Strange to think that whoever designed it didn't think about putting in shelves or draws in the rooms for people to store their clothes. The managers response was that it was designed as a business hotel, well I was on a business trip and I wanted to store my clothes whilst there.
The lifts were another issue, could easily take 5-10 minutes to get from room to ground as you could only get into a specific lift that was designated to you.
Concierge gave me lots of wrong advise, told me that a food market I wanted to go to was NOT open when it was and I also had problems with the bellboy incorrectly quoting me for a car to the airport.
My first room had a leak from the TOILET into the carpet and they asked me to move saying they were putting into a room with windows on two sides giving me some great views, the room didn't have windows on two sides and was basically the same as the first one.
On a plus side, I was given access to the executive lounge because of my status where a  very simple breakfast was served each day, and soft drinks 24/7. Appreciated and valued. Aveda toiletries were lovely. (shame I needed to keep asking for shower caps).
Would I stay again, not sure, have to be in Manhattan again in November and looking around at the moment.

title: Best hotel in NY!
text:
- Location is perfect!
- Room was extremely comfortable and modern! Housekeeping staff were very careful. My room was always clean and tidy.
- Front desk staff was outstanding! Marta and Justine are stars! You should be proud of having employees like Justine! She made me fell like home!

Can't wait to go back!

title: Great front desk, concierge staff
text:
Joshua gave my family the most warm, fun, and pleasant welcome I've ever experienced at any hotel - and I'm Platinum Elite with 100+ nights in hotels each year. 

We also had very pleasant experience with the concierge staff, telling us it was okay to bring drinks and such to our room. 

I will say that the concierge itself was too small, and poorly stocked.

title: Wonderful hotel, prime location
text: I couldn't have asked for a better hotel for our first time staying in Manhattan. Convenient to just about everything, friendly staff, very clean. Rooms were a bit small, but that's to be expected in NYC. Great amenities including a rooftop bar!

title: Welcome change
text:
Joining hubby on business trip and did not want to stay in Times Square but needed to be close to his meetings. This was a perfect location! Walking distance to time square and Rockefeller as well as flat iron and high line
Hotel was fabulous. Lovely lobby with plenty of couches and chairs. Cool eclectic mix of industrial, swanky, and a nod to the the garment district.
Updated elevator system a huge plus.
Rooms were decorated in same fashion as lobby. Classy industrial. A nice mix of cement, marble wall paper and floor to ceiling windows with a nice view. We were on the 16 floor. Nice touches in room didn't go unnoticed!!!
Aveda products in bathroom was a bonus!
Excellent service!!

title: Great stay at this modern hotel
text:
Stayed here for just one night but would definitely return. Hotel is newer, comfortable, quiet and has all the modern amenities many NYC hotels lack topped off by a nice midtown location. Room was a good size for NYC and had a desk and fridge - something you are seeing less and less of in NYC hotel rooms! Staff was very polished and kind. 

One star off because the carpet in our room was showing some wear around the bed. It was bad enough that they should not be renting that room until they can replace the carpet. it looked like they tried to glue it back together rather than doing a proper repair.

title: The perfect location for a show/meals/train!!!
text: Everything was enjoyable and convenient regarding this hotel.  The room was a typical, small NYC hotel room, but it was very modern, clean, quiet, and a short walk to every place we visited.  I visit NYC often, but this was the first time that I didn't have to take one cab or one Uber.  We walked to the hotel from Penn Station -- so close!  Lunch was a few blocks more, then the show was a few blocks more.  Walked about halfway back for dinner and then back to the hotel.  The next day, same experience and a very short walk to the train.  The restaurant on the 5th floor was very good and had outdoor seating (a lot of street noise, but nice to do in NY).  Patricia was an excellent food server.  With the new programmed elevators, the facility was very secure and access to each floor was limited to people who were supposed to be there.  Very important feature.  I will definitely be back!

title: And extraordinary experience!
text:
For context, I have spent over 1500 nights in Marriott hotels around the world. Many of them are extraordinary… And this hotel is among that group.
New York is a tough market… Very savvy guests, very difficult labor market, very high prices.  It seems that this property overcomes those difficulties in a very special way. I credit my extraordinary stay to management here. They have been able to create a culture of success beginning with the Bellman, to security, to the front desk, and on to housekeeping.  I am not speaking of the patronizing "hello" that one receives in most hotels. I am speaking of sincerely happy, content, and hospitable staff. Kudos to the GM and AGM for inspiring their staff to make guests feel welcome.  (it was July and a little bit warm in my room. David the housekeeping director, took it upon himself to go out and to purchase a fan for my comfort.)
This beautifully styled and new property in Chelsea is a most welcome improvement to the hotel scene.  A streamlined front desk process, a beautiful and chic bar area, elevators with state of the art technology. Rooms are new and beautifully appointed with great technology in them. Apple TVs allow you to sync your mobile devices and stream video on demand.
The executive lounge is perfectly acceptable. I've read the reviews about the lounge and must disagree. The food is bountiful and despite not serving alcohol, there is a beautiful bar not more than 20 steps away from the lounge.  I did not find it inconvenient to buy a glass of wine and bring it into the lounge.
Most likely the bigger issue with the lounge is the lack of exclusivity. It would seem as though there is unlimited access to all levels of the Marriott program. The net result is a feeding frenzy at 5:30 PM.
Personally, when in the Big Apple, the greatest city in the world for food, I prefer to explore the culinary seen around town.
All in all, I cannot wait to return to this property. Thank U "management".

title: Great location, needs to work out some "new" bugs
text:
I was really excited to stay at this new Marriott property given its proximity to Penn Station. The first challenge I noticed was how slow all 6 elevators were at the entrance level just to get you up to the lobby. I've seen this design now in a few places and I'm not sure what the logic is around making people wait to take an elevator just to get to a check in desk. This alone lengthened my wait time extensively over my 3 day trip. 

Overall the hotel is decent but I found the rooms fairly worn for being such a new property. We had two rooms booked and both rooms had worn carpets and some of the furniture and walls had not worn well either. The lounge, while nice, offered some of the worst breakfast food I've had in years. It reminded me of when I started my career and stayed at the 3 star hotels I could afford. I wouldn't say don't visit this place but with the amount of options nearby I'd be weary of the prices. For example, one block away is another Marriott property, Fairfield Inn, and it offers a rooftop terrace and the rooms are clean and tidy.

title: Great location and nice hotel.  Staff takes it over the top.
text: Stayed for 5 nights 1/2 work 1/2 family vacation.  The lead navigator Ranie was spectacular.  While I checked in she gave my 5 year old a map and showed her all the places to go.  She remembered my daughter's name and always went out of her way to say hi and talk about her adventures.  The rooms were bigger than standard NY close quarters.  Everything was clean and new.  35th is 1 block from Penn Station, across the street from the Macy's and Herald Square.  Red, Blue and Orange subway stations are a block away.  Javits Center is a quick walk.  Madison Square Gardens is a block away.  Times square is an easy 15 min walk.  Overall, an awsome place to call home base for a NY adventure.

title: Business in the Big Apple
text: The Renaissance Midtown is a great place to stay if you have work in the midtown area.  I found the reception/checkin process to be very friendly; greeted by a welcoming, delightful and energetic check-in crew after a long day of work.  The hotel is pretty new, luxurious, very clean, with an urban feel to it.  Rock & Reilly’s is a fun restaurant with a rooftop (5th floor)/outdoor bar and restaurant is a great place to spend time with friends and colleagues and conduct business, build teams and forge new relations in a fun energetic place.  The concierge lounge it located on the 6th floor, stocked with 'Boxed water' (not plastic - loved the idea), Perrier, and flavored San Peligrino drinks.  My main disappointment was that snacks for happy hour was not very vegetarian friendly..  and the popcorn was bacon flavored.  Argh! staff in the lounge wasn't that helpful either.  the elevators have been installed with secure access to guest floor, which provides restricted access to the guest floors. Also give yourself some extra 5+mins for the elevators which are slow.  But all in all a great place.

title: Wonderful -- The Staff made us feel like favorite members of their family
