text: The hotel facility is excellent.  It is modern, well maintained, clean, well kept and in a great location.  But, the real treasure is the staff at the hotel.  They were OUTSTANDING.  They were efficient, professional, responsive and very friendly.  After a busy day site seeing, going to plays, etc in Manhattan it was like returning home, or to an oasis, and being greeted by friends who regularly welcomed me by name.  One of the concierges (Ranie) (which they call Navigators) was always smiling and did a great job in making recommendations and reservations.  Calling ahead to get a low floor (afraid of heights) Meaghan made certain that we got a room where I wanted it.  The Staff was not only responsive to all requests but carried tasks out in an efficient, courteous and friendly manner.  The Club Room off of the lobby was a wonderful, quiet place to sit and relax at the end of a busy day.  The food was excellent and the service in the restaurant was great.  We could not think of anything they could improve on during our 6-night stay.  Highly recommended.

title: One of the BEST Hotels in NYC
text:
My family and I (myself, husband, 4-year-old son and 60-year-old mom) stayed in a skyline double queen room for 4 nights in June, and I can't say enough good things about it. Here's why:

THE STAFF - 5 stars: About a week before we arrived, Justin, director of guest services, personally contacted me to ask if we had any special requests or if we were celebrating any special occasions. My son was actually turning 4 during our stay, and the day following our arrival one of the lead navigators, Daniel, delivered balloons and a few Hot Wheels to our room, wishing our son a happy birthday on behalf of the staff. My son loved it! I was already impressed with the pre-arrival communication (we travel quite a bit, but this was a first), but the whole staff really went the extra mile to make our entire stay top-notch. I also highly recommend using the hotel's car service - Antonio's. The Uber driver that was supposed to be taking us back to LGA started giving us the runaround when we called to see where he was, and within 5 minutes, Antonio's 12-passenger Mercedes van was ready to go, and cost us roughly the same as what we would have paid the Uber driver (+/- $5). The bellmen were also extremely helpful with getting our bags, stroller, etc. situated. Everyone was very polite and accommodating. 

THE ROOM/HOTEL - 5 stars: The room was spacious, modern, comfortable, clean and offered amazing views. Going into this trip, my checklist included finding a room that had 2 QUEEN beds (not doubles, as most NYC hotels have), about 350 sq. ft., large windows and unobstructed, skyline views. This hotel checked every box, on top of being affordable. On a previous trip to NYC, we decided to be cheap and stay at Hotel Pennsylvania, and it was a huge mistake. Trust me, spend the extra $100 or so per night and stay here. You will not be disappointed. I also recommend booking the hotel through Marriott's website and signing up for the free rewards program. You'll get free WiFi and cancellation up to a couple days before arrival, and if the price drops, you can rebook the lower rate and cancel the previous reservation. I made sure to monitor the rates and shaved off about $400 from the time I originally booked to about a week before our trip. The hotel is also ideally located and has a beautiful garden-like, open-air restaurant (retractable roof). Great all-around. 

As previously mentioned, I can't say enough good things about this hotel - from the building itself to the room, location and employees, this place is truly one of the best. Please send our warm regards to the staff.

title: bishop724
text: Stayed at this hotel July 5-8 with my family for a family getaway. Upon my arrival him after a long, exhausting and tired trip. The  staff was extremely helpful, friendly and accommodating. Joshua the front desk clerk was extremely pleasant, friendly and exhibiting great customer service skills while checking in my family.  He went above the meet y'all on the call of duty to make sure that our stay was one to remember. Justine was another front desk clerk who worked very well with making sure We were accommodated properly. Daniel the concierge/navigator was so informative it was unbelievable. The super superb service and  attentive service he gave was just awesome !!!

title: Nice Hotel
text:
I stayed 3 nights on points in 2 Queen City View room w/ teen son.  It took me forever to earn enough points so this was a huge treat (and Marriott does great job)!  I have stayed at Courtyard a few blocks away so was familiar w/ this part of town - not the prettiest but location is hard to beat to get up and downtown.  W 35th where hotel is located is one way and actually a somewhat quiet street.  

We had early flight so dropped bags w/ bellman (free but do tip them) at 10 am and headed out w/ promise from front desk to call when room ready.  They did, in fact, call when room was ready later that afternoon.  

The room was very comfortable and quiet.  I asked for room w/ bathtub as I read they were most private and it worked out fine.  I understand they're installing blinds in bathrooms so privacy issue should be resolved.  The room had everything we needed including bathrobes and good-sized refrigerator.   The view was fine - nothing spectacular but perfectly fine.  Two small complaints were the black-out blinds did not work properly and the Smart TV did not allow us to watch movies on Netflix using iphones - tech said there was a glitch w/ Apple products.   

My son enjoyed working out at attached Planet Fitness.  I had a drink at beautiful indoor/outdoor bar/restaurant.  It was quiet since it was Memorial Day weekend and locals were not around.  The lobby is also beautiful w/ a little bar area and loads of seating. 

You're two block over from Penn Station/MSG and Macy's.  Again, this is not my favorite neighborhood but we felt safe walking home from late dinners.  We easily walked back from dinner at Chelsea Market and from fav Mex restaurant at W 54th & 9th.   There's a super popular bagel place across the street - you'll wait in line but once you order, they're very efficient and bagels quite good.  I really like Andrew's Coffee Shop a block over on Broadway for good basic NYC breakfast (again, expect to wait a few minutes but food will arrive very fast).  We love The Smith for brunch (make reservation-15 min walk to NoMad location).  It was also an easy walk to Broadway shows from here.  

I was pleased to see security stationed ground level most of the time because you don't need key to access elevators.  

I reserved house SUV to get us to JFK for early flight - $75 flat rate inclusive of tip. Taxis are $52 flat rate w/out tip to JFK.  Penn Station is also right there to take subway.  

This is a beautiful, new hotel in a central location so can't imagine you'll be unhappy staying here.

title: Scelta efficace
text:
Abbiamo alloggiato in questo hotel per 4 notti e si è rilevato un ottimo appoggio per la visita della città; la posizione infatti è eccellente e la zona ben servita per gli spostamenti.
La nostra camera era una king, spaziosa, confortevole, ben arredata e pulita. Operazioni di check-in e out veloci ed efficaci e rapporto qualità prezzo interessante. Che altro chiedere?

title: Perfect location.  Perfect service.
text: We stayed here for a week on a combination business and family trip.  The location was ideal for access to everything.  The rooms were very contemporary and looked new.  The entire staff from doormen to house keeping to the front desk were friendly and exceptionally helpful.  Joshua and Justine at the front desk went above and beyond, displaying patience and courtesy, to help with several unique reservation and travel changes.  Highly recommend.

title: Sauber und ruhig
text:
Wir waren drei Nächte in diesem Hotel und haben keinen Punkt gefunden, der uns nicht gefallen hat. Ok ja einer vielleicht, man muss ca. 10 min bevor man Duschen geht das Wasser abstellen, da es Ewigkeiten dauert, bis es warm ist. Eine Wasserverschwendung hoch 10, man muss es als Gast nur wissen. 
Unser Zimmer war sehr groß und geräumig, das Bad ist auch sehr groß und komfortabel. Alles auf dem neuesten Stand, eher in Richtung Luxus. Die Klimaanlage empfand ich als sehr laut. Von den Geräuschen auf der Straße haben wir nichts mitbekommen. Man kann kostenlos in das Push Fitness neben an gehen, einfach in die 2. Etage mit dem Fahrstuhl fahren, ID mitbringen und los geht's. Das Hotel liegt der zentral und man kann fußläufig gut zum Time Square, Flat Iron Building und zum Empire State Building gehen. Einkaufsmöglichkeiten, Shopping, Supermarkt, Restaurants gibt es dort an jeder Ecke. Eine U- Bahn Station gibt es dort auch direkt, es ist wirklich am einfachsten mit der U-Bahn zu fahren, es geht schnell, ist günstig (eine Fahrt 3$ pro Person) und man entgeht dem Stau.

title: GREAT visit! - fantastic location!  Close to everything!
text: Having stayed in NYC several times, the location here is perfect!  Close to all the action, a great bagel place and Madison Square Garden,  but not at all noisy.  Everyone working there is smiling and happy to serve.  Hotel amenities also top notch - and a great restaurant as well.  Can't wait to go back!

title: Unique hotel in a unique city.....
text:
Front desk is on the 6th floor of the building. Check in was quick and friendly. Was accorded access to MLounge due to Gold status, however i find the lounge lacking - no alcoholic drinks and snacks as compared to other Marriott MLounge around the world. Maybe this is NY, i dunno know.
Anyway, not important.

Room is uniquely designed such that the wall is made of raw concrete. very industrialised look. room size is good, bed is comfortable though airconditioning system can be a tad noisy at night. Love the chaise lounge in the room where i can lie down, enjoy a cup of coffee and see the bustle of the city goes by......

breakfast is good, very tasty esp the bacon. i find it very delicious as compared to others i have eaten in hotels.

good location, just 3 mins away from Penn Station and Macy. 10 mins walk to Majestic theatre and Port Authority bus terminal. good for commuting around this busy city.

strongly recommend this hotel

title: Great Property, Especially Close to Javits Center
text:
From the moment we arrived the whole feel was great. Big thanks to Justin who could read and anticipate our needs. 
Rooms are very comfortable; finally a hotel with a handheld shower in addition to the roof mounted. Bathroom amenities are quality. Sleep comfort great. WiFi really good. 

Executive lounge needs desperate help. The employees seemed overwhelmed, plastic instead of real cutlery, food looks like staged without refrigeration, just the whole atmosphere did not seemed as it should.

Elevator system during heavy traffic can be a drag; too many people directed to one.

Overall a good property, will certainly come back.

title: Excellent Staff willing to go above and beyond to meet your needs
text:
I needed a room for my wife and kids.  And this hotel has a very good location, is new, and rooms are larger than average for Manhattan.  And the price was fair.  Then my brother wants to join and his budget was smaller than mine.  Justin Ellison , Director of Guest Services, was able to meet our needs by providing us the exact type of accommodation we needed, including adjacent rooms.  He was most attentive and as a Marriott Platinum member, I felt very catered to.  The bar/restaurant of 5th floor was very good.  If there is one area to improve is the concierge lounge as the food variety was limited and the service there not on par with the rest of the hotel.  Overall, I give this hotel 5 stars.  If you have a special request or need, Justin surpassed my expectations for meeting and exceeding my expectations.  I would return without hesitation
LF

title: Great service, classy facilities
text:
We stayed here for two nights on a weekend when it is a bit cheaper.  It is still considerably pricey relative to the lower chains but the value is there.  It is quite close to many attractions in Midtown such as Macy's, Madison Square Garden, and the Empire State Building.  Major transportation at Penn Station and 34th street train lines are also near.  You'll have to be located on the upper floors to get views of the Chrysler Building.

The lobby is on the 6th floor from the lobby and you have to choose it on the display before you enter the elevators as there are no buttons within each elevator.  The restaurant is on the 5th floor.  If you are able to get into the concierge, it is 24 hours with ample supply of soft drinks, boxed water, yogurt, along with 2 mac computers for internet usage.  The staff was accommodating as our toilet got clogged and our mini fridge appeared to be turned off (it is energy efficient so the display does not always remain on).  The room, as expected, is on the small side but there is space for a desk, a lounger, and a full sized closet.  The bathroom shower has a glass side that faces the bedroom so you can pull the shade down for privacy.  We were able to get a late checkout and staff really helped us out a lot.

title: New Favourite in Midtown!
text:
Been to NYC many times but this was our first stay here.  Booked this hotel for my 50th birthday week in NYC and it certainly didn't disappoint.  My husband emailed ahead and some lovely cupcakes were delivered to our room which was a beautiful touch.  Not expected but hugely appreciated especially as the first 10 hours of my birthday were spent travelling!  A big thank you to Daniel for that.

Where to start, on entering the hotel we received a fantastic welcome from the bell boys who have a desk on the ground floor - and this was consistent throughout our stay, always smiling always helpful and an absolute asset to this hotel chain - they were on hand to navigate you to the elevators and show you how they work.

If you get a few minutes spare, have a play on the interactive concierge at the end of the lift corridor - really cool!  When you walk along the wall facing the lift sometimes if you run your hand along it the pattern moves too - release the inner geek!

Lobby is on the 6th floor and yet another smiley welcome from the team there.  Who were fantastically helpful, informative.  Really loved the 'Attitude is Everything' artwork in reception and that ethos is certainly in play at this establishment. 

In fact, whenever you came into contact with hotel staff there was always a smile, hello and someone asking how your day was going.  So refreshing.

Room - we did ask if we could exchange our room but only as it was a special occasion and I really wanted to have a bit of a view.  They were so accommodating and I know they were extremely busy which made it really appreciated by us.  We were given the same level room but on a higher floor and opposite side of the hotel.  Heaven, I had a view of the Chrysler building morning, noon and night, my favourite - loved it.  

The room itself was spotlessly clean throughout our stay, towels were amazingly soft with lots of essential extras, which are not always there in other hotels, like free wi-fi, fridge and nice amenities.  The bed linen was high end and the bed and pillows were to die for and we slept like babies for the 5 nights we were there.

We were there when it was really hot so the air con was an absolute gift. Perfect.  The safe in the room was more like a drawer and a more practical square shape which was far bigger than the average hotel safe and big enough to hold all our valuables.

There is a bar/restaurant on the 5th floor which always seemed really popular and busy - we popped in briefly and it seemed to have a really good feel about the place but it was so busy seats were at a premium - never seen a hotel bar looking so lively which, if I am honest, is indicative of the buzz about the hotel.

Location wise, you couldn't ask for better.  Easy travel links with Penn Station being just around the corner, or block, and if its your first time in NYC it has a plethora of the big attractions in walking distance which are so easy to navigate to.

Macy's, Levi's, Victoria Secret and all the major stores within a five minute stroll and, what seemed like, a Duane Reed on every corner!  A lovely seating area at Herald Square behind Macy's which continues for a block or two which is great to sit down, have a coffee and watch the world go by.

The madness that is Times Square lies only 10 minutes walk in one direction whilst the relative peace and quiet of the Flat Iron lies just minutes in the opposite, so something for everyone!  Empire State Building again 10 minutes max. and not forgetting MSG which is seconds away! 

Plenty of places for cheap eats and snacks nearby, a couple of doors down there is a 2bros Pizza - 2 slices and a can of soda $2.99, including taxes a real bargain!  Al's deli around the corner does excellent food around the clock and always cooked from fresh, very reasonably priced and the breakfasts and lamb kebab come highly recommended, if you are eating in sit upstairs as it is nicer, quieter and easier to do a spot of people watching!

All in all, I had a fantastic 50th birthday trip and this hotel played a major part in that.  So thank you!  

Once you have stayed here there will be no going back to anywhere else in Manhattan.  We will be back in the Spring, see you then!

title: Nice stay
text:
The Renaissance Midtown is situated 8-10 blocks south of Times Square. The location is great. The rooms are clean and comfortable, though somewhat small.

In my room the hot water took approximately 5 minutes to arrive, yet this was the only quibble. The bathroom is shower-only, no tub. 

Everything was clean, and the staff were courteous and helpful. While you enter the hotel on the ground floor, the lobby is on the 6th. Rooms and elevator access is secured with a key.

title: Wonderful stay!
text: In planning a weekend in New York with my grandson, I wanted a location near Penn Station and the places we would visit - Aladdin on 42nd Street, Empire State Building, Times Square. Not only did this hotel fit the bill, but I was able to get a free room with Marriott Rewards points. And that lovely 2-bedded room cost 40k points, not the 80k points required by Hilton Honors for a free night in NYC that weekend! I loved the Aveda products in the bathroom, and my grandson loved the complimentary robe and slippers.  The staff was gracious and helpful, and that included a spot-on recommendation for dinner.  I will definitely return to this Renaissance hotel!

title: Fantastic Mid Town Property!
text:
We were celebrating a wedding anniversary so I wanted to ensure we had a very special trip to NYC.  This was a combined work and leisure trip...I chose this hotel based on the online reviews and that its a newer property in NY as Ive stayed in many others in the Marriott family over the years.  As a Marriott loyalist, and a fan of their newer brands of boutique type hotels, like this Ren, the Autograph Collection, Edition, etc.., I hoped this would be a great place to stay and experience the city. 
I was not disappointed!  Before I even arrived, I emailed the Guest Svc Manager and he helped me with some special requests to make our stay more memorable. 
I upgraded our stay to a suite w/ a balcony...if you want to see NYC like you've never seen it before with views of the river, skyline and surrounding areas, this is your ticket!  The room itself was beautifully and tastefully appointed- I'd say on the artsy side, but not overdone or gaudy.  We ate dinner on the spacious patio and enjoyed taking in the views of the city from the floor to ceiling glass all around the room.  

The room had all the touches you'd expect in a high end hotel...mini fridge, luxury soaps, fluffy towels, very nice bed and linens, and of course being a suite it had a nice couch and lounge chair.  The living area TV also had its own surround sound and BluRay player, but heck who's gonna sit around watching BluRays in NYC?  But in case you want to, its there!  Having an extra 1/2 bath was also convenient and I'd imagine if we'd have our kids with us, it would come in very handy.  The couch I believe also had a pull out bed, so I think it could sleep 4 for sure.

The public spaces in the hotel are equally beautiful...they do have an Exec Lounge but it was not serving food or snacks on the weekends, so keep that in mind if that's important to your stay.  We usually like the access to the lounge and we certainly got water and drinks, but it would be nice if they kept it open with all the services over the weekend as well...maybe as they get up to speed and get more requests for this, the management will consider doing this on weekends.  In lieu of the lounge food, the hotel gave me vouchers for breakfast at the Irish Pub which is in the hotel.  I was skeptical b/c over my 25 years of travel, getting a voucher for a bar in the hotel to eat breakfast has led me to some nasty buffets and cold eggs, but not so in this case.  Like the upper floors and lobby, the pub was nicely appointed, had a great breakfast spread and you could order off the menu as well.  My wife had the avocado toast with eggs and it was very tasty!  The special thing about the pub that made it fun for us was that it has a retractable roof that they open when the weather is good..since it was June we got to have breakfast al fresco...not something you get to do often in NYC, unless you find a bench in the park!  We like to hit the gym when we're on the road and there is a full service Planet Fitness attached to the hotel, included at no extra cost, and easily accessible and fully stocked to get in a light workout or pump some serious iron.  

Finally, the service, from my initial contact with the manager, to the front desk staff who checked me in, to the friendly and helpful bellmen out front, was all impeccable.  I'll add that the tone wasn't stuffy or contrived, but they seemed genuinely concerned and wanted to help make our stay memorable.  I've stayed in plenty of hotels that had so-so facilities , but the staff more than made up for that in service.  In this hotel, my experience is that you'll get a beautiful hotel and public areas along with exceptional, guest focused service that is worthy of the Marriott moniker.  Kudos to the management and staff and I look forward to my next visit to the Ren!

title: Great stay during Thanksgiving!
text:
So my review is a little late, as we stayed here Thanksgiving 2016...but we had a great stay.

4 nights 5 days in a room on the 29th floor. Hotel is new and has a modern feel. The room was small, but hey this is NYC...decorated nicely had a nice king sized bed, walk in shower with a etched glass that looks into the room. We had a great view of the NYC skyline from our room. We ordered room service one morning, food was great. Also enjoyed 2 of the bars in the hotel, great fancy drinks. All the staff were friendly and helpful. Can't beat the location in midtown, near the Macys and close to all subways. We would stay here again.

title: Quick getaway
text: This was our second stay at Renaissance in Midtown NY(Manhattan). I really love this hotel. It is located in the middle of everything. Just a few blocks from Times Square and 2 subway stops from The Village. The staff are friendly and the hotel is beautiful and clean. They have an awesome rooftop bar. After check in, we were given a ticket for 2 complimentary drinks each. We had room service on our 1st visit, which was great but a little pricey. I absolutely love this hotel and this will be my go to place every time I visit Manhattan for a getaway.

title: Great location and restaurant
text: We stayed here for 2 nights in June 2017 and really enjoyed the hotel. The rooms are relatively big by NYC standards and were much larger than most of the other rooms we've had in the city. The staff was very pleasant and check-in was a breeze. We had dinner at Rock & Reilly's one night and loved the atmosphere. The restaurant was very busy so service was a little slow, but we still enjoyed the experience. We would certainly stay here again.

title: What a great hotel
text: Working in this area makes this hotel even better.  The ambiance is remarkable - the staff helpful and friendly.  Newly renovated, the rooms are well appointed - and no noise from the street.  Near to Penn Station, you wont be disappointed.

title: A great find
text: Clean, contemporary, convenient, friendly.  Loved this hotel.  Two blocks from Madison Square Gardens and down the street from Empire State.  Euro sleek rooms, great views, very comfortable beds, awesome shower and bathroom.  Common areas very well done.  Ate at Rock and Reilly's.  Amazing space, with indoor and outdoor seating.  Place is packed.  Do not go without dinner rez.  Consistent with other reviews, yes, very noisy.  No way around it.  Great, friendly staff.  Hip, cool, tasty.  Went back later in the evening after a concert for a drink and it was sane and enjoyable.  Bar off lobby works well too.  We will go back to this hotel for sure.  We used points but $189 a night in New York is excellent.  Especially right next to Penn Station train.

title: Great hospitality for wedding hotel block
text:
I booked a block of rooms at this hotel for my wedding guests and we ended up filling about 25 rooms. Everyone raved about the hotel, and I personally experienced the most outstanding hospitality.

ROOMS. Gorgeous rooms with terrific views of the city. Rooms are in perfect condition and extremely clean, although small square footage (not unusual for NYC). Note that bathrooms have frosted panels between showers and beds -- great for a romantic couple, but intimate for friends!

HOSPITALITY. Justine and Ranie were both incredibly helpful to me. Justine helped me to pay for all my wedding party's rooms in advance of the wedding weekend, even though the accounting process took about 20 minutes, but her attention to detail was great! She made a point of saying hi to me when everyone checked in and was super helpful. My husband and I checked into a regular king for our wedding night, but when Ranie found out about it, she gave us a free upgrade to one of the luxury suites on the very top floor! She was overly hospitable to us as newlyweds -- we felt like we were treated like royalty. The rest of the staff was great too -- they brought up a stool from the bar for our makeup artist to use in the getting-ready suite and even retrieved a dress I left behind when I changed rooms.

ROCK N REILLYS. Very spacious restaurant was great for the morning-after brunch my in-laws hosted for about 20 of their family. Didn't have the food, but they were flexible and easy to work with in coordinating the event.

COORDINATING A BLOCK. My only complaint was working with Mashariki in the sales department to coordinate the block. She often did not return my e-mails and it was hard to get updates on how full the block was. But I imagine most guests are not working with the sales department, so this is probably irrelevant for most.

title: Fabulous hotel in great location
text: A lovely modern hotel with quirky designer accents everywhere. The staff were all friendly and very helpful. The room which was a sky view room was quite small which I know is normal for NY but had everything you would need for a comfortable stay. The bed was very comfortable with quality linen. Bathroom great. All in all an excellent hotel which makes for easy walking to either Central Park or downtown to Chelsea or little Italy.

title: Excellent stay near Macys at Herald Square
text:
When I first arrived at the hotel, I was surprised that the check-in lobby was on the 6th floor.  I guess for New York this was not unusual.  The check-in went smoothly and the clerk, Shadae,could not have been more accommodating or helpful. She recognized my platinum-elite status with Marriott and brough out a wheelchair I had previously rented through another company for my mom.The food at their restaurant was excellent and the staff very friendly and would go out of their way to please. The lounge breakfast however was a little disappointing as there were very few items to choose from. 
The breakfast at the restaurant though was very good with many choices. I had connecting rooms and the corner views of the city are wonderful.  The rooms are roomy with elegant, modern marble bathrooms. The best feature for us was the proximity to Macy's.  It was just one block away.  The location of the hotel overall is excellent. It is close to (within walking distance) Time Square and the theatre district. I will definitely be back!

title: My absolute favorite!
text:
It's around my 10th time staying here - and I can just say I'll always come back when I can. A beautiful gem with so much attention for detail that's hard to be found nowadays. The rooms are functional as I need on business, yet appealing with great views both towards Downtown and Midtown and very comfortable beds and practical working amenities. 
As a frequent traveler one of the most important things for me is the bathroom - and the Renaissance is just wonderful here, definitely one of the best hotel showers to find. Also here the attention in little details is very comforting, from the magnifying mirror offering different light settings to the simple fact to offer "real" power outlets, allowing me to use my own hair dryer compared to many other hotels which just have an outlet for low power shavers. 
I've always felt welcomed and over time recognized here. The whole team is determined and guest-oriented. 
Congratulations to running such a great place!

title: Great Staff
text: I stay in NYC often and have to say this was one of the best stays I've had in a while.  The doorman to the check-in staff to management are all too notch.  Hat-off to Joshua who goes the extra mile!  He really made our stay special.

title: People, people, people
text:
What makes a hotel stay memorable? Probably not the thread count of the sheets or the size of the TV, although these tings matter. What really counts is the people, because they make everything work. Marriott's Renaissance Midtown, on 35th between 7th and 8th (just two blocks from Penn Station) has great staff members. Yes, the higher floors have knockout views of the Manhattan skyline, yes, the rooms have a cool, edgy vibe, yes the elevators are fun. But when something slips, or when you need advice or assistance, it is the people who matter. We had two minor things go wrong, one a minor misunderstanding and the other something not directly the hotel's responsibility. In both cases, the desk staff's attitude seemed to be "let me do something to make this situation better--I may not fix it, but I can ease your distress." Part of the issue was power: the management trusts the desk staff to take initiative. Because no senior manager can be at the front desk or on the phone or in the lobby all the time. But hiring good, caring staff members, and giving them reasonable authority, extends management to the individual guest.

Good people make a good hotel, and the staff at Renaissance Midtown have made this one stand out.

title: Excelente opção
text:
ótima localização, quarto belíssimo, com mobiliario moderno e novo. Limpeza do quarto e banheiro impecável. Uma vista espetacular!
Pessoal bem treinado, atendimento cortez e profissional.
O hotel ainda conta com um bar lindo (com ótimos drinks, e tem tbem um pub com area interna e externa ampla, bem frequentado e com uma vista linda.

title: Beautiful Stylish Hotel
text:
I stayed here for 3 nights from Friday 19th May til Monday 21st May and was very pleased with this hotel. The staff were extremely professional, friendly and helpful which always makes the experience so much more pleasant. There are 4 lifts to get you to your floor so there is never a long wait so you can get from room to street level quickly and without hassle. We were on the 19th floor which didn't feel too high for my partner and I who are both a bit iffy about heights! Room was very stylishly and modernly decorated and felt spacious. I loved the white marble shower room and liked the frosted glass partition, although when it came to using toilet you did feel a little exposed although you couldn't actually be seen! The robe in the closet could have been a nice terry towelling one as when I went to use it after I'd come out of the shower I discovered it felt quite synthetic and bobbly like it had been used and washed many times. All other extras in the room were good though like the coffee and tea (a filter coffee machine is provided), the hairdryer was decent and the toiletries were Aveda. 

The bar area in the hotel is very nice and trendy feeling and gets quite busy at times (probably at the weekend) so there is a good atmosphere on a Saturday night. Decor throughout the hotel is of a really high standard and makes you feel like you're in a really top notch hotel. We ate in the restaurant one night but there was too much salt in my main (pasta dish with mushrooms and truffle shavings) so wasn't very impressed with this. My partner wasn't bowled over by his either.

Another word of warning is the bottles of water sold at the bar are extortionate! There is a small newsagent just two or three doors along so get from there.

Hotel is fantastically central, so for sightseeing and shopping this is an excellent hotel to be based. Macy's and Victoria's Secret are around the corner as is the Empire State Building. Times Square only a couple of streets away. There's a tube station at the end of the same street. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in NYC. I think there are probably larger grander hotels in the city but I liked this smaller more understated hotel.

title: Super Location
text:
This was my second stay at this hotel .  It is very near Macy's, Times Square  and Penn Station. It is a buzzing area with lots of shops and restaurants to choose from. Checkin was smooth and the rooms are modern , especially the bathrooms! The glass partition between the shower and the room  is a bit strange! The hotel has a tie up with Planet Fitness which is situated in the hotel. Bell Desk was very helpful with taxi bookings. I have stayed in a number of hotels in the area but I would rate this as one of the best! 

The A/c unit made a lot of noise otherwise everything else was great!

title: Unique Hotel with High Fashion Theme
text: The Renaissance New York Midtown has a great staff and unique high fashion theme throughout its decor. Located in the heart of Midtown Manhattan, it is just seven blocks from Times Square, two blocks from the Empire State Building, and two blocks from Madison Square Garden. The rooms are nicely decorated and sleek, and the beds and linens of course are top-quality Marriott comfort. The hotel has a nice lounge restaurant just below the lobby, and for Gold and Platinum members it has an concierge lounge for breakfast (Mon-Fri) and water and soft drinks 24 hours every day. "Rock & Reilly's," a very popular restaurant and bar, is located in the same building, but no noise can be heard in the hotel rooms. This is a fantastic place for anyone visiting New York to be in the center of it all, with easy access to the subway for excursions anywhere else in the city. I'd recommend this hotel to my family and friends, and will certainly be staying here again.

title: Incredible stay at the Renaissance
text: My mom, sister, and I stayed here for the weekend and absolutely loved it! It is in such a good area, close to all the major attractions, and  their customer service was incredible. Gaetano helped with our bags and helped us get around the city. We will stay here again!

title: 한인타운 가까운 위치, 객실은 조금 추운.
text: 한식이 그리워 한인타운 날마다갔는데 호텔이 가까워서 좋았어요 타임스퀘어도 도보로 10분정도면 가고 위치는 좋은데 객실은 아무리 난방을 최고로 올려도 쌀쌀해서 감기 기운있을때 좀 추웠어요

title: 科技與時尚的舒適旅館
text:
位置距離Penn Station僅僅一條街的距離，建議可以從後門進入旅館，周遭遍佈了餐廳、零售店面、咖啡店與百貨，距離各地鐵路線也十分的近，位置十分的優異。
旅館的設計是屬於些許時尚新穎，但又以舒適磚木質感為主軸的設計，同時應用許多的科技導覽工具（旅館入口門廊、Lobby等）進行導覽，進入Lobby後光線十分明亮與舒適；房間的設計也以同樣的風格導入，可惜由於住宿的樓層並未太高，要不然應可以有更美麗的窗景，床的軟硬度適中，尚稱好睡，整體來說是個還不錯的優異選擇。

title: Du bon et du moins bon, il faut savoir se débrouiller seul dans cet hotel quand on ne parle pas trop bien l'anglais
text:
Les points positifs, un hotel très bien situé sur manhattan dans midtown, à distance de marche de la gare de penn station, endroit par lequel nous sommes arrivées à New-York, très près des stations de métro sur plusieurs lignes permettant de bien rayonner dans manhattan. Une chambre spacieuse, bien équipée, au onzième niveau avec vue sur la ville en particulier madison square garden. Très bonne literie, chambre assez silencieuse pour une ville comme new-york.
Les points négatifs, un personnel peu hospitalier qui ne parle que sa langue, soit l'anglais new yorkais peu compréhensible pour des personnes ne parlant pas très bien l'anglais. (au final il a fallu communiquer par notes écrites en anglais pour se comprendre mutuellement, car malheureusement, il a fallu régler un problème par rapport à l'agence qui nous avait réservé la chambre, aucune personne à l'accueil dans l'établissement ne parlant  le français). aucune information sur le fonctionnement des différents services dans la chambre, (d'habitude on trouve un book qui explique différentes choses, les chaines de télé, l'accès à internet, horaires et lieux des petits déjeuners...) là rien, il faut allumer la télé ce qui n'est déjà pas si simple dans cet hotel, pour accéder à une chaine d'informations sur l'hotel, qui restent toutefois très sommaires. Beaucoup d'imperfections dans la chambre, des liseuses de chaque côté du lit qui ne nous n'avons pas su faire fonctionner, des vis fixées dans le mur de la salle de bains qui ont du soutenir un miroir probablement tombé non remplacé, un robinet du lavabo qui gigote dont il faut resserrer la bague par en dessous pour le consolider. La sensation d'avoir à se débrouiller seul dans cet hôtel, où il n'est pas nécessaire de passer par la réception pour accéder aux chambres ou aux autres parties de l'hôtel. Les seules personnes sympathiques et pour certaines parlant le français sont les serveuses du restaurant de petit déjeuner. Compte tenu de nos difficultés de communications avec le personnel d'accueil nous n'avons pas essayé de détailler toutes les imperfections de notre chambre, ça nous aurait faire perdre trop de temps. Nous avons été  plutôt déçu par cet hôtel, dont nous attendions mieux au niveau de l'accueil et de la qualité globale pour cette catégorie d'établissement qui se veux être plutôt de luxe, une sensation d'un côté impersonnel de cet hôtel.

title: Fire alarm nightmare at midnight.  Horrible customer service/communication
text:
Staying for a few nights but tonight was the last straw.  Here is the first issue....At midnight the fire alarm went off and we were woken from our sleep.  Staying on a high floor we didn't hear any announcement or communication from the hotel.  Only after we were all the way down was there an announcement that there was a malfunction and that announcement only came 20-30 minutes after the alarm went off.   Then the long wait came for an elevator.  We waited about one hour!!! Staying on a high floor we did not want to walk back up so we waited an hour for an elevator.  Again no one from the staff was there to communicate or help.  The echo friendly elevators the hotel has only made the situation worse.  I hope the hotel gives everyone a free night tonight as we lost 2 hours of sleep over this.

Now on to the second major issue during our stay...the service in the hotel restaurant.  Since we came on the weekend as platinum members the lounge was closed so we were given access to the restaurant.   We found what seemed to be 2-3 servers taking care of the hole restaurant.   On both days we had to wait until we were almost done with breakfast to be offered coffee water or juice.  On the second day they were setting up tables instead of taking care of guests.  Please hire more help for the restaurant.  This was a holiday weekend and service was horrible..   guests deserve better.

The lack of guest service and communication was clear from both of these incidents.  I hope the management takes notice of these major issues

title: Very Nice Hotel
text:
This was the nicest hotel that my wife and i have stayed since we started traveling traveling to New York. It was spacious and very nice. Staff was great and the location was superb for attending the Billy Joel concert at Madison Square Garden(MSG). All in all, a great spot. We were near restaurants, coffee shops and more......everything you need is within walking distance. 

 The biggest key is one block from MSG though....ideal place to stay for an MSG event.

title: Magnifique
text:
Séjour d une semaine dans cet hôtel idéalement situé non loin de Time square , a 2 pas de Macy's.
Station de métro Penn station à l angle de la 34eme .
La réception de L hôtel  est accessible par un ascenseur . Des La réception une très belle vue sur Manhattan s offre à vous .
Les chambres sont spacieuses et La
Literie très confortable , notre chambre bénéficiait d une grande baie vitrée avec vue sur la statue de la
Liberté et le bas de Manhattan 
Hôtel calme et silencieux
Nous reviendrons sans hésiter

title: Great Service, Excellent Location, Wonderful Hotel
text:
This place has it all going on.  Good restaurants located in the hotel as well as a Planet Fitness.  Very stylish decor and the property is less than a year old.  

Excellent concierge lounge.  Great patio/terrace bar service.  Extremely friendly staff.  

Can't say enough about this place.  Just excellent all the way around.

title: Nice!
text:
I've been spending a night here during a business trip.
My room at 15th floor was nice, quite, comfortable. The wifi working well.
The staff was helpful and kind.
Good the breakfast.
The price reasonable.
Recommended!

title: The place to stay in Midtown.
text:
Had another wonderful stay at the Renaissance Midtown.  Everything was at or exceed our expectation (with one tiny exception that I'll get to in a min). We were warmly greeted at check in and our room was upgraded. The room was clean, modern, bright and relatively spacious for New York. One challenge I have experienced when staying in NYC is finding a quiet hotel. I am a very light sleeper and hotels here are always a challenge. Rest soundly at this super quiet property!  Weekend breakfast is in the on site Rock and Riley's restaurant which was fantastic. Weekday breakfast (gold and platinum) was in the lounge. On Monday I did come down to eat around 8:30 and they were basically cleaned out. The attendant was very helpful and ordered more food and apologized. A whole new frittata came up soon and he let me know once it was ready. 

Summary: great property!  Great location! Very quiet! I will definitely be back.

title: Weekend at the Renaissance Midtown
text:
My husband and I recently stayed at the Renaissance New York Midtown and truly enjoyed it.  The hotel was clean, the staff was courteous, the vibe was great and the hotel was never overly crowded.  

I'm a Gold member with Starwood and I'm not sure if these little perks are available to everyone, but we got access to the Club Lounge which gave us access to free boxed water and other drinks as well as the choice of either free breakfast or additional points.  While the breakfast wasn't life changing, it was definitely good and included hot items like eggs, bacon and breakfast potatoes as well as the usual staples like pastries, cereal and oatmeal.

The other great thing about this hotel was the location.  While it was in kind of a busy part of the city, it had such amazing access to subway stations that we never had to walk more than a block to get to one.  It's also right next to Penn Station so if you're flying into or out of Newark the trip is just so much easier.  

One thing to note though is that we were in a King room and the partition separating the bathroom from the room itself was glass.  I'm not sure if this is the case for all King rooms, but it definitely would have been a little awkward if I wasn't sharing a room with my husband.  

I would definitely stay here again in the future and would recommend it to others without any hesitation.

title: Great location and service
text: When it comes to hotels I tend to be picky.  I have stayed at The Edition hotel off of Madison and the Carlton as well, both Marriott properties.  My expectations were surpassed with the Renaissance, Ranie Khemraj, went above and beyond for the weekend!  The entire staff was welcoming and warm.  I would highly recommend this hotel.  The location is perfect if you plan to take the city by foot, it's also close to Penn station which makes getting there inexpensive and easy.

title: Very good value in the middle of all the action
text: We chose this hotel mostly because of location and it offered a good rate at the time.  The hotel is located in the middle of New York's fashion district and near most all major subway lines. For Project Runway fans, you are very close to Mood! Lobby and common areas are attractive and well staffed. Rooms are pleasantly big by NYC standards. Comfortable bedding. Very clean. Attractive decor,. Nice to have a small refrigerator in the room. Very nice large shower. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend.

title: Wonderful, Fairly New Hotel!
text:
Stayed here for 6 nights. We arrived early at around 8am and room was not ready. While waiting for the room, we were offered coffee and water. We did not wait long and around an hour and a half later, our room was ready. 

Our room was located in the higher floors (26th). The city view was lovely. The room itself is very decently sized for New York. There are USB ports in every strategic corner of the room. As most have written, the bathroom may not be the best for non-couples but we were fine with it. The water pressure was good and the had a large sink area for two to get ready in. One gripe we had in US were air conditioning were not the best in most hotels. However, the air conditioning here was good and does actually cool the room. As New York is a very noisy city, you should expect the room not to be silent like a library. We weren't bothered by the noise at all. 

Housekeeping generally did a good job in maintaining the room during our stay. No bed bugs during our stay. 

Wifi is fast and reliable. 

Being a Marriott Gold member, we had access to the lounge for breakfast and standard drinks throughout the day. The breakfast was very good considering it's part of the Gold privilege. Bagel, croissant and bread were fresh. The 'cooked' dishes does vary such as chicken and waffes. The selection of non-alcholic drinks were great - coke, diet coke, sparkling water, water, chocolate milk etc. You can even have Chobani yogurt as a snack or for supper. Coffee is just your standard black coffee. They even have soy milk for your coffee. The only feedback we had was to label the different milks at breakfast.

On weekends, breakfast is served in the restaurant below with plenty of varieties again. 

Although we had little interactions, service from the staff at check in and check out were great. Always genuinely helpful. Check out was guaranteed at 4pm for Gold members and we had to remind the reception of this. 

Location-wise, very good in Midtown and walkable to most places like Times Square, High Line as well to the variety of subway stations. All the big names such as Starbucks, McDonalds, Shake Shack, Macy, Madison Square Garden, Walgreen (supermarket/convenience/pharmacy) are very close to the hotel.

If we come back to NY, we will definitely consider this hotel again!

title: A slow hotel in a fast city.
text:
The hotel was booked for a honeymoon trip. Whilst the room was modern and nice, there was:

-Blue industrial tape on the glass wall between the bedroom and shower - the take looked to be holding the glass panel up.
-We asked for extra towels - never got them.
-Upon arrival, the bell desk did not offer to assist with luggage in the slightest, but were very interested in looking at some ladies who were in their summer wear as they walked past the bell desk. 
-Shower pressure weak, spoke to guest services and they ignored it.
-The lady who was seating people at breakfast clearly did not want to be there and kept sitting guests far from the buffet even though we asked for a closer table.
-Housekeeping did not attend the room after the first night, we had to request for it to be cleaned.
-We asked for a feather free room as my wife has some sever allergies. the first night was fine, but after housekeeping came, the pillows were replaced with feathered pillows again and my wife had an immediate reaction.
-The elevators. Wow. Read the other terrible reviews and they all say the same there is a long wait and from the 33rd floor, it often took over 10 mins to get down to the lobby - it seems the elevators are programmed for electrical efficiency instead of guest convenience. One thing I will guarantee is that I will never host a corporate event at this hotel as staff would always be late.

In summary, this does not meet the usual Marriott brand standards.

title: Great Hotel With a Great Team
text: Highly recommend. This hotel got it right from the rooms to the decoration. The best part of the stay was the great staff that had a great attitude that was contagious. They staff made the hotel memorable and was the difference between a good stay to a great stay.

title: Best Hotel Ever!
text: Hands down one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in! Room perfect, clean and aesthetically beautiful. I love the hardwood flooring underneath the bed. The receptionists were very helpful and polite when we checked in at 11pm. Comes with a lot of amenities.The hotel stays true to its online photos. All in all one of my favorites. I will be back!

title: Buen hotel y buana ubicación
text:
La ubicación excelente, la habitación buena con vistas a la ciudad, el hotel moderno con paredes y techos de hormigón muy de moda, con un tamaño bueno para NY. El baño comodo y moderno y todo perfectamente limpio y ordenado. 

El personal de recepción impresentable (excepto Martha). No tenían nuestra habitación al legar a las 17:00 h (!!!) con cama King y nos dieron otra con dos camas Queen hasta el día siguiente. Cuando volvimos no estaba nadie del día anterior, y vuelta a empezar.... no nos preocupemos que queda arreglado. Por la noche gente distinta y otra vez a explicar, nos cambian de habitación y a las 22 me tengo que mover todo el equipaje y armarios yo solito porque no nos ayuda nadie (cuando nos dijeron que nos trasladaban ellos la habitación durante el día). Al marcharnos le pedimos mas tiempo hasta las 16 ya que nuestro avión salía a las 20 y nada de nada, que no, que hasta las 13 y a correr. Todas las personas que nos atendieron secas, antipáticas y nada serviciales.

title: Convenient Location - Newer, Nice Rooms - Reliable Experience
text:
Location is a big win here - the hotel is between 7th and 8th on 35th St so a short walk from Penn Station (where you connect to anywhere in NYC), Madison Square Garden and Macy's.  This is a newer hotel - the rooms are very comfortable with a modern bathroom and great shower.  Lots of plugs in the right places for all of your digital devices.  Robe and Slippers too. Nice lobby on 6th floor with bar.  There is also a popular restaurant in the building and many food options within walking distance.  

A few items that are a bit different:
- Frosted glass wall in shower - as others have mentioned, could be a bit awkward if you are sharing a room and modesty and/or privacy are important to you.
- Elevators - are the newer type where you select your floor before you get on the elevator - confuses many guests.
- No water or mini bar in room (at least not in my room)  - but there is a nice refrigerator.

title: Great Hotel but no WOW factor
text: The location of this Hotel is great, we were walking distance to all the shows and even had a view of the Statue of Liberty from our room (she was small, but still cool).  The lounge in this hotel is average and not very special.  In fact, it’s not open every day which bummed us out a bit.  The hotel had a lot of families on vacation in NY.  We stayed here to get away from our family for a bit and stay in the city to see some shows.  The lobby is a nice relaxing area with comfy chairs and has a small bar/restaurant where you can order food and drinks.  One floor down from the lobby is the main restaurant that can get quite busy.  I would argue that besides its location, this restaurant is the best part of this hotel. Although it met all the Marriott requirements for me, it most likely will not be somewhere I will be staying again. But still a nice hotel.

title: Nice experience in NYC
text:
We really enjoyed staying at this hotel. The location was great for shows, restaurants, shopping. Subway nearby. Being in the garment district was interesting. We were on a high floor with a great view of the city. We could also see into some type of garment industry building over the front entrance of the hotel. It was cool to see people working amongst racks of clothing and wondering what their latest creations would be. 
The hotel amenities were nice. We went to the Planet Fitness in the building. Enjoyed the nicely decorated lobby bar where we had great service. There's a very popular rooftop bar/ restaurant which was absolutely packed with hockey fans one night, so beware of Madison Square Garden event dates. The hotel staff was great. We would definitely stay here again.

title: Escapada de fin de semana largo
text:
Lindo hotel en buena ubicación . Cercano a Macys, Empire State y buena conectividad vía metro. Se puede caminar a Times Square ( 8 cuadras ). Las habitaciones modernas con ducha tipo lluvia, tv flat y decoración atractiva.
Buena atención ( aunque esperaba más para este nivel de hotel ). Restaurant medio en calidad y variedad. Tiene potencial para sacar mucho más partido. El gym en primer piso es de cadena independiente y me pareció regular. 
Tuve problemas con la alarma de incendio y ruidos del equipo de aire ...

title: Four days in New York
text: First off we really love the location of the hotel but we did ask for a quiet room and ended up with a room that had  construction going on down on the street ( not their fault )  but extremely loud and surprise she would put me on the loudest side of the hotel ( when I specifically asked to please be put in a quiet room ) !   At 10 pm when we got back to the room they sound from the grinding   Of the replacement of the street was so loud there was no way I was sleeping in that room !  I am a light  sleeper but hate to be a complainer .  I went to the front desk and she was nice enough to move me to the other side of the hotel .  We enjoyed everything else about the hotel location is great and close to Penn station we took it back to Newark airport with no problem ! Would definitely stay there again

title: Great business hotel
text: This hotel has a 5th-floor rooftop bar (open to the public), and another on 6th floor lobby. The rooms are big, but I have a slight beef with the frosted glass bathroom door: whoever is in the room can see the legs of whoever is on the can.

title: Great location and modern hotel
text:
The location is great, very convenient to shop in Macy's and few blocks to Times Square.
The room is nice and clean however is small size comparing to other hotels I've stayed in Manhattan. The staffs are friendly and helpful.
Recommend to stay here next time.

title: Great location, modern hotel with modern amenities.
text: Perfect for exploring NY - close to a subway station and walking distance to Times Square. Great in room features too - big TV, USB power sockets, coffee machine etc. We stayed for 7 nights and would definitely return.

title: Nice
text: I was in the city for an event and needed a place to stay with quick access to the train in the morning. This hotel is perfectly located for that and reasonably priced on top that. It is a bit on the trendy/hipster side for my tastes, but it is rather new so that is to be expected. The room was clean and comfortable. There is a frosted glass shower wall that can be seen from the entire room, as it is right next to the bed, may make you think twice about who you share your room with.

title: Trendy....Great Vibe..Happening Place
text:
I've stayed here a bunch of times and the hotel, the cleanliness, the vibe and the rooms are all top notch.

There are a few "weird" things about it I'd like to point out.  There are no upgrades to suites for Marriott Platinum members, which is a bummer...they say an upgrade is a higher floor.

The concierge level has great food.....but nothing is really hot...they have lamps heating the food (small quiche for breakfast)  so there's not the traditional breakfasts with hot food options.  The end of the day is popcorn, some salad and they do mix it up a little, again heat lamps which aren't the best for keeping anything warm.

Rock and Riley's is a great spot with good food.

Staff is friendly...not over the top helpful for the cost.  

I'll continue to look for the best property in the Empire State building area....I know I'll find it!

title: Shades
text: The hotel is great, very well located. However, have they ever heard of blackout shades? Waking up at 5:30 with the sun in your room is not the experience i'd want for my vacation... plus, the insistence of the doorbell to get one of their cars to go to the airport was very annoying and wonder if it's even legal.

title: Amazing Value Hotel In The Heart Of NYC
text:
I booked this hotel for 40,000 Marriott Points which is a great value for a Luxury NYC hotel. 

I was upgraded to a "City View King" on the 24th floor. It had a great view of Midtown & Times Square. 

The room was about 300-310 square feet and was very modern. The bathroom was HUGE for a NYC hotel. It had marble counters and a rain shower. The room had partial hardwood floors and partial carpet. There was a huge work desk with a smart 42-inch flat screen. 

I am a Gold Elite member so I had access to the Club Lounge. I was also there on a weekend so they didn't serve food, but it was very nice and large. It had a fridge full off juices, yogurts, and water. They have me a 2-person full buffet breakfast since they weren't serving breakfast in the lounge. 

Overall, this hotel was amazing. I am going to try to stay here every visit to NYC. I would give a 100/100. Exceptional hotel & service!

title: מלון בוטיק מגניב ביותר!!!!
text: מלון בוטיק יפה, מיקום מעולה, צוות נהדר ואדיב, מענה מהיר לכל דבר ועניין, שרות מעולה, החדר יפה ומרווח, החדר שלנו היה city view בקומה 32 נוף מדהים, המסעדה במלון מעולה וגם הבאר, הלובי נעים וכיפי, מומלץ ביותר!!!!

title: One of the more comfortable NYC hotels
text: There is much that makes this hotel work:  the rooms are large by NYC standards, the Midtown location is convenient, the food in the hotel is very tasty and the staff are efficient.  (They managed our conference well.).  I'd stay here again without hesitation.  Only issue?  The elevators can be very slow to arrive, especially at peak times.

title: Comodo, moderno y excelente ubicación
text: Realmente, una ubicación casi inmejorable, en el centro de todo, se podía ir caminando hacia el upper como el lower desde allí. La habitación impecable, muy linda, el tamaño justo, no muy grande pero bien. Cada detalle estaba cuidado, La habitación tenía una vista a la 34 y 7 ave, Se veía el Times Square. La limpieza excelente. Las camas queen eran justas en cuanto a su tamaño pero muy cómodas, la atención de todo el personal por demás amable y excelente, no tengo quejas sino palabras de agradecimiento. Te4níamos a disposición el el cuarto una cafetera, no faltaron jamás cartuchos para hacer el café, la heladera estaba genial, y el baño pese a ser vidriado -esmerilado-. era muy lindo y limpio, con todos los implementos para el aseo, y muy lindo, y si bien resta un poco de privacidad, no nos incomodó, por lo menos a nosotros, en absoluto. El hotel con un concepto super moderno, desde el llamado de los ascensores, hasta la decoración y detalles de cada uno de sus rincones. Sin duda volvería.

title: Ótima opção em Midtown
text:
Dificil apontar algum ponto ruim no hotel. Quarto confortável, cama excelente, chuveiro bom, relativamente grande para padrões de NYC. 
Pegamos um quarto com City View, que definitivamente valeu a pena (ficamos no 20o andar). Nos deram um quarto acessível, portanto o banheiro era enorme.
Wifi gratis, recebem encomendas sem cobrar (e entregam no quarto) e na unica pequena situação que tivemos no quarto resolveram rapidamente (a torneira da pia estava solta).
Fica ao lado da Penn Station, então ir e vir pra qqr ponto da cidade é facilimo.
Provavelmente ficarei novamente lá na minha próxima ida a NY.
Recomendo fortemente.

title: Spring break.
text: Loved the Renaissance Midtown. Easy to get to downtown, or uptown. The way only thing that was slightly odd, was the lack of a wall between the shower, and the beds. Not really the lack of a wall, but the lack of privacy. There is "frosted glass" but is still a little weird. Restaurant is AWESOME!

title: A funky set up/excellent experience
text:
A stone's throw from Macy's, Penn Station, MSG and walking distance to many tourist attractions, this hotel is simply a great place to stay.  The decor is interesting, there are lively bars in the building and a short walk away.  

I didn't care for the up-sell routine upon check in, the elevators are different and seemingly less efficient than normal ones, and the lobby is on the 6th floor.  The criticism stops there.  The room was well appointed, clean, with an attractive, modern industrial-ish design.

title: Ubicación y calidad perfecta
text:
Nos alojamos en la planta 21 y las vistas eran increíbles, las calidades son perfectas y la ubicación es maravillosa para moverte con rapidez por La ciudad teniendo varias líneas de metro en las inmediaciones. El mítico Madison Square Garden en la puerta, Empire State a 5' y Time Square a 10', tengo claro que volveré, y lo volveré a hacer en este hotel. 

Muy muy recomendable

title: OMG - out of this world!!
text:
We got in late (after 11pm, flying from UK) and the doormen helped us up to reception where we were quickly 'processed' and went to our rooms. (we travelled with friends who were on floor 10, we were on 9.)

When we opened the door to the room we were in awe, the room was perfect and the bathroom was very clean and modern with frosted glass door and wall to bedroom.

We ate in the restaurant the  first evening as we were still recovering from the flight and running VMLM on the sunday before. The food was good, a little on the expensive side but when you are whacked from everything it doesn't matter tbh!!

Our friends had a problem in their room with the shower leaking and they reported it to reception who dealt with it that day and relocated them to a higher floor (17) and gave them a drinks voucher for the trouble.

Huge beds, really comfy, great coffee machine, loads of huge towels, changed and made daily, rain shower/wet room style.

I cannot praise this hotel enough, it was fabulous and a few minutes walk from the chaos which is NYC! There is a fantastic pizza place around the corner which you could live on if you're on a more restrictive budget - portions are huge and about $4 a slice you just can't go wrong.

I cannot see how anybody could write a negative review about this hotel - just take my word for it, it's fabulous, book it now!!!

title: Modern Hotel in Midtown
text:
Comfy beds, cool bathroom, Aveda bath products, ice and water nearby. Hallways were a little narrow and walls a little thin-
Could hear people shutting their doors in the morning. Great view on higher levels and restaurant had good coffee (but had to pay for it) . I was actually pleasantly surprised with how convenient the location ended up being. The block is not super nice but felt safe.

title: My NYC Preferred Hotel
text: I spend a lot of time in NYC for on business and pleasure and stay at this Marriott when the planets align. I have tried more than a dozen Marriotts in NYC and this repeatedly has offered superior service and accommodations. I enjoy the vibe the lounge and the people. Flying in from SF on the red-eye and getting off the train at PENN Station entering the space is a nice welcome. I really believe this is a top notch hotel that has something for everyone. From a great location to solid food and beverage offerings, I am looking forward to my weekend stay for fun in May!

title: Excelente
text: O hotel vale muito a pena, ótima localização! Apartamentos novos. O preço é equivalente aos outros da região pois no valor da diária já estão inclusas as taxas e impostos! Não tem café da manhã, mas há uma geladeirinha para você armazenar frutas e sucos;)

title: Warm welcome!
text: We chose this location because of the proximity to the 'NYC International Auto Show'.  The room was a good size for a city hotel.  Clean and comfortable beds.  I loved the bathroom's shower and non-fog mirror!  However, didn't love the sliding frosted glass door on the bathroom.  A traditional closing solid colored door for privacy would be my preference, but we'd stay here again despite the door.  The best part of this hotel was the warm and friendly welcome by the hotel reception employee.  It was very refreshing to really feel like a guest again!  Thanks Joshua!

title: Great location
text: Nice hotel, great location close to all attractions in midtown.  Rooms are a good size for NYC, very cool elevators.  Modern, clean, a little eclectic.  We were given a skyline view room on a high floor and it gave us great views of the city.  We were not far off the elevator and it was still quiet.

title: Great hotel in centre of Manhattan
text: Rooms have great views of the city and its a really good location in the middle of town to explore from. We had room facing downtown and could see for miles, all the way down to statue of liberty. Bathrooms are beautifully done in marble and dark fittings. Service is good and price is high but nothing outrageous for Manhattan. Facilities limited, gym shared with Planet Fitness and no pool etc. Justin in guest relations is really helpful.

title: It's fine....
text: Not a huge fan of 30s mid-town.  Needed to stay there this trip because of proximity to train station.  The hotel was fine.  My king room overlooked 35th which is supposedly a city view.  Again fine.  Room was small and the walls are pretty thin.  I could hear doors slam and the tv in both rooms next to me.  (I was on the 27th floor).  The club area is nice and well stocked.  I don't think I'd come back unless it was for a quick business stop in mid-town.  Solid for one night if business.

title: Great location
text:
Pros:
~1 block north of Penn Station and Madison Square Garden, a few blocks from Times Square, lots of shopping and restaurants nearby
~Modern, clean, relatively spacious by NYC standards
~Very friendly and professional staff
~fridge, safe, coffee maker
~innovative elevator system that reduced wait times to mere seconds
~Relatively quiet
~free wifi, plus gym and restaurant on site

Cons
~lightly frosted glass-walled shower that looks out onto the bedroom plus barn door offered much less privacy than we'd expect for a bathroom.  Modern look, but not practical at all.
~we only had one bathrobe provided for a room with 2 people

title: Great getaway in the city
text:
From the minute you enter, the doorman is very welcoming and quickly directs you to the appropriate elevator to check in on the 6th floor. 
Having used the Marriott App to check in earlier, I thought I would be on my own, but the young lady at the counter, her name was Jadé, was very pleasant and accommodating. She got us on our way very fast. She made it a point to welcome us as Marriott Rewards Elite members.
The room is small, but very nicely appointed. We were upgraded to a Skyline view, on the 28th floor with a view downtown, you can see the Statue of Liberty in the distance, very nice. 
As others have mentioned, the bathroom shower is frosted but nonetheless see thru, so be mindful of who you are sharing the room with. 
I took a couple of pictures so you can see, I'm not sure if the panoramic will upload properly or not. There is a mini refrigerator and single cup coffee brewer, also a great JBL Bluetooth capable alarm clock, very nice.
I forgot to mention, at check in we told Jadé that it was our 25th Anniversary, upon return to our room we found 2 Fuji waters, snacks and a bottle of red wine, with a personal note from Jadé wishing us a happy anniversary, what a great touch!  I called her up and personally thanked her for the detail.
We are in town only for a night, but plan on returning soon!  Beautiful Marriott, great people!

title: AMAZING hotel
text:
I stayed at this hotel on holiday for 6 days and it really was amazing, I was sad to leave by the end because it came to feel like home.  The location is great, its very central in the middle of midtown, very close to Macy's and other major shops.  There is a bagel place across the street which is good for breakfast.  The lobby and bar area was my favourite part as it had a buzzing yet relaxed vibe, and the bar food menu was way better than most other hotels i've been to (make sure to order the garlic fries - they are honestly amazing!)

The staff are lovely and helpful.  In particular, Jade was very helpful at reception, and our waiter Shuba, at the bar was so friendly. The team even arranged a limo to take me to the airport, for the same price as a taxi!

The rooms are very comfortable, the beds are super cosy and the housekeeping staff did a great job.  The bathroom is equipped with Aveda toiletries and feels very luxurious, and the bathroom and rooms were modern and clean.  For a new york hotel, the rooms were more spacious than I had expected.

I would 100% stay here again when I next visit NYC.  It's one of the best city hotels i've stayed in!

title: Great Midtown location
text:
Great new property in midtown if you want ease of getting around NYC or close to Javits. I was there for work at Javits and the quick 15 min walk straight down the street was much easier than the previous location I stayed at over the years. The entire facility feels more on the boutique side of Marriott even more so than some of the boutique properties they have been opening. Lots of exposed concrete and raw materials throughout the facility. 

The rooms are on slightly above average for NYC - there is room to move around and still store your stuff. There is little to no storage though other than one hanging bar and no drawers other than the safe there. This is similar to a property I stay in Chicago at and not sure why they have chosen to switch to this setup - makes it hard for more than one person to have their stuff just on some shelves. 

The higher floor (38th) did still yield some street noise so would recommend higher if you can, the view was spectacular though, having a property look out towards the north unobstructed was really amazing. 

The other noise complaint would be the blinds on the windows, they were awkward to operate and you could hear your neighbors open and closing them they are so loud. 

I think this room is not really for families though(see picture) as the bathroom is only separated by a frosted glass and when the light is one you can still see quite a lot! Also I was getting up early for work 5 or 6am and turning the light on in the bathroom illuminates the entire room which was not ideal for my wife staying with me. 

Overall its a great location and well done hotel with a few quirks if you are solo or a couple would recommend but hard to imagine families staying here sharing the rooms with the privacy issues of the bathrooms. 

One last comment would be - would be great if inside the elevators there was a screen showing where the stops were on the trip up or down, many conversations were had where exactly the elevator was going after getting in!

title: NYC Easter trip
text: Hotel is in a great spot for exploring NYC - close to Penn Station and the subway so easy to get to/from JFK, the Empire State, Madison Sq Garden and Macy's are very close by and only a short walk to Times Square (7th Avenue is extremely busy!!) Staff are very personable and the facilities are good.  Despite asking to be placed in a quiet part of the hotel due to having kids, there were 2 seperate nights where we were disturbed by other selfish guests at 12.30am and 3am respectively - this isn't the hotel's fault though. Also the surrounding area below can be noisy at night but this is the city that never sleeps after all! Great little takeaway pizza place to the left when you exit the hotel as well.  Would recommend this for a break in the big apple.

title: Perfect NYC spot
text: Over and above service.  Really nice people.  Great restaurant/sports bar with extensive kids menu.  Comfortable rooms that were quiet and clean.  Huge gym. (Planet Fitness) Located near one of the best bagel shops in NYC.  Nothing but good things to say about this place.

title: Hidden Gem in the Midtown
text: This is the first NYC hotel that I would go back to!  I am picky, yet there is nothing to pick on at this hotel.  We arrived a little early for check in, the front desk was really nice to let us check in early because they happen to have a room ready.  It's on the 14th floor, with a view of the sky and Madison Square Garden.  The rooms are reasonable sized for NY standard, it has 2 Queen beds that fits our family of 4.  The room is clean and modern.  I really liked the bathroom.  It's the bathroom that I felt more comfortable than the one in my own house.  Almost wanted to copy the design for my future renovation.  Now, there was the location.  Awesome location!  Very close to everything yet not too noisy.  Both checkin and checkout are super easy, all done within 1 minute.  I would definitely go back if I am visiting NYC again!

title: Family Review
text:
This review is written specifically for families.  We are a family of four.  Our children are 12 and 10.  We were looking for a hotel in a central part of NYC as we had a daughter performing in a classical ballet competition with venues all over the city.  The hotel is very central and all subway lines are easy to access from this location.  The staff is helpful and the property is very clean.  Communication with the hotel prior to our arrival was quick and clear.  

Our flight to New York was delayed, so we checked in around 6 pm instead of our scheduled 4 pm.  The room we had booked with a skyline view had been taken out of commission so we were put in an 'accessible' room a few floors lower.  Accessible rooms, in general, are not an issue with us. We "moved in", went to a great dinner (Il Molino-highly recommend), and then washed up and got ready for bed.  There was a reading light in the room that would not turn off.  We called maintenance and they came quickly.  They disabled the light, while we sat in our pajamas.  The next morning the shower flooded the bathroom.  The floor is slanted the wrong way.  My husband quickly requested another room.  Fortunately, we were able to get the skyline view we had originally booked.  Views are absolutely wonderful.  We were on the 34th floor and still could hear city noise, so I suggest booking these high rooms, as the lower will be louder.  The next two days we had issues with the blinds for the room.  We had maintenance come in a total of three times to fix the blind issue.  Each time they were respectful and worked quickly, but it took three times to fix the issue.  None of this was a big issue with us.  The hardest part of our stay with this hotel was the set up of the room, and why we would not recommend this room set up for families.  The showers are separated from the sleeping area by a smoked glass wall.  You can see the person showering, which erases privacy.  Also, if you shower when someone else is sleeping, the light into the room is bright.  The door to the bathroom is also smoked glass, and while thick, you hear everything from the sleeping room. We did not visit the suites, and this might not be an issue there, but we didn't want our performing daughter sleeping on a sofa bed before competition so we chose the 2 queen room. Lastly, if you care about what your children see, elevator 4 has a scantily clad larger than life photo of a woman.  Our children are bombarded with this in all advertising, but having it in the place you stay can be offensive to some.

I will list both pros and cons, again, written with families in mind. 

PROS:
* Great location if you want to see the whole city.  It is central, thus it is in a very busy part of the city.
* Access to most subway lines is very convenient (especially if you have to walk in the rain).  We purchased a 7 day subway pass and practically burned holes in the card.  It was so well worth the money.  We were able to access the entire city and Brooklyn with this.
* Staff is helpful and, when called, reacts quickly. 
* Bell staff is knowledgeable and handles all your ground needs quickly.
* Hotel is clean.
* Request a higher room (skyline view) for a quieter room and for amazing NYC views.

CONS:
* Bathrooms provide very little privacy. 
* Room service leaves a lot to be desired.  While it is generally quick, the food (other than the children's grilled cheese sandwich) is fair at best. -- We had a child who was sick for three days of our stay so we utilized room service more than we like to!
* Maintenance.  While it may have just been our luck, we had two rooms, and both had issues.  Lights, blinds and drains being all of them.  They do respond very quickly, so that is the plus.

All in all, if we were traveling as a couple without children, this hotel would be highly recommended. The day of our check in the restaurant and bar were energetic and seemed to be the in place.  The decor is modern.  The set up (elevators, bar, lounge, interior design) is all cutting edge.  But, it really isn't a hotel I'd recommend for families.  We did enjoy our stay and do not have complaints, but this is a review for other families planning trips to NYC.

title: Hotel parfait
text: J'étais très méfiante étant donné qu'il s'agit seulement d'un 3 étoiles, mais honnêtement il mériterait au minimum 4 étoiles. La localisation est top. La décoration de l'hotel est très moderne c'est très sympa. Pour la chambre nous avons choisi une suite skyline avec salon séparé. Quelle vue!!! En soirée la vue sur les grattes ciels éclairés est fabuleuse!! La chambre est magnifique, confortable et bien décoré, tout est bien pensé. Le seul bémol que j'ai à faire sur cet hôtel c'est le ménage. Il y avait beaucoup de poussières à plusieurs endroits et je ne vous parle pas de la poussière entre le sommier et le matelas. C'est le seul point négatif, sinon l'hôtel était parfait. Ainsi que le restaurant et le petit déjeuner, c'était vraiment délicieux! On s'est régalé.

title: Best Value for money in NYC
text:
Firstly to start this review let's say what this hotel is not. It is not the most opulent and luxurious five star hotel money can buy. It is not a boutique spa type hotel. It does not a country style retreat feel with the finest of furnishings.
