It is very well appointed with nice modern decor - polished concrete ceilings, frosted glass walls around the bathroom, floor to ceiling windows for the fantastic view. 

It is similar to various business hotels but with a more friendly and personal touch. 

It is in a great location for Midtown. You can walk to Central Park (OK a long walk -  30 mins), Times Square, Empire State, Rockefeller, Macy's, Madison Square Garden, The High Line and so on.

It is two minutes from the subway to the rest of Manhattan and beyond. 

All of the staff were attentive and you did feel like a special guest as you arrived. 

The lobby bar, 6th floor, is a nice quiet zone to enjoy a drink, with a balcony for warmer weather.

Rock n Reillys, 5th floor, has a real post work buzz, up till around 11pm. We also ate in here one night. The food was great and Charlie, our waiter, couldn't do enough to help. The rooftop opens up to make this an open air venue when the weather is hot and you get a great view of the Empire State Building from the front of the bar. 

Both bars close at 12pm, maybe it's a European thing, but I quite like a hotel bar that stays open for residents all night 😀.  There are bars locally that are open till 1 or 2am. 

The room itself was spacious enough and the TV huge. The amenities were perfect for a short stay - large wardrobe, coffee/tea maker, fridge (for your own drinks - no minibar), hair dryer, USB charging points, blue tooth speaker and the wifi was great - strong signal and very fast even for the standard service. 

The bathroom was only separated by frosted glass, so I suppose if staying with a friend it could feel a little awkward. The sliding door in ours was slightly misaligned so it was a little difficult to close. From my point of view though, it is the little features like the frosted glass bathroom that make this place stand out a little from a very busy crowded market. 

The bed was beyond comfortable, and huge for a king size bed. 

We were fine with the lifts, we only  waited a couple of minutes one time. However I could imagine how they could be annoying at very busy times in the hotel. 

We never tend to eat hotel breakfasts, so we didn't try this. However the "MY Belly" menu did sound great, if not slightly expensive with the cost for room service added on top. 

Overall for the price, in NYC, this was amazing value for money and I would definite stay again on our next trip. If you want a comfortable, well appointed hotel close to everything in Midtown then this is definitely for you.

title: Modern, clean, comfortable and excellent location
text:
We booked this hotel for a long weekend at Christmas time and we did not know what to expect. We chose it because of the very convenient location - just a block away from Penn Station making it very convenient to navigate NYC with the subway and also go and coming back from Newark Airport.
We were pleasant surprised with the hotel. Very clean, comfortable and modern. 
We had buffet breakfast only one time during our stay at the Rock and Reilly's Irish because we had to leave early to go to Brooklyn but the food was very average, you better have breakfast in one of the many diners or cafés around town.

title: Modern hotel
text:
Went for our anniversary for 5 days to NYC. Stayed at the Renaissance, area is great. Really close to Madison Square Garden which was great because we went to see a Knicks game. Even better was that the Knicks actually stayed at this hotel, was pretty cool seeing a couple of the players in the lobby. 
Room was decent, super comfortable bed, and the view if Manhattan was ridiculously good. 
Ate at the restaurant in the hotel one night, Rock n Reillys, was ok. Not amazing. 
The lifts are a bit annoying too, would be good if they just had regular lifts tbh. 
All in all, this is a nice hotel in a great part of town. Would stay here again.

title: Great location, beautiful rooms
text: Came here with my fiancée for a weekend trip and was incredibly impressed with how new, beautiful, and clean the room was (and relatively spacious by New York standards). It definitely had a vibe that mirrors W hotels - modern, sleek, etc. Well-decorated lobby area and the bar/restaurant (Rock & Reilly's) was a good spot for breakfast. Every staff member was pleasant and helpful and the location was prime - while there's not much around the hotel itself (save for an amazing bagel place aptly named "Best Bagels") it is easily walkable to penn station, Times Square, Madison square park, etc. and we enjoyed not being directly in the tourist trap of Times Square anyways. As other posts have mentioned, the frosted glass divider between the shower and bedroom is something to be mindful of if you're sharing the room with others, but we didn't mind it at all. Access to planet fitness was great - much better than tiny hotel gyms. I was so impressed and we will be back!

title: Everything we wanted
text:
This Marriott property was exactly what we needed in exactly the right spot.  It's south of the craziness that is Times Square, yet close enough to walk to TS or any Broadway show.  The rooms were small-ish, but by NYC standards, quite roomy.  The bathroom is well equipped and clean, despite not much privacy with glass shower wall and glass bathroom door.  It's not a big deal, but worth noting if you need privacy with another guest in the room.  We didn't need that, so the kids thought it was cool!  The bar is off the side of the lobby and present, but nothing memorable.  The club lounge is on the lobby floor and is just right.  Well stocked, convenient, and welcoming, it is a must for families with kids.  

Hotel has access from 34th and 35th streets, which is easy for Uber or taxis.  There's a Starbucks and a local pastry place across 35th street that make breakfast easy.  

Nothing but great things to say about this place.  Was perfect for my family of 4.

title: Excelente
text:
Eu, meu marido e meu filho (ainda na barriga!) estivemos em Nyc em outubro de 2016, nos hospedamos no Renaissance Midtown e simplesmente amamos! Hotel muito bem localizado (próximo ao Madson Square), dá para ir a pé para vários lugares e tem também as estações de metrô com as linhas que vão para qualquer canto de Ny. Além da localização o hotel se destaca pela estrutura e arquitetura; é bem novo e tudo muito bonito e moderno. Quando você chega no térreo nem parece uma recepção de hotel (e na verdade não é), pois você precisa pegar um elevador (mais moderno que já conheci) para ir até a recepção. Muito legal! 
O atendimento é muito bom, ágil e eficiente. Não tomamos café no hotel, mas há dois Starbucks muito próximo e uma outra lanchonete para tomar café (Andrews). Indico bastante esse hotel, e quando voltarmos a Ny com certeza nos hospedaremos nele novamente.

title: Excellent
text: Excellent staff everyone extremely friendly and helpful!! Room view was fantastic room very clean!  Restaurant and lounge wonderful as well! Will be planning a trip with family definitely staying there!!

title: Modern, Comfortable, Classy
text:
Every time I come to NYC I try to stay in a different hotel, but after staying at the Renaissance NY Midtown, I don't think that's going to be the case. I'm definitely going to come back to this one! 

The room was large by NYC standards with an equally nice-sized bathroom. The sheets and comforter were soft and cozy, there was a closet and a mini-fridge, a chaise lounge, and a very neat shower. (Note: The shower is visible from the bed through frosted glass. It's private but depending on your travel companion situation, keep this in mind.) The very cool lobby was on the sixth floor and everything was accessible by digitized elevators. I rarely had to wait! 

The hotel was far enough away from Times Square and Broadway to not be hectic, but close enough to walk there in under 10 minutes. Close to Penn Station, Madison Square Garden, Herald Square, and a really great boutique coffee shop.

I ordered room service my first night and was impressed at the quality and taste of the burger and fries. Usually room service food is sub-par, but I ate almost the whole thing. The next morning my breakfast never arrived, and because I was on a strict schedule, I couldn't wait. The staff apologized profusely and invited me to grab a bite in their Club Lounge, which was great. Mistakes happen, but it's how those mistakes are handled that tell me a lot about a place, and I felt they did a stand-up job.

When it was time to leave, the bellmen were more than helpful, arranging a private car that would save me time and money, especially since many flights were being cancelled.

I stayed for two nights and plan to book here the next time I'm in the city.

title: Close to penn station, modern
text:
Stayed 2 nights. Great for people who will be staying near penn station- only 5-7 min walk from the station. 

Next to planet fitness. Lobby is on the sixth floor- elevator operates based on a touch screen- just press the floor you want to go to and the screen will tell you which elevator to get on. Do not hop into just any open elevator because there is no buttons to select a floor inside the elevator.

Check in time is at 4pm but if there is a room available the hotel will let you check in early ( I checked in at 1pm). I appreciated all the visual artistic touches at the hotel. 

Stayed in a room with king bed, at room 1120. Not much of a view- office building was right across from the room. Pretty spacious and modern. Bed was very comfortable and so were the pillows. Hotel uses aveda products. Pretty quiet. Did not use wifi but hotel does offer free wifi. Has central air!

No free water so buy your own bottled waters( do not buy at duaneread stores- go to either cvs or asian grocery stores nearby like hmart on 32nd st or near the new york public library there is a japanese grocery store). If you want slippers bring your own. Toothbrush/paste bring your own. 

I would come back to this hotel in the future and recommend it to others who are visiting nyc-- but i would not come here with my parents or grandparents because it is little too modern/non- traditional feel for older/conservative/traditional guests. I also do not think i can share a room at this hotel with my friends or brothers because bathroom was somewhat see-through.. you can only see shadows of the person taking shower from the bedroom.. but still.. i would not feel comfortable.. but of course this is up to each person's level of comfort. 

Giving 4 out of 5 because the room was not 100% clean at the time I entered the room ( previous guest must have spilled champagne or some drinks on the counter below the TV and that area was so sticky- I had to clean the area before placing my bags on the counter).  Also a hotel employee knocked on the door and before i could open the door he just opened the door himself thinking no one was in the room ( I think he thought something had to be fixed in the room) not his fault for trying to get into the room to fix stuff... but I was surprised to see him just open the door before I could answer/ open the door myself.

title: Excellent Hotel!
text: This is absolutely a 5 star hotel! We stayed last weekend and were amazed by the excellent hospitality provided to us. The food is delicious, the room is clean and beautiful, the hotel is exquisite itself. The staff were professional and courteous, a big thanks to Wilfrid Jacques and the GM, David D. went above and beyond to make us happy. We will definitely come back again. Thanks for everything.

title: Superbra
text:
Mycket bra läge och väldigt fina rum med helt okey standard för prisnivån modernt rent och,snyggt - sköna sängar och mysigt badrum - mottagande och service kanske det bästa absolut toppnivå - mycket bra service utan att vara påstridig.
Fri internet som faktiskt funkar och gym som ingår - så rekommenderar

title: Jury's still out on this -- could be a 5 star experience but....
text: This would have been a 5 star review. Property was amazing, new, clean, great views and at the time great staff. The location isn't my favorite but very convenient to the Javits Center (I was there for a show). The problem? I had used Rent the Runway and gave the dress to the front desk to send back. They didn't get it to UPS until almost a week later which resulted in a $250 late fee from RTTR that I had to pay. My travel agent is still trying to resolve, but it left a bad taste in my mouth. When traveling for business in a high pressure environment you do look to the hotel staff to help alleviate stress and assist with things like mailing a package. I hope they make good on this.

title: Terrible Hotel
text: This hotel is very bad and I do not recommend staying here. My family and I were barely in the room because we were out in the city , but when we were we were troubled with bugs flying around all the time. Even after requesting for the bugs to be removed, I was given a response from a hotel worker that was very disrespectful and she claimed "there are no bugs." Also the security guards are more interested in the events taken place at the hotel rather then the customers security and well-being.

title: Fantastic Hotel!
text:
Our team of 20 editors and publishers stayed at this hotel for Vision Expo at the Javits Center and we were thrilled with the staff’s excellent service and all of the amenities and services at this property! 
Thank you for a wonderful experience...We will be back for sure!

title: Events more important than hotel guest
text:
A real shame. This a is a fairly new property that I have stayed at several times. The location isn't great but the rooms are actually well designed. Great beds, interesting bathrooms (wall of glass between shower and bedroom, frosted slightly for the modest), great water pressure, tv mounted in the right spot, perfect blackout blind. Many positives. On the routine negative side (I'll get to specific negatives in a bit), the elevators are a mess - there are three (the fourth only runs between street and lobby) elevators for 30+ floors. They are 'external call group managed' elevators - meaning you request a specific floor before entering an elevator and are told which car to board. Slow and confusing is the only way to describe them - and I have stayed here several times. 5 - 10 waits are not unusual.

Another routine complaint - the small concierge lounge is always too crowded. Worse, the breakfast offerings in the lounge verge on the pathetic. NO HOT FOOD!!! Cold hard boiled eggs, cold bacon, and a selection of warm yogurt, etc. The 'featured' item every day I have stayed here over five visits is sad little chicken and waffles under a heat lamp. Truly disappointing.

Now for this specific visit: the hotel booked a large event. An event they simply do not have the resources to support. They closed the concierge lounge to hand the space to the event - displacing their most loyal hotel guests. The alternative provided was an ante-room on a different floor with no seating, poor lighting - and again no service, hot appetizers. Extremely disappointing.

And for the true deal breaker - because of this event (which the property's size and access could not support) it took 20 minutes to get from the street level to,the 6th,floor then 13 minutes to get to my room on the 10th floor.

The response from management was unsatisfactory. I am Life Platinum Marriott Rewards member for more than 15 years and still booking more than 100 nights a year yet my complaints were dismissed by the Director of Guest Relations. Clearly this property values an event customer over all of their hotel guests.

I will not be a customer of this hotel again.

title: Incredible hospitality
text: My significant other and I stayed at this hotel to celebrate his big birthday recently. I was impressed from the very beginning when the Director of Guest Services wrote me to ask me personally how he could make my stay more enjoyable. After giving him my request, he forwarded my note to the concierge who also wrote me with suggestions for my stay. When we arrived, we were greeted by a very friendly bell staff and made our way upstairs to check in. The reception staff was extremely helpful and made us feel special and that they truly cared about our stay. We were given free drinks and snacks to celebrate the big day which was extremely thoughtful of them. The room itself was beautiful. We upgraded to a skyline view and had a corner room that made us feel that we were in the clouds! The bed was perfect and the staff filled my pillow request. Everything about the room was classy. The elevators took you right to your floor without stopping which was very convenient. This hotel is midtown and convenient to everything in NYC. We were close to Times Square, Herald Square, Madison Garden, Macy's, and the Empire State Building. The subway was a very short walk so we were able to get downtown in no time at all. We never ate at the hotel so I can't comment on the food but the open bar area was quite nice and the bartenders made great cocktails. This is a very reasonably priced hotel with great service in NYC! I look forward to returning!

title: Real Cool Hotel and close for everything
text:
Nice Hotel, good beds and beautiful bathrooms. Very clean and innovattive, very good elevators systems . Love it 
Very good bar area and very good personal. This hotel is very closed to everything in Times Square

title: Great location, thoughtful details in design, helpful staff
text:
I had a great experience at the Renaissance. Although I chose it primarily based on its prime location literally across the street from Penn Station, I was really impressed by the facility, the room, and the staff. At check-in, Joshua was very helpful in getting me oriented to the amenities within the property and having me on my way to my room quickly. As requested in my Marriott Rewards profile, he put me in a room on a high floor with a relatively nice city view. (If you, like me, prefer very quiet hotel rooms, you may want to ask for a room that does *not* face 34th Street.) 

The room itself had a nice, transitional/modern-minimalist style, with interesting art pieces and a mix of materials and patterns. There were more than ample standard and USB plugs placed thoughtfully throughout the room, and the lay-out of the room maximized its function within a limited footprint. The large shower, with a combo rainfall shower and hand-held wand, was a great touch. The bed was comfortable, and the blackout blinds did their job. 

Although I didn't take advantage of it, the room service menu seemed to offer lots of options at reasonable prices. 

If I need to return to this neighborhood again, I absolutely would not hesitate to check in here.

title: Best Hotel Experience in a LONG time
text: We stayed here for 4 nights over spring break with our two teen aged daughters.  I cannot say enough wonderful things about this property.  Each and every experience within the hotel was on pointe and beyond our expectations.  Service was friendly and professional from the bell stand, to check in, to concierge, to the bar, room service, club lounge.  EVERY PART of this stay surpassed our expectations.  Rooms were clean, spacious, and beds were comfortable.  Only opportunity for improvement would be to do away with the frosted glass bathroom wall and the sliding frosted glass doors.  We moved rooms due to lack of privacy to a room with a tub/shower combo, but the bathroom door was still frosted glass and did not close tightly.  In a room with more than a king bed there is the risk that a higher level of privacy in the bathroom would be appreciated.  Other than that this is the perfect hotel, with a great location and outstanding service!!!  Thank you, Marriott Mid Town for a wonderful stay!

title: Very Nice Hotel and Friendly Staff
text: During a recent business trip, I spent three nights at Renaissance New York Midtown Hotel and it was a great experience. I enjoyed a great view from a very nice room. The staff were very friendly, professional, and helpful. Passing staff in the hallways, elevators, etc. always included a friendly greeting and inquiry if they could do anything to make my stay better. I definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Great people, good location
text: It was fairly busy, though we were in town for a convention so that was to be expected.  Even with the masses of people, the staff were polite and, though they forgot our room-service order one night, upon calling them a second time they apologized profusely and made the whole order complimentary.  The hotel is within walking distance to the Javits Center (about a 12-15 minute walk) but is a bit difficult to get to with a car.  They DO have a valet service ($55 / day) and there are several places to eat within walking distance.  The restaurant on the 5th floor was pretty good and prices were reasonable (for NYC).  Rooms are par for the course when it comes to NYC, maybe slightly larger than expected (we stayed in the Skyline room, which offered nice views of the city skyline).

title: very nice!!
text: This is a great hotel in a wonderful location to roam around NYC.  It's within a block from multiple subway lines.  The people are friendly and helpful.  Concierge lounge was quite nice as was the restaurant on the 5th floor.  I would definitely go back.  However, I would definitely not use their valet car service as we had to wait about an hour to get our car delivered.  I believe self park is within a 5 minute walking distance so I would recommend that option if you have a car.

title: Nice stay, exceeded my expectations
text: Everything I needed was catered beyond my expectations. Aveda products in the bathroom were a nice touch on quality. Quiet room. Nice view through the window. Convenient location and helpful staff. Would stay here again.

title: Best smile in NYC
text: In town for a few days for Spring Break with my daughter.   Stayed at another hotel last night and just checked in with Mishka-- who had the best smile and personality of anyone we've come across yet in NYC-SHE made our day!  We also have a really cool room with an amazing view....!  Would stay here again and I highly recommend.

title: Nice property with great staff
text:
I'm in Manhattan frequently for work and have stayed all over the island. I chose this hotel because of the proximity to a conference since I typically do not choose this neighborhood because of the constant crowds. 
This is a very nice property and the staff proactively reached out to me before my arrival and offered assistance should I need anything.
A unique feature of this hotel is that the "fitness canter" is literally the entire adjacent Planet Fitness. That was nice.
The Lounge had mediocre food services but had a couple of things that I really liked. 24/7 access to a more than typical selection of beverages and snacks. Every flavor of San Pelligrino sodas, yogurt, milk, etc. The second thing I really appreciated was that the breakfast service had real New York bagels.
My room was nice and the TV let me mirror my iPad onto it.

title: A great business hotel
text: This is the perfect business hotel for me.  It's relatively new, clean, nice bathrooms and shower, nice TV and comfortable bed.  The restaurant is nice as well.  If it's close to your business location, this is the best hotel option in the neighborhood.  The staff is well trained and polite as well.  I definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Great hotel in midtown
text:
Located just outside Penn Station in the garment district, this hotel is the closest Marriott accomplished in its endless pursuit of recreating a W. With lots of exposed concrete and bass-heavy ambient music, it still offers ultra-modern comfortable rooms and great service. The rooms are decent sized for New York, with a nice shower, fridge, safe, and sufficient closet and cabinet room. The workstation is good and the Internet speed is pretty good. I managed to get more done when on VPN, as Marriott appears to throttle speeds based on the application being used.
The gym is a large Planet Fitness facility. 
While sufficient, it is a letdown compared to the hotel's overall style and design -  especially in comparison to excellent Renaissance properties like the one in downtown Washington DC. Also irritating are the elevator controls - you choose your destination floor before you get in. But somehow, unlike other places, at the Renaissance understand which elevator to take is just confusing and unnecessarily so.
The concierge lounge is excellent: breakfast and dinner there is both tasty and beautifully presented. Fantastic job for the team.
The onsite restaurants are fairly good but unless you are stuck in the hotel during a snow storm (like I was) - why on earth would you eat there - you're in NYC?!
This is my new favorite in New York and should be yours as well.

title: Staff couldn't be more helpful
text: I have to say the staff at this hotel, especially front desk and concierge couldn't be more helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel to families, couples or people traveling on business. Location couldn't be better, this hotel is a must.

title: Modern Hotel, Good Location
text: Stayed at the Renaissance Midtown for the first time.  The Hotel is new, modern, rooms extremely comfortable and attractive.  We had a King size room with window that opened to 35th street.  Great bed and linens, high tech, spa like bathroom.  Even though this was a typical "New York size room" it felt spacious.  The multiple lounge/bar areas and restaurant are clearly a destination for the 30 something crowd.  Easy access to Penn Station and multiple subway lines.  Midtown is a little less hectic than Time Square, but there is still the ever-present street noise.  The only think a little odd about the room is that there were no drawers for stashing clothing, two shelves in the closet seemed to be the solution.  Would definitely stay here again.

title: One night business trip
text: Stayed at this hotel because of it's location. The hotel is very modern with a funk elevator system but still efficient. Rooms were classic NYC size hotel rooms but they offered a lot more than most. Great bed, killer shower, great decor. Overall excellent hotel.

title: An Oasis in the Penn Station area
text:
First of all. LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION.  I could see the lights of Broadway from the corner of 35th Street and 7th Avenue (see photo) which is the corner from the hotel entrance.  The hotel is across the street from Penn Station at the rear entrance, a block away from Macy's and Madison Square Garden.  Starbucks at the corner and a Bagel/Breakfast place across the street - get up early, the line gets long.   Yes they do have valet parking although, like all NYC establishments,..expensive.  
Next - The VIEW of MSG and Penn Station is amazing any time of day(see photos) Did I say amazing?  AMAZING!!
The Room is well furnished, even electronically covered with plugs for one's device. The Bathroom with the frosted glass door is a nice touch.  The Shower is soothing..paying special attention to the shower head.  The lighting is good inside the bathroom.  
The Bar on the 5th floor opens to a balcony with also a fantastic view of 34th Street and Penn Station.  At the time of our stay was closed.  The elevators could be slow but that would take a big renovation.    We stayed at a corner room which was very very nice.
I must commend the entire staff. From the Doormen all the way to the Front Desk Staff.  All Friendly and with a lot of advice on where to go.  I feel my family and I are safe with the doormen.  The Staff at the front desk were fantastic!!  Much kudos to the gentlemen and ladies manning The Front Desk during the early afternoon.
By the way, The Front Desk and Lobby is at the 6th Floor.  The Restaurant and Bar called Roc N Reilly is on the 5th Floor.
This will be our "go-to" hotel whenever we are in the city.  Its like a Refuge from the hustle of NYC.

title: good
text: Best choice in the Penn Station, MSG, neighborhood.  (I've stayed at the Affinia and several others in that neighborhood.)  It's fairly new and perhaps best of all, has good soundproofing enabling sleep in an otherwise noisy area.  The rooms are lovely, including the bathroom and shower.  All new and nice amenities.  Pleasant staff.  Only drawback, which I heard others complain of more than experienced myself.  As with most Marriott upscale hotels, the elevator system is where all the controls are outside the elevator and the system is not good.  I heard of people waiting 15 mins at busy times for an elevator.

title: A Refuge from the madness ( well almost)
text:
We stayed here at the end of August last year fo 8 days. We had a high city view room which was superb.
Each night we never tired of the view.
The reception staff were lovely very friendly and always keen to help, just great.
The rooms were well equipped all be it a little weird. I was convinced they had not had time to finish the rooms before letting them as the ceilings were bear concrete and the wallpaper was missing in parts exposing rough concrete. Little did I know this was deliberate! Hmmm distressed concrete as decoration, oh well, that's New York I suppose. 
The bathroom just wonderful except it's a glass wall between it and the bedroom!! Yikes it's a good job we had been together a long time but we still had to step out while one was in the bathroom. Another thing the bathroom door slides but does not completely close leaving a half inch gap, need I say more. Guess I'm not quite hip enough for New York. Change this and despite the concrete it would have got a resounding approval.
Noise from the landing, most of the nights we had a good restful sleep but one night we had a totally broken night as the service lift was opposite our room having requested a room away from the lifts. All we heard all night was the lift bell ringing knocking on doors Fromm room service and when I investigated at 3 am the door to the service lift had been wedged open so the noise was much louder than it should have been and it looked like people had been moving laundry and such like. Altogether that night was a nightmare.the floor was full that night and that might account for the noise but who knows.
We are gold card holders so we had access to the executive lounge which was fairly good although at times staff did not appear to know what they were doing.the hot water heater marked hot water only had been used for coffee so a decent cup of tea was impossible, back to the room for the kettle. We waited half an hour one day for someone to get us hot water not tainted with coffee. I suppose that's the penalty for being a Brit. The food was  not bad providing you were not veggie otherwise it was a bit limiting but it was the same thing every day which if you were only their for a few days was fine but not so good  for a week. Plenty of ice cold water and soft drinks though although not too many diet options.
Location wise the hotel is opposite Penn station and a few 100 yards from Maceys so you are right in the thick of it. The problem we found was that Maddison Square Gardens was above Penn Station and our room overlooked it. A tea dance is held each night, it starts about 7 pm and the noise despite the height of the room was very intrusive we were worried it would continue all night but thankfully by 10.30 it all stopped.Its a shame they don't tell you this at reception when you book in rather than leaving you to think what have you let yourself in for. Still if you read this you will know not to worry.
All in all we had a lovely time at this hotel despite the grief mentioned above. The reception staff were lovely and tried their best to assist you . That's a good recommendation for the management. The staff in the restraint were great and the food was good so all in all it was a good experience. That said for me I don't think I would go back  but that's really because I would prefer being closer to Central Park or Times Square rather than the  centre  and we found the Hyatt at Times Square much quieter when we stayed there the previous year. 
All in all it was a lovely hotel once you take out the disturb au on one of the nights and if you want to be in the centre it's a good location, just make sure you know the person you share with extremely well in view of the bathroom.

title: Few hiccups that they attempted to compensate
text:
Really great location near Penn Station.
As far as NYC hotels go, the room was adequate size.
A bit upset that we couldn't check in early...or even at the allowable time.  They did compensate us with drinks.
Bar prices seem high, even for the location, but maybe I'm wrong.
One night we had water flowing from the light fixture in the bathroom ceiling.  Created a minor inconvenience, but we were again compensated.
So yes, there were some snafus, but they tried to make it right.
I really enjoyed the location being so close to penn station, subways and a short walk to times Square.

title: Great Hotel in a Great Location
text:
My fiancé and I traveled to New York to see Eric Clapton at Madison Square Garden.  In searching for hotels near the Garden we came across the Renaissance Midtown and chose to stay there for a three night stay.  The place was perfect for our trip and the type of facility we enjoy.

It's conveniently located a block form the Garden and Penn Station.  That turned out to be great because we were meeting friends for the show that came in via train and it was really convenient for everyone.  Its also about two blocks from 5th Ave. so we were able to spend a day walking along 5th and seeing Rockefeller Center, Tiffinay's, Sacs, etc.   One of the things we really wanted to do was visit the September 11 memorial and the new 1 World Trade Center (Freedom Tower).  That was only about a 20 minute cab ride from the hotel and a very memorable experience.

Our room (#811) was amazing!  We decided to get a room with a terrace and #811 exceeded our expectations.  The terrace was very large and nice with lots of seating  and a table.  The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was modern and nice.  One caveat...the wall between the shower and main bedroom area is glass.  Although it is frosted and steams up when the shower is on, that may make some uncomfortable.

The hotel personnel were fantastic and very helpful.  I wish I had got their names so I could give them the credit they deserve, but a few stand-outs were the woman that cleaned our room.  I think her name was Sadie or Mercedes, but she did a great job.  The bar tenders in the lounge on the 6th floor were also outstanding.

We will definitely stay at the Renaisance Midtown on our next trip to NY.

title: Good location, modern accommodations, rooms small and need tweaking
text: The location of this property is great...right by Macy's Herald Square.  The accommodations are modern and fairly nice.  There are some things about the room that need to be addressed:  no storage for folded items, shower has frosted glass with no privacy, bathroom is poorly lit.  LOTS of street noise (it is Manhattan, afterall).  We had cocktails in the lobby bar during our stay, which was decent.

title: Fabulous Midtown Property
text: We couldn't be more pleased with our stay at this property.  I chose it based on outstanding reviews on TripAdvisor and Yelp, and the reviewers did not let me down.  We had two rooms. Our teenage daughter brought two friends on the trip.  Justin helped arrange for us to have rooms on the same floor and linked our reward and cash stays into a single reservation.  He gave outstanding service.  The hotel has a central location.  The decor is trendy and modern.  The rooms were spotless and well-appointed.  Even beyond the beauty of the property, the highlight  is the excellent staff.  The staff at the front desk were always friendly and helpful. The navigators gave excellent advice.  This is a smaller property, and we felt like we got to know the staff during our stay.  The concierge lounge is very comfortable and well-stocked. My husband appreciated having a real gym available to use.  We typically stay in Times Square, but my husband liked this much better. We were in NYC when a major snowstorm was expected.  The hotel was well-equipped to handle any situation.  Loved our stay.

title: Great Renaissance, very good location!
text: We have been to this location twice in the last year.  Both times were awesome.  For platinum members the lounge is nice but crowded at times.  It is closed on the weekends but you can elect the breakfast in Rock & Rileys which is a full buffet for 2.  I would recommend choosing that over points as it is a very good deal!!

title: Great hotel, great location!
text: We stayed at the Renaissance for a quick week-end trip to NYC.  We arrived around 11 am Saturday morning and to my surprise were able to check in right then.  The staff was extremely friendly from check-in until we departed.  The hotel is extremely clean and has a cool vibe.  The rooms are a bit small, but most rooms in NYC are, so that is to be expected.  The room was very nice though and had everything we needed.  We also had a good view from our room, not just the wall of another high-rise. The hotel is also in a great location.  We arrived at Penn Station, walked a few minutes and were there.  It is also a quick walk uptown (maybe 25 minutes to upper East Side) and downtown.  The subway is also right down the street. We were able to leave our bags downstairs at check out and picked them up at 8:30 pm in time to catch our train home.  We had the breakfast buffet downstairs which was just ok, but it was convenient.  For Rewards members, the lounge is open for snacks all week-end, although we never made it in there.

title: It was ok
text: I enjojed the city view. The rooms didn't have much space for the price. The frosted glass shower did not allow for privacy. Average at best, nothing about the experience was exceptional nor was it a negative experience, hence 3 stars.

title: AVOID if you rather have your personal belongings not taken from your room.
text:
Halfway through our trip we enjoyed a day out exploring the city upon our arrival in the evening we noticed my partners necklace which she had left on the bathroom counter had been taken, and was no where to be found in the room. It was a recent gift, of considerable monetary and personal value. We went downstairs to customer service to raise this, the whole time the staff really didn't seem to bothered about what happened, and had zero urgency. Neverless they said they would look into the issue and get back to us on Monday which conveniently was the day we were checking out and flying back to London.

4-5 days later, no reply so i'm left to chase up head office, where i get passed around to several people eventually being led to Stephanie Wager in their 'insurance' department who was supposed to resolve the case for us and settle up. It's now 2 MONTHS, and nothing has happened, the whole time my emails have been ignored, or reply's take weeks, most recently i heard from Stephanie on the 1st March where it was said the case was nearly resolved, again 2 weeks later no reply and I've been left to chase up.

I'd expect this kind of service from Travel Lodge, or Holiday Inn, not the renaissance hotel which costs substantial amount of money to stay at, for that it seems fair that one could expect a certain level of SERVICE & RESPECT back, but clearly this place is happy to take, take take from you (quite literally) and provide you with nothing back.

Shocking customer service, I've held off 2 months leaving this review but enough is enough i'm tired of constantly being ignored.

title: Upscale, Comfortable and Accommodating
text: I am most impressed with the excellent customer service.  All of the staff that I encountered in any part of the hotel were extremely friendly and accommodating.  It is so pleasant to be greeted with a genuine smile and treated with expertise.  I also enjoyed the comfort and cleanliness of my room.  The hotel has a trendy and modern design which I am partial to as well.  I am already booked for another stay.

title: Excellent Hotel in Midtown.
text: I just stayed at the Renaissance in Midtown overnight. The hotel looked and felt very new and it was extremely clean. My room was also extremely quiet even though I was close to the elevator. The room design was contemporary and very well designed with everything looking new. Ample towels and toiletries as well. In addition, the hotel is literally one block from Penn Station and has many restaurants and stores within a very short walking distance. The guest lounge looks fresh and modern and there is a good restaurant on the fifth floor. Excellent hotel at an excellent location. I highly recommend it.

title: NYを満喫
text: ペンシルベニア駅の目の前なのでアクセス抜群。市内交通はもちろんの事JFKにもペンシルベニア駅を使って行けるので便利。表通りの方の入り口は少しわかりにくいが、慣れれば問題ない。メインの入口前には美味しいベーグル屋がある。部屋も快適でWi-Fiなども一切不便はなかった。

title: The Midtown Gem
text: Quietly located off of Seventh Avenue, this Renaissance is outstanding.  From your check-in experience to your "Garment District" inspired room, you'll be glad you stayed here.  The higher floors offer you an incredible view of the city.  Your room is comfortable and the bathroom has everything you could need. You'll also find great options for food and entertainment within the hotel.  Right next and attached via an elevator you'll be part of a real gym.  Excellent stay right in the middle of the City!

title: Best location for Manhattan mid-town business
text:
For folks who have work in midtown Manhattan, the Renaissance by Marriott is an ideal hotel. It is just a few minutes walking from Penn Station, that gives you inter-city connectivity. The metro-connectivity is almost immediately as one gets out of the hotel.
It also happens to be in a busy shopping district - the largest Macy's store, so is H&M, Old Navy and many more. The other prominent landmark is Madison Square Garden which is less than 5 mins by walk. The staff is helpful, could be more informed though - I had some issues resolving a transaction involving my USD Charge card. For the gym rats..you have a direct access to Planet Fitness form the hotel.

title: Beautiful hotel
text: Stayed here the last two days and will not be staying anywhere else from now on when we visit New York, and we are diamond hyatt members. The hotel a high end offering with a mid-level  pricing for a New York hotel at around 200/night. The location is great as it's walking distance to Times Square, broadway and MSG even in freezing weather. The hotel is beautifully decorated with a very modern, trendy theme that's flows all the way through the hotel to the rooms and fifth floor restaurant which had a beautiful bar. There is a cool interactive projection images on the ground level floor. The lobby area is on the sixth floor and is very modern and comfy and you feel good spending time there. Beds in the room and pillows were incredibly comfortable and the room was very clean with exposed cement ceilings which fit the rooms decor. Only small things I would change ideally would be to have two shower heads in the shower in the single bed rooms and the towels in the bathroom to be a little softer but all in all couldn't of been happier with our stay.

title: Brilliant location, great hotel
text:
We loved our stay here, room was very clean, staff were helpful and friendly.

We specifically asked for a quiet room, which we got. The bed was the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in! 

The bar Rock and Reilly's was really nice. 

The lifts were quick and were easy to work! 

The location of this hotel was brilliant. Right around the corner from Macy's and Madison square garden but far enough you don't hear alot if traffic, apart from the sirens... but then you'll hear those no matter where you stay in NYC! 

On the day of departure, our flight wasn't until the evening and we were able to store our luggage all day until we were ready to leave for the airport at no extra cost. 

The only thing I wasn't keen on was the hot water took about 10 mins to heat up and we would have to run the tap for ages for us to have hot water. We let reception know and they came up straight away which was good. That's the only reason I'm not giving this hotel an excellent rating, everything else was fantastic! 

I would definitely stay here if I ever visited new York again.

title: Trip To New York For The Big East Tourney at MSG
text: We had an absolutely fabulous visit to Mid Town New York.  Our visit to the Renaissance New York Midtown Hotel on W 35th Street ( not to be confused with the Renaissance at Times Square ) could not have been better.  We were warmly greeted by the valet upon our arrival.  The ever efficient elevators ( neat system ) took us directly to the 6th floor where we were welcomed by the front desk clerk.  Both of our requests for a room located on the higher floors and a king sized bed were met without hesitation.  Although we had arrived an hour earlier than the 4pm check in time we were presented with keys to a room on the 22nd floor.  Our room was very nice.  The view was terrific.  The bathroom was spacious and VERY CLEAN and had an impressive shower.  The location of this hotel was simply perfect for our short visit.  We were in town to attend the Big East Final Four Tournament at The Madison Square Garden.  The Renaissance is conveniently located 1 block from the MSG.  We walked and had a lovely dinner at Nick and Stef's Steak House conveniently attached to the Garden.  Following a very enjoyable time at the 2 ball games we walked back to enjoy a cocktail in the hotel guest lounge located on the 6th Floor before retiring to our room. The following morning we thoroughly enjoyed our full breakfast at Rock & Reilly's which is conveniently located on the 5th floor.  The staff was simply great!  The food was delicious and reasonably priced.  Following our breakfast we requested and received a late 3pm check out.  This allowed us to enjoy a visit to the Empire State Building which was also a short walking distance from the Renaissance Hotel.  We then enjoyed a short cab ride downtown to the 911 Memorial which is a must visit.  A very emotional experience to say the least,  Upon our arrival at 1:30pm back at the hotel our friends at the valet whisked our car up from the nearby parking garage and wished us well on our trip back to Massachusetts!  I would HIGHLY recommend a stay at this fabulous hotel.  We can't wait to come back for a long weekend to see a few broadway shows and a Rangers Bruins game!  Cheers!

title: Modern and practical in midtown
text:
This is my third stay at this hotel. I have picked it primarily for two reasons: it's very new and modern and it is walking distance from Penn Station (which is very ora tu al as I always go to NYC by train). 

Rooms are on the smaller side but this is normal in NYC. The lounge is comfortable and food pretty decent. The bar and restaurant is nice and with a good vibe. 

One small complain: worse bathrobes in my whole life! The material does not dry off, gets stuck on your skin and feels simply horrible!

The other serious downturn is how looooong elevators take. 

To sum up: a very modern and nice hotel, very practical for a business trip.

title: Excellent stay
text: The service of any staff I encountered during my stay was just excellent. The location of the hotel is very convenient for times square and surroundings. I had to be in the Javits center and it was an easy 15min walk. Rooms are comfortable and clean. I will defintely stay here again!

title: Great Midtown Stay
text: We loved our time at The Renaissance. This was a perfect location between downtown and Times Square, right by Madison Square Gardens.  We were able to walk nearly everywhere. We took the subway a couple of times when we went down to the 9/11 Memorial, and the hotel was located conveniently near the 34th street station or Penn Station. Great restaurants all around, including a fantastic bagel shop across the street.  We really were able to enjoy local food, not tourist traps at this hotel. The rooms were good sized and the staff were helpful and courteous. We could hear some typical street noise, but the rooms were quiet. Earlier posts from other guests mentioned the clear glass bathroom door. Those are frosted over now, so there was more privacy. We will definitely stay again.

title: Ended with a bang
text:
Room was great.  Bar was great.  Location was great as I was attending an event at Madison Square Garden.

About 3 am, I fell in the bathroom and cut quite a gash in my forehead.  Front desk aided with cleanup and bandages.  Thanks guys.

Would easily recommend to anyone.

title: Gutes Gesamtpaket und nur kleinere Schönheitsfehler
text: Bin zum zweiten Mal im Renaissance gewesen, das erste Mal geschäftlich, dieses Mal privat. Beide Aufenthalte waren super, die Lage ist einmalig und perfekt für alle Unternehmungen. Guter Check-In durch Nate, man hatte das Gefühl wirklich ernst genommen zu werden. Im ersten Zimmer funktionierte der Abfluss nicht, das Bad war nicht richtig sauber und wir hatten zwei kleinere Queen-Betten. Am zweiten Tag durften wir umziehen, das Zimmer 3011 war bis auf die zweimal komplett verstopfte Toilette und ein etwas muffliger Geruch perfekt. Der Check-Out war unterkühlt und unfreundlich, das schmälerte den Gesamteindruck. Ansonsten alles gut, nettes Restaurant, tolle Rooftop-Terrasse (das Roof im 5. Stock...), gigantischer Blick auf lower Manhattan. Gegenüber liegt das super Bagel-Lokal, nur zu empfehlen. Wir werden das Hotel wieder buchen und hoffen dass der eine oder andere kleinere Fehler behoben wird.

title: Better this time around
text: Back again for business trip.  The hotel is sold out and packed with people. The elevators are running a little faster this visit.  Room is spacious and clean.  I had to call for coffee maker which I recall was always in the room.  Was not feeling well so had fish tacos in the Madison Lounge that were quite yummy.  I also like that as a return business customer I get a coupon for a free drink.

title: Pleasant stay at the Renaissance New York Midtown
text:
I stayed at the Renaissance for one overnight this past weekend.  We had tickets to see Billy Joel at MSG and wanted a place within walking distance to MSG. The Renaissance fit that bill.
The hotel is on 35th Street...two blocks from MSG...so it was a short walk from Penn Station to the hotel.  
Check in was at 4:00 pm and we had asked for an early check in but our room wasn't ready when we arrived at 2:45 or so.  The girl at check in said she'd text us when the room was ready. We went 2 doors down to John O'Sullivan's (an Irish Bar) for a bite to eat but by 3:45 we still hadn't gotten notified that the room was ready.  Went back to the hotel and were able to check in...they forgot to notify us :-(  The guy who checked us in was very pleasant as was everyone else we dealt with.

Anyway, the hotel was nicely appointed - opened less than a year ago - and clean.  They have a unique elevator system which condenses the service to a group of floors so you're not riding or waiting for a long time. The room wasn't huge but it was fine for 2 people.  The bathroom was very nice and spacious and CLEAN which is my #1 priority when staying in a hotel.  Bed was comfortable.  We were on the 27th floor but could still hear street noise occasionally.

We did eat at the hotel restaurant Rock & Reilly's which was just ok.  Service was slowish and they had a limited menu for "pre-show" people...I guess to get people in and out quickly.  The free breakfast the next day was a continental breakfast which was adequate.

I would recommend the hotel just for the proximity to MSG.  It was so great to go to the concert and not have to get on a train home.  I also HIGHLY recommend getting to see Billy Joel...the show is great.

title: Tout était parfait!
text:
Hôtel avec un emplacement centrale, accessible, proche de tout, nous avons tout fait à pieds.
La chambre était magnifique, décorée avec beaucoup de goût, moderne et de belle taille.
Et enfin la vue... depuis notre chambre au 29ème étage, juste magique! On pouvait voir la statue de la liberté...

title: Great weekend trip!
text: We were greeted at check-in with an upgraded room. Very modern hotel. We were on the 30th floor and had a fantastic view of the city. The rooms were very quiet. My husband and I thought the mattresses and pillows were exceptionally comfortable. The staff was very friendly. Because it was over the weekend, the club room did not offer any snacks but was stocked with beverages. We would have appreciated coffee/tea in the club. We enjoyed everything about the hotel and thought the location was convenient. Getting a late checkout was not a problem. We look forward to staying here on our next NYC visit.

title: Convenient to Penn Station & Fabric District
text: This hotel was a pleasant surprise in NYC, so close to Penn station, I could drop my stuff and head out for my NYC adventures.  I would definitely stay again, there were many conveniences in the room like USB plugs and power outlets which are always a hard find.  The bed was comfy, the food was good, decor was modern, and interestingly, the walls were concrete, which made it a little cold in the winter.

title: 快適な滞在
text:
2月に4泊しました。日本からJFK空港に着くとチェックイン前の昼頃にホテルにつくのは仕方ないのですが、こちらのホテルは数日前にメールで到着便を確認し、当日11時過ぎにも関わらず、チェックインさせてくれ、非常に助かりました。長時間のフライトで疲れてますからね～
フロントやそのほかの従業員の方も非常に感じがよく快適に過ごせました。立地はタイムズスクウェアまでも歩いて大したことがない上に地下鉄の駅も近く、便利でした。近くの地下鉄の駅はあまりきれいではありませんでしたが、それほど危険な感じではありません。ホテルとは関係はありませんが、駅の中や入り口付近に少々浮浪者系の人はうろついておりました。ホテルの設備は値段からすると十分リーゾナブルで全く不満はありません。おすすめしたいホテルです。

title: Ótima localização
text: Hotel com excelente localização e vista para o Madison Square Garden. Hotel com decoração moderna. O quarto é um pouco apertado para duas pessoas e a parede do banheiro é de vidro fosco, o que  é interessante quando se está sozinho ou em casal, mas não é agradável quando se divide quarto em viagem à trabalho.

title: Perfect
text: From the bellmen to the check in to the stunning rooms, our overnight stay at the Renaissance Midtown was just perfect. We had a great time and will stay here again in the future. We loved the Irish pub (John Sullivan's) right next door. The rooms were quiet and comfortable.

title: Great hotel/Great location
text: Justin & his staff are very accommodating and helpful! We were celebrating our anniversary and the front desk staff sent us a bottle of wine and chocolate covered strawberries!  The hotel is amazing and rooms are very nice. The location was perfect. Right across the street from penn station so you can catch a subway to anywhere in the city within minutes. We will definitely visit again!

title: The Place to Stay in NYC
text: The Renaissance NY Midtown is an awesome hotel.  Without question, it was one of the nicest Marriott properties that I have stayed at. Cost permitting, I will definitely try to stay at this Renaissance property whenever I travel to NYC. The staff was great and friendly, and the rooms were very nice. The lobby bar was awesome with a great bar staff and I enjoyed Rock n' Reilly's. Additionally, you have access to the Planet Fitness located in the building which is nice compared to a lot of hotel gyms. Great location in Herald Square with easy access to the subway. I would highly recommend this Marriott property.

title: Tired.
text:
My wife and I stayed here for a conference the past 4 nights. A good location, 5 blocks from the conference.
The hotel is "tired " and could use some TLC on the rooms. Duct tape hoping wires in place, bad lighting, no comfortable area within the room.
And to to it off, a massive support pole in the middle of the room.
Kind of humorous when you figure I'm a platinum elite member and this was supposedly a room upgrade for me!

title: Great place to stay!
text:
This was our 2nd trip to the Renaissance Midtown and we'll be back.  We were meeting friends in mid-town so it was a perfect location.  It's around the corner from the trains so if you need to get around town, no problem!  We stayed in a sweet suite...very modern, chic design.  Had one big bathroom and 1/2, which was an added bonus.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.
Having Rocking Rileys in the building is fantastic, we love that place.  Great vibe and perfect locale if youre going to MSG for an event.

title: Midtown charmer
text: Great new hotel with fabulous midtown location. Staff all very accommodating especially in concierge lounge where Anthony takes great care and runs the show. Very convenient to subway, theater and hip restaurants and very good pricing for NYC

title: My New Favorite Place to Work & Play in NYC
text:
I discovered the Renaissance on 35th a month ago and had a great stay.  This past weekend I had to the chance for an extended R&R stay in NYC and returned to the Renaissance.  The hotel provides access to an enormous two floor Planet Fitness gym for free.  Room service was fast and the food was excellent.  The room design is excellent and a fresh design that maximizes comfort and work.  The staff was exceptional... they are attentive and engaged at all times.

I'll be back.

title: Fantastic Hotel & Fantastic Director
text: After 163 tripadvisor reviews , and for the first time, it is an honor for me to write what I think about this hotel and its manager. Why an honor? Because David the director is an fantastic professional. David is attentive and respectful of his word, which is rare these days, after 65 trips in the US, he is, without doubt, the most professional I have ever seen in the United States. Concerning the hotel, this is the place to be in New-York, Nice rooms, nice restaurant. Bravo !!! Bravo David, Bravo the team.

title: Great property, fantastic service, staff..
text: Staff was very helpful, went out of there way to accommodate my family. Excellent indoor/outdoor bar/restaurant area with excellent city view. Fun property with great access to Penn station. Service was excellent and very prompt. I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Best hardware in US Marriott properties but stingy for marriott members
text:
This property was opened in 2016 so it was completely new. The arrival level has a fantastic electronic wall that shows various figures with the background music. The gym on the second and third floor was so big with diversified cardiovascular facilities. The restaurant and bar with a outdoor patio was located on the fifth floor was decorated characteristically and elegantly.  The club lounge(concierge lounge) was next to the lobby and provided water and soft drinks 24 hours. However, on the weekend the lounge did not provide breakfast and happy hour. Marriott gold and platinum members got a continental breakfast vouchers to have a weekend breakfast in the restaurant. Though the vouchers marked "continental breakfast" but actually we were served by a full hot breakfast. Lobby and room was very faddish and beautiful. 

However, this hotel was a little bit stingy for Marriott gold/platinum member. If you booked a one bed room and want to have a two queen bed room you had to pay extra $40-80 USD. They did not grant any complimentary room upgrade from one bed to two beds. I did not make sense. I stayed a lot of Marriott, SPG, and IHG hotels in Manhattan and often asked for a room with two beds. Renaissance Midtown hotel is the only one hotel charging elite members by additional fee.

title: Best Ever
text: Our first time in New York and we wanted something to celebrate my wife's 50th birthday. we found a real gem with this hotel, snazzy, fashionable and brill location. The staff on the desk were amazing and couldn't do enough for us. We'll come back to New York and when we do we'll stop here again.

title: Suvey tour of Manhattan.
text:
Great location; within 1.5 blocks of Macey's, Penn Station, and Madison Square Gardens; three blocks from Empire State Building and 10 minute walk to Time Square; subway stops on same block.  Nice rooms and common areas; great bar; restaurant limited menu but otherwise excellent.

Get a corner room floor 33 or higher.

title: Justine at the Front Desk
text: Justine at the front desk was great. We had left something behind and she went out of her way to search lost and found. We were originally told it had not been turned in and had not been found so we appreciated the extra effort.

title: Hidden Gem
text: Great employees offering to help any time.  The location was convenient to everything.The hotel has a nice lobby and bar, and rooms were clean and modern with a great view.  We hope to return some time soon.

title: Fantastic choice for my daughter's birthday!
text: Best hotel choice I've made.  The location is perfect being a stones throw from Penn Station and a short walk to The Empire State Building, Macy's etc.  The price was just right as well.  The staff was wonderful, friendly and helpful.  I emailed ahead that it was my daughter's birthday and her first visit to NYC.  I was hoping to leave our bags to go sightseeing.  We got an early check in, upgrade to city view and a complimentary (delicious) dessert from the hotel restaurant.  The restaurant food was wonderful as well.  The room was bright, clean, trendy, and just the right size for the two of us.  The bathroom was the best.  Great water pressure and plenty of hot water.  When we go back to the city this is definitely where we will stay.  We felt very safe in the surrounding area of the hotel.  Great location!

title: Great place to stay for a Business Trip
text: I really enjoyed staying at this hotel. I have stayed at the Renaissance Times Square many times over the years and thought I'd try someplace new this time. So glad I did! The rooms were very nice and the hotel staff was super friendly and accommodating. Even though this is a bit further from my office, I will definitely stay here in the future. Lots of shopping and dining choices close by and next to Penn Station if you are taking the train.

title: muito bom !
text: hotel novo , moderno , otimas acomodações , boa localização , otimo serviço , bom atendimento ! fiquei 5 dias nesse hotel e foi muito bacana a experiencia nesse lugar , sensacional ! super recomento !

title: Convenient Midtown property with sleek and sexy luxury accomodations
text:
The staff here is extremely helpful and friendly. Definitely receptive to any questions or needs you might have. The rooms are a good size for New York accommodations. However, if it matters to you, the bathroom is not all that private - basically just enclosed in thin, frosted glass. We didn't have a problem with it, but it may be awkward for families or not-so-close friends. Bed is comfortable, and the furnishings are quirky, sleek, and ultra-modern.

The only hiccup with the stay was that we had placed a room service order for breakfast, and apparently the system went down (not their fault), but no one alerted us that our food order had been lost. We waited until about half an hour after the scheduled delivery window to check on its status, and the woman we reached on the phone was very apologetic and kindly helped us to re-place the order. We're glad we called, otherwise we would have never known! The food was delivered about another half hour later, and though it was tasty, the presentation left something to be desired. We did not expect the food to arrive in take-out-like containers in a paper bag. For as luxurious, modern, and beautiful as the Renaissance Midtown is, the delivery felt sloppy and sub-par. If we would have known, we would have chosen to do brunch at a nearby restaurant for a nicer experience at the same price.

Otherwise, the accommodations were gorgeous, clean, convenient to all of the plans we had made in the city without being right in the thick of Times Square, and quiet from room to room (not accounting for street noise, which is totally normal). I think this is the first time I've stayed somewhere in Midtown where I didn't hear footsteps or voices from other rooms. We would definitely stay at the Renaissance Midtown again, and recommend the property to others as well.

title: Buen hotel
text:
Estuvimos pasando el fin de año en Nueva York y elegimos este hotel por los buenos comentarios que leímos y por la ubicación del mismo.

La recepción del hotel está situada en la sexta planta del edificio, el check in fue rápido y dado que llegamos el día de noche vieja nos preguntaron si teníamos algún plan, nos comentaron que el Restaurante del Hotel tenía una cena especial para esa noche y nos dieron algunos consejos sobre sitios donde cenar, tomar algo, etc. 
 
La habitación estaba ubicada en la planta 25 y aunque daba a una pequeña fábrica, también se veían tanto el Empire State como el edificio Chrysler.

La habitación era modernita y estaba muy bien decorada. La limpieza era excelente y la calefacción estupenda, al igual que el WIFI. Por lo que respecta al tamaño de la habitación puedo decir que no es que fuera demasiado grande, pero teniendo en cuenta los problemas de espacio que hay en Nueva York, la verdad que estaba muy bien.

En cuanto al precio, no es que sea especialmente barato (aunque también es cierto que nosotros estuvimos en época navideña) lo que si que es cierto es que unos días antes de viajar vimos que en la zona de Times Square había hoteles del mismo estilo (misma categoría, estilo modernito, con vistas, etc.) a un precio similar (cosa que no ocurrió cuando reservamos porque de haber sido así hubiéramos elegido un hotel en el mismo Times Square).

En cuanto al desayuno, no puedo opinar porque no desayunamos allí ningún día, ya que fuera tienes varios bares, un starbucks, etc donde poder desayunar a un precio aceptable.

El hotel está a escasos 5 minutos de Jamaica Station y tiene dos estaciones de metro muy cercanas.

title: Strong value and right in midtown
text: This hotel has some of the better deals if you need to be right in midtown, it's nice and modern and the bathrooms/fixtures are solid. Not much to complain about here, this does the trick and is a consistent spot

title: Been here several times, nice hotel
text: Great hotel that is very convenient to Madison Square Garden and Penn Station.  The rooms are modern and clean -- they try to treat their Marriott status members well with upgrades.   Concierge lounge is also one of the best I've seen across Marriott properties with attractive breakfast options.   Rockin Reilly's is the bar on 5th floor that has a cool atmosphere    and good service.  Only complaint about hotel is the elevators - they are slow.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: I stayed at this hotel on a business trips for 2 nights. I don't have anything negative to say about it. The staff was very friendly, there were plenty of bar/lounges to choose from and my room was gorgeous. The price was great too and not in a "you get what you pay for kind of way either". I am honestly amazed how inexpensive it was for the quality.

title: Average hotel with a unwelcoming lobby
text:
I think the main problem from the start with this hotel is that the lobby is on the 6th floor and the arrival desk downstairs was pretty unwelcoming, so when I arrived mid-evening after a long flight and on my own I had to tug my suitcase in through doors that were difficult to open, and then had to find someone to ask where check- in was. The lifts were complicated and weren't well- explained so I stood for a while before I worked out which lift to use, and all that was before I could check- in. When I left I asked the door-man for the bag they had stored for me. He said not a word to me when he handed it back to me, and I presume that the reason he didn't even look up when I left and said a cheery thanks and goodbye was because I hadn't tipped him ( hard to see why a tip was obligatory for someone who had silently fetched one suitcase from the store for me)
I thought the room was well- equipped though I didn't like the concrete wall and ceiling that looked like the room hadn't been redecorated after a flood or some renovation work. ( I'm not sure if that was the case or whether that was meant to be the style but my guess is that it wasn't quite finished) 
The meal I had in Rock and Reilly was tasty and the service there was excellent but I wouldn't recommend the hotel to a friend when there are so many other good hotels in NYC to choose from.

title: Excellent modern hotel
text: Excellent hotel with great bars and a great restaurant. Centrally located across from Madison Square Garden and great shops and restaurants within walking distance.  Our room was spacious considering New York standards. The bathroom was awesome! Frosted glass door and shower made it interesting but still private. Great Avedo products for guest use, too.

title: Fantastic!
text: I stayed at the Renaissance Midtown for one night on a weekend trip to NYC and I couldn't have been more pleased with my choice. The woman who checked me in made me feel most welcome and was very helpful in explaining how to operate the high tech elevator. The room was not large, but it was beautifully designed and appointed, and the view of uptown was great. I was really impressed to find that the bathrooms have Aveda products. It's worth noting that the wall that separates the bathroom from the sleeping area is glass, and although it is frosted about four fifths of the way up, the frosted area is not completely opaque.

title: Great Location, Great Front or house team & Concierge, Bar Service Needs Training..
text:
Visited the property from 01 Feb - 08 Feb for my husbands special birthday.
No disappointed with location! Fabulous!
Reception staff were accommodating & friendly.
Daniel at Concierge was absolutely superb! Passionate & Enthusiastic a great asset to the hotel team!
Rooms were perfectly positioned, modern & contemporary with great views of New York!
The entire hotel team including the guys at entrance were superb, very friendly & oozed customer service.
Where the hotel would have scored 5 stars would have been in the bar.
Service was not great & the attention to detail was lacking.
Did it spoil the break, No, but it would have meant more if we were recognised as guests especially as a special birthday treat!
No real acknowledgement of why we were there from team, but we are not stars, but a little reference to why we were in NY would have been great!
Anyway overall, great spacious rooms, great reception & Concierge team, great location so don't hesitate to book! We will be back & look forward to visiting the hotel in the future!

title: AMAZING PROPERTY AND STAFF
text: I cannot say enough about the staff at this property.  They go above and beyond regarding every detail of your stay.  The rooms are fabulous!  I had a skyline suite and it was marvelous.  The location is perfect.  You are right near Penn Station, MSG and walking distance to Times Square and tons of shopping.  The pub on property and the lounges are top notch and the in-room dining menu is great!  The staff will be happy to help you with whatever you need.  I will find it hard to stay elsewhere when I visit the city.

title: Great new property
text:
Very nice, modern, brand new property close to Penn Station.  Guests have access to Planet Fitness on the ground level which is nice too. Much better than a typical hotel gym. 

Marta at the front seat was very nice too.

title: Home away from home
text: So this is my second stay here and I just wanted to express my love for this hotel.  It is the perfect place for a frequent traveler.  Great rooms with breathtaking views, a lounge, a fantastic bar, a huge gym next door and best of all the employees.  Every single employee offers such great service and kindness.  In particular on this last stay, Joshua and Anthony were so great to deal with.  Thank you Renaissance for making my recent stay to New York so great.

title: Excellent service, cool look and amazing location
text: I love the renaissances in general, but this is amazing. is very new and is well located, so close to Penn station, an areas that is actually changing quite rapidly. all about the decoration and presentation of the hotel is great and cool. The people working there are extremely nice and always attentive. they have great bar in the lobby and the rooms are just amazing.

title: New Years Eve Weekend Getaway...
text: Stayed at this property from Dec 30th to Jan 2nd (a few other times as well)...this property is located in one of New York's prime locations and views were killer from our room...this hotel, is one of my favorites! The trendy bar called Rock & Reilly's was our go to for great drinks and food. Sage Against The Machine was my drink of choice, the Crispy Rock Shrimp (was perfect) and we topped it off the Filet Mignon...cheers to the chefs! Fast forward to the rooms...they are sorta Edition'ish, very sexy and sheek but larger (based off the standard king rooms). You are lady will enjoy the spacious shower :)...the frosted glass is really cool too. Overall, this is the perfect hotel...

title: 위치가 탁월함!
text:
근처에 마트 지하철역 타임스퀘어 모두 가깝고 도보이동 가능합니다
어메니티는 아베다구요. 생각보다 깔끔하고 좋았어요!

title: Possibly not  a good fit for techno-dummies
text: My husband and I liked our weekend stay at this new, trendy hotel in a prime NYC location. BUT, it might be a bit frustrating for people ( like us) not into high tech features. First, the elevators are digital " robots" with touch screen options and automatic delivery to the floor you select. As a fellow traveler remarked, " this requires a lot of trust"- no buttons for the floors, no beeping noise or flashing lights when " your" elevator appears. Several times I neglected to look at the quick screen which appears on the command tablet to let you know which elevator to board. I stood there looking perplexed but fortunately my husband had seen the screen and remembered the graphics showing " our" elevator. In fairness, the elevators in question arrived quickly and were very fast. Maybe some modification with audio and visual clues ( like Siri? ) could help us oldies get the hang of it. And, unusually, there's no hotel directory in the room. I found out modest amounts of info ( like where the ice machines were located) by scrolling around on the tv screen but not much information and not easy to find. That being said, the decor is all well done industrial chic, the bed was very comfortable and the food good. We had a weekend price well below what anyone else was charging for a similar class of accommodation so definitely worth the learning curve!

title: Still Working Out Some Kinks
text: The location of this hotel was fantastic! Very near Penn Station if you are arriving by train. Well-priced for Midtown. The room was comfortable, well-sized, and clean. That being said, there was no tub available and there were some construction related inconveniences that I anticipate will be worked out soon. I had a minor incident where a ceiling tile in the revolving door fell and jammed the door. The bellhop was helpful in getting me out, though for the price of the hotel I would expect not to have things falling on my head.

title: New hotel, great location
text: I am a loyal Marriott member who has been to NYC many times, and I didn't recall this hotel. With good reason, the hotel only opened a year ago. It was only a few blocks from Penn Station which was perfect since we came into the city by train. The staff couldn't have been nicer. The outside bar was a nice way to get the night started. I will definitely be staying at this hotel in the future!!!

title: Amazing Stay
text: I had an awesome experience from Martin helping my guest and I to our room, to check in with Ariel and then Taraji with her outstanding customer service. I was having problems with my check in because I didn't book directly through the website and Taraji handled it in a very professional manner even though it took a long time to figure out. The staff was superb! The rooms was very clean and modern. The view was great. I will definitely recommend this hotel and will visit it again.

title: Convenient to Penn Station
text:
As a frequent visitor to NYC, I decided to try this hotel and was very happy. The lobby is on the 6th floor - so once in the building you need to head there.  The hotel is on 35th St but there is a small entrance on 34th which makes it very convenient to Penn Station. 

Very modern design.  The rooms even have windows that open to let fresh air in. 

Note - the wall between the shower and the bedroom is glass. Even though frosted, you have limited privacy.  So you probably don't want to share with someone you are not that close to!

We were in room 3005 - this is an adjoining room with a door to the next room.  Avoid this room if you don't like this set up. We couldn't hear anything from the next room.

title: Beautiful hotel, great staff, in great location
text:
I recently spent one night at the fairly new Renaissance Midtown New York hotel.  The hotel is located on the very busy West 35th St between 7th and 8th Ave about 2 blocks from Penn Station and Herald Square.  I arrived fairly early for my stay, and was lucky enough to get a room, which I know isn't guaranteed, but was appreciated.  As a Platinum member, was I upgraded to a city-view room.  I found the check-in to be very fast and friendly.  My room was up on the 25th floor.  Keep in mind with this hotel that it is decent size and has 4 elevators, but they can run quite slow.  
My room was small, but not bad for NYC.   It was modern, clean, comfortable, and overall a very nice room.  There was plenty of power outlets, and a nice work desk, which is always appreciated as a business traveler.  The room had a very large bathroom with a nice rain shower.  The frosted glass wall, was a cool touch, but if travelling with friends it could get awkward.  I found the room to be very quite for a city room and also very dark with the shades drawn, which is also well appreciated.
My only complaints about the hotel are very minor.  First, I didn't find the food in the concierge lounge to be particularly good, or the service to be very friendly. Lastly, be aware that West 35th can be quite busy due to its straight access the Lincoln Tunnel.  So it can be hard to get a cab or a long wait for an Uber!

title: Design Hotel in the Heart of New York
text:
If you like Design and modern Hotels - this should be your choice.
I definitely enjoyed my stay here. The rooms with a city view do really have a great view and also the bathrooms are quite big and stylish. 
The staff were super nice and helpful with every question i had.

title: Pleasant Surprise
text:
What a pleasant surprise.  This was my first visit to Manhatton and did not know what to expect.  

The location of the Hotel is a bit deceiving as it is off the main drag, but don't let that stop you from staying.  The doorman were always helpful, polite and friendly.

From cheek in to check out my stay was very good.  There is an onsite restaurant, bar in the lobby and a nice concierge lounge for the Marriott elite members.

I would recommend staying for business and or pleasure.

title: Awesome place
text: So I arrived at the hotel after being awake for more than 24 hours and multiple flights. I was tired and jetlagged. The staff were amazing. The bellman who helped me in with my bags, the check in staff who found me a room straight away, and the lady from housekeeping who helped when I dropped my bag in the hallway. Everyone was so friendly and helpful. The hotel itself was really nice, comfy bed and a really fabulous shower. The location is great, plenty of shops and eateries around. Times Square is a short walk away, and the metro station is right behind the hotel if going further afield. I would definitely stay here again next time I am in NYC.

title: Newer Hotel in a Great Location
text: Stayed here over a weekend in December and the Renaissance New York Midtown Hotel was a great choice.  Excellent location as it was a short walk to Times Square and the theater district and is within a block of Herald Square and Madison Square Garden, plus it was right next to Penn Station, so could quickly catch the subway when needed.  We checked in on a Friday night and the front desk was very efficient, although not very personable, but I was welcomed as a Marriott rewards elite member which is always nice.  I had booked a skyline view king room which was decent size, plus the bed was very comfortable.  Bathroom was good size with a nice shower.  Being on a high floor gave us a nice view of the city.  I liked the way the elevators operated - instead of pushing up or down when you get to the elevator bank, you punch in your floor, then it directs you to the elevator number you are to take.  Then you don't need to punch in your floor when you get on the elevator.  A couple of other things stood out for me - the staff on the ground level were very friendly and greeted us whenever we were coming or going.  They were very helpful the day we were leaving in storing our bags and then helping us get our bags loaded into the car we were taking to the airport.  Also, the hotel arranged a car service for our ride back to the airport, which was very reasonably priced.  The driver was on time, car was clean, and we had no issues getting to the airport - highly recommend using the hotel to set this up if a car service is needed.  In general, my impression is that the hotel is very well managed.  One last comment on the value of this hotel - being a weekend during the holiday season in December, you are not going to get a bargain on any decent Midtown hotel.  But the rate I got on this hotel was reasonable particularly given the location, the service, and it being a newer, very modern hotel.  Overall I was very happy with our stay and will stay here again on my next visit.
